title: Columbia Holds Off Rally By San Jose to Win, 7168
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Jan. 2 (UPI)  Columbia withstood some strong offensive board work and a zone press last night to beat the San Jose Spartans, 7168.

title: India Said to Be Planning To Strengthen Her Navy
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 2 (AP) The chief of India's naval staff says the Government will soon begin building submarines and patrol craft.

title: Marle Neivert Affianced
description: FORDS, N. J., Jan. 2Mr. and Mrs. Harold Neivert have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Marie B. Neivert, to Bruce E. Fischer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard K. Fischer of Elizabeth. The future bride is a graduate of Trenton State College. She teaches business education in the Woodbridge Township school system. Mr. Fischer is attending Rutgers University.

title: Quick Response to Fire Alarms Unaffected by Men's Job Action
description: A couple of dozen firemen were just about to sit down yesterday to their lunch of steak and spaghetti, cooked in the firehouse kitchen, when the alarm sounded.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: De Seversky's New Role
description: The man who designed the P47 fighter plane of World War II, and whose book, Victory Through Air Power, was one guide for longrange Allied air strat egy in that war, has declared war on industrial air pollu tion.

title: Books:
description: HOW YOU CAN PROFIT FROM THE COMING DE VALUATION. By Harry Browne. 189 pages. Arlington House. $5.95.

title: Motorcycle Gangs Terrorizing OnceCalm Atlanta Hippie Area
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 2Death and fear have displaced peace and love as the hallmarks of a seedy hippie neighborhood re cently invaded by several motor cycle gangs.

title: COLTS, RAIDERS EVEN;
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 2In what looms as a classic quarterback duel between Johnny Unitas and Daryle Lamonica, two teams embarrassed by Super Bowl losses, the Baltimore Colts and the Oakland Raiders, will be trying for an opportunity for atone ment in tomorrow's American Conference championship game.

title: Architecture
description: FOR New Yorkers, this has been a holiday sea son of some bad cheer. The power or fate that orders things giveth and taketh away.

title: Joan Whitney Meyer Married on L.I.
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I. Jan. 2Miss Joan Whitney Meyer, daughter of Lady Weidenfeld of London and William Blair Meyer of New York, was married here this afternoon to Charles Ander son Dana 3d, son of Mr. Dana Jr. of New Canaan, Conn., and New York and the late Mrs. Marion Turrell Francis of Morristown, N. J.

title: Stamps
description: ART has many forms, and recent stamps have commemorated Portugal's centuriesold art of making port wines, paintings in Israel's Tel Aviv Museum, and Gobelin tapestries in Poland's Wawel castle.

title: JOSEPH J. LILLEY
description: HOLLYWOOD, Jan. 2 (AP) Joseph J. Lilley, who arranged music for many Bob Hope and Bing Crosby motion pictures, died of cancer yesterday at the age of 57.

title: Criminals At Large
description: If there's an award going for novel ways to murder, I'll be glad to nominate Kin Platt's THE KISSING GOURAMI (Ran dom, $4.95) as a worthy candi date. Platt's book celebrates yet another privateeye caper in Californiaa milieu (if we can believe our detective fiction) that has the highest density of unharvested nuts among our 50 states. Anesthetized as I am to extremes, I found it a bit hard at first to accept the novel's motivation and method. A wealthy playgirl orders a truly outr party dress, featuring live fish in plastic containers. Some one substitutes piranha for the original finny decorations, and sends the dress along to gen erate a corpse. From this point, we proceed to more orthodox methods of mayhemall of them equally effective. When shamus Max Roper finally se lects the killer, few of the other characters are left standing.

title: Davidson of Raiders No Gentle Ben
Ohio State Wins by 9575 As Yale Loses 9th in Row
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Jan. 2 (UPI)  Allan Hornyak and Luke Witte, sophomores, scored 58 points between them to lead Ohio State to a 9575 victory over Yale tonight for its fifth triumph in nine games.

title: HERBERT C. SPENCER
description: BETHESDA, Md., Jan. 2 Herbert C. Spencer. director of circulation of the American Chemical Society, died yester day of a heart attack while shoveling snow at his home here. He was 43 years old.

title: Singapore President Sworn
description: SINGAPORE. Jan. 2 (UPI) Dr. Benjamin H. Sheares was sworn as President of Singa pore today.

title: The Nation
description: John F. Banzhaf 3d doesn't smoke, but he's not a fanatic about it; what really bothered the bachelor lawyer was the seductionbytelevision of those innocent of the cigarette habit. So four years ago, in January 1967, he asked the Federal Com munications Commission an em barrassing question: considering the mounting evidence linking cigarettes and cancer and heart disease, shouldn't there be space available on the airwaves to tell people not to smoke?

title: BUSINESS LETTER
description: Many investors prize divi dend checks almost as highly as stock certificates. But thousands of them never re ceive dividend checks they are entitled to and, more sur prisingly, don't seem to miss them.

title: Rotz Pilots Al Hattab to Victory in Orange Bowl Handicap at Tropical Park
description: MIAMI, Jan. 2Jockey John L. Rotz always has had a knack for getting home when added money is on the line. Last year, Rotz won 25 stakes and he started the new year right where he left off as he drove Al Hattab to a hardearned victory in the $31,600 Orange Bowl Handicap at Tropical Park.

title: 3 GROUPS ACTIVE IN L.I.U. ELECTION
description: On the verge of appointing its third chancellor in two years, Long Leland University has broken tradition and al lowed student, faculty and alumni participation in his se lection.

title: Shorter Takes 10,000 For 2d Brazil Victory
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Jan. 2 (AP)Frank Shorter of Boul der, Colo., ran 10,000 meters in 29 minutes 31.4 seconds today and won his second race here in three days.

title: Headliners
description: The Beatles long since have given up personal appear ances together, and for months there has been talk of a final breakup. Last week the break came. Paul McCartney brought suit in London to end the partnership with John Lennon, George Harrison and Ringo Starr and to divide their assets, said to exceed $100million. It was just seven years ago that the four young musicians came out of Liver pool and, with their long hair and fresh style, quickly became folk heroes. As affluence set in, they began to drift apart. Their end perhaps was foretold by their last record, made last May; it was titled, Let It Be.

title: Reader's Report
description: Any twinge of romantic re gret for the good old 19th cen tury is effectively squelched by Alan Scholefield's realistic re play. The year is 1820, when British yeomen are being shunt ed into the slums by the En closure Act and the Industrial Revolution. A family of Suffolk farmers, the Southgates, tries to escape the System by emi grating to the Cape Colony of South Africa, only to be met by an onslaught of disaster that begins with the death of the father on the initial trek. From there on, life for the Southgates is just one damn thing after an other, as 17yearold John has to battle the blights of nature and the villainy of his fellow manespecially one very rich fellowman who is trying to buy up the less fortunate home steaders.

title: Apocalyptic Sect Surprised When World Didn't End Thursday
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C.; Jan. 2 Leaders of a branch of the True Light. Church of Christ, who had taught their 450 followers in North Carolina and South Carolina that the world would end in 1970, said today that they were surprised and shocked by the failure of the prophecy but not to the extent of doubting any of the sect's other doctrines.

title: Horse Show News
description: Donald W. Thackeray, a 55yearold retired Army Colonel from New Windsor, Md., has been elected to the Bureau of the Federation Equestre Internationale, the world governing body of equine sports.

title: Xavier Downs Air Force
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 2 (AP) Jerry Helmers scored a game high 25 points tonight as Xavier of Ohio beat Air Force, 8065. The Musketeers, connecting on 51 per cent of their shots, coast ed to their sixth victory.

title: U.S. TEAM REACHES JUNIOR TENNIS FINAL
description: MIAMI BEACH, Jan. 2 (AP)  South Africa defeated Italy and the United States, seeking its second straight title, swept past France to reach the final of the Sunshine Cup interna tional junior team tennis tour nament today.

title: Marilyn Rand Engaged
description: UNION, N. J., Jan. 2The engagement of Miss Marilyn S. Rand to Stanley Loewen thal, son of Mrs. Mildred Loewenthal of Irvington, has been made known by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Rand. The couple are gradu ates of Rutgers University.

title: CITY WILL SUE U.S. ON WELFARE COSTS
description: Mayor Lindsay directed the city's Corporation Counsel yes terday to sue the Federal and state governments to strike down laws that mandate wel fare costs to the city, a sum totaling more than $600million in the current fiscal year.

title: Jan. 3 Garden Preview
description: A GLANCE through nursery cata logues this spring will show several trends in the types of woody plants being grown and offered for sale by the commercial nurs eryman.

title: Norman Singer? Why Write an Article About Him?
description: WHEN Mayor Fiorello H. La Guardia proclaimed the es tablishment of the New York City Center of Music and Drama in 1943, Norman Singer was, as they used to say in World War II, some where in England, making his sacrifice for the cause as a sergeant in the Army's Signal Intelligence Corps.

title: Miss Havens To Be a Bride
description: GARDEN CITY, L. L, Jan. 2Mr. and Mrs. Gordon N. Havens have made known the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Margaret Havens, to Fred Bicknese. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Frits H. E. Bicknese of Port Washing ton and The Hague, the Neth erlands. A wedding in August is planned.

title: Death Row Prisoner in Jersey Granted Hearing by U. S. Court
description: TRENTON, Jan. 2Edgar H. Smith, who has been on death row longer than any other man in American penal history, has been granted a hearing in his effort to get his murder convic tion reversed.

title: PORT AGENCY SEES MAJOR S.I. GROWTH
description: Within 15 years, the popula tion of Staten Island will soar from 300,000 to more than a halfmillion people, according to a study by the Port of New York Authority.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Kent Names Security Chief
description: KENT, Ohio, Jan. 2 (UPI) James L. Fyke, former police chief at Inkster, Mich., has been named director of campus security at Kent State Uni versity. The creation of the post was recommended by the President's Commission on Campus Unrest.

title: Miss Fretz 3Set Victor In South African Tennis
description: PORT ELIZABETH, South Af rica, Jan. 2 (AP)Tory Fretz of Los Angeles defeated Ceci Mar tinez of San Francisco, 57, 60, 61, in the allAmerican wom en's singles final of the East ern Province tennis champion ships today.

title: IRISH MIST STARS IN JERSEY SHOW
description: BRANCHVILLE, N. J., Jan. 2 Dick Booth and. Pam Worden split honors after they dueled in two divisions today at the HiTor Stables horse show.

title: Stars Drub Chaparrals
description: LOGAN, Utah, Jan. 2 (AP) The Utah Stars romped to a 134109 victory over the Texas Chaparrals tonight, as Zelmo Beaty scored 27 points.

title: Cheaper Driving?
description: A communitywide cam paign to encourage consum ers to absorb considerably more of their auto insurance losses than they have in the past is under way in Penn sylvania.

title: Reader's Report
description: Awaiting a difficult child birth in a West African hos pital, the narrator of this bril liant interior monologue keeps sifting through her psyche in pursuit of past nightmares. I am covered with memories like barnacles, she reflects in one reverie, and most of the mem ories are guilty ones. Guilt for not having loved her father more, guilt for a past abortion, guilt for having killed a pet rab bitpast sins surface in frag ments of remembrance.

title: Cautious Approach Noted
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 Premier Kosygin's comments on the strategic arms limitation talks reflect the cautious ap proach that has developed over the last several months, in the view of analysts of Soviet af fairs here.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Cuba Says Recent Census Puts Count at. 8,553,395
description: MIAMI, Jan. 2 (AP)Cuba has a population of. 8,553,395, an official announcement said this week.

title: West German Traffic Toll Up
description: WIESBADEN, West Germany, Jan. 2 (Reuters)  Highway deaths in West Germany rose 14 per cent in the first 10 months of 1970 to 15,332, the federal Statistics Office reports.

title: How to Stop Inflation: Stop Raising Wages
description: WASHINGTON. IN early November an emergency board appointed by the President to deal with the interminable problem of labor relations in the rail road industry recommended a 37 per cent increase in wages and benefits over three years.

title: M'INTIRE IS BUYING TRACT IN FLORIDA
description: PORT. CANAVERAL, Fla., Jan. 2  Plans for the devel opment of a 700acre complex into a reformation freedom center and Christian con ference have been announced here by the Rev. Carl McIntire Fundamentalist preacher and champion of rightwing causes.

title: Price Freeze in the Congo
description: KINSHASA, the Congo, Jan. 2 (AP)The Government has ordered a freeze on consumer prices, the Congolese news agency reported today. Two weeks ago the government de creed a 20 per cent increase in the basic salaries of all workers, effective Jan. 1.

title: CONGRESS CLOSES AS SENATE VOTES SST COMPROMISE
NEGRO COLLEGES NOT USING  U.S. AID
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2For two years, Negro colleges called on the Nixon Adminis tration for substantial financial help. Last September, the Ad ministration, responded, releas ing $30million for use by the schools. Three months later, 60 per cent of the funda remain unused and it looks as if they never will be used.

title: Fordham Wins 11th Straight, Downing Princeton, 81 to 71
description: Fordham's fast, highjumping and undefeated basketball team scored an 8171 victory over Princeton at Rose Hill gymna sium in the Bronx last night. The triumph has its 11th straight for the best start by a Ram team since the 195253 campaign.

title: LAVER TRIUMPHS OVER ROSEWELL BY 63, 62, 75
description: Rod Laver, professional ten nis's biggest moneywinner in 1970 with $201,953, picked up his first check of the new year yesterday with a straightset victory over Ken Rosewall in the opening clash of the Tennis Champions Classic at Madison Square Garden. The scores were 63, 62, 75.

title: Kalamazoo Quintet Wins
description: KALAMAZOO, Mich., Jan. 2 (AP)Kalamazoo beat Wabash, Ind., 8370, today. Dan Las koski's 23 points paced Kalama zoo.

title: 5,400 Offtrack Bettors Are Ready for Action
description: The voice coming over the loudspeaker attached to the blue and orange van vibrates with the promise of a side show barker.

title: YEMENI INTRODUCES FIRST CONSTITUTION
description: ADEN, Southern Yemen, Jan. 2Yemen's first permanent constitution was presented in Sana this week by President Abdul Rahmanallryani at a meeting of the National As sembly.

title: Prague Seemingly Prosperous, But the Economy Puzzles Some
description: PRAGUE, Jan. 2 (Reuters) For a country that has expe rienced an invasion, political turmoil and a crippling purge of economists and technicians over the last two years, Czech oslovakia is looking remark ably prosperous.

title: BLANDA IS HAZY ON DAY AS A COLT
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 2 (AP) George Blanda, the 43yearold wonder of the Oakland Raiders, has been around football so long that his memory is getting a little fuzzy.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: The Socialism of Fools
description: TWENTYFIVE years after the end of World War II and the collapse of the most anti Semitic regime in history, antiSemi tism appears to be on the rise around the world. But unlike the situation before 1945, when antiJewish poli tics was largely identified with rightist elements, the current wave is linked to governments, parties, and groups which are conventionally de scribed as leftist. Various New Left activists in different countries, Ameri can black militant groups, Arab socialist spokesmen, and East European Communist governments have moved on from antiZionist to antiJewish and fully antiSemitic statements and acts. And though the extreme right remains relatively weak in Western countries, its news papers have become much more open about referring to Jewish con spiracies.

title: 66  Killed as Barrier Falls At Glasgow Soccer Match
description: GLASGOW, Scotland, Jan. 2 Sixty six were killed today When crowd barrier collapsed at the Ibrox soccer stadium here.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: A survey of 1,800 house holds in four western Penn sylvania counties indicates that Pittsburgh's new $36 million Three Rivers Stadium will generate more than $15 million a year in direct bene fits to the city's economy. Indirect economic benefits, including retail sales and other related expenditures, were not determined by the survey.

title: Rockefeller Message to Legislature Wednesday to Contain Some Surprises
description: Governor Rockefeller's mes sage outlining his 1971 legisla tive program, which he will de liver at the opening of the 194th Legislature on Wednes day, is likely to rely heavily on campaign promises, including pledges to enact an anticrime safe streets act on a state level and an environmental measure aimed at noise pollution.

title: Television
description: THE waiters all know him at Sardi's now, and when he left the res taurant after a drink and. a light supper the other night the autograph hunters hanging around outside, scan ning faces of diners for the famous, forced pieces of paper into his hands. Hey, Billy, c'monn, sign right here, they said: The tall, scholarly look ing black man wearing horn rimmed glasses and a quiet gray business suit took each piece of paper patiently and signed his name, Billy Tay lor.

title: ENEMY TRUCE ENDS IN SHARP CLASHES
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sun day, Jan. 3 (AP)The enemy's threeday New Year's truce end ed early today with sharp fight ing reported almost to the closing hours in both the north ern and southern, parts of South Vietnam.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISA crucial barrier to coexis tence between the United States and its adversaries Is the wholly different philosophy of national strategy as con ceived in America and as conceived by those Communist nations with which we are in various stages of quarrel.

title: Can Tijuana Live Down Its Reputation?
description: TIJUANA, MexicoIt is probably the toughest civicimprovement job since the Pied Piper marched the rats out of Hamelin, but civic leaders here are determined to try to change this notoriously sleazy border town into a family resort.

title: Squires Conquer Condors
description: HAMPTON, Va., Jan. 2 (AP) The Virginia Squires took an 110 lead at the start and never were headed tonight as they maintained their Eastern Divi sion lead with 137126 victory over the Pittsburgh Condors.

title: Article 17  No Title
description: Amer. Hockey League

title: Jan. 3 Garden Preview
description: ?? ?? breed ers and plant pathologists. Chemists have produced an array of new chemicals to modify plant growth and con trol insects and diseases of fruit crops. Virus experts are removing viruses which reduce plant vigor and crops. Engineers are perfecting mechanical harvesting equip ment. New varieties with improved plant and fruit characteristics are being intro duced each year.

title: The World
description: In Italy last week, long shoremen in Genoa announced they would refuse to unload Soviet ships. In Paris, demon strators occupied the offices of Intourist, the Soviet tour ist agency. In Washington, the Senate and the House of Representatives both passed resolutions expressing grave concern over the continued injustices to Soviet Jews. In Copenhagen and Oslo, the Danish and Norwegian Prime Ministers expressed shock at and condemnation of the So viet Union. In Jerusalem, more than 100,000 Jews prayed at the Wailing Wall.

title: Snow and Ice Still Grip Much of West Europe
description: LONDON, Jan. 2 (Reuters) Much of Western Europe was still in the grip of snow and ice today as a bitter cold spell showed no sign of a letup. At least 10 persons were reported dead in bliz zards that hit the Rhone Valley in southern France.

title: U.N. MAKES APPEAL FOR ARAB STUDENTS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 2The United Nations has made an appeal to member countries for funds to educate young Palestine Arab refugees, which has been described as a necessary move to avoid future disorder in the Middle East.

title: Bulls Seek $600,000 Damages From Sonics in Protest of Hayvvood Unveiling
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 2 (AP)The Chicago Bulls filed a three point protest with the National Basketball Association and asked $600,000 damages from the Seattle SuperSonics today for Seattle's unveiling on Dec. 30 of Spencer Haywood.

title: RYUN CONSIDERS RETURN TO TRACK
description: Jim Ryun is considering a return to active track and field competition, possibly as early as late this month.

title: Bullets Defeat Pistons
description: DETROIT, Jan. 2 (AP)The Baltimore Bullets reeled off 12 straight points midway in the final period tonight and went on to beat the Detroit Pistons, 10899, for their third straight victory. Jack Marin paced the victors with 29 points.

title: Where did Italian women learn to wear silken drawers?
description: For every American, for every European, the Age of Discovery is their epic agea time of dauntless courage when men in the tiny ships voyaged through storms and tropi cal heat to discover new worlds or reveal landsIndia and Cathay which had for centuries been vested in myth. In America the eruption of Europeans was superficially cathartic empires were toppled by a handful of horsemen, the ageold worship of the sun ripped out and replaced by the Catholic Church, the population decimated by disease and slavery.

title: BLUECOLLAR RISE IN PAY IS VETOED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (UPI) President Nixon has vetoed a proposed 4 per cent pay rise for the Government's bluecol lar workers, charging in a mes sage to Congress that the bill would have added to inflation.

title: Kastner Gets Baseball Post
description: Elwood C. Kastner, former dean of financial aid at New York University, has been named president of the Cape Cod Baseball League.

title: Auto Unit Extends Validity Of Some Licenses 4 Days
description: ALBANY, Jan. 2 (UPI) Holders of automobile registra tions and driver's licenses scheduled to expire New Year's Eve have been given a four day extension by Vincent L. Tofany, Commissioner of the State Department of Motor Vehicles.

title: El Al Plans to Seek New Stops At U.S. Points Beyond Kennedy
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 2.Israel plans to request an amendment to a 1950 air agreement with the United States that restricts carriers of El Al Israeli Airlines to the use of Kennedy Inter national Airport in New York.

title: Oregon G.O.P. Head Resigns Prior to Court Sentencing
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Jan. 2 The Oregon Republican chair man, Irving Enna, resigned this week, three days before receiv ing a suspended sentence on charge of negligent homicide.

title: Mrs. Hansen Joins Net Pros
description: Mrs. Betty Ann Grubb Han sen of California, the seventh ranked United States player, has joined the World Tennis magazine touring pros, the group announced yesterday. Eight of the nation's first 10 players are now in the group, which reported that its first tour of 13 events would have $199,000 in prize money.

title: Austrian Slalom Postponed
description: SALZBURG, Austria, Jan. 2 (AP)  An international giant slalom race with entries from 13 countries was postponed to day until tomorrow because of insufficient snow.

title: Red Beam Wins by Neck
description: LINCOLN, R. I., Jan. 2 (AP) Red Beam charged through in the stretch and scored by a neck in the $4,500 Nantucket Purse today before 11,337 fans at Lincoln Downs.

title: Mailbox: Violent Football
description: To the Editor:

title: Girl, 8, Killed in Elevator As She Plays With Brother
description: An 8  year  old girl was crushed to death in an elevator shift at about 2 A.M. yesterday in the Earle Hotel, 103 Waverly Place.

title: Art Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Workers in 45 States Will Get 5 Monday Holidays This Year
description: WASHINGTON, Jar. 2 (AP) Starting this year, most workers in the United States will have five guaranteed three day weekends.

title: Indiana Newspaper Sold
description: ELWOOD, Ind., Jan. 2. (AP) The Elwood publishing co., inc., publisher of the Elwood Call Leader, has announced purchase of physical assets of The Tipton Tribune, effedive with the Sat urday issue. The price was not disclosed. Jack Barnes, presi dent of the. Elwood Corporation, said there would be no immedi ate changes in personnel at the 75yearold Tipton. paper.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Meat Standards Met
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 2 (AP) The Agriculture Department has announced that state meat inspection programs in Georgia, Illinois, Vermont and New Jer sey have been certified as at least equal to Federal stand ards, bringing to 20 the number of states with qualified meat programs.

title: DETECTIVE SEIZES 4 IN A BRONX HOLDUP
description: A muchdecorated Bronx de tective shot one of four sus pected robbers yesterday and then arrested all four in a diner where, 19 months ago, he shot and captured an offduty transit patrolman after a holdup.

title: MRS. SAM MINSKOFF
description: Mrs. Esther Kerstein. Mins koff, widow of Sam Minskoff, founder and former head of Sam Minskoff & Sons, a lea& ing New York building firm, died Friday in Palm Beach, Fla. She was 81 years old and lived at 710 Park Avenue.

title: Boston Man Sentenced
description: PORTLAND, Me., Jan.2 (AP) Raymond E. Duffy, 32 years old, of Boston was sentenced to a year in jail Wednesday for possessing a counterfeit post marking stamp and for jumping bail.

title: About Motor Sports
description: In the 15 months that Bill Smyth has been executive di rector of the United States Auto Club he has modern ized the club and infused that oncewaning organiza tion with a vitality that few observers had thought possi ble. It was fortunate for USAC that Smyth got the latitude he want ed as a prerequi site for taking the job. Not long after assuming office be incorpo rated into it the functions of the director of competition.

title: What's. New at the Movies
description: ALEX IN WONDERLAND, di rected by Paul Mazursky and written by Mazursky and Larry Tucker, is one of those movies about movies that even Federico Fellini hesitated to make until he had completed 7 other films, says Vincent Canby. The movie is about a 36  year  old director named Alex (Donald Suth erland) who, having made immensely. successful first film, sinks into Con trolled despair as he tries to find a new project. Among his fantasies he not only etiokes Fellini, but also Fellini images. By evoking memories of other, much better movies, Ma zursky and Tucker simply call attention to the self indulgent emptiness of their own. They can be very funny men when they confine their scrutiny to the little disasters of con ventional family life, and when they work inside the frame of what is, in es sence, the blackout sketch. Unfortunately Mazursky and Tucker have insisted on making a movie about a moviemaker who doesn't have too much of interest on his mind, and who doesn't seem too different from the Hollywood freaks he puts down.

description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

description: Engagements

title: M. J. Feinstein And Miss Keyes To Wed in June
description: BERWYN, Pa., Jan. 2John Parkinson Keyes has an nounced the engagement of his daughter, Miss Catherine MacArthur Keyes, to Mithael Jon Feinstein, son of Dr. A. Archie Feinstein of Philadel phia and Mrs. Cecelia Fein stein of Merlon.

title: The World
description: MADRID  After death sentences were pronounced on six Basques at a mili tary courtmartial in Burgos last Monday and Spain caught one more glimpse of her old, violent nightmare, the edi torial plea hi all the papers was: After justice  mer cy.

title: 17 DIE AS U.A.R. JET CRASHES IN LIBYA
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Jan. 2 (Reu ters)All 17 persons aboard an Egyptian Comet jet airliner were killed today when it crashed into sand dunes only minutes before a scheduled landing here, airport authorities said.

description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Bowdoin Admits 9 Coeds
description: BRUNSWICK, Me., Jan. 2 (UPI)  Bowdoin College, a bastion for males since it was founded in 1794, has admitted nine coeds for the school year starting next September, the school Announced,

description: To THE EDITOR:
