title: Offshore Fund Purchases 7 Shopping Centers in U.S.
description: PORTLAND, Me., Jan. 4  United States Income Proper ties, Ltd., an offshore mutual fund with headquarters on Grand Cayman Island in the Caribbean, has purchased the Pine Tree Shopping Center here and six shopping centers in Massachusetts for more than $10million.

title: Teachers Quitting Singapore University
description: SINGAPORE, Jan. 4  An American professor who has headed the University of Singa pore's philosophy department since 1965 has resigned, accus ing Singapore's leaders of tendency toward authoritarian ism.

title: DR. RUTH STRANG OF COLUMBIA, 75
description: Dr. Ruth Strang, professor emeritus of education at Teach ers College, Columbia Univer sity, died Sunday in Brunswick General Hospital, Amityville, L. I., after a long illness. She was 75 years old.

title: 1970 VALUE OF CROPS PUT AT $24.1BILLION
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (UPI) Farmers were hit by corn blight disease and drought last year but still wound up with crops valued at a record $24.1 billion, an annual Agriculture Department report indicates.

title: WELFARE HOTELS ASSAILED BY KOCH
description: Representative Edward I. Koch called on the City Coun cil yesterday to pass a bill to compel landlords to rent apart ments to welfare recipients.

title: McCafferty, Colt Coach, Gains Super Bowl Berth and Identity
description: In the closing moments of the American Conference championship game Sunday, with the Baltimore Colts about to complete their 27 17 victory, Coach Don Mc Cafferty beckoned John Uni tas to the sideline. As the quarterback trotted over, his idolators in Memorial Sta dium accorded him a roaring ovation.

title: AMERICAN SMELTING IN E.I. DU PONT PACT
description: The American Smelting and Refining Company said yester day it had signed a tentative, 10year agreement to supply between 125,000 tons and 150,000 tons of titanium dioxide a year to E. I. du Pont de Ne mours & Co.

title: Sports of The Times
description: What ever happened to the theory that no pro team could reach championship stature without a slick, sharpshooting passer as its quarterback? The Dallas Cow boys rode all the way into the Super Bowl over the weekend despite the runofthe mill qualifications Of Craig Morton as their chief handler and thrower of foot balls.

title: Levra Accepts New Post
description: LAS VEGAS, N. M., Jan. 4 (UPI)Coach John Levra, who built New Mexico Highlands into a national smallcollege football power, resigned today to accept the athletic director ship and head football coaching job at Stephen F. Austin Col lege of Nacogdoches, Tex.

title: $700,000 More Is Reported In Estate Left by Illinois Official
description: SPRINGFIELD, III., Jan. 4 (AP)A new hoard of cash and easily negotiable securities to taling about $700,000 has been found in the estate of the late Illinois Secretary of State Paul Powell, Attorney General Wil liam J. Scott announced today.

title: Newsmen on Two Tabloids In Britain End Wildcat Strike
description: LONDON, Jan. 4Journalists on The Sun and The Daily Mir ror, Britain's two largestsell ing national tabloids, returned to work today, ending ineffec tual wildcat strikes that start ed Thursday.

title: Long Island Railroad Faces $43.3Million Deficit
description: The Long Island Railroad, faced with an expected opera ting loss of $43.3million In 1971, will go to the Legisla ture this month in an effort to avoid a fare rise.

title: Train Delays Mar New Cars Debut
description: Thousands of Penn Cen tral commuters were delayed up to 80 minutes yesterday in three separate incidents, including a fire that shut down all service on the Hud son Division for almost an hour.

title: . . . Time for a Taxi Commission
description: The overwhelmingly strong case for establishment of a Taxicab Commission has been hammered home in the letter sent by Mayor Lindsay to all members of the City Council as it begins public hearings today on higher taxi fares.

title: Foe's Film Depicts Capture of G.I.'s in Battle
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4The Columbia Broadcasting System televised an enemy film tonight in which about a dozen Ameri can fighting men are depicted as surrendering to the Vietcong in South Vietnam.

title: Cleveland Cuts Payroll
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 4 (AP)  Only 77 of 500 Cleveland Rec reation Department employes remained on the city payroll to day after 26 cityowned, recrea tion halls were closed because of an 80 per cent cut in the department's annual budget.

title: British Coal Chief Resigns in Dispute On Denationalizing
description: LONDON, Jan. 4A sudden resignation tonight by the chairman of Britain's National Coal Board indicated that the Conservative Government had decided to sell off parts of the country's nationalized in dustries.

title: CAMBODIANS TRY TO FLANK ENEMY
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Jan. 4 , (AP)A large Cambodian task force was reported today to have begun an attempt to outflank the Communistled troops that have cut off Pnom penh from the sea since Nov. 20.

title: Beame Will Seek Bill to Curb Mayor's Power on Contracts
description: Legislation mandating Board of Estimate and City Council approval of all construction contracts authorized in the capi tal budget will be introduced in the Legislature at the re quest or Controller Abraham D. Beame.

title: P.O.W. List Questioned
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 4  Lieut. Robert Frish man of the Navy, a former prisoner in North Vietnam, in sisted today that many more Americans were held by Hanoi than those reported in recently released lists of captives.

title: Vermont Goes to High Court
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP) Vermont turned to the Supreme Court today in an effort to force New York State and the International Paper Company to remove a huge blanket of de caying sludge from the bed of Lake Champlain. Vermont asked Supreme Court permission to file suit seeking an order to clean up the sludge and to block further waste disposal from the company's pulp processing fa cility at Ticonderoga, N. Y.

title: Dr. Brothers, on Air, Dissuades WouldBe Suicide
description: A Long Island housewife who telephoned radio station WMCA here threatening suicide yester day was dissuaded by Dr. Joyce Brothers, the psychologist, who spoke to her for almost three hours, 90 minutes of it on the air.

title: $50Million Contract Set
description: The Atlantic Richfield Com pany announced yesterday that it had awarded a $50million contract to the National Data Corporation of Atlanta for the development and operation of a total retail credit card system for the oil company.

title: HUGE SNOWSTORM STRIKES MIDWEST
description: A storm stranded thousands of holiday travelers yesterday as it piled up kneedeep snow and drifts up to 12 feet tall along a 1,000mile belt of the plains and the Middle West.

title: Mayor of Charleston, S.C., To Run for Rivers's Seat
description: CHARLESTON, S. C., Jan. 4 (AP)Mayor Palmer Gaillard of Charleston announced today his candidacy for the seat va cated by the death of Repre sentative L. Mendel Rivers, Democrat of South Carolina.

title: F A. A. Plane CrashLands In Queens and Hits House
description: A twinengine DC3 airplane owned by the Federal Aviation Administration crashlanded in a street, overturned and slid into a house near the south western edge of La Guardia Airport in Queens last night.

title: Overnight Parks Planned
description: Plans for a nationwide chain of overnight parks for camper trucks and trader homes were announced yesterday by Ra mada Inns, Inc. and the Bryn Mawr Group, Inc.

title: Turner and Mrs. O'Malley Win Awards in Yachting
African Studies Center at Cornell Develops Practical and Scholarly Skills
description: ITHACA, N.Y.While some students at Cornell University's Africana Studies and Research Center tutored children at an Ithaca community center as their field work, others worked in voter registration and eco nomic development projects in urban and rural Mississippi and in Harlem. And still other stu dents picked beans, dug ditches and made bricks in Tanzania, East Africa.

title: 1,000 Others Strike
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 4 (UPI) About 1,000 garbage men, truck drivers, road crewmen and plumbers walked off their jobs today in this city where strikes had closed the schools and both daily newspapers.

title: Denial of Bail to Seattle 7 Assailed Here by Attorneys
description: Denial of bail to defendants in the Seattle Seven conspiracy trial was denounced here yes terday by attorneys and rela tives of the young defendants.

title: Defense Contract Awards To Companies Announced
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (UPI) Defense contracts totaling $23.1thilliorr were awarded to five companies today.

title: Gas Blast in Miami Beach Kills One
description: MIAMI BEACH, Jan 4 (UPI) A gas explosion shattered a block of businesses today just off the touristpacked Lincoln Road shopping mall, spraying the street with broken glass and debris and killing at least one person.

title: MARGARET R. CASS
description: Margaret R. Cass, adminis trator of employe benefits for the Lever Brothers Company, died on Saturday at Doctors' Hospital after an illness of sev eral months. She was 57 years old and lived at 1 University Place.

title: Congressmen Told of $693Million Arms Sales Under Food for Peace Program
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4  The General Accounting Office told a Congressional subcommittee today that the Food for Peace program had permitted foreign countries to purchase nearly $700million in military equip ment in the last five years.

title: Virgin Islands Governor Sworn In
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, V. I., Jan. 4 (AP)  Dr. Melvin H. Evans, a black physician, was installed today as the first elected Governor of the Virgin Islands.

title: OUTPUT OF STEEL UP 4.8% IN WEEK
description: Steel production last week rose by 4.8 per cent from that of the previous week, the American Iron and Steel In stitute reported yesterday in Washington.

title: Scandinavian Bank Venture
description: Two Scandinavian banks, Den Norske Creditbank, Oslo, and Kansalls  Osake  Pankki, Helsinki, plan to establish a new bank in London called the Nordic Bank, Ltd., it was an nounced yesterday. A third in stitution, the Svenska Handels banken, Stockholm, is seeking permission to acquire part own ership of Nordic, which is scheduled to open before July.

title: Queens Power Interrupted
description: About 1,600 Consolidated Edison customers in the South Ozone Park and Howard Beach sections of Queens were with out electricity from 3 to 4:50 P.M. yesterday as a result of trouble in an underground feeder cable of the Woodhaven substation, a spokesman for the utility reported.

title: 4 Investment Houses Announce Changes in Major Management
description: Four investment houses an nounced yesterday major changes in top management or the admission of new partners.

title: Percentage Drops
description: Stocks with the largest per centagelosses on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday:

title: Manson's Lawyer Calls Murder Case A Political Trial
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 4 (AP) Charles Manson's attorney today called the Sharon Tate murder trial a political trial of which Manson actually is a very small part.

title: Alpine Ski Resorts Are Warned of Repetition of Fatal Avalanches
description: So much has now been learned about where and when avalanches are likely to occur that specialists in the subject consider it inexcus able that many people living in established communities, as well as unwary skiers, are killed every year in such catastrophes.

title: MAURICE E. CLARK
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Jan. 4 Maurice E. Clark, a retired Brooklyn teacher, died Satur day in Valley Hospital here of a heart ailment. He was 71 years old and lived at 127 Ack erman Avenue here.

title: Judge Theodore Levin, 73, Of U.S. Court in Michigan
description: DETROIT, Jan. 4  Judge Theodore Levin, who served for seven years as chief judge of the Federal District Court for the Eastern District of Michi gan, died of heart failure in Harper Hospital here on Thurs day after a short illness. He was 73 years old.

title: About Pro Basketball
description: If the latest twists in the Spencer Haywood case seem confusing to the basketball fan, he need not feel lonely. Many lawyers are confused, too.

title: Sterling Area Trade Report
description: LONDON, Jan. 4 (UPI)The overseas sterling area had a favorable basic balance of trade of about $624million in the first half of 1970, the Central Statistical Office said today.

title: FRANK KRIPPEL, 75, BANK EXAMINER HERE,
description: RYE, N. Y., Jan. 4Frank W. Krippel, who headed the Reorganization Division of the Treasury Department in Wash ington, supervising the Bank Holiday and the subsequent re openings of banks in the 1930's, died yesterday in Lawrence Hospital, Bronxville. He was 75 years old and lived on Kenil worth Road here.

title: DENNISON OFFERS PLAN FOR SUFFOLK
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Jan. 4 H. Leo Dennison, Suffolk County Executive, presented the County Legislature today with his 11th annual message. It reflected an awakening to the need for action on a multitude of county problems.

title: Soviet Role in Vietnam
description: President Sadat's acknowledg ment of the death of six Soviet soldiers appears to be the first official confirmation of the loss of Russian military personnel in the operation of antiaircraft installations supplied to Mos cow's allies.

title: Marine General Says Long Hair Is Barred by Tough Tradition
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4  The Marine Corps is determined to hold fast to its long tradition of tough training and discipline because it is confident that it will continue to be successful in attracting volunteers.

title: Books of The Times
description: There is a discouraging paradox about the Orangeburg shootings of Feb. 8, 1968, in which 3 students of South Carolina State College were killed and 27 wounded. For the events leading up to the incident were both inevitable and preventable. They were inevitable in that the confrontation between the police and students came as the lethal climax to a series of piledup grievances. But the killings could have been prevented at any given moment by an intelligent action or word. That the stu dents were unruly and provocative, that they used Insulting language and threw things, has been admitted. But that the only way to handle the students was to shoot Into them, seems, in spite of a jury verdict that justified the police, scarcely proven. At least it is scarcely proven in this documented analysis by two reporters who covered the case then and who believe it of sufficient importance not to let it dis appear from the consciousness of Ameri cans. For they show that the highway pa trol was insufficiently trained in riot con trol and, what is worse, rudderless. There was then, as in the events leading up to the killings, no leadership on the part of the Establishment from the Governor, Rob ert E. McNair, down.

title: Market Place: Full Disclosure  Is It, Really?
description: Sometimes highly interest ing information is left out of fulldisclosure statements filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON SHOW SHARP DROP
description: The London stock market de clined sharply yesterday. The main cause was a scarcity of buyers, but continued concern among businessmen about cost inflation was also among the reasons for negligible trading.

title: Museum Turns to AllJewish Shows
description: Citing financial reasons, the Jewish Museum, one of the city's prime showcases for avantgarde art, has decided to discontinue all exhibitions not related to the museum's com mitment to the Jewish com munity. The decision has brought about the resignation of Karl Katz, the museum's di rector since 1968.

title: NIXON WILL PRESS REVENUE SHARING IN NEW CONGRESS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4Presi dent Nixon said tonight that he would make a farreaching new revenuesharing proposal in his State of the Union Message later this month and would campaign vigorously in Con gress for its enactment.

title: Haywood Plays for SuperSonics But Bucks Win, 124110, and Lodge Protest
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 4 (UPI) The Seattle SuperSonics decided to insert Spencer Haywood, the American Basketball Associa tion defector, into the lineup for the second half in their Na tional Basketball Association game against Milwaukee to night, but it was too late to stop the Bucks, who won, 124 110.

title: Singapore Studies Pollution
description: SINGAPORE (UPI)The Gov ernment has engaged experts to study air pollution problems before we suffer from suffo cation, Finance Minister Dr. Goh Keng Swee said.

title: Blazers Triumph, 119106, As Petrie Scores 39 Points
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 4 (UPI) Geoff Petrie of Portland topped the 30point mark for the fifth straight game tonight when he scored 39 in pacing the Trail Blazers to a 119106 victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers.

title: Rail System Is Hero in French Storm Crisis
description: PARIS, Jan. 4  The French railroad system, s?? being abandoned by passengers and shippers, was widely hailed to day as the hero of a major transport crisis.

title: Early Gains for Wheat Futures Are Trimmed Near the Close
description: A small supply of unfilled orders and poor crop reports caused late buying of wheat futures while heavy snow and low temperatures in the Mid west resulted in a demand for corn and oats futures on the Chicago Board of Trade yes terday.

title: BIG BOARD TO LIFT FEES FOR LISTINGS
description: The New York Stock Ex change has scheduled increases in listing fees for common and preferred stock and for war rants, effective April 1.

title: F.D.A. Negotiating For Labeling Study Paid for by Industry
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (AP) The Food and Drug Adminis tration confirmed today that it was negotiating for $100,000 in industrysupported research to help shape new labeling re quirements aimed at disclosing the nutritional value of proc essed food.

title: Advertising:
description: The back page of The New York Post yesterday featured a twocolor 200line ad for American Brands Silva Thin cigarettes. It was the first ad on that page in the memory of Dorothy Schiff, the pub lisher.

title: CHARGE IS DISMISSED AGAINST JUDGE'S SON
description: Marijuana possession charges against a State Supreme Court justice's son, a girl and two youths arrested with him last June were dismissed Dec. 2, court records showed yester day.

title: PLEA ON MIDEAST MADE BY ROGERS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan.  Secretary of State William P. Rogers appealed to Israel, Jordan and the United Arab Republic today to show flexi bility in the indirect peace talks that are due to resume here tomorrow.

title: Nevada Governor Inducted
description: CARSON CITY, Nev. Jan. 4 (AP)  Mike O'Callaghan, a Democrat, was sworn in today as Nevada's 23d Governor on the snowcovered steps of the Capitol.

title: Pigeons Stolen, No Race
description: TOKYO, Jan. 4 (AP)  The traditional 62mile New Year's homing pigeon race from Utsu nomiya to Tokyo was canceled today because somebody stole a truck with the 460 pigeons; aboard. The truck and the pi geons were found on a highway to Utsunomiya today, but it was past post time.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Europartners Securities Corporation, for merly Credit Lyonnais Corporation, has announced the election of Frank E. Jedlicka Jr. as president and chief executive officer. He succeeds Pierre de Vomecourt who has retired. Neil T. Carr and Edward J. Fuller, both vice presidents, were elected to the board of directors at the investment banking firm.

title: Transcript of Four Correspondents' Interview With President at the White House
description: Following is a transcript of a tele vised interview with President Nixon from the White House last night as recorded by The New York Times. Network correspondents par ticipating were Eric Sevareid of the Columbia Broadcasting System, How ard K. Smith of the American Broad casting Company, John Chancellor of the National Broadcasting Company and Nancy Dickerson of the Public Broadcasting System.

title: Ling & Co. TakeOver Set
description: FORT WORTH, Tex., Jan. 4 (AP)The Institutional Equity, Corporation agreed today to ac quire substantially all of Ling & Co.'s customer and dealer ac counts as of Jan. 15.

title: Wallace Weds Divorcee in Alabama
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Jan. 4 (UPI.Gov.elect George C. Wallace, 51 years old, married Cornelia Ellis Snive ly, a 31yearold divorcee, to night in a private ceremony before their families.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Black Aide Is Hired
description: SEATTLE, Jan. 4 (AP)Ray Jackson, a black former Wash ington fullback, was hired as an assistant football coach by the Huskies today in a move aimed at easing racial prob lems in the football program.

title: South Carolina Upset, 7964
description: CHAPEL HILL, N. C., Jan. 4 (AP)North Carolina took the lead from the opening buzzer tonight and upset South Caro lina, 7964. It was the first loss after nine victories for the Gamecocks. North Carolina is 92.

title: Parting Shot on Vietnam
description: Mr. President, my term of office in the Senate is drawing to a close.

title: UNITAS, POLYTURF KEYS IN BOWL ODDS
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Jan. 4  The Super Bowl game be tween the Baltimore Colts and the Dallas Cowboys was rated even money today by Jimmy (The Greek) Snyder, the Las Vegas oddsmaker.

title: JUDGE REINSTATES BAIL FOR PANTHER
description: Supreme Court Justice John M. Murtagh reinstated bail yes terday for Michael Tabor, a Black Panther who last week denounced him in the courtroom as a vile Fascist swing pig.

title: Gifts to the Neediest Fund $100,000 Behind Last Year
description: More than 6,500 contribu tors have responded so far to the 59th annual appeal for the Neediest Cases Fund. Compared with a year ago, the number of donors is off nearly 4,000 and the total $648,512.97  is off more than $100,000.

title: News Analysis
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 4The re cent trial of 11 wouldbe hi jackers, nine of them Jews who sought to flee to Israel, and the impending trial of about 20 other Jews in Leningrad and other cities have again aroused concern abroad and focused at tention on the Soviet Union's treatment of its three million Jews. It is an ex tremely volatile subject. It has led Jewish leaders in the West to talk as if the Jewish popu lation here is faced with annihi lation and it has produced anger in the Kremlin and denials that any Jews are persecuted or that any antiSemitism can exist.

title: The Way Adolfo Dresses Up Shorts, Women Needn't Be All That Daring
description: I used to wear sequined shorts when I lived in Holly wood  it was a scandal, Paulette Goddard remarked happily at Adolfo's fashion show at the St. Regis yester day. Hattie Carnegie made them for me in colors like bright yellow, and I wore them under a long mink coat, just like today. Nobody else had them.

title: Warning on Inflation
description: LONDON, Tuesday, Jan. 5 (Reuters)Prices are rising in Britain so fast that the buying power of the pound could be reduced by onethird in five years, according to Britain's In stitute of Company Directors.

title: Percentage Gains
description: Stocks with the largest per centage gains on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday:

title: Doctors Puzzled by Brucellosis Affecting Men in Iowa Abattoir
description: Government doctors are in vestigating a puzzling outbreak of a bacterial disease that has caused 53 workers in a large slaughterhouse in Dubuque, Iowa, to become ill with fevers, chills, sweats, weakness, head aches and weight loss up to 44 pounds.

title: Advertising:
description: William W. Mulvey, chair man of the executive committee and an executive vice president of McCannErickson, is switch ing over to the parent company, the Interpublic Group of Com panies, as a senior vice pres ident.

title: Ski Conditions
description: BOSTON (AP) Following are ski conditions from selected New England ski areas as re ported by the ski area operators Monday morning.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: INTEGRATION HELD HOUSING AID GOAL
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 4The United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit has or dered that the Department of Housing and Urban Develop ment, in considering applica tions for mortgage insurance or rent supplements for a housing project, must determine wheth er the project will increase or maintain segregation.

title: Truckload of Scotch Stolen
description: Three hijackers stole a truck with $70,000 worth of Scotch whisky yesterday1,000 cases of Dewars White Labelthe po lice reported. Steve Cruz, 30 yearold driver for the Monroe Express Company of 4442 12th Street, Long Island City, Queens, and his helper, Timothy Sheehan, 24, were forced into a small vantype of truck in downtown Brooklyn and driven around for twoandahalf hours before being dropped off in South Ozone Park, Queens. The whisky had been consigned to the Knickerbocker Liquor Com pany in Syosset, L. I.

title: Brokerage House And Ling's Brother Punished by S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 (UPI) The Securities and Exchange Commission revoked today the brokerdealer registration of Ling & Co., Inc., of Dallas for alleged violations of antifraud and registration sections of Federal securities law.

title: 38 Mine Blast Victims Insured for $19,700 Each
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Jan. 4 Each of the 38 miners killed in last Wednesday's explosion at the Finley Coal Company mine in Wooton; Ky., was cov ered for the maximum $19,700 under the Kentucky Workmen's Compensation Act, according to the servicing agent here.

title: Patterson Bout Reset
description: The 10  round heavyweight fight between Floyd Patterson and Oscar Bonavena, originally scheduled for Jan. 22 at Madi son Square Garden, was reset yesterday for Friday night, Feb. 12.

title: Rev. Arthur A. Ford Dead at 75; Medium Who Aided Bishop Pike
description: The Rev. Arthur A. Ford, a Disciples of Christ clergyman and psychic medium who lec tured widely on extrasensory perception, died yesterday at Baptist Hospital in Miami after a short illness. He would have been 75 years old Friday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Hannum Is Hospitalized
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 4 (AP) Coach Alex Hannum of the San Diego Rockets was hospitalized today for treatment of a res piratory infection, and a six year pro, Larry Siegfried, was named to handle the team.

title: Government Ain't Machinery
description: Mr. Dooley's dictum, politics ain't beanbag, has a modern corollary: government ain't machinery.

title: State Welfare Takeover in 73 Urged by Community Council
description: An educational campaign aimed at having the state take over local welfare, costs to help the localities cope with mounting money crises was announced yesterday by the Community Council of Greater New York.

title: BOY'S CONFESSION TO 65 FIRE UPHELD
description: The Appellate Division of State Supreme Court has up held the legality of a confes sion in which a Yonkers youth admitted that he set a fire in a Jewish community center that killed 12 persons.

title: State of the Economy
description: From the standpoint of American businessmen, workers and consumers, 1970 was a dismal year. Industrial pro duction and the total real output of the economy slumped; unemployment and consumer prices climbed; corporate profits dropped; over 150 brokerage firms went out of business and the Penn Central Railroad, a mammoth of American industry, had to reorganize under the bank ruptcy laws, forcing executives in many other companies to think about the unthinkable.

title: St. Peter's Routs Fairleigh
description: JERSEY CITY, Jan. 4Ted Martiniuk, a junior guard, scored a career high of 30 points in leading St. Peter's College to an 8671 victory over Fairleigh Dickinson before 2,000 fans at the Jersey City Armory tonight. Martiniuk hit on 11 of 18 shots from the field and a perfect 8 of 8 from the foul line.

title: Reagan, Heckled, Pledges Welfare Reform
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Jan. 4 Speaking over the chants of a crowd of radicals espousing the cause of welfare recipients, Gov. Ronald Reagan promised today to restructure the welfare sys tem to eliminate waste and the impropriety of subsidizing those whose greed is greater than their need.

title: Pompidou Predicts Entry for Britain In Common Market
description: PARIS, Jan. 4President Pompidou predicted today that Britain would be accepted into the Common Market because her membership was now in the interests of France and Eu rope, as well as Britain.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4In his ap pearance on Meet the Press, Gover nor Rockefeller of New York expressed remarkable confidence that Congress would enact this year a revenueshar ing program making perhaps ten bil lion Federal dollars available to the states and municipalities. Congress would have to act, Mr. Rockefeller said, if we are not going to have a major breakdown in the cities of this country, in the urban areas of this country during the coming year.

title: G.M. Elects First Negro As Member of Its Board
description: DETROIT, Jan. 4  Dr. Leon Howard Sullivan, a black min ister from Philadelphia who has been a pioneer in helping Negroes find better jobs in in dustry, was elected today to the board of directors of the General Motors Corporation.

title: S. AFRICA IS BACK IN DAVIS CUP DRAW
description: LONDON, Jan. 4 (Reuters) South Africa, barred from last year's Davis Cup tennis com petition, will be included in the draw for the European zone this year. But it was believed unlikely that she would partici pate.

title: Vatican Acts to Accept OderNeisse Boundary
description: ROME, Jan. 4 (AP)The Vatican disclosed today that it has moved to accept the OderNeisse border between West Germany and Poland.

title: 8 Building Projects Awarded
description: The Perini Corporation, a construction and realestate concern, said yesterday that it had been awarded eight con struction projects totaling more than $42million. The Boston based company said the awards included three pipelinecon struction projects in Canada.

title: FIREMEN'S UNION. AND MY ACCEPT A NEW MEDIATOR
description: State Supreme Court Justice William Kapelman assumed the role of mediator yesterday in the contract dispute between the city and its firemen.

title: 3 Gaza Attacks Reported
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 4An Israeli military spokesman said today that Arab guerrillas in Gaza carried out three grenade at tacks against Israeli military patrols this morning, resulting in the death of one guerrilla and injury to one civilian. There were no Israeli casualties re ported.

title: Last Chance for Civic Peace . . .
description: The mediation begun yesterday by State Supreme Court Justice William Kapelman represents what may be the last hope for ending the firemen's illconceived job action without a confrontation of great potential danger to them and to the city.

title: Computer Replaces Cowboy in Raising Livestock
description: CHICAGOThis city's as sociations with the cowpoke and the grassy range are all but over, victims of changes in the way cattle and hogs are grown and slaughtered.

title: Payments Balance In Germany Shows November Surplus
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, Jan. 4. (Reuters)The Federal Bank reported today that West Germany's basic balance of payments showed a surplus of 57 million marks ($15.57mil lion) in November, 1970,against a surplus of 1.44billion marks ($39.34million) in October.

title: ASG HOLDERS TO ACT ON GLASS WRITEOFF
description: ASG Industries, Inc., an nounced yesterday that it planned to submit for stock holder consideration at the company's annual meeting on April 22 a $17million writeoff for a glass plant being closed down at Arnold, Pa., and a sheet glass furnace that has not operated for nearly two years. The writeoff is being considered as a quasireorgr ization.

title: Giovanni Battista Giorgini Dies; Headed Italian Fashion Shows
description: FLORENCE, Italy, Jan. 4 (AP) Giovanni Battista Giorgini, who is credited with having started Italian fashions in the world market, died at his home here yesterday. He was 72 years old.

title: CITY REPORTS GAIN ON DERELICT CARS
description: A total of 72,961 derelict vehiclesabout 200 a day were removed from the streets here in 1970 under the Sanita tion Department's abandoned car program, Acting Commis sioner Jerome Kretchmer said yesterday.

title: Dr. Bundle in the Hospital
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 4Dr. Ralph J. Bunche, Under Secretary General for Special Political Affairs, was confined to New York Hospital during the weekend with a respiratory ailment. United Nations spokesmen said that Dr. Bunche, a Middle Eastern specialist, was being kept in formed of developments there.

title: DEFOREST ELY, HEAD OF AD AGENCY, DIES
description: Dr. DeForest Ely, a physi cian who was president of Wil liam Douglas McAdams, Inc., advertising agency, died Sun day night at his home in East Hampton, L.I. He was 57 years old.

title: 2 Get Prison in Drug Case
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 4 (AP) Two men from Chile, convicted by a jury, were sentenced to prison terms today for bringing $300,000 worth of cocaine into the United States. Guillermo Arriagada, 32 years old, re ceived a 10year term. Eleuterio Jelvez, 35, got eight years. The two men, both of Santiago, were sentenced by Federal Dis trict Judge Alexander Harvey 2d.

title: Mayor's Panel Finds '70 Census Undercounted City
In Tokyo, Housing Shortage Persists Amid Affluence
description: TOKYO, Jan. 4Neighbors of a family living in a rickety wooden apartment building watched in amazement not long ago when members of the fam ily started loading their posses sions into a moving van.

title: MICHAEL LAULETTI
description: Michael Lauletti, retired as sistant foreman of the delivery department of The New York Times, died Sunday. He was 70 years old and lived at 166 Burr Place, Hasbrouck Heights, N. J.

title: German Visit Put Off
description: BONN, Jan. 4Despite the bad weather, the West Germans had prepared today to roll out the red carpet for Senator Muskie. To speed him to a meeting with the West German Foreign Minister, Walter Scheel, at his vacation home in the Austrian Alps, a Luftwaffe jet stood by through the day. But by nightfall, Senator Muskie was still in London. The trip to Germany was put off and, when the fog lifts, he will head for Tel Aviv, the next scheduled stop on his tour.

title: Tevye's Suffering Enacted for Movie
description: LONDONTevye, the poor Ukrainian Jewish milkman with five unmarried daugh ters, a lame horse, a sharp tongued wife and enduring optimism, is now in the movies.

title: Cowboys TwoGun Threat: Strong Run, Strong Defense
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 4 The Super Bowl game in Mi ami on Jan. 17 will match the Dallas Cowboys, a run ning team featuring a rookie named Duane Thomas, against a passing team, the Baltimore. Colts, whose star is an oldtimer, John Unitas.

title: Vandals Burn F86 Jet In Harlem Playground
description: An old F86 jet fighter donated by the Air Force to a Harlem playground was set on fire last night and badly damaged, the Fire De partment said.

title: MUNDT WILL KEEP POST THOUGH ILL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4  Efforts to persuade Senator Karl E. Mundt to resign from the Senate have apparently failed.

title: Issues in City's Pay Talks
description: Following are the parties and issues in the city's current negotiations with its uniformed services:

title: City Stores Gain
description: In a twoweek sales flurry before and after Christmas, seven of New York's largest de partment stores concluded 1970 with their best average monthly gain of the year.

title: ELIAS A. KUSHNER
description: Elias A. Kushner, president of Texite, Inc., a textile concern at 389 Fifth Avenue, died in Miami Sunday of a heart attack. He Was 59 years old and lived at 80 Park Avenue.

title: HAINSWORTH TAKES TOP A.A.U. POSITION
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 4 (AP) Harry Hainsworth, 50 years an official with the Amateur Athletic Union, has succeeded Donald F. Hull as its executive director.

title: Vatican's Choice of Bishop Widens Conflict With Dutch
description: THE HAGUE, Jan. 4The appointment of a conservative priest as Bishop of Rotterdam has set off a new round in the conflict between the Vati can and the Roman Catholic Church in the Netherlands.

title: Boston to Cut Spending
description: BOSTON, Jan. 4 (AP)Mayor Kevin H. White said today that he would cut city spending sharply and ask all department heads to take a pay cut in the new city budget. Mayor White also said he would propose cut ting 500 city employes from the payroll and banning all new programs.

title: Farmingdale Wins, 8560
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I., Jan. 4  The Farmingdale Aggies, paced by Charles Duncan's 15 points, defeated the touring Czech National basketball team tonight, 8560.

title: Communist China Recognized by Chile
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 5Com munist China announced today the establishment of diplomatic relations with Chile, where a Marxist president, Dr. Salvador Allende, came to power last year.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE ON LONDON BOARD
description: Selective buying of leading issues and advances in quiet trading on the London stock exchange yesterday followed President Nixon's forecast Monday night of significant improvements in the United States economy.

title: Soviet Complains to U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 5The Soviet delegation, in a protest to Secretary Gen eral Thant, said it reserved its right to bring criminal pro ceedings against leaders of the Jewish Defense League and suit for the physical damage and moral injury sustained during demonstrations by the league at the Soviet Mission on Dec. 27 and 28.

title: LEAFS 20 VICTORS OVER NORTH STARS
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Jan. 5 (AP)  Jacques Plante re corded his third shutout of the season tonight as the Toronto Maple Leafs defeated the Min nesota North Stars, 20, for their fourth straight National Hockey League victory.

title: Javits's Brother Is Reprimanded
description: Benjamin A. Javits, brother and former law partner of Senator Jacob K. Javits, was suspended from practice yes terday for, three years for at tempting to perpetrate a fraud upon the courts of Mexico and the United States.

title: MEKONG TANKERS AMBUSHED BY FOE
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Jan. 5 (UPI)Enemy gunners were reported today to have am bushed two small tankers tak ing badly needed gasoline up the Mekong River to Pnompenh.

title: The Job Picture: When and Where
description: I know what unemploy ment does to somebody. I've seen an unemployed man come into my father's store. I've seen the look in his eye when he can't pay the bill. I've seen the look in his chil dren's eyes when he can't pay that bill. President Nixon Jan. 4, 1971

title: Montreal Group Wins Franchise For Pro Soccer
description: The North American Soccer League announced in Atlanta last night that a franchise had been awarded to Montreal and that Cleveland would be con sidered tomorrow.

title: Chicago Teachers Strike At Seven City Colleges
description: CHICAGO, Jan, 5 (AP) Teachers at Chicago's seven city colleges went on strike to day, providing an unscheduled vacation for more than half of a student enrollment of 39,000.

title: U.N. Aide Talks With Middle East Representatives
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 5Representatives of Is rael, Jordan and the United Arab Republic resumed indirect peace talks here today under the auspices of Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring of Sweden, Secretary General Thant's special repre sentative for the Middle East.

title: Anaconda Is Glum Over Chile's Moves On Copper Holdings
description: The Anaconda Company, a major copper producer with large holdings in Chile, mailed a letter to its shareholders yes terday, warning that proposed Chilean legislation could have a substantial adverse effect on the financial position of Ana conda.

title: A Matter of Confidence. . .
description: From the outset of his Administration, President Nixon has had a problem of building public confidence in his purposes and leadership. As his hourlong television in terview on Monday evening made clear, that is still his problem, and he is aware of it. He made himself available for the interview as part of his recurrent effort to sell himself to the American people.

title: Tass Reports Arraignment
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 5 (AP)Tass, the Soviet press agency, re ported the arraignment today of Miss Davis in a dispatch from New York headlined: 'Authori ties Make Ready to Mete Out Reprisals.

title: Nixon Arrives in California
description: EL TORO MARINE AIR STATION, Calif., Jan. 5 (AP) Air Force One with President Nixon aboard landed here this afternoon.

title: Mt. Vernon Father Accused Of Fatal Beating of Infant
description: MOUNT VERNON, N.Y., Jan. 5 (UPI)A 29yearold compu ter consultant was held here today on charges of having beaten his 18monthold daugh ter to death.

title: NIXON DECLARES CONGRESS FAILED ON MAJOR ISSUES Says It Will Be Remembered for What It Did Not Do Welfare Plan Cited ALBERT REBUTS ATTACK Asserts the Administration Itself Has FailedFurther Cabinet Ousters Barred
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5Pres ident Nixon ranked the 91st Congress today as one that would be remembered in his tory not for what it did, but for what it failed to do.

title: FIREMEN ORDERED TO END JOB ACTION AND REOPEN TALKS
description: State Supreme Court Justice William Kapelman directed the city's firemen yesterday to stop their job action and ordered both the city and the firemen to resume goodfaith collective bargaining aimed at resolving their dispute.

title: U.S. Report Issued in 1969
description: The most recent report in the United States, Smoking, To bacco and Health, was re leased in July, 1969, by the Department of Health, Educa tion and Welfare. It said the mortality rate for male smokers between 45 and 54 years old was double that of nonsmokers, and that the life expectancy of a 25yearold man who smokes was 3.4 years shorter than that of a nonsmoker.

title: OVERPRICING FOUND IN A DEFENSE STUDY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (AP)  Government auditors have found overpricing by de fense contractors in more than half of the military contracts examined in a spot check.

title: QUALIFYING RULES REVISED FOR 500
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 5 (AP) The Indianapolis Motor Speedway eliminated some of the drama today from qualifi cations for the 500mile Me morial Day race, but it made a lot of drivers and car owners happy.

title: Oil Well Found Off Nigeria
description: The Gulf Oil Corporation an nounced yesterday the dis covery of a commercial oil well offshore Nigeria. The well Abiteye lx tested 3,600 barrels of oil a day from three levels of Miocene sand. The well is located about eight miles north east of Gulf's Escravos Termi nal and 60 miles southwest of Benin City.

title: Gift of Golf Balls Costs Melnyk His Amateur Status
description: Steve Melnyk, the 1969 United States Amateur golf champion, has forfeited his am ateur status as a result of hav ing accepted six dozen golf balls from an equipment manu facturer at Augusta, Ga., before the 1970 Masters tournament, the United States Golf Associa tion announced yesterday.

title: SHAW OF BUFFALO IS ROOKIE OF YEAR
description: Dennis Shaw, the Buffalo quarterback who compares playing pro football with playing with my brothers in the park, was named rookie of the year twice yesterday.

title: ASARCO AND DU PONT CLARITY AGREEMENT
description: E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., Inc., and the American Smelting and Refining Company issued a statement yesterday clarifying an announcement made Monday on a 10year agreement under which Asarco will deliver titaniumbearing minerals to du Pont.

title: Hofstra Is 9067 Victor Over West Chester State
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Jan. 5 Hofstra maintained its hold on first place in the Middle At lantic Conference's Eastern Sec tion tonight with a 9067 rout of West Chester State.

title: RISE IN AID URGED FOR URBAN AREAS
description: ALBANY, Jan. 5Citing the expanding responsibilities of county governments in the state, a special panel appointed by Governor Rockefeller today proposed increased state aid to 17 urban Counties that would cost $46million over a four year period beginning in 1972.

title: N.B.C. WILL PRESS READING METHOD
description: Popup, a series of one minute educational films em ploying the techniques by which Dr. Caleb Gattegno teaches basic reading skills to children, will begin Jan. 23 as regular features of the National Broadcasting Company's Satur day morning television lineup.

title: Some Questions for the President
description: WASHINGTONWhat bothers me about Presidential press conferences is that, like so many things that orig inate in the White House, they exist only at the pleasure of the Presi dent. Some day, a highly displeased President is going to abolish them altogether and make it stick.

title: U.S. REPORT FINDS FRAUD IN HOUSING Cites Wide Abuse in Federal Home Ownership Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 The House Banking and Curren cy Committee released a re port today showing widespread abuse by real estate specula tors in the Federal program of home ownership for low and moderate income families.

title: ARNOLD CONSTABLE TO CLOSE A STORE
description: Arnold Constable, Inc., the Fifth Avenuebased specialty store chain, will close its eight year old store in Upper Darby Pa., outside Philadelphia, and is also negotiating to lease space to another tenant in its store in Trenton, N.J.

title: MERGERS IN 70 FELL 15% FROM 69 LEVEL
description: Merger announcements last year fell to 5,173, down 15 per cent from the 1969 total of 6,107 it was announced yester day by W. T. Grimm & Co., a Chicagobased financial cons suiting concern specializing in mergers and acquisitions.

title: Actor Cleared of Charge
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 5 (UPI) Audie Murphy, America's most decorated soldier during World War II, was cleared to day of charges of illegally pos sessing blackjacks. Mr. Murphy, now an actor, testified he was authorized to possess them be cause he is a special officer with the Port Hueneme, Calif., police force and a deputy with the Dallas County Tex, sheriff's department. The police said they found the weapons in Mr. Murphy's home and car last May 28 when he was arrested on assault and battery charges in connection with the beating of a dog trainer. He was acquit ted of those charges.

title: ROCKELLER SEES PRESIDENT ON AID Assurances of New Money From a RevenueSharing Plan Reportedly Given
description: ALBANY, Jan. 5Governor Rockefeller, preparing for the opening of the 1971 Legislature tomorrow, talked to President Nixon today about where to get some of the money needed to resolve the state's fiscal crisis.

title: TV:
description: Hugh Wheeler's Big Fish, Little Fish was first pre sented on Broadway in 1961. Despite good reviews, it closed after a brief run. Last night it was, deservedly, re vived on Hollywood Tele vision Theater on National Educational Television as the first in this year's series of plays, which will include Lillian Hellman's Montser rat and a repeat of the excellent The Andersonville Trial.

title: New Haven ExChief Heads Antifraud Drive
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 5 (AP)  James F. Ahern, former Police Chief of New Haven, Conn., was named today by the Casualty Insurance Fraud As sociation to head a nation wide drive against fraudulent insurance claims.

title: GEORGIA LUSK, 77, SERVED IN HOUSE
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., Jan. 5 (AP)Mrs. Georgia L. Lusk, a former member of Congress from Carlsbad, died today in a hospital here. She was. 77 years old.

title: ??Day Fog Lifts at Heathrow
description: LONDON, Jan. 5 (Reuters) A freezing fog over London's Heathrow Airport lifted today after having caused thousands or airline passengers to be stranded since Sunday. But air line officials warned that it could be days before normal service could be resumed.

title: $2,917 Double Sets Record
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 5 (UPI) The Fair Grounds recorded the biggest daily double in its 98 year history today, a $2,917 return on a $2 ticket on Posen's Day in the first race and Count less Craig in the second.

title: Valerie Hinge Wed To Sean Sweeney
description: Miss Valerie Hinge, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Norman Hinge of Hunton, England, was married in Yoshiwara, Fuji, Japan, on Dec. 27 to Sean Sweeney, son of Mr. and Mrs. James Johnson Sweeney of New York.

title: Hawaii Is Toppled
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 5 (AP) Hawaii suffered its first bas ketball defeat of the season tonight, bowing to Loyola, 111104.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 5 (AP) Howard Komives scored 6 points in the final four minutes tonight to help the Detroit Pistons post a 9890 National Basketball Association victory over the Atlanta Hawks.

title: Rancher Brands Luggage
description: SARASOTA, Fla. (AP)  George Cross, a rancher, never has a problem trying to locate his luggage. He has painted a large cross on all pieces of his luggage and it is quickly spot ted on the airport conveyor belts when he flies from his Florida ranch to his western ranch at Duboise, Wyo.

title: Correct Policy Toward Chile
description: President Nixon might have chosen his words with greater care. but the gist of his comment on United States relations with Chile during his televised interview Monday was clear: Washington unreservedly recognizes the right of Chileans to a Government of their own choosing; it will maintain correct relations with the Marxistled coalition of President Salvador Allende and will continue its programs and contacts with the Chilean people.

title: Minnesota's Senate Is Snarled As Parties Struggle for Control
description: ST. PAUL, Jan. 5 (AP)The Chief Justice of the Minnesota Supreme Court refused to swear in new State Senators today and the 34 members of the Republicanoriented Con servative majority walked out as the opening of the Senate's biennial session turned into a chaotic battle for control.

title: MARQUETTE TOPS LOYOLA BY 7863
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 5 (UPI) Marquette tied a school record tonight in beating Loyola, 78 63, at the Milwaukee Arena.

title: Maternity Clothes From an AvantGarde DesignerRudi Gernreich
description: Rudi Gernreich isn't exact ly the first designer one would think of to do meter nity clothes. In fact, he could easily be the last. The per petrator of the topless bath mg suit, who most recently accessorized his fashions with dog tags and guns, can hard ly be accused of being a sen timentalist.

title: Shelley Goodgold Bride of W.M. Cole
description: Miss Shelley Ann Good gold, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Joseph Goodgold, was married here last night to Wayne Mark Cole, son of Mr. and Mrs. David Cole of New Hyde Park, L. I.

title: Mrs. Ky and Tribesmen in Dispute Over Land in South Vietnamese Highlands
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan 5 (AP)  A land dispute in volving Montagnard tribesmen on one side and Mrs. Nguyen Cao Ky on the other has gone to the highest officials of the Government for a decision.

title: Dr. Bunche's Condition Fair
description: Dr.Ralph J. Bunche, United Nations Under Secretary Gen eral of Special Political Affairs, was reported in fair condition at New York Hospital last night. He was admitted to the hospital Saturday with a resp? ratory ailment.

title: Dr. Columbus O'Donnell Iselin, Noted Oceanographer, Is Dead
description: VINEYARD HAVEN, Mass., Jan. 5Columbus O'Donnell Iselin, senior oceanographer and former director of the Woods Hole Oceanographic In stitution, died today in Fal mouth Hospital as a result of in juries received in his home here. He was 66 years old.

title: Executive Changes
description: Dr. James M. Hester, president of New York University, has been elected a member of the board of directors of the Irving Trust Company and, its parent organization, the Charter New York Corpo ration. Dr. Hester who has been president of the university since 1962, also serves on the board of the Union Carbide Corporation and The Lehman Corporation.

title: McLain's Wild Pitch On Links a Painful One
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Jan. 5 (UPI)  The blade of Denny McLain's golf putter came off its shaft today and struck a playing partner in the mouth, knocking out several teeth.

title: Tennis on Coast Today
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 5 (UPI) The $15,000 British Motors women's tennis tourna ment gets under way at the Civic Auditorium tomorrow, with Mrs. Billie Jean King, Rosemary Casals and Mrs. Ann Jones among those contesting for the $4,300 first prize.

title: Civil Defense Aide Named
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (AP) Allan R. Zenowitz, Massa chusetts civil defense director the last six years, was sworn in today as Northeast regional director for the Federal Office of Civil Defense.

title: Their Goal: $200Million Arts Subsidy
description: Would you believe an an nual Federal subsidy of $200 million for the arts?

title: Title Victory Helps to Reunite Hayes and Landry After Earlier Discontent
description: At first glance, the picture presented on the sideline at the end of the DallasSan Francisco championship game last Sunday appeared incon gruous. There in front of the Dallas bench Bob Hayes was hugging Tom Landry and Tom Landry was hugging Bob Hayes.

title: A Clarification
description: The USLIFE Corporation has signed a definitive agreement to acquire the Columbia Sav ings and Loan Association, Los Angeles, from the National General Corporation. Columbia has no connection with the savings association of the same name that is based in Woodhaven, Queens.

title: Bridge:  Winners of International pairs  Display Versatility in Bidding
description: There are many bidding languages in bridge, and young players tend to be much better linguists than their Seniors.

title: STAKES MARK SET BY SINGLE AGENT
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Jan. 5 (UPI) Unbeaten Single Agent shat tered the Los Feliz Stakes rec ord by a second today in win ning the $29,000 event in 1:15 1/5 over 6 furlongs at Santa Anita.

title: Term Sought for Moluccan
description: THE HAGUE, Jan. 5 (Reuters) A prosecutor today demand ed a sevenyear prison term for Hendrik Johan Hetharia, a South Moluccan separatist, in connec tion with the killing of a police guard outside the Indonesian Ambassador's residence at Wassenaar., near The Hague, on Aug. 31. The defendant, is one of a group of 33 South Moluccans on trial.

title: Fiddler on Roof to Bow As Film Nov. 3 at Rivoli
description: The film version of the long run stage musical, Fiddler on the Roof, will have its world premiere on Nov. 3 at the Rivoli Theater. It will be shown on a reservedseat basis, ac cording to the Mirisch Produc tion Company; United Artists, the distributors, and the theater management.

title: Private Parking Wins
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 5Al though she was the only starter in a sixhorse field without mud credentials, the Lotsoc Stable's Private Parking romped to a fivelength victory in the six furlong feature in 1:15 2/5 on a sloppy track today at Liberty Bell race track.

title: About Baseball
description: The next step in Curt Flood's antitrust suit against baseball will take place this month, and although no one involved expects dramatic developments, the progress of the case through the courts is of some importance politically as well as legally.

title: $450,000 Is Won by Family In Explosion of Floodlight
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Jan. 5 (UPI)A family in Edi son, N. J., won $450,000 in damages yesterday from Kodak, Sylvania and Underwriters Lab oratories in connection with critical burns suffered by a 6 yearold girl when a movie floodlight exploded.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5One of the small but important ironies in the tan gled relations between United States officials and enemy officials in Viet nam is that there is a persistent misunderstanding between them about the word understanding.

title: ZIMEL RESNICK
description: ASBURY PARK, N. J., Jan 5  Zimel Resnick, for many years operator of Palace Amuse ments, a large resort enterprise, died yesterday at Jersey Shore Medical Center in Neptune of a heart attack. He was 74 years old and lived at the Santander Apartments here.

title: B52 Attacks Reported
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 5 (AP)United States B52 bombers were reported to have pounded the Ho Chi Minh trail in Laos today in a continued attempt to counter an enemy buildup.

title: W. and L. Hires McHenry
description: LEXINGTON, Va., Jan. 5 (AP) William D. McHenry, 38year old athletic director and head football coach at Lebanon Val ley College, was named athletic director today at Washington and Lee University where he played football in the 1950's.

title: AIRLINES TO SEEK FARE INCREASES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5The airline industry, anticipating new financial problems at the close of its worst year ever, in dicated plans today to seek fur ther curtailment of marginal service and fare increases of up to 20 per cent in order to reduce its losses in 1971.

title: Disclosure by Sadat Is Censored by Egypt
description: In the United Arab Repub lic, which maintains strict press censorship, most news media apparently found it necessary to suppress Presi dent Anwar elSadat's dis closure Monday that Soviet soldiers had been killed in an Israeli air raid on Dah shur, 18 miles southwest of Cairo. The raid was believed to have occurred last Jan. 28.

title: Installment Credit Down;
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5Con sumer installment credit de clined by $302million in No vember, mainly because of the General Motors strike, the Fed eral Reserve Board reported today.

title: Gertie's Squaw First;
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 5Robert Kahoe's Gertie's Squaw took the lead at the quarterpole and then drew off to a halflength victory over fastclosing Miss Fall River in the $9,000 Miss Disco Purse at Pimlico race course today. Somebodys Pride, the favorite, was third.

title: Davis Family Stumps the Country in Bid for support
description: Three members of the closely, knit family of Angela Davis have begun to appear at a grow ing number of rallies and meet ings across the country, ap pealing for support and bring ing the message: Angela is in nocent.

title: Proposed Blue Cross Rate Rise Protested by Subscribers Unit
description: Public hearings on a pro posed 19.3 per cent rate in crease for Blue Cross commu nity  rated subscribers were disrupted yesterday morning when 30 members of a group calling itself the Subscribers Coalition walked out of the hearings to protest the pro posed rise.

title: POVERTY AGENCY RESISTS 22% CUT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5The Office of Economic Opportunity has successfully resisted a cut of 22 per cent in its next budg et, but will still wind up with 10 per cent less in funds than in the present fiscal year.

title: Bruggmann of Switzerland Wins World Cup Giant Slalom;
description: BERCHTESGADEN, Germany Jan. 5 (AP)  Edmund Brugg mann of Switzerland upset Pat rick Russel of France in the World Cup giant slalom today, but Russel's secondplace finish enabled him to take the lead in the cup standing from Henri Duvillard, also of France.

title: Hodgson Tells of Plan to Ask Strike Ban
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5The Nixon Administration plans a strong push in the next Con gress for legislation to prevent nationwide transportation strikes, according to Labor Sec retary James D. Hodgson. It would be the first antistrike legislation since the TaftHart ley Act of a quartercentury ago.

title: BATORY, UNRUFFLED, WILL SAIL AT NOON
description: Hardly affected by a long shoremen's boycott that forced passengers to carry their own luggage, the Polish liner Stefan Batory is to leave here at about noon today and is scheduled to return on March 20.

title: Fragments at Blast Sites Linked to Panthers Office
description: Detectives at the trial of 13 Black Panthers here, testified yesterday that evidence found at the scene of explosions in Queens and the Bronx, and at the scene of an attempted bombing in Manhattan, was traced to an antipoverty office in which several Panthers were employed.

title: Cat Burglar Gets Toys
description: CONGRESBURY, England (AP) A cat burglar in a series of raids carried off baby toys, balls of wool, slippers and such. The culprit was Suky, a Siamese apparently trying to provide for her litter of six kit tens.

title: Carlos to Be a Starter
description: PHILADELPHIA Jan. 5 (UPI) john Carlos, the sprinter, will be the starter for the 50 yard dash in the Philadelphia Track Classic Jan. 23, Jim El liott, Villanova track coach and meet director, said today.

title: Advertised Prices Up 0.11% By HERBERT KOSHETZ
description: The level of prices on a wide variety of consumer items advertised by department stores in November rose by a fraction of 1 per cent compared to the year before, according to the Bureau of Advertising of the American Newspaper Publishers Association.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Men in the News
description: ALBANY, Jan. 5 There may be as many diverse ele ments on his side as my side, maybe more, but he keeps them all together. He's a hell of a leader. These remarks were once made by Senator Joseph Zaretzki, the Demo cratic minority leader, about Senator Earl William Brydges, the Republican majori ty leader and the most powerful man in the Legislature. While Mr. Zaretzki's remarks may smack of some of the clubbiness that exists among the older members of the Legislature, regardless of party affiliation, they also succinctly convey a sense of the stature Mr. Brydges en joys in the Senate where he has served since 1949.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Henry Fischer's contention (letter Dec. 20) that the Jews left Iraq after two millenniums of reasonably satis factory coexistence with the Arabs simply because Zionist agents de liberately fostered local hostility to pressure them out is a familiar type of argument to observers of the re cent American scene.

title: Rockland Elects Chairman
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., Jan. 5 County Legislator Hersche?? Greenbaum of Mousey was elected chairman of the 18man Rockland County Legislature here today. He succeeds Legis lator John B. Lovett of Pearl River, who resigned today as chairman, having served since the Legislature was created A year ago. Mr. Lovett is also Supervisor of the Town of Orangetown.

title: FIVE FOUND GUILTY IN MOVE ON CASTRO
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 5 (UPI) Five of eight men charged with supplying M16 rifles for an unsuccessful attempt to assasi nate Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba last April have been found guilty in Federal District Court here.

title: Earlier Curtains on Broadway Make Debut to Mixed Reviews
description: Initial reaction to the start of Broadway's 7:30 P.M. curtain Monday night was ecstatic on the part of theater people, but considerably less than that from some restaurateurs.

title: MORMON CENTER IS PLANNED HERE
description: A religious center that would include a chapel, Sundayschool Classrooms and cultural facili ties is being planned for Lincoln Square by the Church of Jesus Christ of Latterday Saints (Mormon).

title: Market Place  Using Insurance  To Buy Bonds
Advertising:
description: New York happens to con tain the world's largest pool of advertising dollars. And clustered around it with dippers of varying sizes are the representatives of the media, not the least active of which are the representa tives of the nation's TV stations.

title: Peace on Earth Ends for 15 Servicemen in Cortland
description: CORTLAND, N.Y., Jan. 5 Tears and pride were com mingled today at the freezing airport here as 15 servicemen whom the people of Cortland County had brought home from Vietnam for Christmas started their return flight.

title: Glasgow Soccer Postponed
description: GLASGOW, Scotland, Jan. 5. (Reuters)The Glasgod Rang ers have postponed their Scot tish League soccer match at Cowdenbeath Saturday because of last Saturday's disaster at Ibrox Park, their home stadium in which 66 persons were killed when a staircase buckled as fans were streaming out of the park.

title: Green Beret Deplores Mylai; Is Excused From Trial Panel
description: FORT McPHERSON, Ga., Jan. 5  A former highranking Green Beret officer who served in Vietnam was excused from a courtmartial panel today after declaring that such acts as the alleged Mylai massacre wer shameful to an Army that I've served for 22 years.

title: State Names Publicity Aide
description: ALBANY, Jan. 5 (UPI Walter J. Holmes, former news man and radio announcer and a former aid to two New York City Controllers, was named today as a public relations offi cer of the Department of Audit and Control. The appointment to the $24,800ayear post seas annuonced by Controller Arthur Levitt. Mr. Holmes, a nativer of New York City, succeeds Francis S. Rivett of Albany.

title: South Carolina Upset
description: CHAPEL HILL, N. C. Jan. 5 (UPI)North Carolina's bas ketball team jumped to an early lead and upset secondranked South Carolina, 7964, last night.

title: Firs Time Donors Assist the Neediest
description: Since she was a child, Mrs. P. had always noticed the summaries of needy cases in The New York Times. How ever, she would dismiss them as important, but too de pressing to read.

title: Chief Officer Quits At Butler Aviation
description: Paul S. Dopp, the largest stockholder by far of Butler Aviation International, Inc., stepped down yesterday as chairman, president and chief executive officer.

title: Gore Takes Vanderbilt Post
description: NASHVILLE, Jan. 5 (UPI) Former Senator Albert Gore disclosed today that he would join the faculty of Vanderbilt University here part time, but had no intention of giving up politics.

title: Canada Reports Increase Of Reserves in December
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 5 (Canadian Press)  Foreignexchange re serves rose $34.5million during December to reach $4,679,000, 000 at the end of the month, the Finance Department re ported today.

title: `Diplomacy on the Docks
description: The arrival here the other day of the Polish liner Stefan Batory was the first New York docking of Communist passenger ship in twenty years. While per haps not the occasion for wild rejoicing, it did offer modest opportunity to welcome the rebuilding of bridges to Eastern Europe in furtherance of the policy of dtente.

title: Even at White House, A Moment of Hesitation
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 Like millions of other Amer icans, President Nixon, had to stop and think today be fore writing the date. In the President's case, however, it was not a check he was writing but approval of a new law.

title: Nixon Acts to Circumvent Mills on Revenue Sharing
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5The Nixon Administration will try to overcome key Congressional opposition to revenue sharing with the states by obtaining bipartisan sponsorship of a bill by a majority of House members soon after the new Congress opens.

title: The Theology of the Youth Vote
description: I have been studying the Supreme Court's majority rulings on voting rights: henceforward, in all Federal elections, full franchise is granted to illiterates and eighteenyearolds. The rulings are lucid, convincing and legal as can be. But somehow they do not make sense.

title: CHERRIX VICTOR IN OPENING TROT
description: YONKERS, Jan. 5Robert Cherrix, who has established a reputation over the years as a hot driver in cold weather, warmed the hearts of his back ers in 36degree temperature by capturing the opening race at Yonkers Raceway tonight.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Not many fans remain of those who ever Watched George Napoleon Rucker pitch for the Brooklyn Dodgers. Rucker was much too sane an operative to qualify as one of the oddballs who created all those rich Dodger legends. When Rucker died last month at the age of 86, it was said that he hid held rank es the No. 1 Dodger lefthander until Sandy Roufax whisked past him almost half a century later.

title: Cardinal Said to Forbid Dutch Bishop to Speak
description: AMSTERDAM, the Nether lands, Jan. 5 (Reuters) Bernard Cardinal Alfrink, pri mate of the Netherlands, has banned the Most Rev. Adrien Simonis, the controversial new Bishop of Rotterdam, from making public state ments for the time being, Ro man Catholic sources said to day.

title: Theft in Two Installments
description: LONDON, Jan. 5 (AP)A gang stole two trucks from a garage in north London today, then loaded them with $360, 000 worth of cigarettes and tobacco they had stolen from a warehouse next door and drove away.

title: Chaps Sink Condors, 142133
description: FORT WORTH, Jan. 5 (AP) The Texas Chaparrals used a balanced scoring attack and a 46point fourth quarter to de feat the Pittsburgh Condors, 142133, in an American Bas ketball Association contest to night.

title: Bolivian ExMinister Seized
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Jan. 5 (Reu ters)The police today arrest ed David Fernandez, a former Interior Minister, and five other persons after two guerrilla at tacks i nthe city yesterday. They were accused of mem bership in a rightwing guer rilla organization, the police said.

title: Mercury Is Found In Fish Dating to27
description: Researchers at the state's De partment of Environmental Con servation have found levels of mercury in preserved fish caught up to 43 years ago that are more than twice as high as levels that now bar fish from the market.

title: Fraternity at Northwestern U. Evicts Members in Policy Rift
description: EVANSTON, III., Jan. 5 The locks have been changed on the doors of the Phi Kappa Sigma House and the windows on the lower floors have been covered with plywood.

title: MRS. W. E. DILLMEIER
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Jan. 5 Mrs Doris Laidlaw Dillmeier, wife of William E. Dillmeier, president of the Dillmeier Glass Company, died yesterday at her home 8 Hampton Road, after a short illness. She was 58 years old.

title: DAVIS MAINTAINS U.S. BOWLING LEAD
description: ST. PAUL, Minn., Jan. 5 (UPI)Dave Davis shot a 1,744 series in the second round of the $75,000 United States open bowling tournament tonight to maintain his lead after 16 games.

title: Harriman Author, Hits Nixon's Vietnam Policy
description: If Hubert Humphrey had been elected President, we would have been well out of Vietnam by now.

title: H.R.A. ISSUES PLEA FOR APARTMENTS
description: Spurred by a protest sitin at the offices of the Human Resources Administration, the city made an urgent appeal yesterday for apartments to house welfare families who must vacate unsafe or un healthy hotels,

title: Report Criticized in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (UPI) Horace R Kornegay, presi dent of the Tobacco Institute, issued a statement today term ing the British report on smok ing a revised edition of a document issued nine years ago by an antitobacco committee of the Royal College of Physi cians.

title: HENRY T. SULCER, LED EMPLOYMENT AGENCY
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Jan. 5 Henry Thearle Sulcer of Short Hills and Bay Head, N. J., vice president and former president of Boyden Associates, New York executive employment concern, died on Saturday at his winter home. He was 59 years old.

title: Golf Awards Go to Hill And Kathy Whitworth
description: Dave Hill and Kathy Whit worth have been named as the top professional golfers of 1970 on the basis of their tournament play perform ance averages, Golf Digest Magazine announced yester day.

title: Dance: Bruhn and Makarova Meet and All Is Well
description: The central event of Amer ican Ballet Theater's weekend at the New York City Center was the longawaited first ap pearance of Erik Bruhn with the Soviet newcomer, Natalia Makarova. The ballet was Les Sylphides, and the per formance was on Sunday afternoon.

title: Jerusalem
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 5The presence of Soviet  supplied groundtoground missiles In the United Arab, Republic has raised new fears among Israeli strategists about Soviet inten tions in the Middle East.

title: Politician's $700,000 Hoard Called Not a New Find
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Jan. 5 In a total reversal, State Attor ney General William J. Scott said today he had not uncov ered a new $700,000 hoard stashed away by the late Illi nois Secretary of State, Paul Powell.

title: Cairo
description: CAIRO, Jan. 5One of the surest ways to perk up lagging conversation at a diplomatic re ception in Cairo is to raise the enigmatic question of Soviet military presence in the United Arab Republic. Seldom have so many diplomats talked so long and heatedly on the basis of so little information.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: DR. WARREN G. KAUDER
description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., Jan. 5  Dr. Warren G. Kauder, a sur geon on the staff of Beth Israel Hospital, died in the hospital yesterday after a long illness. He was 53 years old and lived at 320 South Harrison Street.

title: 3 WALL ST. HOUSES SET APPOINTMENTS
description: Three Wall Street firms an nounced new appointments yesterday.

title: Law Lets U.S. Pay Physicians Who Enlist to Serve in Slums
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5A farreaching $60million pro gram designed to attract doc tors to ghettos and rural areas was signed without fanfare by President Nixon on New Year's Eve over the opposition of sev eral key health aides.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISThe one clich6 worth re peating as another decade starts is that you can't escape, the future, dis agreeable as that future may appear to those who inhabit the present.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Don't we ever tire of our games? Don't we ever slice through our roles, our rhetoric, our egos? Perhaps we do, but perhaps also it is profitable for us to latch on to social movements and reap financial benefits from a radical chic.

title: Studebaker in New Link;
description: StudebakerWorthington, Inc., the diversified industrial con cern with roots in the automo bile industry, has quietly ac quired a major interest in a member firm of the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Taiwan Envoy Quits Chile
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Jan. 5 (UPI)Ambassador TiTsun Li of Nationalist China, describing Chile's move as an extremely unfriendly act, closed the Em bassy and left today to return to Taiwan.

title: Arson at R.O.T.C. Quarters
description: CLAREMONT, Calif., Jan. 5 (AP)A firebomb was thrown into a room used by the Re serve Officers Training Corps on the first floor of a building at Claremont Men's College to day, but automatic sprinklers and firemen kept damage to minimum, the school said.

title: Morris M. Ravin, Engineer Who Became Lawyer, Dead
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Jan. 5Morris M. Ravin, a Newark lawyer, died today in St. Barna bas Medical Center, Livingston, after a short illness. He was 70 years old and lived at 57 White oak Drive here.

title: Metreveli Wins 2 Matches In Tasmanian Title Tennis
description: HOBART, Tasmania, Jan. 5 (AP)Alex Metreveli of the So viet Union, winner of the South Australian and West Australian titles, scored easy victories to day in the first two rounds of the Tasmanian tennis champion ships.

title: White House Stand On Soviet Tenders Off Cuba Clarified
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5The White House emphasized today that President Nixon would consider it a violation of an understanding with the :Soviet Union if her nuclear sub marines were serviced any where at sea by submarine tenders operating from Cuba.

title: Merger News
description: The Green Giant Company announced yesterday it had agreed in principle to acquire the John R. Thompson Com pany. a restaurant Chain and frozenfood processor, through an exchange of stock.

title: Stocks on Amex Advance
description: The American Stock Exchange scored its biggest daily gain yesterday in more than a month as advances outnumbered de clines by more than a twoto one ratio in steppedup trading.

title: Speed Crime Trials Or Quash Charges, U.S. Courts Told
description: The United States Court of Appeals issued rules yester day designed to give sus pects in criminal cases a trial within six months in the Fed eral District, Courts of New York, Connecticut and Ver mont.

title: Scout for Expos Retires
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 5 (AP) Johnny Moore, 68, a baseball scout for more than 24 year's, the last two with the Montreal Expos, retired from fulltime scouting duty today.

title: 2 Tracks File Suits
description: ALBANY, Jan. 5 (AP)The Vernon Downs harness track and Finger Lake flat track filed suits in State Supreme Court today to have the state's off track betting law declared un constitutional.

title: Nebraska Gains No. 1 Ranking In Writers Final Football Poll
description: Nebraska was voted No. 1 in the final Associated Press football poll of sports writers and broadcasters yesterday after its 1712 Orange Bowl victory, which followed Notre Dame's 2411 upset of pre viously topranked Texas in the Cotton, Bowl and Stanford's 2017 upset of No. 2 Ohio State in the Rose Bowl.

title: Curb on Inspectors Seen
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 Representative Ken Hechler said today that top officials of the United States Bureau of Mines issued orders a month ago that had the effect of for bidding Federal mine inspec tors in Kentucky to act against known violations of the law in the Finley brothers mine.

title: Jewish Group Denounced
description: The AntiDefamation League of B'nai Brith said yesterday that the Soviet Union had been given an excuse for their warn ing by the recent activities of the Jewish Defense League.

title: Budget for Sound Schools
description: The first budget submitted by Dr. Harvey B. Scribner, the school system's new Chancellor, bears the unmistak able stamp of his intent to bring about fundamental reforms. The budget is highclose to $2 billion, and almost $432 million above the current expenditures. But $324 million of the increases is mandated by union con tracts and other predetermined escalation of costs, leav ing only $108 million in new money for the improvements pledged by Dr. Scribner.

title: Muskie Leaves London
description: LONDON, Jan. 5 (Reuters) Senator Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat of Maine, left here tonight for Tel Aviv after an unscheduled stopover in Brit ain because of bad weather in Europe. He is on a personal visit to examine European and Middle ??

title: State U. Offers Merger Proposal to Brooklyn Poly
description: The State University of New York, acting under legislative mandate, has proposed to merge the Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn into the university by absorbing its highly regarded graduate engineering depart ments.

title: Emergency Is Declared In Malaysian Floods
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malay sia, Jan. 5 (Reuters)Prime Minister Abdul Razak de clared a state of emergency in western Malaysia today as flood waters inundated Kuala Lumpur, the capital.

title: Katzenbach and Hoopes Assail Nixon Doctrine on Aid to Asians
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (UPI) Two former officials of the Kennedy and Johnson adminis trations expressed doubt today that the Nixon doctrine of sub stituting United States aid for American manpower in Asia could achieve either an Ameri can disengagement or political stability in that part of the world.

title: Savings Bank Merger Set
