description: The Franklin Savings Bank and the Kings Highway Sav ings Bank plan to combine, forming an institution with as sets of more than $1billion, it was disclosed yesterday.

title: Grayson Quitting Football
description: OAKLAND, Jan. 5 (AP) Dave Grayson, free safety for the Oakland Raiders, said today he was retiring from football after a 10year career.

title: Harvard Tuition Goes Up
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 5 (UPI)Tuition at Harvard Uni versity will go up $200 to $2,800 for the 197172 school year, officials said today. This was the third straight year in which Harvard has increased tuition. It raised tuition from $2,000 to $2,400 in 196970 and from $2,400 to $2,600 for the current school year.

title: Aide to Archbishop Named
description: ROME, Jan. 5 (AP)Pope Paul VI has named the Most Rev. Charles Koester auxiliary to John Cardinal Carberry, the Archbishop of St. Louis, the Vatican announced today. The 55yearold bishop has been parish priest at the Church of St. Joan of Arc in St. Louis.

title: Wilt Gets 20,000th Rebound
description: OMAHA, Neb., Jan. 5 (UM) The Cincinnati Royals de feated the Los Angeles Lakers, 146112, tonight despite the 40 point scoring of Wilt Chamber lain.

title: CITY TO ASK RENT AID TO POOR FROM STATE
description: The Lindsay administration will ask the Legislature for $115million in appropriations to help poor families here pay rents that were raised by re visions last year in the city's rentcontrol law.

title: Bombed Statue Rededicated
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 5 (AP)A rebuilt statues of a policeman, was rededicated today in Hay market Square. The statue com memorates the killing, of seven policemen in an explosion May 4, 1886, during a strike. The statue was blasted Oct. 6, 1969, and the radical Weathermen claimed credit. The statue was repaired but was blasted again last October.

title: Jersey Announces Vast College Expansion Plan
description: TRENTON, Jan. 5 (AP)The State Department of Higher Education announced a master plan today for a massive ex pansion of public higher educa tion in New Jersey that could cost 6500million.

title: Furniture That Lets Armchair Travelers Relax in Style
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 5The safety belt may be the only thing missing from the trans portationinfluenced scene at the semiannual International Home Furnishings Show here. Everything elsefrom trac tor seats and hub cap light ing to reclining chars that look as though they had been borrowed from O'Hare Inter national Airportis being of fered to store buyers at this wholesale market, which comes to a close Friday.

title: Economic Analysis
description: In his television broadcast this week President Nixon pre dicted that, as a result of the expansionary monetary and fis cal policies he intends to pursue in 1971, unemployment would be reduced and inflation will continue to come down.

title: PACERS TRIUMPH OVER PROS, 9288
description: MEMPHIS, Jan. 5 (AP) In diana squandered a 12  point second  half lead before Mel Daniels's two clutch jumpers in the fourth period enabled the Pacers to turn back the Mem phis Pros, 9288, in an American Basketball Association game to night.

title: U.S. Scored on Housing;
description: A high official of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York at tacked yesterday the Federal Government's coddling, pro tecting, and subsidizing of the housing industry.

title: Players on 4 N.H.L. Teams Fined $7,000 by Campbell
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 5 (AP)  Clarence Campbell, president of the National Hockey League, levied a total of $7,000 in fines today against players from four teams who left their benches to join onice melees.

title: Major Price Shifts Made
description: Important price adjustments were announced yesterday by companies in the agricultural chemical, computer and metal fabricating industries.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Hamilton Watch Workers To Get 10% Pay Reduction
description: LANCASTER, Pa., Jan. 5 (AP) The Hamilton Watch Com pany announced today that 2,000 salaried and hourly em ployes will take a 10 per cent pay cut from Jan. 11 to May 29 in an effort to keep the company operating.

title: ROLAND R. TOBLER
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Jan 5  Roland R. Tobler, president of Tobler, Ernest & Traber, Inc., a manufacturer of industrial fabrics in Elmsford, N. Y., died of cancer last evening, He was 49 years old and lived at 5 North Wilton Road here.

title: New Polish Leaders Visit Moscow for a Day's Talks
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 5Edward Gierek, Poland's new commu nist party leader, and Piotr Jaroszewicz, the new Premier, met with Soviet leaders to day to discuss last month's rioting in Poland.

title: Northwestern Bell Debentures Selling Briskly at 7.85% Yield
description: The Northwestern Bell Tele phone Company's $150million of debentures, eagerly watched by the bond market to see how bond prices and interest rates would move this week, were priced to yield 7.85 per cent. They sold relatively fast.

title: Webster to Receive CoachofYear Honor
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (AP) Alex Webster of the New York Giants will receive the first Vince Lombardi memo rial award as the National Football League coach of the year at the 36th annual din ner of the Touchdown Club Saturday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Town Name Is Misspelled
description: COTOPAXI, Colo. (AP)  Postmaster John F.Young says he has counted 103 different spellings of the name on mail sent to this town in westcen tral Colorado. It was named by an early day mining man for a volcano in Ecuador.

title: ARTHUR H. SCHENK
description: FAIR HAVEN, N. J., Jan. 5 Arthur H. Schenk, a director of the Midland Insurance Com pany of New York and a former vice president, died yesterday at Riverview Hospital, Red Bank, after a long illness. He was 70 years old and lived at 90 Woodland Drive here.

title: Basketball Star Breaks Foot
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (AP) Lenny Baltimore, a 6foot6inch forward for George Washington University's basketball team, broke his foot in practice last night and will be out of action for three or four weeks.

title: Theaters Adopt Pact to Cut Costs and Prices
description: The League of New York Theaters announced yester day its longawaited eco nomic plan aimed at lowering ticket prices and encouraging the production of new and what may be considered fi nancially risky plays on Broadway.

title: Coin Flip Settles Order of Picking In Football Draft
description: Houston, Washington and De troit won coin, flips yesterday to help determine the order of the National Football League draft starting here Jan. 28.

title: TV:
description: Uncompromising documen tary treatment of pressing national and international concerns is so rare on tele vision these days that one regards with anticipation a program touted as unique and unprecedented. The Columbia Broadcasting Sys tem's 60 Minutes program last night presented what it called an unrestricted look at the Jewish community of Ru mania entitled Jews Behind the Iron Curtain.

title: New I.R.S. Information Chief
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (UPI) William I. Greener Jr. was appointed today as director of public information for the In. ternal Revenue Service. Mr. Greener, 45 years old, had been deputy chief of information for the Air Force, stationed in the Pentagon.

title: Activities of the Soviet Union and Its internations in Egypt. The View From Four Capitals
description: Soviet activities and intentions in the United Arab Republic remain a subject of intense speculation and a ques tion that underlies the renewed indirect ArabIsraeli negoti ations. Following are views of the question from four capitals involved in Middle East diplomacy.

title: . . . and the New Gradualism
description: During his television interview, President Nixon was guardedly optimistic about the economic outlook. He expects unemployment to come down, but he declined to say by how much or when.

title: Iraq's Grand Rabbi Greets His Visitors With Caution
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq  The Grand Rabbil an Arab official said, and the pale old man looked up from the Hebrew scriptures on his desk.

title: Jesuit Weighing Race for Mayor Of Jersey City on Reform Slate
description: JERSEY CITY, Jan. 5The Rev. Victor R. Yanitelli, a Jesuit and the president of St. Peter's College, said today that he was seriously considering running as a reform candidate for Mayor if there was a mayoral recall election here.

title: Advertising:
description: Perry L. Ruston, president of Conde Nast Publications since April, 1969, has been elected to the additional post of chairman. He replaces Ira S. V. Patcevitch, who retired Thursday.

title: About Motor Sports
description: Stock cars, genuine stock cars? With street tires? Has Bishop flipped? No John Bishop, president of the In ternational Motor Sports As sociation, knows all the rea sons for exotic modifications that transform a stock car into a stockappearing race car at a cost of at least $25,000 and 2,000 manhours. But Bishop, like many others in auto racing, is seeking ways to reduce costs for competitors who are not endowed with factory support. His club specializes in racing for small sedans and small formula cars. Bish op is Manning 15 to 20 races for sedans at such places as Danville, Va.; Charlotte, N. C.; Summit Point, W. Va., and Lime Rock, Conn.

title: Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5The Soviet military presence in the United Arab Republic is esti mated by United States offi cials here at 12,000 men, with no indication that this level of deployment is changing sig nificantly.

title: Skiers Face Challenges In the Hills Near Rome
description: TERMINILLO, ItalyWhen convalescing American sol diers returned to the United States following World War II saying they had spent time skiing at a rest camp near Rome, their statements were met with skepticism.

title: PACTS APPROVED FOR MODEL CITIES
description: A $1.9million contract with the Port of New York Author ity to provide a jobtraining and placement program for 1,775 residents of the central Brooklyn Model Cities area was signed yesterday by Mayor Lind say.

title: New Legislators Get Bearings in Albany
description: ALBANY, Jan. 5John G. Lopresto showed up here to day to claim his freshman seat in the State Assembly and found that the spoils of his election victory included office space in a corridor with barely enough room to sit down.

title: Influenza Epidemic Strikes in Fort Lauderdale
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Jan. 5 (AP)An outbreak of in fluenza that produced 18 deaths in one week has forced health officials to declare an epidemic in this resort city. Fort Lauder dale has been rapidly filling up with vacationing elderly, who are the most susceptible to the disease.

title: M. MALLORY GRAY, 60, BROKERAGE OFFICER
description: BRIARCLIFF MANOR, N.Y., Jan. 5  M. Mallory Gray, senior vice president of R.W. Pressprich & Co., a member firm of the New York Stock Exchange, died today of can cer at the Rosary Hill Home, a nursing home in Hawthorne. He was 60 years old and lived at 370 Cedar Drive here.

title: SUGAR FUTURES UP 9 TO 15 POINTS
description: World sugar prices rose 15 to 9 points (hundredths of a cent a pound) yesterday on the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange, The rise and that of the day before was attributed to the announcement by Pre mier Fidel Castro on New Year's Day that Cuba's sugar harvest was behind schedule.

title: Dr. Scribner Warns Harlem Board to Settle Differences or It Will Be Disbanded.
description: Members of the District 5 Local School Board for Central Harlem have been warned that unless they resolve their dif ferences and begin to work to gether, the board will be dis banded by Dr. Harvey B. Scrib ner, Chancellor of the city's schools.

title: Issues in City's Pay Talks
description: Following are the parties and issues in the city's current negotiations with its uniformed services:

title: Soviet Warning Rejected; U.S. Shocked at`Threat
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5The United States has firmly reject ed the Soviet Union's warning that Americans should no long er expect the Soviet Govern ment to protect them in the Soviet Union.

title: Troops Pulled Out of Quebec and Ottawa
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 5The Cana dian Government tonight ended the operation under which Ca nadian armed forces were de ployed last October in Quebec, Montreal and Ottawa to aid the police in preventing terrorist activity by separatists.

title: J. FRANK BAUMANN
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Jan. 5 J. Frank Baumann, who retired last July for health reasons as vice president of the Lincoln Savings Bank, Brooklyn, died today in North Shore Hospital. He was 57 years old and lived at 659 Park Avenue here.

title: Priest Wins in British Pool
description: LONDON, Jan. 5 (AP)  A Roman Catholic priest in Bir mingham, who insisted on anonymity, won $240,000 to day, the first prize on a soccer pool. Goodness me, he said I only wanted to win a few thousand to pay off the out standing debt on the new parish hall.

title: MISS DAVIS CALLS TRIALA FRAMEUP
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., Jan. 5 Angela Davis, accused of mur der, kidnapping and criminal conspiracy, declared her inno cence at her arraignment today and said she was the target of a political frameup.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Courts. President Nixon signed a bill to provide an executive for each Federal judicial circuit, to free the chief judges of administra tive and managerial duties.

title: DOLE IS SELECTED TO DIRECT G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 President Nixon has selected Senator Robert J. Dole of Kan sas as the new chairman of the Republican National Com mittee, sources at the commit tee and at the White House dis closed today.

title: Stars Trim Rockets, 11499
description: DENVER, Jan. 5 (AP)The Utah Stars ran off 14 straight points in the third quarter to build a 6749 lead and then coasted to a 11499 American Basketball Association victory over the Denver Rockets to night.

title: Mitchell Is Urged to Seek State and Local Vote at 18
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (AP) Attorney. General John N. Mitchell was Aimed today to revive the issue of 18yearolds Voting in State and local elections.

title: MOHAWK AIRLINES SHOWS NET LOSS
description: Mohawk Airlines, Inc., whose 56dayold strike so far has cost the company in excess of $4million, reported yesterday operating results for the month of November and the first 11 months of 1970.

title: Hobart College Trial Is Set For Feb. 2 by State Judge
description: CANANDAIGUA, N. Y., (AP) A State Supreme Court jus tice today set Feb. 2 for the trial of Hobart College on crim inal charges of coercion.

title: MANY AT CRASH SITE CRITICIZE PATTERN
description: Residents of the Jack son Heights community in Queens, where a Government owned DC3 plane crashed and then slid against a small frame house Monday night, said yes terday that they believed such an accident was bound to hap pen.

title: Kennedy Gets Checkup
description: BOSTON, Jan. 5 (AP)Sena tor Edward M. Kennedy, Demo crat of Massachusetts, entered New England Baptist Hospital today for an overnight stay for a checkup of his back, broken in a plane crash in 1964.

title: Nelsen to Undergo Surgery
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 5 (UPI) The Cleveland Browns quarter back Bill Nelsen, will have to undergo corrective knee sur gery, but the club's owner, Art Modell, said today that Dr. Donald H. O'Donoghue, an Okla homa City orthopedic surgeon, gave no indication that Bill's career is finished by any means.

title: Philadelphia Homicide Unit To Be Increased by 30%
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 5 (AP)  Police Commissioner Frank L. Rizzo, disturbed by rising crime and killings, said today that he would add nearly 30 per cent more men to the homi cide squad.

title: Northeast Fog Disrupts Air and Ground Travel
description: Dense fog, born of cold air drifting across warm ocean waters and nourished by mois ture from rain and melting snows, swirled through the Northeast yesterday, disrupt ing airport operations and ren dering driving hazardous.

title: PriceInflating Tax Angers Belgians
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 5Bel gium has just swung over to the Common Market's sys tem of indirect taxation with a flurry of price increases that has antagonized the population and brought re peated calls for calm from the Government.

title: Men in the News
description: ALBANY, Jan. 5Money or more accurately, the lack of it in the state's coffers is expected to be the main theme of the 194th Legisla ture, which opens here tomor row. There may be an inter esting subplot as well: who will be heirapparent to Gov ernor Rockefeller. Perry Bel mont Duryea Jr., the Republican Assembly Speaker from Mon tauk, L. I., is expected to figure in both parts of the State House drama. In the Assembly chamber and in the corridors and restaurants, the talk is of revenuesharihg. Even the Governor has said that the state of, the state is grave unless the Nixon Administra tions comes through with massive financial aid. Mr. Duryea says that he is one of the earliest proponents of the revenuesharing concept.

title: SOVIET WARNS U.S. IT MAY RETALIATE FOR HARASSMENT
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 5The So viet Government, angered by continued harassment of Soviet representatives in the United States by militant Jewish groups, has threatened to retal iate against Americans sta tioned in Moscow.

title: State Tracks Warned of Losing Share of Offtrack Bet Revenue in Union Fight
description: YONKERS, Jan. 5  New York State tracks may be by passed and may lose their 1 per cent share of offtrack bet ting revenue if the pari mutuel clerks' unions continue their hard line, a spokesman for the New York City Off Track Betting Corporation said today.

title: Villanova Triumphs by 9461
description: FARGO, N. D., Jan. 5 (UPI) Clarence Smith scored 21 points and Tom Ingelsby got 19 tonight to pace Villanova to a 9461 victory over North Da kota State.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: to the Editor:

title: Rider Wins 5th in Row
description: TRENTON, Jan. 5 (AP) Rider won its fifth straight basketball game tonight, beat ing Lafayette, 7973. Rider, which has lost once, was led by Glenn Albano, with 17 points.

title: Mine Chief to Take Testimony Today
ARMY TRIAL OPENS IN LENINGRAD CASE
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 5 (AP)A Jewish Soviet Army officer went before a courtmartial to day and a trial for nine other Jews will begin tomorrow, Jew ish sources reported. They said all were charged with com plicity in a Leningrad airplane hijacking attempt last June.

title: MELVIN LOOS, 73, PRINTING LEADER
description: Melvin Loos. who retired last year as assistant director of the Columbia University Press, died Saturday in St. Mi chael's Hospital, Newark, after a short illness. He was 73 years old and lived at 402 Forest Avenue, Teaneck, N. J.

title: KNICKS, CAVALIERS TO MEET TONIGHT
description: With Willis Reed back in the starting lineUp and Cazzie Rus sell again available to spell the forwards the Knicks open a fivegame road trip tonight against the Cavaliers in Cleve land. But the game that will gain the most attention is to morrow night's meeting against the Bucks, led by Lew Alcindor and Oscar Robertson, in Mil waukee. Every KnickBuck en counter is a preview of, what is expected to be the National Basketball Association's play off final next May.

title: Panel Asserts Bethlehem Steel Discriminates Against Blacks
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5  A federally appointed, panel of labor experts has found the Bethlehem Steel Corporation, the nation's second largest steel producer; guilty of discrimina tion against blacks through the company's seniority system.

title: VETO ON TAXI FARE HINTED BY AURELIO
description: Deputy Mayor Richard R. Aurelio hinted strongly yester day that a taxi fare increase would be vetoed by the Mayor if it was not accompanied by a law creating a commission to regulate the taxi industry.

title: Detroit Firemen Awarded 11% Pay Rise to $12,000
description: DETROIT, Jan. 5Firemen in Detroit have been awarded an 11.1 per cent pay increase, rais ing the pay of fiveyear men to $12,000 a year. Men with less than five years service got a 6 per cent pay raise.

title: Navajo Tribal Council Swears In Two Top Leaders
description: WINDOW ROCK, Ariz., Jan. 5Peter MacDonald and Wilson Skeet were sworn in today as chairman and vice chairman of the Navajo Tribal Council. Along with 74 delegates of the council, they will lead the na tion's largest tribe of Indians for the next four years.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 5 (UPI) Jerry Sloan sank 29 points, Bob Love 26 and Chet Walker 23 to night to lead the Chicago Bulls to a 116103 victory over the San Diego Rockets despite a 36 point performance by the Rockets Calvin Murphy.

title: Miss Macchi First
description: MARIBOR, Yugoslavia, Jan. 5 (UPI) Francoise Macchi, a 19yearold French skier, out raced 74 World Cup competi tors in the women's giant sla lom today.

title: Books of The Times
description: Love a place like Kansas and you can be content in a garden of raked sand. Earl Thompson's first novel has plenty of things wrong with it, but none of them fatally affect its openness of feeling and its for lorn believability. As Edmund Wilson said long ago of another imperfect first novel, A Garden of Sand does not fail to live. It is an account of the Depression boyhood and pre cocious sexuality of a boy named Jacky Anderson. His grandparents, a failed farmer and his American Gothic wife, un dertake to raise him when their widowed daugh ter, Wilma, the boy's mother, de serts him to go work as hatcheck girl in the Calico Cat Club. (Where else would a high hipped young widow who some said looked a lot like young Madge Evans look for workWool worth's?) As Wilma wanders farther afield, into a brief jail sentence for larceny, a second marriage, smalltime prostitution, Jacky's grandparents drift from their farm to partnership in a diner, then to a truck ers cafe on the highway. Jacky, tough and resourceful, steadfastly daydreams of be ing reunited with his mother.

title: Cuban Census Shows a Decline. In Births and Population Growth
description: MEXICO CITY, Jan. 5A sharp decline in births has be gun to slow Cuba's population growth significantly, according to the first published results of Cuba's 1970 census.

title: MOSCOW
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 5The So viet Union has pledged all necessary aid to the United Arab Republic, but beyond that general statement, the Soviet authorities have been extreme ly secretive about the extent of their militaryassistance pro gram to Egypt.

title: POLICE DRIVE SET ON BAILJUMPERS
description: A major reorganization of procedures for apprehending bailjumpers will be put into effect Feb. 1, State Senator Roy Goodinan said yesterday after a meeting with Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy.

title: Federal Judge Dismisses a Suit On Army Spying on Civilians
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 5A Federal judge dismissed today a suit by the American Civil Liberties Union seeking an injunction to halt Army spying on civilians.

title: Vatican Opens Marxist Study Center
description: ROME, Jan. 5A Soviet dip lomat recently walked into, the Roman Catholic Church's fore most institution for the training of priests, was welcomed by Jesuit scholars in Russian and shown stacks of wellread is sues of Pravda, lzvestia and other Soviet newspapers.

title: F.T.C. Eases Remedy Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 5 (AP) The Federal Trade Commis sion announced today that it was abandoning efforts to establish a general rule requir ing makers of headache and upsetstomach remedies to back up their advertising claims. Instead, the commis sion said, it will move against misleading or deceptive adver tising, on a casetocase basis.

title: Jerseyans Pay $550 To Free a Lion Cub
description: RED BANK, N. J., Jan. 4 (UPI) A 98pound lion cub that spent the last six months in a pet store display case was flown to a Florida game preserve today after animal loving residents in Red Bank purchased its freedom.

title: CITY MAKING LOAN TO TRANSITAGENGY
description: City Controller Abraham D. Beame said yesterday that he had approved a $36million city loan to the Transit Authority to help maintain the 30cent fare at least until, Dec. 31, 1971

title: Residents and Architects Plan Local Deal Center in Brooklyn
NEWAUTO SALES CONTINUE TO LAG
description: DETROIT, Jan. 5Newcar sales at the end of December continued to lag far behind last year although the General Motors Corporation showed signs of recovery from its long strike.

title: 5 Gunmen Rob New York Post of $180,000 Cash
description: Five masked robbers armed with pistols yesterday held up the cashier's and accounting of fices of The New York Post, cowed 50 employes and escaped with a cash payroll of $180,000.

title: New Trial of Jews Adjourns in Soviet; Reopening in Doubt
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 6  The trial of nine Soviet Jews accused of organized antiSoviet activity opened in Leningrad this morn ing and was promptly adjourned to at least Monday, usually reliable Jewish sources said.

title: BRYDGES FAVORS CASINOS
description: ALBANY, Jan. 6Earl W. Brydges, the Senate majority leader, called today for the legalization of gambling casinos under strict state supervision. He told a crowded news con ference in his office at the State Capitol that he would introduce a bill in the Senate soon for an amendment to the Constitution to permit opera tion of the casinos.

title: CONNECTICUT TOLD TAXES MUST GO UP
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 6Thomas J. Meskill, the first Republican Governor of Connecticut in 16 years, declared at his inaugura tion today that the state was wallowing in debt and that $800million in new taxes would have to be raised in the next two years.

title: CASPER FAVORED ON COAST TODAY
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 6The 1971 professional golf tour opens here tomorrow to the sound of music, Glen Campbell, the guitaristsinger, is the new est Hollywood celebrity to be come officially associated with the $7million tour.

title: Bad Guy of Ring
description: Discussing his plans for the future a few years ago, Charles (Sonny) Liston struck a lyrical note that hardly matched his image as everybody's bad guy.

title: Black and Puerto Rican Police Meet to Discuss Community Links
description: At 1:15 yesterday afternoon, clusters of chatting men with conventionstyle name tags pinned above the telltale off duty bulges of policemen were called to their seats in the Corinthian Room of the Park Sheraton Hotel, and the first New York City seminar on The Black and Puerto Rican Policeman and his Community was, officially opened with two national anthems.

title: The 7:30 Curtain
description: The 7:30 curtain that now rises at all Broadway theaters is considered a revolutionary change for playgoers, play ers, restaurant managements and the small but influen tial world of the West Forties and Fifties. Actually, it's a preRevolutionary change. In the 1750's, when plays were presented by his Excellency's permission at the theater on Nassau Street, the curtain went up precisely half an hour after six o'clock.

title: Major U.S. Agencies Halt Their Use of Drugs Declared Ineffective by F.D.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6The major Federal agencies con cerned with health have or dered their doctors and hospi tals to stop using drugs de clared ineffective by the Food and Drug Administration.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President spent the day working in his office at the Western White House in San Clemente, Calif., chiefly on the State of the Union Message he will de liver to the new Congress on Jan. 22.

title: Merger News
description: The United States Court of Appeals in Chicago rejected yesterday efforts by a group of 30 stockholders of the North American Car Corporation to delay the merger of their com pany into the Flying Tiger Cor poration of Los Angeles.

title: Gude, Winmill to Merge With Prescott, Merrill
description: Prescott, Merrill, Turben & Co., a large regional brokerage house, announced an agreement yesterday to merge with Gude, Winmill & Co., another mem ber firm of the New York Stock Exchange, with headquarters in New York.

title: Zindel Play Adds Two
description: Nancy Marchand and Rae Allen will costar with Julie Harris and Estelle Parsons in Paul Zindel's And Miss Rear don Drinks a Little. The play is rehearsing for a Broadway opening on March 4.

title: Advertising:
description: Mazda Motors of America, a wholly owned subsidiary of the Toyo Kogyo Company, Ltd., Hiroshima, plans to begin the introduction of the Mazda motor car into the United States on May 1.

title: CORPORATE BONDS ADVANCE IN PRICE
description: The corporate bond market displaying its greatest surge of power since late November, climbed sharply yesterday in the wake of the Chemical Bank decision to cut the prime rate.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Reserve Net and Payments To Treasury at New Highs
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6The earnings of the Federal Reserve System and the resulting pay ments to the Treasury rose to record levels in 1970, the Re serve Board reported today.

title: BENJAMIN HERSEY, DIVINITY DEAN, 67
description: GLOUCESTER, Mass., Jan. 6 The Rev. Dr. Benjamin B. Hersey, retired dean of the Crane Theological School of Tufts University and a former trustee of the Universalist Church of America, died at his home here last night. He was 67 years old.

title: Swirl of Superlatives Opens 194th Session
description: ALBANY, Jan. 6The 1971 session of the Legisla ture began unofficially when the leather settees and snug parlor chairs outside the Senate and the Assembly began filling up early today with lobbyists. Many of the lawmakers had not arrived when the lobbyists took up their posts.

title: HANOI AGAIN DENIES FLIGHT AGREEMENT
description: TOKYO, Jan. 6 (UPI)North Vietnam said today President Nixon's statement that there was an understanding between Hanoi and Washington over United States reconnaissance flights was a fiction.

title: Ladder to Fire Safety
description: The intervention of State Supreme Court Justice William Kapelman has opened up a practical and digni fied way for the city's firemen to extricate themselves from their perilous lob action. By requiring that regu lar reports on the progress of contract negotiations be submitted to him, the judge has in effect made himself guarantor that bargaining on all issues will proceed in good faith. On that basis, continued refusal by the fire men to perform indispensable maintenance and inspec tion duties, is as pointless as it is hazardous.

title: Godot Revival Due; Relevance Is Seen
description: Samuel Beckett's Waiting for Godot will be revived off Broadway during the first week of February at the Sheridan Square Playhouse. Alan Schneider, who directed the 1956 American premiere. will stage the production to be presented by Edgar Lans bury, Mark Wright and Jo seph Beruh, with Stuart Dun can and H. B. Lutz.

title: BIG BOARD ISSUES NOTCH ADVANCES Traders and Investors Again Reacting Favorably to Remarks by Nixon GAINS EXCEED DECLINES Dow Industrial Average Up 2.20 Points to 837.97 on 16,960.000 Shares
Lockheed Asks U.S. Help Until Cost Fight Is Settled
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation replied today to Defense De partment proposals to settle contract disputes involving ap proximately $1billion, The company made a counterpro posal that would keep Lock heed in business with Govern ment funds while the corpora tion continued negotiations with the Pentagon.

title: SCHOOLS ACCUSED OF HOMOSEXUAL BIAS
description: A City Councilman accused the Board of Education and two major corporations yester day of discriminating against homosexuals in their hiring practices.

title: Assemblyman Resigns To Run for Senate Seat
description: ALBANY, Jan. 6 (AP) William J. Giordano, Demo crat of Brooklyn, resigned from the Assembly today to enter a special election for a seat in the State Senate.

title: N.Y.U. Five 9171 Victor;
description: New York University and Wagner are not having the best of seasons, but their basketball pecking order remained intact last night as the Violets de feated the Sea Hawks, 9171, at Alumni Gym.

title: Goodtobegone Is First
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 6  Mrs. William C. Wright's Goodtobe gone drew away from the field in the stretch and scored a threelength victory in the fea ture race at Pimlico today.

title: Child's Pride and Joy: His Mother
description: When the Metropolitan Am ateur Athletic Union junior track Championships ended last night, 5yearold Leslie McRae headed home to Jersey City to go to bed and Felix JeanLouis headed for the rathskeller at the C. W. Post campus to cele brate his 19th birthday.

title: Man in the News
description: The scientific life of Dr. Choh Hao Li, the University of California scientist who isolated, identified and yes terday announced that he had synthesized the human growth hormone, has been one of seemingly overwhelm ing challenges with solutions that might appear absurdly small for the effort expended. His work to iso late the hormone is a case in point. To collect one sixth of an ounce of GH, the hormone, he used be tween five and 10 thousand glands from cadavers and then had to extract a valu able substance from the pea size structure known as the master gland.

title: Executive Heads Red Cross Drive
description: For the second successive year, John (Jock) Elliott Jr., chairman of the board of the Ogilvy & Mather advertising agency, has accepted the chairmanship of the cam paign for members and funds of the American Red, Cross in Greater New York.

title: Trial of Paterson Policemen Begins in Federal Court
description: NEWARK, Jan. 6An all white jury heard opening state ments today in the trial of eight Paterson policemen ac cused of brutality and vandal ism during the city's July, 1968, racial disturbances.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Raise for Illinois Legistors
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Jan. 6 (AP)The 76th session of the Illinois Legislature met for 30 minutes today and voted leg islators an annual raise of $5, 500 effective at noon, when the 77th session convened. Gov. Richard B. Ogilvie promptly signed the bill, which will pay members of both houses $17, 500 a year.

title: An Iraqi Symbol Slowly Fades Away
description: SAMARRA, IraqThis citadel of Islamic tradtion is witnessing signs of the decline of an old Iraqi institution, the dishdasha.

title: BLUE CROSS MOVE STIRS CRITICISM
description: Bess Myerson Grant, the city's Commissioner of Consu mer Affairs, charged yesterday that the public hearings being conducted by the Blue Cross on a proposed rate increase were a meaningless exercise, de signed only to serve the pur pose of the Associated Hospital Service, the formal name of the Blue Cross.

title: Mr. Nixon on Congress
description: President Nixon seems to have some difficulty deciding which hat he wants to wear.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Nat'l Hockey League

title: What Does the U.S. Want in Vietnam?
description: BANGKOKIn recent times few issues have provoked in a nation so much heated controversy, dissension and convulsion as Vietnam policy.

title: Dayan Says Egypt Deploys Big Guns Along the Canal
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 6 (Reut ers)Defense minister Moshe Dayan said today that Egypt had deployed 250 heavy and medium guns and more than 30 operational missile batteries in the Suez Canal zone since the ceasefire came into force in August.

title: MAMARONECK SHIFT IN SCHOOLS UPHELD
description: ALBANY, Jan. 6The State Court of Appeals today upheld the right of a school district to adopt new school boundary lines.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Executive Vice President Resigns at Goodyear Tire
description: R. V. Thomas, 46 years old, has resigned as executive vice president of the Goodyear Tire and Rubber Company and as president of Goodyear Interna tional, a subsidiary. He had been with Goodyear 28 years.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Soviet Boxer Invited to Spar With Ali
description: Muhammad Ali, undefeated heavyweight boxer, has invited a Soviet heavyweight, Kamo Saroyan, to box a tworound exhibition with him on Jan. 19 at Miami Beach where Ali will be training for his March 8 title fight with the champion, Joe Frazier.

title: Opening Dates Moved
description: Two productions have moved their opening dates to avoid conflicts. Claire Bloom and Donald Madden now will appear in A Doll's House next Wed nesday at the Playhouse Thea ter. The new rock musical Earthlight makes its debut Jan. 17.

title: Reform in the Kitchen.
description: Recently, while defrosting our 23 yearold refrigerator  a necessary monthly choreI was struck with the reason for one of our modern discon tents. That is, the separation between an individual's actions and the result of those actions. Today we spend our lives doing one part of a taskin the home or at workand we seldom See where our actions end. We live in a society where the works are often concealed from us. But if I had not defrosted the old refrigerator, it would soon become choked with ice and break down, a good example of the direct relation between a task and its result.

title: In This College Course, the Students on Their Class work
description: COVENTRY, Conn.The students who attend the course that Julia Hayes teaches at the University of Connecticut at Storrs get no credit for it, but they do get to eat the classwork.

title: Kyes to Join Lazard Freres &
description: Roger M. Kyes is joining the investment banking firm of Lazard Freres & Co. as a general partner on Feb. 1.

title: Abel Quits Wings Post; Bitter at Coach and Club
description: DETROIT, Jan. 6 (UPI)Sid Abel, general manager of the Detroit Red Wings for eight years, resigned today, saying he did not approve of the Na tional Hockey League club's rookie coach and its policies.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Vatican Urges Clemency
description: ROME, Jan. 6  The Vatican radio appealed today to Presi dent Ahidjo to commute the death sentences imposed on Msgr. Ndongmo and five other defendants in the two trials in Yaound .

title: 3 Killed and 9 Wounded In New Clash at Amman
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Jan. 6 (Reu ters)Three persons were killed and nine wounded in a clash in Amman this afternoon, it was officially announced here to night.

title: Aide of Conservatives Says Taxes in State Will Go Up
description: The Conservative party's ex ecutive director charged yes terday that New York State voters would face a monu mental tax increase this year that was calculated and pro gramed into the budget a year ago and hidden from the voters during an election year.

title: Belgrade Jails West German
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Jan. 6 (AP)A military court today convicted Hans Peter Rullmann, a correspondent for the West German magazine Der Spiegel, of espionage for an unidentified foreign government and sen tenced him to six years in prison. Two Yugoslavs were given fiveandahalf year prison terms.

title: Podgorny Will Visit Egypt And Hold Talks Next Week
description: CAIRO, Jan. 6 (UPI)Presi dent Nikolai V. Podgorny of the Soviet Union will visit Egypt next week, the semiofficial newspaper Al Ahram said to day.

title: PACT ENDS WALKOUT AT WASHINGTONSTAR
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (UPI) Striking garage mechanics and The Washington Evening Star reached agreement on a 27 month contract early today. The newspaper, shut down since last Friday, said it would re sume publication tomorrow.

title: END OF G.I. COMBAT FORESEEN BY LAIRD
description: PARIS, Jan. 6  Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird, stopping off here today on his way to Southeast Asia, said that the United States would end its combat responsibili ty in South Vietnam by mid summer.

title: JOHNSON OF GIANTS SELECTED IN POLL
description: Ron Johnson of the New York Giants was named to the Na tional Football League's All Pro team, chosen by sports writers and sports broadcasters yesterday for The Associated Press. The running back is the only New York representative of the 22 choices. None of the Jets was selected.

title: Bucks Beat Bulls, 119106
description: MADISON, Wis., Jan. 6 (AP) Lew Alcindor and Oscar Robertson teamed for 47 points tonight to guide the Milwaukee Bucks to a 119106 National Basketball Association victory over the Chicago Bulls.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6At the close of his latest conversation with four television reporters, President Nixon recalled that they had had the first such talk about six months ago and said that we'll give you another shot about six months hence.

title: CELTICS CONQUER SONICS, 137 TO 112
description: BOSTON, Jan. 6 (AP)The Boston Celtics scored 47 points in the final period tonight, snapping a 90all tie and rac ing to a 137112 National Bas ketball Association victory over the Seattle Sonics.

title: Cuba's Bleak Outlook
description: Fidel Castro made no effort to conceal Cuba's bleak economic outlook in his latest major address. Even at this early point in the vital sugar harvest, there are already difficulties and labor shortages. Tobacco pro duction has dropped, while the price of nickel, Cuba's second major export commodity, has declined. Mr. Castro complained of vagrancy, parasitism and other strange vices of the revolution and called for a crusade to eradi cate them. And he gave a hint of Cuba's serious social problems by revealing that 400,000 children between six and sixteen are neither going to school nor working.

title: Jersey Candidate Convicted
description: CAMDEN, N. J., Jan. 6 James E. Johnson, the 1969 gu bernatorial candidate of the conservative New Jersey Inde pendent party, was found guilty today of interfering with the duties of four Internal Revenue Service agents who were seiz ing his restaurant equipment to satisfy a tax lien. Mr. oJhnson, 48 years old and a resident of Toms River, was cleared of a charge of assaulting the agents. He was continued in $5,000 bail. No sentencing date was set.

title: Pompidou Yields, Links Rail Wages to Cost of Living
description: PARIS, Jan. 6  Presiden Georges Pompidou has tried to buy labor peace in France this year by making a major con cession to the nation's larges union group, the Communist led General Confederation o Labor.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: ARSENIC RESIDUES FOUND IN POULTRY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (AP) the Government found illegal residues of organic arsenic in from onefourth to onesixth ofthe poultry samples taken in, 1968 and 1969, but officials say they doubt the residues pose any serious human health hazards.

title: Capehart's Grandson Wins Tree Burning Ban
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 6 (UPI)The grandson of for mer Senator Homer Cape hart went to court today and won a restraining order pre venting the burning of Christ mas trees in city parks in a Twelfth Night tradition.

title: Hofstra Dons Thermal Underwear for Its Trip Down East for Bluenose Basketball
description: It wasn't difficult for Paul Lynner's family to figure out a Christmas gift for the Hof stra basketball coach. The heavy Cossacktype sealfur hat he received, will come in handy for his trip to Nova Scotia this weekend.

title: U.S. Foreign Military Assistance for 1970 Is Put at 8 Times the Figure in Budget
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6A Defense Department official told a Congressional subcom mittee today that the United States had supplied about eight times the amount of foreign military assistance formally listed in the President's budget for military aid last year.

title: TAXIRIDING IS DOWN SINCE THE STRIKE
description: Taxicabs in the city have suf fered a drop in patronage since the 15day strike last month, according to an industry spokes man. Most drivers questioned also said business had fallen off.

title: MRS. JAY F. SCHAMBERG
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 6  Mrs. May Bamberger Scham berg, the widow of a promi nent Philadelphia physician, died here today after a short illness. She was 86 years old.

title: Construction Loan Rate Cut
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Jan. 6 The Pennsylvania Industrial Development Authority at a meeting today lowered from 4 per cent to 2 per cent the interest rate on its loans for the construction of new plants or plant expansions within the state.

title: ROCKEFELLER SAYS STATE MUST TIGHTEN ITS BELT;
description: ALBANY, Jan. 6Governor Rockefeller warned the Legis lature today that the state faced a bleak fiscal situation.

title: A Nun From India Is Extolled by Pope At Peace Prize Rite
description: ROME, Jan. 6Pope Paul VI today praised Mother Teresa, the founder and Superior Gen eral of the Indiabased Mis sionaries of Charity, as a sym bol of brotherhood among men.

title: Award for Tarkenton
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (AP) Fran Tarkenton, quarterback of the. New York Giants, will receive the Dick McCann Me morial Award Saturday as the National Football League play er of the year at the Touch down Club dinner.

title: Chess : Gligoric and Larsen Draw, But the Game's a Beauty
description: The game played by Grand masters Svetozar Gligoric of Yugoslavia and Bent Larsen of Denmark in the 24man Majorca interzonal knockout deserves the brilliancy prize. The point was split and each contestant contributed to the game's depth and sparkle.

title: U.S. Copters From Saigon To Aid Malaysia in Flood
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Jan. 6 (UPI)The United States Army diverted six UH1 heli copters from Vietnam to Malay sia today to help rescue thou sands of people marooned by monsoon floods. Meanwhile, new rains created another stricken region in western Malaysia.

title: BLASTING IS FOCUS OF MINE INQUIRY
description: HYDEN, Ky., Jan. 6Em ployes of the Finley Coal Com pany gave conflicting testimony today about the possible use of an illegal, explosive fuse at the Hurricane Creek mine.

title: Benjamin Gottesman, 79, Dies; Helped Dewey in Gang Crusade
description: Benjamin Gottesman, one of the heroes of Thomas E. Dew ey's war against this city's po liticalunderworld alliance in the nineteenthirties, died Tuesday night in St. Joseph's Hospital. Far Rockaway, Queens. He was 79 years old and lived at 2049 Sea Girt Boulevard, Far Rock away.

title: College Sports Notes
description: Army decided yesterday to play only 10 games during the 1971 football season. Maj Gen. William A. Knowlton, the United States Military Academy's superintendent, approved the recommenda tion of his athletic board to return to a 10game sched ule after Army joined many colleges last year in playing 11 games. Navy, on the other hand, has already scheduled an 11th game for 1971. The middies will play Virginia at Char lottesville, Va., Sept. 11, a week before they start their original 10game schedule.

title: Edison Group Incorporated
description: The Edison Electric Insti tute, the trade association of the nation's private electric utilities, has been incorporated under the new NotforProfit Corporation Law of the State of New York, effective Jan. 1. D. Bruce Mansfield, president of the Ohio Edison Company, was named chairman and Shearon Harris, president and chairman of the Carolina Power and Light Company, was chosen vice chairman.

title: Labor Unions Form Mutual Fund
description: Organized labor, in a move to improve the ability of workers to become capital ists, has created the first mu tual fund designed specifi cally for union members.

title: Firemen Meet Today to Decide On Whether to End Job Action
description: Members of the Uniformed Firefighters Association were scheduled to meet in Manhat tan Center this morning to de cide whether to call off the job action that began New Year's Day.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: JACOB FEINSTEIN
description: SARASOTA, Fla., Jan. 6  Jacob Feinstein, a member of the American Stock Exchange in New York and its predeces sor for more than half a cen tury, died Sunday after a long illness. He was 80 years old.

title: Joseph Jacobs, Diplomat, Dead; Retired Ambassador to Poland
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 Joseph E. Jacobs of Boca Ra ton, Fla., a retired diplomat whose service ranged from Pe king in 1915 to Poland, where he was ambassador during the Poznan upheaval of workers in 1956, died at his former home here yesterday. He was 77 years old.

title: Gas Caused Miami Blast
description: MIAMI BEACH, Jan. 6 (AP) An explosion that killed one person and injured 34 others on Monday was caused by nat ural gas, investigators said to day. The gas was said to have been fed into the destroyed building through an abandoned line that had not been capped.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED IN CORN FUTURES
description: Profit taxing and speculation turned most early gains in com modity futures prices on the Chicago Board of Trade into losses yesterday.

title: Nixon Reportedly Says He Is Now a Keynesian
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (Reuters)President Nixon has described himself as now a Keynesian in eco nomics, according to How ard K. Smith of the Ameri can Broadcasting Company, one of the four television commentators who inter viewed the President on television show Monday night.

title: SIX RANGERS NAMED TO ALLSTAR BERTHS
description: Six New York Rangers, the club's largest complement ever, were named to the National Hockey League's East Division AllStar team yesterday.

title: Sports of the times
description: He was sitting in the basement powder room of a Reno hotel, the only place they could find for him to dress after his workout, studying his face in a mirror ringed by tiny light bulbs and casually intimidating a visitor who had come from New York to see his return to the ring in March of 1968. Anyone, he was saying evenly, who says I'm over 35 is calling my mother a liar

title: Buechner Is Resigning Brooklyn Museum Post
description: Thomas S. Buechner, di rector of the Brooklyn Mu seum for 11 years, has an nounced his resignation to accept a post in private in dustry. The resignation, ef fective June 30, 1971, has been pending since last fall.

title: MRS, HERBERT R. LOUIS
description: Mrs. Sylvia Steinberg Louis, teacher and college adviser of Sheepshead Bay High School, died Friday of cancer in Me morial Hospital. She was 54 years old and lived at 1211 East 21st Street, Brooklyn.

title: Garden Seeks Title Bout
description: Carlos Monzon of Argentina, the world middleweight cham pion, has been offered $75,000 to defend his title against Emile Griffith at Madison Square Garden April 12, the Garden matchmaker, Teddy Brenner, said yesterday.

title: Skindivers Said to Smuggle 200 Pounds of Marijuana
description: Detectives seized 200 pounds of highquality marijuana yes terday that they said had been smuggled into New York Har bor on a ship from South America, dropped over the side in plastic bags and retrieved at night by skindivers.

title: More Russians Send Plea To Nixon on Angela Davis
description: Ten Soviet intellectuals, in chiding the composers Dmitri Shostakovich and Aram Khach aturian and the ballerina Maya Plisetskaya, have written to President Nixon, asking clem ency for Angela Davis, the black Communist militant and philosophy teacher.

title: Sonny Liston, ExHeavyweight Champion, Is Dead
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Jan. 6 (UPI)  Sonny Liston, for mer world heavyweight boxing champion, was found dead in his home last night by his wife, Geraldine.

title: City Housing Employes Put Off Strike to Continue Bargaining
description: A union representing 5,800 service employes at 172 city housing projects agreed last night to postpone a strike that would have cut essential serv ices to 600,000 tenants.

title: A Senator Tells How Gas Canisters Sank in Lake
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (UPI) About 200 canisters of nerve gas awaiting disposal sank un noticed through melting ice of an Alaskan lake in 1966 and lay at the bottom three years before the Army tried to re cover it, the office of Senator Mike Gravel, Democrat of Alaska, said today.

title: An Unwise Threat
description: Moscow's threat to declare open season on Americans in the Soviet Union has justifiably provoked a strong reaction in Washington. The Soviet Government should be under no illusion as to the effect on American public opinion if this threat were to become reality.

title: judges Are Questioning jury Panels to Speed Trials
description: In an effort to speed criminal trials, judges across the state this week took over the job of questioning prospective jurors, a task traditionally per formed, and treasured, by lawyers.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6Until re cently the Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, which is being built over a large part of Washington, had just seemed gigantic, arrogant and inhuman.

title: MinimumTax Law Eased by Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6In the final hours of the Congres sional session, with about three minutes debate for each mem ber end no rollcall votes, Con gress passed more than 20 spe cial tax bills, including one that chips away at the new min imum tax.

title: Tyler Resigns as Haryou Head; Pressure to Leave Is Denied
description: State Supreme Court Justice Andrew R. Tyler has resigned as chairman of the board of Haryou  Act, the much criticized antipoverty agency in Harlem.

title: Manson Request to Dismiss Lawyers Denied by Judge
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 6 (UPI) Charles M. Manson and three female members of his family asked the court today to dismiss their lawyers and let them reopen the defense in the Sharon Tate murder trial.

title: Colonel on Mylai Panel Declares Killing P. O. W. Might Be Proper
description: FORT MePHERSON, Ga., Jan. 6  An Army colonel who said it might be proper to ex ecute a prisoner of war in an unconventional conflict such as the Vietnam war was tenta tively seated today as head of a jury that will decide a Mylai case.

title: News of Dogs
description: It seemed so natural to see Tom Gately of Pineville, Pa., leading a wire fox ter rier in competition at the recent Washington, Balti more and Philadelphia shows that it was a bit startling to realize that a year had slipped by since he retired as a pro fessional handler after 41 years. This was one of his own dogs, Ch. Gay terry Little Cher ry, the only kind he shows nowa days, and as an owner handler he was a lot more relaxed than when victories were of vital importance.

title: Market Place Can We Get Rid Of Certificates?
description: It was not so long ago that the nation's brokerage houses faced disaster in the midst of plenty. It was during the bull market of 196768 that brought Wall Street big prof its.

title: TV: Great American Dream Machine on WNET
description: Television, real television, came at last to television last night in The Great American Dream Machine. It's been a long time coming.

title: ITALIAN REDS REPORT TALK ON SOVIET JEWS
description: ROME, Jan. 6 (Reuters)The Italian Communist party said today that it had consulted with Soviet and East European par ties on the question of Jews who wished to emigrate.

title: STOCK PRICES FIRM ON LONDON BOARD
BET AGENCY HIRES EXSAMUELS AIDES
description: Twelve former aides in How ard J. Sainuels's Democratic primary campaign for Governor last year have been hired for the staff of the New York City Offtrack Betting Corporation. The organization, headed by Mr. Samuels, reports a little over 200 employes.

title: New Burroughs Calculators
description: DETROIT, Jan. 6 (UPI)The Burroughs Corporation today introduced six additional mod els to its Series C electronic cal culator line. The new calcu lators range in price from $545 to $1,445, the company said. One is a batterypowered minielectronic calculator that uses largescale integrated circuitry.

title: S. Carolina Tops Temple
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Jan. 6 (UPI)John Roche's 21 points led South Carolina to an 8471 basketball victory over Temple tonight.

title: SALES AT PEAKS FOR FOREIGN CARS
Arsonist Granted Appeal
description: ALBANY, Jan. 6Thomas A. Ruppert, 21 years old, who was convicted of setting a fire that killed 12 persons in the Yonkers Jewish Community Center, was granted permission today to appeal his conviction. Ruppert, a former Job Corps worker, had, been convicted of murder and arson in 1967.

title: Council to Examine City Superagencies For Effectiveness
description: A City Council examination during 1971 of the effective ness of the Lindsay Adminis tration's superagency structure was promised yesterday by the Council's majority leader, Thomas J. Cuite.

title: L.I. Bishop to Be Consecrated
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L.I., Jan. 6 (UPI)  The Most Rev. John R. McGann will be con secrated as the new Auxiliary Bishop of the Rockville Centre diocese tomorrow in St. Agnes Cathedral here.

title: Brief Demonstration Held
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 6 (UPI)A few hours after the workers visit, about 20 chanting youths staged a brief demonstration outside the embassy, American sources said.

title: A Blast Wrecks 10 Homes
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 6 (UPI) Ten row homes were wrecked by an explosion and fire today. Their 68 occupants escaped without serious injury.

title: If the Taj Mahal Is Too Expensive . . .
description: In the 17th century the Shah Jehan of India con structd what may be the most beautiful building in the World in honor of his deact queen Not every man these days can afford a Taj Mahal to prove his love, but if he has $50,000 handy, he might run into Cartier next week and buy his wife a pendant that once belonged to the Shah's Queen Mum taz Mahal.

title: Pennsylvania Abortion Law Voided by 2 County Judges
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 6 (AP) Two Allegheny County judges ruled today that Pennsylvania's abortion law was unconstitu tional.

title: MEKONG OIL CRAFT SET AFIRE BY FOE
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Jan. 6 (AP)A South Vietnamese landing boat loaded with gaso line and other fuels was shelled from an island in the Mekong River today. The boat exploded, sending greasy black smoke several hundred feet into the air.

title: Colonels Upset Squires
description: LOUISVILLE, Jan. 6 (AP) Dan Issel scored 38 points as the Kentucky Colonels upset the Virginia Squires, 145137, in an American Basketball As sociation game.

title: CUBAN BOMBER GETS PROBATION
description: An antiCastro Cuban who pleaded guilty to bombing the Spanish tourist office here in the summer of 1968 was set free on probation yesterday by State Supreme Court Justice Harold Baer over vigorous pros ecution objections.

title: 6 VISIT U.S. EMBASSY IN MOSCOW PROTEST
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 6Six So viet workers, representing two Moscow factories, called at the United States Embassy today to protest against the harass ment of Soviet representatives by militant American Jewish organizations.

title: CHILE IS TAKING OVER 2 MORE U.S. CONCERNS
description: VALPARAISO. Chile, Jan. 6 (UPI)President Salvador Al lende Gossens announced to day that his Government was taking over two United States affiliated concerns and said foreign businessmen who re fused to comply with Chilean laws would be asked to re turn to their homeland. He also said, We don't want some Americans to stay too long in Chile.

title: Judge Permits a Subpoena Of Hospital Abortion Files
description: State Supreme Court Justice Hyman Korn ruled yesterday that Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz could subpoena the abortion records of a referral agency and a hospital in the course of an investigation.

title: Yonkers Democratic Mayor Finds Reforming City Is a Lonely Job
description: YONKERS, Jan. 6Alfred Del Bello, the first Democrat to serve as Mayor of this city in 32 years, came into office a year ago faced with a ma jor problem: rebuilding public confidence in a city that the State Investigation Commis sion, in public hearings held less than a month before his inauguration, had report ed was riddled with cbrrup tion.

title: FordJapanese Talks to Reopen
description: HIROSHIMA, Japan, Jan. 6 (Reuters) The Toyo Kogyo Company and the Ford Motor Company will reopen talks on financial ties, suspended last month, in late February or in March, Kohei Matsuda, presi dent of the Japanese car com pany, said today.

title: American Smelting Will Follow Action To Cut Zinc Prices
description: The American Smelting and Refining Company announced yesterday that it would follow a move initiated late Monday by the St. Joe Minerals Corpora tion that in effect cut the cost of zinc to some customers.

title: Sonic Booms on West Coast
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif., Jan. 6 (AP)A series of sonic booms awakened people early today, and Air Force officials said the noise may have been caused by an air defense alert. The Evening Tribune, quoting a spokesman for the North American Air Defense Com mand, said more than 100 United States and Canadian fighter planes had been sent into the air in a surprise test of air defense readiness.

title: New Orleans Theater Set To End Marat/Sade Run
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 6 (AP) A community theater, whose doors were shuttered tempo rarily last month when the po lice raided its production of Marat/Sade, has announced it will close at the end of Jan uary if money isn't raised to pay debts and royalties.

title: 326 Donors Add to Fund For Needy
description: Thank you for giving us the opportunity to add our small gift to the gifts of oth ers, so that together we may do what no one of us could do alone.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Big Finland Steel Mill Uses a Soviet Furnace
description: HELSINKI,FinlandIn blast furnace technique and general steel making our opinion is that the Soviet Union is number one, and they have the capacity to ex port. The Russian people have always been good metallur gists.

title: Governor Begins His Fourth Term With Extensive Changes in Cabinet and Staff
description: ALBANY, Jan. 6Governor Rockefeller has begun his fourth term with a mixture of new faces and veterans in his cabinet and on his staff.

title: DAVIS RETAINS LEAD IN $75,000 BOWLING
description: ST. PAUL, Jan. 6 (UPI)The 192man field in the $75,000 United States open bowling tournament was pared to the 64 high scorers tonight and Dave Davis, a Miami lefthander, was still leading.

title: Satellite Launching Off
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Jan. 6 (UPI)Launching of a pow erful new communications sat ellite, set for Jan. 13, was in definitely postponed today be cause engineers have still not traced the cause of an earlier satellite failure. The new Intel sat 4 radio relay satellite can be made ready for launching within 11 working days after the final goahead is received.

title: Makarova and Bruhn Form Magnetic Team
description: The big, super, mammoth, economy size package of the current season by American Ballet Theater at the New York City Center can perhaps be summed up in five words: Natalia Makarova and Erik Bruhn. Those words have given a tremendous impetus to the season, with City Cen ter boxoffice records broken, crowded houses and that gen eral air of excitement that only occasionally attaches it self to a dance season.

title: OHIO SEEKS RETURN OF 4 SEASONS LOAN
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Jan. 6 (AP)  Ohio today asked a Federal Court in Oklahoma City, Okla., to bypass normal bankruptcy procedures in re turning $4million the Ohio treasury lent last year to Four Seasons Nursing Centers of America, Inc.

title: Army Drops Charges Against Four in Alleged Mylai CoverUp
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (AP)  The Army dropped today the charges against four more officers in the alleged cover up of the killing of South Viet namese civilians at Mylai.

title: City Reports Air Is Still Sooty, But Sulphur Dioxide Is Lower
description: Intensified air pollution con trol has not made a significant change in the city's most visible air pollutantsootin the last five years, the Department of Air Resources reported yester day.

title: Special Shop Area Voted Near World Trade Center
description: Elevated walkways, a large plaza and bilevel shopping fa cilities south of the World Trade Center were approved yesterday by the City Planning Commission as part of a spe cial zoning district.

title: TYPICAL FOOD BILL PUT AT $34 A WEEK
Requiem in Albany
description: In a sober, subdued State of the State address before members of the Legislature, who interrupted him only once for perfunctory applause, Governor Rockefeller buried a dream yesterday. It was the dream that state government, if it but had the will, could do almost anything to meet its own emerging needs. He began his fourth, fouryear term in Albany by failing to call for the enactment of any boldly new, innovative pro grams. He confessed instead the state's approaehing fiscal bankruptcy, its utter dependence now on addi tional forms of Federal assistance.

title: Samuels Gets City Approval for Separate Offtrack Betting Pool on Yonkers
description: A bizarre situation arose last night in the muddled offtrack betting controversy. .

title: Seale, in Outburst, Says State Drops Blacks on Jury List
description: NEW HAVEN, Jan. 6An gered at the way the prosecu tion had questioned a black prospective juror, Bobby G. Seale interrupted court proceed ings today, calling the prosecu tor a pig because he's knock ing off every black man from the jury list.

title: LAB WORK DISCUSSED AT PANTHERS'
description: Defense lawyers spent most of yesterday at the trial of 13 Black Panthers here crossexam ining two police laboratory technicians about the methods they use for chemical analysis.

title: Hatfield Ready to introduce Legislation to Repeal Draft
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (AP) Senator Mark Hatfield, Repub lican of Oregon, will introduce legislation to repeal the draft when Congress convenes later this month.

title: MRS. SCHNEERSOHN
description: Mrs. Nechama Dina Schneer sohn, widow of Rabbi Joseph Isaac Schneersohn, leader of the Lubavitcher movement of Orthodox Jews until his death in 1950, died yesterday at her home, 770 Eastern Parkway, Brooklyn. She was 88.

title: A Pay Rise at Harvard
description: CAMBRDIGE, Mass., Jan. 6 (AP)Harvard University an nounced today increases in pay for the 1,200 graduate teaching fellows on the faculty of arts and sciences, effective July 1. They will be paid $6,000, up from $5,500, until they have taken eight full courses or the equivalent in the graduate school, when their pay will rise to $7,600, up from $7,000.

title: Groppi Sentence Upheld
description: CHICAGO, Jan. ?? (UPI)The United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit upheld today a sixmonth contempt sentence imposed by the Wis consin Legislature on the Rev. James E. Groppi, the Milwaukee priest who led demonstrators in a sitin at the Wisconsin Capitol. The decision, however, came after the sentence had expired. Father Groppi served 10 days of the sentence in 1969 before it was reversed by a Federal District Court.

title: Engineer Killed in Wreck
description: PIKEVILLE, Ky., Jan. 6 (UPI) A train engineer was killed today and three crewmen were injured when a Chesapeake and Ohio freight derailed near Pom pey, Ky. J. R. Weese of Shell biana, Ky., the engineer, was pinned in the wreckage.

title: Brittany Upset by 2 Teachers Who Defy Area's Moral Beliefs
description: PARIS, Jan. 6Two young teachers have set rural Brit tany on its ear, one by marry ing a divorced man, the other by refusing to marry the father of the child she will soon have.

title: Nixon Signs Aid Bill
description: SAN CLEMENTE. Calif., Jan. 6President Nixon signed a bill today authorizing $550mil lion in military, and economic assistance.

title: Mayor of San Diego Is Found Not Guilty At His Bribery Trial
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 6 (AP)  Mayor Frank Curran was found not guilty today of bribery and conspiracy charges stemming from alleged payoffs from the Yellow Cab Company. He had been accused of using his in fluence to push through a fare increase three years ago.

title: Coaches Ousted
description: Charlie Winner of the St. Louis Cardinals and Bill Austin of the Washington Redskins were both dismissed yesterday bringing to seven the number of recent coaching changes in the National Football League.

title: Batory, Boycotted by I.L.A., Leaves Without Incident
description: The Polish liner Stefan Ba tory, which raised protests by the International Longshore men's Association when she docked in the Hudson River on Monday, left for home yester day without fanfare.

title: Nixon Now Expected to Transfer His Emphasis to Domestic Issues
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 6 President Nixon has now indi cated in public as well as in private that he deems it rea sonably safeas well as po litically desirable  to turn away from his personal pre occupation with foreign prob lems and to devote more attention to the home front

title: Honors for Harrelson
description: Bud Harrelson, the New York Mete shortstop, will be honored by Sports Lodge of B'nai B'rith for high principle and achieve ment in sports in 1970 at the organization's Bill Corum Me morial Awards dinner on Sat urday, Jan. 23.

title: Mail Thieves Loot 200 Street Boxes; Gang Is Suspected
description: About 200 street mailboxes in the city have been broken into in the last two months, requiring their removal for re pairs or replacement.

title: Dr. Jarring Rocks Israel
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 6 (AP)A new rock song on the Israeli hit parade is called Dr. Jar ring. Sung by the Hopeful Good Timers, the song is dedi cated to Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, the United Nations intermedi ary conducting ArabIsraeli peace negotiations in New York.

title: Detroit Upsets Bonnies
description: DETROIT, Jan. 6 (AP)De troit defeated previously un beaten and 10thranked St. Bonaventure, 7573, tonight.

title: Bronx Slayer Sentenced
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Jan. 6 (UPI) A 22yearold Bronx printer was sentenced today in Nassau County court to a term of up to 15 years in prison for the murder of an alleged Times Square prostitute in October, 1969. The defendant, Robert Consilvio of 944 Calhoun Ave nue, had been indicted for murder in the fatel beating of 21yearold Mary Ann Pilgrim, but last November, he pleaded guilty to a reduced charge of firstdegree manslaughter.

title: RUBENS WORKS FLY HOME TO BRUSSELS
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 6 (Reuters)  Two Rubens masterpieces, bought for $850,000 by a Bel gian bank, were flown home to Belgium from London today after being cleared for export by Britain.

title: Miss Pope in Moliere Play
description: Peggy Pope will be in the Phoenix Theater's production of School for Wives, which stars Brian Bedford. Miss Pope is to portray Georgette in Richard Wilbur's new translation of Moliere's comedy.

title: Advertising:

title: BANK FUND AIDED MUSE AND FORD
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (AP) Senator Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat, Maine, who has Presidential aspirations, and the House Republican leader, Gerald R. Ford, are listed as having received donations from a controversial bank campaign fund whose money was spurned by 18 other Congressmen.

description: MINNEAPOLIS, Jan. 6 (AP) A spokesman for the National Football League Players Asso ciation said today a tentative agreement had been reached to provide players with a pension at age 55.

title: Synthesis Opens the Way For Varied Medical Uses
description: The reported synthesis of human growth hormone was described yesterday by special ists in the field as a landmark in laboratory production of the substances that control many life processes.

title: Royals Win in Overtime
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 6 (AP)  Nate Archibald swiped a pass with 14 seconds to go in over time and scored a 3point play to help the Cincinnati Royals beat the Portland Trail Blazers, 133128, tonight.

title: Romney Assails Patman on Housing Abuse Report
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 George Romney, the Secretary of Housing and Urban Develop ment, accused Representative Wright Patman of Texas today of breaking an agreement in the release of an inaccurate, misleading and very incom plete report of widespread abuse in a subsidized housing program.

title: SAMUEL SHEIRR
description: Samuel Sheirr, executive vice president of H. Lewkowitz Inc., jewelers, died yesterday after a short illness. He was 68 years old and lived at 155 East 50th Street and 6 Roxen Road, Rock ville Centre, L. I.

title: Perelman Plans Trip, VerneStyle, Around World in 80 Days
description: LONDON, Jan. 6If all goes well, the doors of the Reform Club will swing open one day this May and admit a mustached figure with sunk en chest and air of icy calm.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Winter is the time for East Coast saltwater fishermen to give their gear some much needed attention.

title: Bishop Among Six Doomed as Plotters By Cameroon Court
description: YAOUNDE, Cameroon, Jan. 6 (Reuters)A Roman Catholic bishop was sentenced to death by a military tribunal here to day.

title: Head of Northern Illinois U. Named Provost of Pittsburgh
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 6  Dr. Rhoten A. Smith, the president of Northern Illinois University, has been named provost of the University of Pittsburgh. The appointment of Dr. Smith, who is 49 years old, will be effec tive Aug. 1, Dr. Wesley W. Pos var, the Pitt chancellor, an nounced today.

title: Theater: Artaud's The Cenci Comes to La Mama
description: So far as it is known, An tonin Artaud wrote only one actual play. The Cenci, based on a play by Shelley and a translation by Stendhal, both filtered through Artaud's demonic imagination.

description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 6 Led by Col. Serge Obolen sky, the durable 80yearold patriarch of the New York charity ball world, a small band of international social ites arrived in San Francisco this week to attend such dis parate events as the open ing of the Australian ballet with Rudolf Nureyev as guest star and choreographer, a rich hippie party in a real ly hip restaurant and a week end in the Sierra, where storms have piled up an un seasonal amount of snow.

title: States Assail U.S. Boat Sanitation Code as Lenient

description: Providing security for Soviet installations here is a complex problem for the New York City police.

title: 2 G.I.'s Killed ht Vietnam

title: Sales of Savings Bonds Exceed Redemptions
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (UPI)Savings Bond sales exceeded redemptions in De cember for the third consecu tive month after nearly two years of redemptions out stripping sales, the Treasury Department reported today.

description: TERRE HAUTE, Ind., Jan. 6 (UPI)The Rose Polytechnic Institute became the RoseHul man Institute of Technology to day as theengineering and sci ence college received as a gift the multimilliondollar assets of the Hulman Foundation.

description: Sol Hurok, back from Mos cow where he lost the Bol shoi Opera and the Bolshoi Ballet engagements that he had planned for the Metro politan Opera House, picked up a box from his desk and pressed a button. Laughter flooded the Fifth Avenue of fice  raucous, mechanical guffawing  while the 82 yearold impresario smiled wryly.

description: JERSEY CITY, Jan. 6 (AP) Firemen here who are in a con tract dispute with the city voted a job action today, then called it off when a court granted the city a restraining order.

description: A former West Point senior who had been denied a dis charge as a conscientious ob jector won a stay from as signment to active duty yes terday in a United States Court of Appeals ruling that the Ar my had violated its own regu lations.

description: BAGHDAD, IraqThe, Iraqi sponsored commando group, the Arab Liberation Front, has been stressing its ties to the Chinese Communists lately and denouncing the conservative Government of King Hussein in Jordan.

description: Two onduty firemen sub dued a holdup suspect here last night after he fired two shots at them at close range and missed.

description: A new academic discipline is rising on the nation's cam puses: women studies.

description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (UPI) J. Edgar Hoover said today that racial disorders, attacks on policemen and subversive activities continued to be a threat to the country in 1970, but he noted a decline in racial incidents in schools.

description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6  The House Select Committee on Crime, reporting to Con gress today after an 18month study, called for consideration of a preventive detention law to permit the imprisonment of narcotics peddler suspects pending trial.

title: Books of The Times
description: Yes, it may as well be admitted that the installments of this book that appeared in LifeMagazine were somehow dull and irritating. Here, an the one hand, was the moon circus, still fresh in our mindsan event beyond linear journalism somehow; an event that seemed to demand radio static and the unstable images of the TV

title: Second Opposition Party Is Formed in South Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Jan. 6 A group of conservative poli ticians led by former President Posun Yun today formed South Korea's second. opposition part, the Nationalist party, to participate in the presidential and parliamentary elections in the spring.

title: Pistons Win, 100 to 99
description: DETROIT, Jan. 6 (UPI) Dave Bing scored 7 of his team's last 10 points and Otto Moore hit two clutch free throws tonight as the Detroit Pistons defeated the San Diego Rockets, 10099, in a National Basketball Association game.

description: Mayor Lindsay hailed Gov ernor Rockefeller's speech yesterday, which, he said, forcefully describes the di mensions of the financial crisis which confronts New York State and has accurate ly defined the critical role which the Federal Govern ment must assume in helping us to meet those problems.

description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 6Even Bill Fitch, the coach of the Cleveland Cavaliers, seemed more conscious of the game that the New York Knicks will play tomorrow night than of the one in which the Knicks trampled his expansion team, 12794, tonight before 3,436 fans at Cleveland Arena.

title: Personal Finance Place of Safekeeping for Securities Deserves Consideration by Investors
description: The start of 1971 is a good time to think about safe keeping of securities for two reasons.

description: BELGRADEWith the overthrow of khrushchev in 1964, the Soviet party bureaucracy finally freed itself from the nightmare of a purge, in this case an antiStalinist purge, that could have resulted in the hazardous loss of the bureauracy's preponderance of power.

title: I.D.S. IS EXPECTING TO LIST PROFIT RISE
description: Investors Diversified Serv ices, the nation's largest mu tual fund organization, said yesterday it expected to show an increase in its consolidated earnings for 1970 of about 55 cents per classA common share by changing its method of re porting life insurance earnings.
