description: BUFFALO, Jan. 6 (UPI)The Buffalo Braves snapped an eightgame losing streak with a 115108 victory over the San Francisco Warriors tonight.

title: Rail Merger Goes to I.C.C.;
description: The Chicago, Rock Island & Pacific Railroad merger pro ceeding, in which that troubled carrier seeks to join the pros perous Union Pacific Railroad, was assigned yesterday to the Interstate Commerce Commis sion's threemember finance di vision.

title: Screen: 'Satan's Sadists':Double Bill Also Offers 'Hell's Bloody Devils'
description: The aroma emanating from some 25 movie houses yesterday came from a double serving of junk called "Hell's Bloody Devils" and "Satan's Sadists." The films mark the local foothold of a California company known as Independent-International.The first picture is routine gangland fare, with wedgedin footage of young motorcycle brutes as box-office bait. Some of the color photography has a cool, crisp flavor, especially when the camera scans various Las Vegas facades. But it's truly sad to see the involvement of such people as Broderick Crawford, Scott Brady and Kent Taylor in the smoking out of a Nazi-minded counterfeiter.The other film, "Satan's Sadists," is the main offender, a ragged little cash-in on depravity and bloodshed, which the sponsors proudly announce has already coined a mint in theaters across the nation. "See wild hippies on a mad murder spree!" promise the ads, also suggesting a link with the Tate murders.For the first half hour, all we could take, a group of many, human vermin bully, vilify and slaughter three helpless civilians in the remote California desert. Then they go after more. Brady and Taylor, hapless guys, show up in this one, too.But the saddest sight of all is Russ Tamblyn (remember "tom thumb"?), as the psycho masterminding the killers. If this is his "comeback" trail, it's a definite detour.

title: KARL KNIPE, SERVED MAJOR AD AGENCIES
description: Karl Knipe, an advertising executive who retired in 1958, died Tuesday at his home. He was 79 years old and lived at 30 Sutton Place.

title: News of Skiing
description: ZURICH, Switzerland, Jan. 5 Thousands of American skiers who flocked to Europe for the Christmas holidays learned that many Alpine re treats could suffer from a dearth of snow in December.

description: BERCHTESGADEN, West Germany, Jan. 6 (AP)Jean Noel Augert of France easily won the season's first Alpine World Cup special slalom race today, but the Austrian team managed to place four men among the top 10 finishers.

description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (AP) A State Department spokes man said today that the United States Embassy staff at Pnom penh would be expanded te oversee the use of United States aid.

description: CHAPEL HILL, N. C., Jan. 6 (UPI)Vermont C. Royster, editor of The Wall Street Journal, has accepted a pro fessorship in journalism and public affairs at the Univer sity of North Carolina.

description: ALBANY, Jan. 6Following are ex cerpts from the message by Governor Rockefeller on the state of the state to the Legislature. An abbreviated version was delivered on radio and television.

title: AMEX PRICES RISE IN ACTIVE TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange advanced yesterday to their highest level in almost nine months. Trading was ac tive.

description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6  A pioneering Federal census of city and county jails showed today that 52 per cent of their inmates had not been convicted of a crime and that many in mates, whether convicted or not, endured less than human conditions.

description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 6 (UPI)A Vietcong broadcast today rejected as illusory logic President Nixon's opti mism for peace in Vietnam.

title: DENZIL W. COE
description: Denzil W. Coe, a veteran tun nel engineer, died Tuesday in Summit Park Sanitarium, Po mona, N. Y. He was 91 years old and lived at 263 Orange burg Road, Pearl River, N. Y.

description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 6 A Harvard student news paper, The Independent, re ported tonight that Derek C. Bok, dean of the Harvard Law School, had been selected by the Harvard Corporation to be the school's next president.

description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Jan. 6  Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, the United Nations special rep resentative for the Middle East, was reliably reported today to have accepted an urgent Israeli request to fly to Jerusalem for consultations with Premier Golda Meir. His departure ap peared set for tomorrow.

description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 6 (UPI) Robert G. Baker, former sec retary of the Senate Democratic majority, will go to prison Jan. 14 to begin serving a one to three year sentence for theft, fraud and income tax evasion.

description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 6The hormone responsible for growth in the human body has been synthesized for the first time by a group of basic research scientists at the University of California Medical Center. It is the largest molecule ever pieced together by scientists in a laboratory.

Mork won the fourth and last event, but the fall on the Innsbruck Berg Isel jump spoiled his chance to overtake Raska.

description: Two detectives and six other persons were arrested yester day and charged with being part of a $2millionayear auto theftgang operating here and Upstate.

description: MINEOLA, L. I., Jan. 7A Hofstra University honor stu dent who became a registered voter this week under the United States Supreme Court decision lowering the voting age in national elections to 18 was appointed a committeeman today in the Nassau County Democratic party.

description: HOLLAND, Mich., Jan. 7 (UPI)An iron monster that shreds old cars to the size of large cornflakes began opera tion here today.

description: PEKINGSo what's been happen ing in the world? I asked the Chinese fellow journalist who met me at the railway station in Shanghai.

description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 7 (AP) Members of United Workers, Local 674, voted late yesterday to accept a new contract and to return to their jobs tomorrow, ending a strike against the Chevrolet plant in nearby Nor wood that had affected more than 8,000 workers.

title: Miss Sandra Gillette Zeese Is Bride of Steven W. Driscoll
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I., Jan. 7Miss Sandra Gillette Zeese, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Hoff man Zeese Jr. of Huntington, was married here tonight to Steven Word Driscoll, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Swan ton Driscoll of Chappaqua, N. Y. The ceremony in St. John's Episcopal Church was performed by the Rev. Walter H. McNeeley, rector emeritus of the Episcopal Church of St. Joseph of Arimathea in Elmsford, N. Y. The Rev. William Spillman, rector of St. John's, assisted.

title: State Appoints Deputy Education Commissioner
description: Dr. Thomas D. Sheldon, the 50yearold Superintendent of Schools in Baltimore, was ap pointed yesterday as New York State's deputy commissioner for elementary, secondary and continuing education.

title: Books of The Times
description: That insatiable group of Times fans who became quasi insiders (of sorts) by reading Gay Talese's The. Kingdom and the Pow er have another treat in store for them in Turner catledge's volume of reminiscences. Mr. Catledge does not write with quite the grace or the dramatic license of Mr. Talese after all he lived it as this newpaper's managing editor from 1951 to 1964, but like the good reporter he was he gives a full, straightfor ward accounting for, his years here that is more reve latory of the news paper's operations from his vantage point than was Mr. Talese's. Actu ally, when I heard that enough peo ple in Los An geles, Philadelphia, Kansas City, Keo kuk and all those otter places were buying Mr. Talese's book to make it a best seller I was surprised. As a topic for best sellerdom, I did not expect a big New York newspaper to rank right up there with such staples as sex, money and 2Iday diets, but I have been wrong before and no doubt will be again.

title: Arrogance of Power
description: As a result of huge cost overruns on four military programs, of which the most important is the C5A cargo jet, the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation is on the verge of bankruptcy. In an effort to keep the company from going under, the Pentagon has proposed to pay an extra $758 million to Lockheed, provided that the company agrees to pay $200 million of this back as a fixed loss on the C5A contract.

title: ALLAMERICA NAMED BY SOCCER COACHES
description: The National Soccer Coaches Association, holding its 31st an nual convention here, an nounced yesterday the selection of the collegiate allAmerica team, which will be honored at a dinner at the Commodore Hotel tomorrow, the fourth and last day of the convention.

title: Union Leaders, at City Hall, Oppose a Taxi Agency
description: The high command of the city's labor movement yester day dominated what had been scheduled as a public hearing on taxicab legislationpacking the City Council chamber at City Hall with taxi drivers and lining up spokesmen against a proposed commission to regu late the taxi business.

title: Bucks Conquer Knicks by 116106 Although Alcindor Is Hampered by Fouls
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 7The man basketball players call the Big O has seldom been bigger or better than he was tonight. The Big O is Oscar Robertson.

title: NEW REPORT IS MADE BY MOHAWK AIRLINES
description: The president of Mohawk Airlines, Inc., announced yes terday several additional steps in the airline's previously dis closed financial restructuring program. Russell Stephenson said the company had been ad vised that consent will be given to the deferral until March 1, 1971, of payments of principal and interest due Jan. 1, 1971, totaling about $2.9million of its senior notes held by the Chase Manhattan Bank and by an aircraft manufacturer.

title: Montclair Halts Glassboro
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N. J., Jan. 7Led by the secondhalf shooting of Bruce Davis, Mont clair State won its fifth straight New Jersey State Col lege Conference game tonight, defeating previously unbeaten Glassboro State, 7464.

title: Kings Tie Flyers, 55
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 7 (UPI) A goal by Bill Flett with 7:49 remaining enabled the Los An geles Kings to tie the Philadel phia Flyers, 55, tonight. Phila delphia held a 41 lead early in the second period.

title: Reagan Apparently Skirts Clash With White House Over Welfare
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7Gov. Ronald Reagan of California appeared tonight to have nar rowly avoided a $684million confrontation with the Nixon Administration over his welfare policy. But a second dispute, over lawyers for the poor, continued to intensify.

title: U.S. Extends Controls on Loans Of Banks and Foreign Investing
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7  The Government announced today the extension for another year, with minor modifica tions, of its program of controls over bank lending and busi ness investment abroad. The announcement was made jointly by the Treasury, the Federal Reserve Board and the Commerce Department. The Treasury said it would ask Congress to renew the third element of the program to slow the outflow of capital and improve the balance of international payments. This is the interestequalization tax on purchases of foreign secu rities that expires March 31.

title: Eric Hodgins, Creator of Mr. Blandings, Dead
description: Eric Hodgins, whose 1946 first novel, Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House, became a best seller and whose later ef forts to overcome the effects of a stroke was the subject of his prizewinning book, died yesterday at his home, 150 East 50th Street. He was 71 years old.

description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP) A United States inspection team plans to visit some So viet and other foreign sta tions in Antarctica to make sure no one is violating the ban on military activity.

title: Reform Urged in Maine

description: The small downstairs audi torium at the New York Cul tural Center housed a warmly sentimental concert Wednesday night.

description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP) Thirty years ago, the aver age woman measured 3425 36. Not any more.

title: Exchange Pact Reported

title: Commodity Price Index Up 2.6 From WeekAgo Level
Increase of 7.4% In Major Crimes Reported by City
description: The city's rate of reported crimes rose 7.4 per cent in the first 11 months of 1970 over the corresponding period in 1969, the Police Department re ported yesterday in an analysis of seven categories of major crimes.

title: SOVIET STEPS UP ANTIU.S. PROTEST
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 7The Soviet Union today stepped up its campaign to protest against harassment of Soviet repre sentatives in the United States by militant Jewish organiza tions.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The time is fast approaching for the closing of the ballot boxes for this year's election to the baseball Hall of Fame at Cooperstown. Most of the votes already have been cast by the Baseball Writers' Association and its too late by now for any lastminute electioneering to have any ap preciable affect. If the lodge brothers were listening when I put in a pitch for Early Wynn to join Yogi Berra as a new enshrinee, I'll be satisfied.

title: Alva Gimbel: Gives Helping Hand to Many
description: When a friend asked Mrs. Bernard F. Gimbel if she would go to Harlem to watch some dancers taking class, the 76yearold widow of the head of the Gimbel depart ment store chain didn't hesi tate for a moment. She went directly from her suite in the Pierre Hotel to an abandoned church on Morningside Av enue at East 122d Street. What she saw in action was the twoyearold Dance Thea ter of Harlem.

title: Jarring Flies to See Mrs. Meir; Will Be Back by Sunday Night
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 7Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, the United Nations intermedi ary in the Middle East conflict, left for Israel this afternoon for meetings with Premier Golda Meir and other members of the Israeli Government.

title: UNION QUICKLY BARS OFFER BY CHRYSLER
description: DETROIT, Jan. 7, (UPI)The Chrysler Corporation offered its 120,000 United Auto Work ers employes a new contract today that the company said would cost it $1billion in wages and fringe benefits. The union immediately rejected the offer, calling it deficient.

title: Strike Termed Rumor
description: WARSAW, Jan. 7 (UPI)  An official of the shipbuilding in dustry in Gdnask, reached by telephone, said reports of a strike were merely rumors. He said there had been no strike theer since the December dis turbances.

title: Store Sales Increase
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7The Commerce Department today estimated last week's depart ment store sales at $660million, up 10 per cent from the year earlier $601million.

title: Skorich Named to Coach Browns
description: The Cleveland Browns named Nick Skorich yester day as head coach to succeed Blanton Collier, who had re tired. Skorich, 49 years old, had been the offensive coach on Collier's staff. He was head coach of the Philadel phia Eagles from 1961 through 1963.

title: Bomb Damages Girls Agency
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 7 (AP) A fire bomb was thrown through a window of a Camp Fire Girls headquarters in sub urban Pomona last night, caus ing fire damage estimated at $50,000, officials said. The fire may have been connected with recent racial disturbances at Pomona High School, which is across the street from the sin glestory, twoyearold head quarters, the police said.

title: Heart Fund Reports Gain
description: Americans contributed nearly $44  million last year to the Heart Fund, an increase of al most $3million over 1969, the American Heart Association an nounced yesterday.

title: JOHN G. MKENTY, 70, A FORMER RCA AIDE
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass., Jan. 7 (AP)John Gilman MacKenty of Edgartown, a former execu tive of the Radio. Corporation of America and a conservation ist and gun collector, died today at Massachusetts General Hos pital in Boston. He was 70 years old.

title: Carter Holds Reins at BroadwayHale
description: Edward W. Carter, the schol arly, softspoken president of BroadwayHale Stores, Inc., who on Wednesday will receive the retailing Industry's highest award for achievement, is a zealous believer in corporation expansion not only through in ternal growth but also by ac quisitions.

title: McGovern Resigns Party Post to Seek Presidency in 1972
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7Sen ator George S. McGovern of South Dakota announced today his resignation as chairman of the Democratic party's reform commission, clearing the way for his announcement as a Presidential candidate on Jan. 18.

title: Suit Asks Free Schooling of Retarded
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 7The Pennsylvania Association for Retarded Children filed suit in Federal District Court here to day in an attempt to require the state to make free public education available to all re tarded children.

title: 18,321 Passenger Autos Are Recalled by Chrysler
description: DETROIT, Jan. 7 (UPI)The Chrysler Corporation an nounced today two recall cam paigns involving possible de fects in 18,321 passenger cars built in the 1971 model year.

title: MRS. JOHN R. OVERALL
description: Mrs. Florence Kimbrougn Overall, wife of John R. Over all, assistant vice president of Harris Upham & Co., invest ment bankers, died yesterday of a heart ailment in Doctors Hos pital. She was 62 years old and lived at 530 Park Avenue.

title: Sabres Top Wings, 74
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 7 (UPI)  Phil Goyette scored one goal and set up four others tonight as the Buffalo Sabres beat the Detroit Red Wings, 74.

title: NIXON DENIES MOVE AGAINST M'CORMACK
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 7 (UPI)President Nixon de nied today that his Adminis tration was seeking in any way to obtain criminal indictments against the former Speaker of the House, John W. McCor mack.

title: Czech Lawyer Explains
description: PRAGUE, Jan. 7 (AP)Dr. Zdenek Hrazdira, chairman of the Czech Lawyers Association, said today that demands for money that Czechoslovak emi grants in the West are receiv ing were purely to pay lawyers appointed to defend them on charges of leaving the country without permission.

title: As Ski Fever Rises in U.S., So Does Toll
description: VAIL, Colo.  When 12 yearold Charlie Libin and his family flew from New York City to this resort re cently, he was looking for ward eagerly to schussing down the slopes on his skis. Instead, after a few runs, he came down with the ski pa trolon a toboggan. Charlie had broken his leg.

title: AUXILIARY BISHOP ORDAINED ON L.I.
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I., Jan. 7The Most Rev. John R. McGann was ordained to day as an Auxiliary Bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Rockville Centre.

title: Cholera Spreads in Nigeria
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Jan. 7 (Agence France Presse)  Cholera has spread from Lagos to the Western State capital of Ibadan, a city of more than million people, Nigerian health authorities reported yesterday.

title: Seymour Voices Opposition To Legalizing Marijuana
description: Whitney North Seymour Jr., the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, said yesterday that he would oppose any move to legalize the use of marijuana because of the drug's statistical link with heroin.

title: The Talk of Vicksburg
description: VICKSBURG, Miss., Jan. 7 A confused Northern youth arrived here after dark not long ago and spent the night in a local hotel without knowing what city he was in. On arising the next morn ing the first person he en countered was Mrs. Mary Mc Kay, an elderly widow who is well known here as the foun der of a restau rant called the Old Southern Tea Room, as the granddaughter of a planter who owned 500 slaves before the Civil War, as a woman who still seriously refers to Northerners as damn Yan kees and as the possessor of a tongue so salty that her best friends call her Contrary Mary to her face.

title: Repeal of Laws on Sex Is Urged Here
description: City Investigation Commis sioner Robert K. Ruskin called yesterday for the repeal of all state criminal laws regulating sexual conduct between con senting adults.

title: 7 G.I.'s Reported Killed As Foe Attacks 2 Patrols
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Jan. 8 (AP)  North Vietnamese and Vietcong forces were reported to have attacked two American recon naissance patrols yesterday in widely separated parts of South Vietnam and to have wiped out one of the patrols.

title: Alabama Judge Is Found Guilty In Keeping Negroes Off the Slate
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Jan. A white, segregationist judge who deleted the names of Ne gro candidates from a 1968 ballot was found guilty here today of both civil and crimi nal contempt of Federal Court.

title: Israel Charges Air Violations
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 7  Israel charged today that Egyptian planes made four sorties over Israeli positions on the east ern bank of the Suez Canal yesterday in violation of the ceasefire.

title: Injured Garrison to Accompany Cowboys on Their Flight to Miami Sunday
description: When the Dallas Cowboys fly to Miami on Sunday to pre pare for the Super Bowl game, they will be carrying one im portant casualty, Walt Garri son.

title: Reports Of Florida Influenza Undocumented, Doctors Say
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 7Govern ment doctors at the Center for Disease Control said today that they had received no documentation of an outbreak of influenza in Fort Lauder dale, Fla.

title: Books of The Times
description: In yesterday's column, on Norman Mailer's Of a Fire on the Moon (Little, Brown, $7.95), I registered complaints: dis satisfactions that arose from the install ments of the book that appeared in Life magazine (which may have seemed unfair to bring up, but then many people I have spoken with are judging the book by the Life pieces, and the book is somehow a very different matter); and annoyances that persisted for a time in the book itself. But having catalogued these quibblesthe unresolved problem of Mailer's ego con fronting cold interstellar space, his un justifiable portentousness about the limits of technology, the tedium of scientific detail, the occasional theoretical murki ness, and the question of whether so much was needed so soon after the eventI described how nonetheless I read Of a Fire on the Moon with mounting interest and excitement, and how on reflection after finiShing it, the book snapped into focus as an extraordinarily rich and com plex work.

title: Nebraska Gets Democrat
description: LINCOLN, Neb. Jan. 7 John James Exon, 49yearold Lincoln businessman, was in augurated today as Nebraska's 33d Governor and the eighth Democrat ever to hold the office.

title: Scaloppine Recipe For the Weekend
description: In the menus below, dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISThe greatest problem of the 1970's remains the same as the great est problem of the 1960'show to arrange balanced atomic defenses with out destroying the world. But the answer this decade will probably differ radically from that attempted ten years earlier.

title: Smuggled Raphael Is Seized in Boston
description: A tiny portrait of a young Italian noblewoman by Raphael, acquired by the Boston Mu seum of Fine Arts in 1969 for somewhere in six figures, has been seized by the United States Bureau of Customs for having been smuggled into this country without the required declaration.

title: 2 Elections Due in Brooklyn
description: ALBANY, Jan. 7  Governor Rockefeller today ordered simultaneous special elections on Feb. 9 for a State Senate and Assembly seat in the Park SlopeSouth Brooklyn section of Brooklyn. The vacancies were created by the death of State Senator William J. Fer rall of the 22d Senate District and the resignation of Assem blyman William J. Giordano of the 53d Assembly District to run for the Senate seat.

title: Joint Farming Venture Set
description: MANILA (UPI)The Philip pine and Japanese Govern ments have started a joint farming project in two agricul tural areas in the Philippines, featuring the Japanese methods of farm production.

title: Soviet Diplomat Leaves Bonn In Connection With Spy Case
description: BONN, Jan, 7  The West German Government said today that a Soviet diplomat had been asked to leave the country. The diplomat, P. F. Borovinsky, re turned home at Christmas.

title: Holy Cross Routs Colgate
description: HAMILTON, N. Y., Jan. 7 (AP)Holy Cross scored 13 points quickly as the game opened tonight and coasted to an 8764 victory over Colgate.

title: Screen: 3 Products of American Film Institute Aid
description: Since 1967, the American Film Institute has made ap proximately 70 grants to filmmakers of all stripes and persuasions, including gifted and politically radical direc tors like Robert Kramer, firsttime filmmakers like Bruce Davidson (the photog rapher) and comparatively established avant  gardists like Jordan Belson.

title: Ancient Mandaean Sect Thrives in Iraq
description: BASRA, Iraq  The Man daeans, an ancient people who scorn Moses and Abraham as false prophets, are prospering ?? modern Iraq.

title: MORTON R. GOODMAN
description: Morton R. Goodman, former treasurer of Mark Rafalsky & Co., realty brokerage and man agement firm, died Wednesday at his home. He was 68 years old and lived at 240 West 73d Street.

title: U.S. MAPS CHANGES IN HEALTH SYSTEM
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7A major shakeup of the Federal health system, Its personnel, institutions, administration and services provided to hundreds of thousands of Americans is in the offing.

title: Colts Try New Approach
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 7 (UPI) The Baltimore Colts, trying to forget their last disastrous Super Bowl trip, are doing everything different this year.

title: LOAN RATES CUT FOR CONSUMERS Reduction by Major Retail Commercial Banks Here Follows Earlier Actions
description: Interest rates on consumer loans were reduced yesterday by most of the major retail commercial banks in the New York metropolitan area. The re ductions ranged between one half per cent and one percent age point at an annual rate, de pending on the type of loan and its maturity.

title: A Tray Officer in Leningrad Plot Gets 10 Years in CourtMartial
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 7A Lenin grad military court today sen tenced Lieut. Vulf I. Zalman son to 10 years in a prison camp on charges of participa tion in the planned hijacking Of ?? Soviet airplane in June, usually reliable Jewish sources said.

title: Medici Stresses Prosperity and Hard Rule
description: VOLTA REDONDA, Brazil, Jan. 7Gen. Emilio G. Medici, the President of Brazil, came to this steel town today to emphasize prosperity  the more visible of the two main themes of his administration of the country's sixyearold militaryled Government.

title: Priority Decision in Vermont
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., Jan. 7 Gov. Deane C. Davis began his second twoyear term to day with a warning that a budget squeeze would force the Legislature to assign a basic priority to welfare or educa tion. He clearly sided with wel fare.

title: DRUG DEATHS HIGHER, VIETNAM DATA. SHOW
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 7 (UPI)United States officials disclosed today that improved reporting and diagnostic sys tems show the number of drug deaths among American serv icemen in Vietnam may be 70 per cent higher than previously thought.

title: Planners Stress Consumer
description: WARSAW, Jan, 7 (UPI) Poland's economic planners in dicated today that they would pay more attention to con sumer needs in the future.

title: Peace in the Firehouses
description: The safety of the people of New York City has been enhanced by the decision of the Uniformed Firefighters Association to call off its job action and resume full normal activity. Special credit is due State Supreme Court justice William Kapelman for applying the legal remedies available to him in a manner that encouraged resumption of direct contract negotiations in an atmosphere free coercion, economic or penal.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Bendix Corpora tion announced yesterday the election of W. Mi chael Blumenthal as president and chief op erating officer. Mr. Blumenthal, 45 years old, has served as vice chair man since June, 1970.

title: News of Skiing
description: Frank Ellis, who conducts a tollfree ski reporting tele phone service from his Tor rington, Conn., home on be half of ski areas operators, spent much of yesterday grooming his property.

title: O.K., A.O.K. and O KE
description: LONDONO.K. has had a more re markable career than any other mod ern word.

title: New Bear Mountain Lodge
description: The Palisades Interstate Park Commission has announced that a 24room lodge will be opened at Bear Mountain. State Park in New York on Jan. 16. Laurance S. Rockefeller, presi dent of the commission, said the lodge, at the north end of Hessian Lake would accommo date 96 people.

title: Paul Brown, Brodie Chosen For Pro Football Honors
description: Paul Brown of the Cincinnati Bengals was named the 1970 National Football League coach of the year and John Brodie, the quarterback of the San Francisco 49ers, was named the league's most valuable player by the Associated Press yesterday.

title: Tenants Assail Aid to Addicts, as Plot
description: A group of East Side tenants charged yesterday that Odys sey House, the private drug re habilitation program, was let ting itself be used by the tenants landlords in a plot toy harass and then expel them.

title: BRUINS CONQUER CANUCKS, 6 TO 4
description: BOSTON, Jan. 7 (UPI)The Boston Bruins had a bid for two National Hockey League records wiped out by an of ficial's ruling tonight while whipping the Vancouver Ca nucks, 64.

title: Two Are Indicted in Slaying Of Lehman College Employe
description: Bronx District Attorney Bur ton B. Roberts announced yes terday the indictment of two men for the fatal stabbing on Oct. 6 of the 51yearold cafe teria manager at Herbert H. Lehman College.

title: Jewish Editor in Geneva
description: GENEVA, Jan, 7 Aron Ver gelis, editor of the official So viet Yiddishlanguage monthly Sovetish Heimland, said at a news conference here today that foreign propagandists were creating a Jewish problem in the Soviet Union.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Indonesia Envoy a Suicide
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Jan. 7 (AP)The Indonesian Ambas sador to North Korea shot and killed himself Tuesday after it was announced that he was being removed from his post, Foreign Minister Adam Malik said today.

title: Virginia Woolf's Diaries Coming Here
description: The New York Public Library has acquired the 27 volume manuscript diary of Virginia Woolf, the British novelist and essayist who committed suicide in 1941. The library's Berg Collection, which will house the diaries, is now said to be the world's largest collection of Mrs. Woolf's manucripts.

title: Smoke Forces Jet Drill
description: LOS ANGELES. Jan. 7 (AP) A United Air Lines captain ordered his sevenman crew and 35 passengers down an emergency chute at Los An geles International Airport to day when smoke was discov ered in the passenger section. Airline officials reported no injuries and said that the trouble on the DC8 apparently stemmed from a malfunction in the airconditioning unit.

title: Man in the News
description: ALBANY, Jan. 7On New Year's morning, despite freez ing winds, two men and their young sons rode to the top of a partially constructed 44 story office building adja cent to the Capitol to survey progress on the vast $1bil lion South Mall complex. One of the men was Governor Rockefeller who thought an out ing to the site of the controversial complex that is his pet project would be a treat for his boys Nelson Jr., 6 years old, and Mark, 3. The other adult staring down from the aerie at the 98.5acre building site was Robert Royal Douglass, secretary to the Governor and the second most powerful man in, the executive branch.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Basic Agreements Are Reached On Amateur Skiing Eligibility
description: LONDON, Jan. 7Skiing and Olympic officials reached a basic agreement today on rules of amateur eligibility, but two major obstacles remain be fore the best Alpine skiers can take part in the 1972 Winter Games at Sapporo, Japan.

title: N.Y.U. Matmen Triumph
description: The New York University wrestling team, led by un defeated John Hohmann and Mike Jacques, turned back Montclair State, 2411, last night at Alumni Gymnasium. Hohmann, a 190pounder, and Jacques, a heavyweight, each gained his eighth triumph. The Violets now have a 62 won lost record.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Indians Sign Leon, Foster
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 7 (AP) The Cleveland Indians an nounced yesterday the signing of an infielder, Eddie Leon, and an outfielder, Roy Foster, to 1971 contracts. Both players received raises, the Indians said.

title: Work Stoppage Reported
description: STOCKHOLM, Jan. 7 (UPI) The Stockholm newspaper Aftonbladet reported today that 3,000 shipyard workers in Gdansk have reported to work.

title: PNOMPENH MAY GET PETROLEUM AIRLIFT
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Jan. 7 (UPI)Diplomatic sources in Pnompenh said today that American military planes might have to be used to transport petroleum to the capital if the enemy's stranglehold on Route 4 could not be broken.

title: Blaze Routs Tenants of 3 Upper East Side Buildings
description: Residents of three five story buildings on the Upper East Side were driven into the frigid streets yesterday afternoon when a three alarm fire swept through their buildings.

title: PENN TURNS BACK HARVARD BY 8162
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 7  Phil Hankinson, a sopho more, scored 18 points tonight and sparked fifthranked Penn sylvania to an 8162 Ivy League basketball victory over Har vard.

title: Iowa State Wrestlers Win
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Jan. 7 Iowa State's undefeated wres tlers, ranked third in the nation, defeated Hofstra University to night, 333. In winning their third match of the season, the defending National Collegiate champions registered three pins as Hoftra managed only one decision, an 83 victory by 167 pound Bill Stauffer.

title: Philip Meagher Is Dead at 72; Former Times Police Reporter
description: Philip Meagher, a police re porter for The New York Times for 40 years before he retired in 1967, died yesterday after suffering a stroke. He was 72 years old and lived at 2447 93d Street in Jackson Heights, Queens.

title: STRANGERS LETTERS TO P.O.W.'S ASSAILED
description: An American visitor who re turned this week from Hanoi said that North Vietnamese of ficials told him that letters and parcels sent to American pris oners by strangers tended to delay mail sent by the prison ers relatives.

title: Heel Injury Puts Tolan Out of Action Till June
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 7 (AP) Bobby Tolan, center fielder for the Cincinnati Reds, tore the Achilles tendon in his right heel while playing basketball yesterday. Reds' officials said he probably would net see any baseball action until about June 1.

title: FRANK TOWNSHEND OF AD AGENCY HERE
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Jan. 7  Frank W. Townshend formerly of Riverside, Conn., re tired senior vice president of the CampbellEwald Company, New York advertising concern died today after a brief illness. He was 68 years old.

title: MISS HOGAN GAINS IN HOBART TENNIS
description: HOBART, Australia, Jan. 7 (AP)Patti Hogan of Irvine, Calif., the topseeded player who was eliminated in the Tasmanian open singles tennis competition yesterday, teamed with Olga Morozova of the Soviet Union to advance to the women's doubles semifinals to day.

title: Shoemaker Uninjured In Spill From Saddle
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Jan. 7 (UPI)  Willie Shoemaker, racing's riding champion, was thrown from his mount in the fifth race at Santa Anita to day when the saddle slipped on It's A Corker, but he es caped injury.

title: Pro Soccer League Names Woosman as Commissioner
description: Phil Woosman, executive di rector of the North American Soccer League for the last three years, has been appointed com missioner, the league announced at a meeting here last night.

title: Winning Number Picked In New Jersey Lottery
description: TRENTON, Jan. 7 (AP) Gov. William T. Cahill reached into a revolving drum today and completed the selection of the first win ning lottery number in New Jersey history. The winning number was 394584.

title: Singapore Makes Apology To Complaining U.S. Blacks
description: SINGAPORE, Jan. 7The Home Affairs Ministry, in a statement issued today, said the Government regretted the inconvenience and anxiety caused to American Negro visitors here who had com plained of official discrimina tion.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: MRS. THOMAS J. CANNON
description: Mrs. Loretta Cannon, mother of Jimmy Cannon, the syndi cated sports columnist, died yesterday at Medical Arts Hos pital, after a short illness. She was 85 years old.

title: Kansas Names Fambrough
description: LAWRENCE, Kan., Jan. 7 (AP)Don Fambrough, an as sistant coach for the last 23 years, was elevated to the head coaching job at the Uni versity of Kansas today. Fam brough has been at Kansas for 19 years. He is 48.

title: THE HOPE BEGINS 2D DECADE TODAY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 The American hospital ship HOPE sails for the West Indies tomorrow, beginning her second decade of service.

title: LONG HAIR LEGAL, SOVIET AIDE RULES
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 7Shaggy haired Soviet youths who have been struggling to keep their hair longdespite angry stares, hostile school officials and puzzled parentshave won a concession from the country's secondrankinglawenforcement official. He said'that no matter how awful they may look, the youths are not breaking any law and should not be arrested.

title: Benign Deceit in Desegregation
description: Last May, in the only constructive recommendation an otherwise vague message on racial problems in the schools, President Nixon asked Congress for $1.5 billion to speed desegregation. These funds were to help South ern school districts eliminate dual school systems and underwrite Northern efforts to attain betterintegrated quality education in de facto segregated schools.

title: East Berlin Streets Are Dark For 2d Night in Power Crisis
description: BERLIN, Jan. 7East Berlin lay in darkness tonight, its street lamps unlighted for the second consecutive night as part of a national effort to con serve electricity.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Tunis Reexamines Political System After 15 Years of a OneMan Regime
description: TUNISAfter 15 years of oneman rule, Tunisia is taking a new look at her institutions.

title: False Ads Alleged For a Food Cutter And a Hearing Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (UPI) The Federal Trade Commis sion today issued charges of false advertising against the makers of VegoMatic, a food cutter, and Telex hearing aids.

title: CHANGES IN PACTS WITH A.E.C. URGED But U. of California Faculty Votes for Continued Ties
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 7  The Regents of the University of California will receive at their next meeting a faculty recommendation to make sig nificant changes in the uni versity's contracts with the Atomic Energy Commission.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Some anglers develop a passion for ice fishing but for many it is only a reasonably pleasant way to stave off cabin fever.

title: RODGERS NAMED COACH AT U.C.L.A.
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 7 (AP) Franklin Pepper Rodgers, head football coach at the Uni versity of Kansas, was named coach at the University of Cali fornia Los Angeles today.

title: WASHINGTON
description: Don't look now, but the 1972 Ameri can Presidential election campaign has already started. Suddenly, the candi dates are talking and acting in a dif ferent way, showing up in newsworthy capitals and TV studios, hiring speech writers, political strategists and poll sters, attending private dinners with rich benefactors and otherwise demon strating that they have the itch.

title: They Still Go into Advertising Despite Its Establishment lmage
description: They are a new generation of young women in advertising, with college dip lomas still crisp enough to crackle, but the light in their eyes isn't reforming zeal. It's ambition.

title: BLACKS CRITICIZE ATTACK ON BANKS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7Black bankers, incensed over criti cism of their institutions by Andrew F. Brimmer, the only Negro member of the Federal Reserve Board, reacted today with an angry personal attack on him.

title: Merger News
description: Lincoln First Banks, Inc., a Rochester bank holding com pany, announced yesterday it had agreed in principle to ac quire the National Bank of Northern New York in Water town.

title: Layoffs Are Listed In Key Industries
description: The automobile and aircraft industries were added yester day to those affected by lay offs.

title: Washington Notes
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7  President Nixon told the na tion, in his Conversation with four television news men Monday night, that he had not been in charge of the campaign to elect Repub licans to Congress last No vember. Neither, it would seem, was anyone else. The President told the newsmen that the tactical error of rebroadcasting, on election eve, his denunciation of the demonstrators who stoned his limousine a few days earlier in San Jose, Calif., would not have occurred had I been, shall we say, running the campaign.

title: AMEX SHARES UP THIRD DAY IN ROW
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange yesterday ad vanced for the third consecu tive session in fairly active trading.

title: FOODADDITIVE PRICE UP 3 CENTS A POUND
description: The Commercial Solvents Corporation announced yester day that it had raised the price of monosodium glutamate, a food additive, by 3 cents a pound in fiber drums contain ing 100 pounds net, effective immediately.

title: Copters Aiding Victims Of Floods in Malaysia
description: KUANTAN, Malaysia, Jan. 7 (AP)A British Navy heli copter carried food today to 150,000 flood victims perched on rooftops and roads in the region of Temerloh.

title: A.B.A. Warning: Haywood Hassle Stirs Talent War
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Jan. 7 (AP)Commissioner Jack Dolph of the American Bas ketball Association said to day that A.B.A. clubs would take retaliatory measures against the National Basket ball Association because of the Spencer Haywood case.

title: Golf Lead Shared at 66 By Casper, Shaw, Smith
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 7Billy Casper pulled his 14year old driver from his bag today and swung. It was the first stroke in his bid for honors as the 1971 pro golf tour opened with the $110,000 Glen Campbell Los Angeles open.

title: Dalton School, Facing Dispute, Is Taking a Hard Look at Itself
description: Spurred by a move of some trustees to replace Headmaster Donald Barr, the Dalton School, one of the city's largest, most prestigious and progressive pri vate schools, is reevaluating its programs, policies and ad ministration.

title: Poland, in Shift, Gives Unusual Publicity to High Party Meeting
description: WARSAW, Jan. 7Po land's new Communist leader ship is preparing for a ses sion of the 90member Central Committee with an unusual dis play of discussion and publicity.

title: TEACHERS PONDER POLLUTION COURSE
description: I Some 200 city teachers and local school board members met yesterday in an attempt Ito work out ways of teaching environmental problems so that they will be meaningful to ur ban children.

title: 3 SAY MEDINA GAVE ORDER TO KILL ALL
description: FORT McPHERSON, Ga., Jan. 7  Three witnesses at the courtmartial of a sergeant accused of playing a role. in the  alleged massacre at My Lai testified today that their company commander had or dered his troops to kill every one in the hamlet.

title: Dining Guide: The Winds of Change
description: The restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored where indicated.

title: Mercury in Tuna Is Found Far Less Than in First Test
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 (AP) The Food and Drug Adminis tration said today its halfcom pleted survey of the nation's canned tuna supply indicated far less mercury contamina tion than a firstround test had shown.

title: SUBURBAN ZONING GOES TO U.S. COURT
description: St. LOUIS, Jan. 7  The American Civil Liberties Union filed in Federal Court today what may become a landmark lawsuit in the field of open housing.

title: Appeal Made to Mrs. Court
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Jan. 7, ReutersAn Aboriginal lead er, Pastor Doug Nicholls, ap pealed today to Mrs. Margaret Court, the Australian tennis champion, not to play in South Africa if her doubles partner, Evonne Goolagong, was not in vited.

title: At Rubinstein's Recital, Style and Tonal Beauty
description: The locale was Philhar monic Hall, and there were as many people on the stage as it could accommodate without pushing the piano off, and Artur Rubinstein's recital followed its normal course. He devoted himself to Chopin, and when it was all over there was one of those loveins, with a beam ing Mr. Rubinstein loving his audience, and a beaming, cheering audience loving him.

title: Baseball Schedules a World Series Game at Night
description: Seeking a bigger television audience, baseball and the National Broadcasting Com pany have decided to turn one of the World Series games next fall into a night game.

title: Playboy, Opening Here, Marks Synge Jubilee
description: It is doubtless a terrible thing to be saying of a man on his hundredth birthday, but I have a niggling sus picion that the reputation of John Millington Synge, love ly roaring boy that he was, will prove more fragile than that of most playwrights caught in the quick quick sands of treacherous time. Yet, I am quarter Irish my self and wild bulls could not drag from me such a trea sonable expression.

title: FIREMEN RESUME TALKS WITH CITY; JOB ACTION ENDS
description: The city and the Uniformed Firefighters Association re sumed contract negotiations yesterday after the firemen had voted overwhelmingly to end their job action and again per form all duties.

title: Rites for Gottesman
description: A funeral service was held yesterday at The Riverside, Far Rockaway, Queens, for Ben jamin Gottesman, the former waiters union official whose testimony was decisive in the SchultzHines prosecutions of underworld links with politics here in the 1930's. Burial was in New Montefiore Cemetery, Pinelawn, L. I. The name of a daughter, Mrs. Rose Lang, was inadvertently omitted from the list of survivors in yesterday's obituary of Mr. Gottesman.

title: Davis Ahead as Bowlers Advance to Semifinals
description: ST. PAUL, Minn., Jan. 7 (UPI)  Dave Davis, a left handed bowler from Miami, posted a 1,696 score in eight games today to lead 24 sur vivors from a starting field of 192 into the semifinals of the $75,000 United States open bowling tournament.

title: Class 44: where Silence Is No Ideal
description: Anibal Rosado was walk ing sideways when he entered the classroom the first morn ing after Christmas vacation. This let him slip furtively be hind the students pressing around the desk of the teach er, Dorothy Boroughs, who was straining to catch the words that went with the music of their excited voices.

title: A New President and Chairman Are Elected at Hamilton Watch
description: The Hamilton Watch Com pany, whose losses for the fiscal year ending Jan. 31 are estimated $15.5million, an nounced yesterday the election of a new president and chair man.

title: Lakers Top Cavaliers, 110105
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 7 (AP)  Happy Hairston scored 25 points and Jerry West, return ing to action after missing one game because of a broken nose, added 23 points tonight as the Los Angeles Lakers downed the Cleveland Cavaliers, 110105.

title: Dance: Ballet Theater Does Ontogeny
description: There was something very curious about American Bal let Theater's performance at the New York City Center Wednesday night. The Ballet Theater management had as sured me that the perform ance was sold out. A friend of mine telephoned the box office for a ticket and was assured that none was avail able.

title: Lindsay Hails the Police Force, But Extends Corruption Inquiry
description: Expressing total confidence in the Police Department, Mayor Lindsay signed a bill yesterday extending for six months the powers of the special commis sion that has been investigating allegations of corruption in the 32,000member organization.

title: Teacher Strike Is Fought
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 7 (AP) The city school board went to court today in an effort to end a partial teacher walkout and announced it would attempt to resume classes Monday on an abbreviated basis. The board petitioned Allegheny County Judge Gwilym Price Jr. for an injunction to halt the fourday old strike by the Pittsburgh Federation of Teachers. A hear ing was set for tomorrow.

title: ADDICT, 21 HANGS HIMSELF IN TOMBS
description: A 21yearold robbery sus Pect and drug addict hanged himself in the. Manhattan House of Detention for Men yesterday, according to the Department of Correction.

title: Suspended Teacher Back
description: LAWRENCE, Mass., Jan. 7 (UPI)Roger Mailloux, an Eng lish teacher at Lawrence High School who was suspended for writing an allegedly obscene fourletter word on a black board during class, returned without incident to his teach ing chores today. A United States Court of Appeals re fused yesterday to grant the Lawrence school board any fur ther delay in reinstating Mr. Mailloux.

title: Hawaii Notches No. 8
description: KINGSTON, R.I., Jan. 7 (AP)  Oncebeaten Hawaii went on a 10point scoring spree in the second half tonight and pulled away to a 9282 victory over Rhode Island. It was Hawaii's eighth victory.

title: Combat Troops to Remain
description: WASHINGTON Jan. 7 (UPI) United States troops are to cease to play a major combat role in Vietnam after May 1, but the Pentagon said today that more than 100,000 Amer ican combat troops would re main there in a security role.

title: Engagements
description: SORRELLFINESTONE. The engagement is announced between Martin Stuart Sorrell, M.A., M.B.A., (Harvard), son of Mr. and Mrs. Jack Sorrell of 135 Millway, MiII Hill, London, N.W. 7., England, and Sandra Carol Ann, daughter of Mrs. Laure Fine stone of 4 Wells Riso, London, N. W. 8., England.

title: Laird, in Bangkok, Pledges More Arms Aid in 1970's
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Jan. 7Secretary of Defense Mel vin R. Laird has assured Thai leaders that United States military aid to Thailand will increase over the next ten years. At a dinner with Thai officials at the residence of Premier Thanom Kittikachorn, Mr. Laird is reported to have pledged that aid would be made available from excess stocks of military equipment.

title: 11 Animals Dead, Others Dying; Abandoned Zoo's Owner Sought
description: MYERTOWN, Pa., Jan. 7 (UPI)Three African lions and eight monkeys were found dead tonight on a reserve known as Rudy's Jungle Playgound. The owner had disappeared.

title: Failing Firms Cost Big Board $68Million
description: The New York Stock Ex change calculated yesterday that the total cost of liquidating 14 of its member firms and providing financial assistance to one other during the crisis on Wall Street would be $68, 731,000.

title: CONGDON OF STARS ACQUIRED BY NETS
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Jan. 7The New York Nets, in an effort to strengthen their backcourt, acquired Jeff Cong don from the Utah Stars today for a future draft choice and a player to be named.

title: CITY HALL WEIGHS PRESIDENTIAL BID Lindsay's Staff Studies His Prospects in Primaries
description: Mayor Lindsay's key aides have studied the election laws of all states that hold Presi dential primaries, with a view toward analyzing the Mayor's chances of making a success ful Presidential bid in 1972.

title: Scribner Is Tested by a Tough Audience, the Student Press
description: Dr. Harvey B. Scribner, who became City School Chancellor last Sept. 1, yesterday faced what turned out to be his toughest audience a group of high school editors and report ers.

title: Bourguiba at Walter Reed
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7  President Bourguiba was ad mitted to Walter Reed Hospital for medical tests yesterday at the designation of Secretary of the Army Stanley R. Resor, a spokesman for the hospital said today.

title: Debate on Recognition of Peking Intensifies for Japan's Leaders
description: TOKYO, Jan. 7Ever since Canada and Italy recognized Communist China last fall, a quiet but intensive debate has been going on within the Jap anese Government over what Premier Eisaku Sato has called the China problem.

title: Advertising:
description: The boobtube generation despite the fears of many has not tuned out news papers, a survey sponsored by an interested party shows.

title: SyngeSong To Resound In Ireland
description: DUBLIN, Jan. 7A great splurge of singsong will mark the centenary of the birth of John Millington Synge in Ireland this year.

title: Delaware Plans Sunday Thoroughbred Racing
description: A bill to permit Sunday horse racing this year at the Delaware Park thoroughbred track in Stanton, Del., will be submitted to the Delaware Leg islature when it convenes next week.

title: FOOD AID, ABUSED, IS CUT IN VIETNAM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 7The United States aid mission in South Vietnam has quietly suspended a significant part of the Food for Peace pro gram after Federal investiga tors uncovered widespread abuses, including the sale of war victims food aid as pig feed.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: BAY STATE REFORM IN TAXES PLEDGED Sargent to Offer a Plan Other Governors Sworn
description: BOSTON, Jan. 7 (UPI)Gov, Francis W. Sargent promised today a tax program designed to provide relief for home owners, to attract new industry and to stimulate Massachusetts sagging economy.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: TRIAL OF PANTHERS ENTERS NEW PHASE
description: The prosecution yesterday completed presentation of evi dence to support its contention in State Supreme Court here that 13 Black Panthers con spired to bomb two police sta tions and a Board of Education building. It then began a new phase of the trial.

title: City Hires a Boiler on a Truck To Heat 6 Harlem Tenements
description: A bulky, 200horsepower mobile boiler unit, rented by the city in an experiment, hummed noisily in a truck in Harlem yesterday, supplying heat to families in six tene ments where the heating sys tems had broken down.

title: Advertising:
description: Young & Rubicam has gotten another account from General Foods, a client since 1924.

title: Las Vegas East
description: To legalize all forms of gambling and thrust the state into the role of licensing or operating gambling casinos so that such activity can be easily taxed, as State Sena for Earl Brydges of Niagara Falls has suggested, would be to turn New York State into another Nevada and New York City into another Las Vegas. It would be to invite here all the undesirable elements that now swarm around the fringes of the roulettecrapsblackjack opera tions wherever they are legal. The fiscal situation in both New York State and City is desperate, but hardly that desperate.

title: Governor Seeking a Curb On Phosphate Detergents
description: ALBANY, Jan. 7Governor Rockefeller plans to seek legislation curtailing the sale of detergents and other clean ing products containing phosphates by next year as part of a steppedup drive against all forms of pollution.

title: WESTERN ELECTRIC DROPS JERSEY PLAN
description: The Western Electric Com pany canceled plans yesterday to move part of its headquar ters from Manhattan to the quiet, rural town of Bedminster, N. J.

title: Casino on North Brother Island Proposed by Two Councilmen
description: City Councilmen Matthew J. Troy Jr. of Queens and Mon roe Cohen of Brooklyn proposed yesterday that uninhabited North Brother Island, in the East River, be turned into the Las Vegas of the East.

title: White House Seeks Installation Of SatelliteControlled Aviation
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7The White House Office of Tele communications Policy said to day that the Government should promote the installation of satellite systems for air naviga tion over the Atlantic and Pacific.

title: Bridge: Small Spot Card, Is the Key To Landing Borderline Game
description: Small spot cards occasion ally have highly significant roles to play. Looking at the diagramed deal, one would not suppose that North's heart six was the crucial card. The five would not have been high enough, as the play demonstrated when the deal occurred recently at the Harmonie Club in New York.

title: Princeton 7858 Victor
description: HANOVER, N. H., Jan. 7 Princeton shot 51 per cent from the floor in the first half to night and used a 26point per formance by Brian Taylor to post a 7858 Ivy League victory over Dartmouth before 1,700 fans at Alumni Gym.

title: Duke Eleven Gets Aide
description: DURHAM, N. C., Jan. 7 (AP) Larry Thompson, a highly successful junior college coach from Iowa, was added today to the staff of Mike McGee, the new head football coach at Duke University.

title: A Tribute to Synge At Lincoln Center
description: Several hundred invited guests raised glasses in trib ute to John Millington Synge, author of The Playboy of the Western World, at a reception last night after the play's opening at Lincoln Center's Repertory Theater. The reception, held in the Patrons Room, off the main lobby, was decorated with photos of western Ireland, Synge's birthplace.

title: Rangers Farm Out Apps
description: The New York Rangers an nounced yesterday that Syl Apps has been assigned to Omaha of the Central Hockey League. Apps, a center, ap peared in 28 National Hockey League games this season and scored one goal and made two assists.

title: Downtown Scene: Dugmore Collages
description: When Clyfford Still went to the San Francisco School of Fine Arts in 1946 as a teacher, it was nothing more than one of the many pedes trian institutions for art edu cation in this country. But Still, a man of powerful per sonality and commanding sensibilities, was able to turn the school from a scriptorium of academics into a dynamic center of artistic creativity to be reckoned with.

title: Italian Red Paper Chides Soviet On Barring Jewish Emigration
description: ROME, Jan. 7  A dispatch from Moscow in the Italian Communist party newspaper L'Unita today said that the Stalinist heritage and a lack of understanding at present were making life difficult for Soviet Jews who wanted to em igrate to Israel.

title: December Sales Up at 8 Large Chains
description: Eight of the country's largest retail chains reported yester day increased sales in Decem ber over the 1969 month, but the gains were not among the year's best monthly increases.

title: Market Place: Show Goes On And On and On
description: If there ever was a Mickey Mouse company, Walt Dis ney Productions isn't it.

title: Invitation to a Trial
description: President Nixon's invitation to fourteen outstanding Soviet scientists to attend Angela Davis's trial, to see for themselves whether she is fairly judged, is a master propaganda stroke in the best sense of the word. Since the message the Soviet scientists sent to the President on Christmas Day implies that Miss Davis was in danger of being railroaded and punished for a crime she did not commit, it would be highly desirable for these observers to attend the trial. We hope the Soviet Gov ernment will accept Mr. Nixon's challenge, and permit them to come.

title: DISCOUNT RATE REDUCED TO 5%
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7The Federal Reserve Board an nounced today another small reduction in its discount rate, following bank lending rates and other shortterm interest rates downward.

title: Sanitationmen Seek 10% Of Pay for Hazards on Job
Gas Reserves Purchased
description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex., Jan. 7 (UPI)The Coastal States Gas Producing Company an nounced today it has con tracted to buy gas reserves estimated at 400 billion cubic feet over the next 15 to 20 years. Deliveries are scheduled to start May 1 at about 75 mil lion cubic feet daily.

title: Students Assail Power Company in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7A group of law students here is seeking to block all advertising and promotional activity by the utility that provides power to the nation's capital on the ground that the utility cannot cope with the existing demand for electricity.

title: Pleasure Boat News
description: Ted Turner isn't the only yachtsman of the year. The young Atlanta millionaire, who outscored Bill Ficker for the Martini & Rossi award last Monday, must share the honor with at least one other world figure, Prime Minister Edward Heath of Britain.

title: Thant Said to Ask Meroy For 6 Doomed in Cameroon
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 7, (Reuters)  Secretary General Thant today called in the Cameroon delegate, Michel Njine, to discuss the death sentences imposed yesterday on six persons, including a Roman Catholic bishop,, in Yaounde.

title: RAIL TONMILEAGE DECLINED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7 Freight traffic on United States railroads and intercity truck tonnage in the week ended Jan. 2 were both below the total volume carried during the corresponding week of the preceding year.

title: Murderer of Two Sentenced to Death By a Judge Upstate
description: UTICA, N. Y., Jan. 7 (AP) A County Court judge today sentenced a convicted murder er, Martin J. Fitzpatrick, to death in the electric chair.

title: Communists Accuse Laird
description: PARIS, Jan. 7The Vietnam ese Communists charged today that Defense Secretary Laird was taking new war plans with him on his visit to Saigon.

title: PROGRESS REPORTED ON TESTTUBE BABIES
description: LONDON, Jan. 7 (AP)Test tube babies moved one step nearer, Nature magazine re ported today, when British scientists recently fertilized two human eggs in a labora tory and grew them to a stage where they might live if im planted in a woman's womb.

title: India Lifts Bank Rate to 6% In Move to Check Inflation
description: BOMBAY, India, Jan. 8 (Reu ters)India raised today its bank rate from 5 per cent to 6 per cent, in a move to check inflationary trends and restrain credit.

title: PRICES ADVANCE FOR SOYBEAN OIL
description: Reports that prices of edible oils, which compete With those for soybeans, had risen in Eu rope created considerable in terest among traders yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: JARRING CONFERS WITH MRS. MEIR
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 8  Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, the United Nations special representative for the Middle East, opened an exchange with the Israeli Gov ernment today, spending two and a half hours with Premier Gold Meir and Foreign Minister Abba Eban.

title: Retail Sales Show One Per Cent Dip; Car Strike Cited
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 Retail sales in November, af fected by the General Motors strike, were down one per cent from October and were only two per cent above No vember, 1969, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Sonics'
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 8 (UPI)Len Wilkens tallied 30 points and Dick Snyder added 26 tonight as the Seattle SuperSonics erased a 17point halftime def icit to beat the Buffalo Braves, 110102.

title: EARL E. ANDERSON, BUSINESS ADVISER
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., Jan. 8 Earl E. Anderson, a former chairman of the executive com mittee and financial vice presi dent of BeechNut Life Savers, Inc., died yesterday at his home, 181 Christopher Street. His age was 84.

title: Books of The Times
description: AMERICA AND RUSSIA IN A CHANGING WORLD. A Half Century of Personal Observation. By W. Averell Harriman. 218 pages. Doubleday. $5.95.

title: NEW FACE SHOWN BY LANA CANTRELL
description: When Lana Cantrell, the Australian singer, first came to this country in 1966, she wore her hair short with a long lock slanting over one eye in the Veronica Lake fashion. Her general appearance suggested an updated flapper and her performances depended a great deal on exuberant energy and lung power.

title: 4 Killed in Baltimore Blast
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 8 (AP) Four persons, including two children, were killed today when an explosion leveled three row houses in East Baltimore. The blast was apparently caused by a gas leak.

title: STATE STUDY ASKS EASED DRUG LAW
description: ALBANY, Jan. 8A state commission that has been work ing closely with Governor Rockefeller's staff win recom mend major reductions in the penalties against users and sellers of marijuana, sources close to the Governor said today.

title: ENGELHARD MINERALS CUTS RHODIUM PRICE
description: The Engelhard Minerals & Chemicals Corporation an nounced yesterday that it would reduce the price of rhodium by $5 a troy ounce to a new sell ing range of $200 to $205 per troy ounce, beginning Monday.

title: TWO SOVIET ARTISTS DROP PERFORMANCES
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 8Two Soviet artists  the conductor Maxim Shostakovich and the violinist Leonid Kogannoti fied the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra today that they would not perform here as scheduled on Jan. 15 and 17 because of the presence of a Russian defector in the cello section.

title: LAKERS CONQUER 76ERS, 123 TO 117
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 8 (UPI)  Gail Goodrich scored 29 points tonight as the Los An geles Lakers defeated the Phila delphia 76ers, 123117, in a National Basketball Association game at the Spectrum.

title: Hawks Place Record 8 Players on National League West AllStar Team
description: Bobby Hull, only 12 goals shy of surpassing Maurice Rich ard as the secondhighest goal scorer in National Hockey League history, was a unani mous choice yesterday to the West Division AllStar team.

title: PNOMPENH BEGINS POWER RATIONING
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Jan. 8 (UPI)The Cambodian Gov ernment, unable to force open its major land route to the sea, imposed electricity rationing in downtown Pnompenh tonight because of a shortage of diesel fuel to run the city's generators.

title: Trudeau Visits Pakistan
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Jan. 8 Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau of Canada expressed general optimism today about a peaceful settlement of the Middle East problem in the long run, but he said that there was no cause for imme diate optimism. Mr. Trudeau and Prime Minister Heath of Britain visited Pakistan on their way to Singapore to at tend the Commonwealth Prime Ministers conference.

title: SCIENCE SUBSIDIES TRACED BY CONANT
description: President Truman's veto in 1947 of the original bill to cre ate the National Science Foun dation permitted the contro versial subsidy of American basic research by the military to come about, Dr. James B. Conant says.

title: PRO MUSICA CONCERT SHOWS IMMEDIACY
description: The New York Pro Musica brought its ancient instruments to Tully Hall Wednesday night for one of its rare concerts of Renaissance instrumental mu sic. As always, the Pro Musica showed that the world hasn't changed completely in the last 500 years.

title: Haywood Allowed to  Play
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan.8 (UPI) Spencer Haywood was per mitted to continue playing for the Seattle SuperSonics of the National Basketball Association for at least 10 more days under a ruling handed down today by a Federal judge.

title: Bridge: Prospects of a Grand Slam Hazy Until Dummy Shows
description: The textbook advice, based on the scoring table, is to bid a grand slam that has two chances in three of success, and a small slam that has a 5050 chance.

title: FRENCH BANK RATE LOWERED TO 6%
description: PARIS, Jan. 8The principal French lending rate was cut from 7 per cent to 6 per cent today as the trend of lower in terest rates accelerated in the industrialized Western coun tries.

title: The Uninvited
description: They're holding a wedding, but they have neglected to invite the bride.

title: Sports of The Times
description: YONKERS, Jan. 7Howie the Horse, as he now refers to himself, was expected at Yonkers and a spokesman for the trotting track was a little worried. What we don't want, the man said, is this place being used for a stage for sensationalism in our own backyard that's going to give us a bad name. The man explained that The Horse had been invited to speak to a meeting of harnessracing writers, publicists and handicappers long before offtrack betting and Howard J. Samuels had stopped looking like such a sure thing.

title: DIEHL AND MENO TAKE MILE RACES
description: HANOVER, N. H., Jan. 8 Charlie Diehl of Boston College and Skip Meno of Colgate shared the spotlight tonight in the second United States Track and Field Federation Eastern Regional track meet at Dart mouth College's Leverone Field house.

title: Alan Marks Excels in Piano Recital
description: Alan Marks is one of those astonishing young pianists who come before the public ready and able to play anything you might name, at whatever tempo demanded, with intelligence and good taste.

title: Man in the News
description: One day last spring, four small boys abandoned their streetcorner softball game in Harlem to stare at a curi ously dressed man clinging to the side of a fire engine as it sped by in response to an alarm.

title: In Tunisia, It's Population Explosion vs. Women's Lib
description: TUNIS, Tunisia This country was shocked recently to learn that it has a high 3 per cent annual population growth rate, and not 2.2 per cent as had been generally believed.

title: 90 Reported Killed In Crash of Airliner In Soviet on Dec. 31
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 8 (UPI)  Aviation sources said today that 90 persons were killed when a Soviet Aeroflot airliner crashed and disintegrated dur ing takeoff from Leningrad's Smolny Airport on New Year's Eve.

title: Primary for Rivers's Seat
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Jan. 9 (AP)  The chairman of South Carolina's Democratic party, Harry M. Lightsey Jr., says he will recommend that his execu tive committee set Feb. 23 for a special primary to fill the seat left vacant by the death of Representative L. Mendel Rivers.

title: Histrionics on Taxi Rule
description: Harry Van Arsdale, ringmaster of New York City's perpetually embattled trade unionists, proved he was no David Merrick with the theatrical performance he staged for the City Council this week in the hope of killing the projected Taxicab Commission.

title: RAYMOND FLICKER, PUBLISHER, DEAD
description: W. Raymond Flicker, presi dent, treasurer and general manager of the Post Publishing Company of Bridgeport, Conn., died yesterday in New York Hospital after a long illness. He was 73 years old and lived in Fairfield, Conn.

title: Percentage Gains
description: Stocks with the largest per centage gains on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday:

title: Article 12  No Title
description: WENGEN, Switzerland, Jan. 8 (AP)  The classic Lauber horn downhill ski race, gen erally considered one of the toughest of the European rac ing season, was canceled today because of lack of snow.

title: SOVIET SAID TO ASK ANTIMISSILE CURB
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8So viet arms negotiators are re ported to have suggested that the Soviet Union and the United States take a first step toward limiting the strategic arms race with an agreement to restrict their antimissile defense sys tems to national command posts in Washington and Mos cow.

title: Six Funeral Homes In Area Are Fined For Bill Violations
description: ALBANY, Jan, 8  The State Health Department announced today that it had imposed fines totaling $3,200 on six funeral establishments in the New York metropolitan area and their officials for violating consumer protection provisions of the Public Health Law.

title: Seminary Here Transformed From Dead to Vibrant School
description: New York Theological Sem inary, which was given up for dead a year ago, is now alive and thriving, according to its president, the Rev. George W. Webber.

title: Gromyko Gives Beam Stern Protest on Explosion
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 8  Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko de livered a stern protest today to the United States Ambassa dor, Jacob D. Beam, over the bomb blast at a Soviet Em bassy building in Washington this morning.

title: An Offshore 4th Jetport Is Suggested by Lindsay
description: Mayor Lindsay called yes terday for prompt action by New York and New Jersey state officials to get a fourth major jetport built in the metropolitan area.

title: Quadruplets Born in Idaho
description: JEROME, Idaho, Jan. 8 (AP) Quadruplet girls were born to day to a truck driver's wife at St. Benedict's Hospital here. The Mother, Mrs. William Springer, 22 years old, of Twin Falls, Idaho, and the girls were re ported doing fine despite a breach birth. Three of the girls weighed 2 pounds 6 ou??es each and one weighed 2 pounds 1 ounce.

title: Slayings of 2 Queens Students Are Called Ritualistic Murder
description: McCONNELLSBURG, Pa., Jan. 8 (AP)The slaying by torture of two nursing students from New York City was described today as a ritualist murder that involved narcotics.

title: Bruce Marks Dances Traitor With American Ballet Theater
description: The Traitor by Jose Limn is one of those ballets that one is almost compelled to like be cause of Its thematic serious ness and high moral tone. It is Also a ballet of monumental choreographic dullness, setting ??n ??rreproachable hero on a pedestal asking to be under mined. American Ballet Theater presented the work Thursday evening for the first time this season during its brief stay at New York City Center.

title: Bronx BailJumpers Promised Amnesty and Then Crackdown
description: District Attorney Burton B. Roberts of the Bronx yesterday announced an amnesty to be followed by a crackdown on bail and parole jumpers in mis demeanor cases.

title: Ship Ablaze in Caribbean; 690 Escape in Lifeboats
description: The French cruise liner An tilles ran aground and then caught fire off a tiny island in the Caribbean last night, forcing 690 passengers and crew mem bers to abandon the burning ship.

title: Charles Frost, 75, Industrialist And a Philanthropist, Is Dead
description: Charles Frost, a Certified Public Accountant, a developer of industrial companies and, in later years, a philanthropist, died yesterday after a long illness at his New York resi dence in the Wyndham Hotel, 42 West 58th Street. He was 75 years old.

title: BOMBING ASSAILED BY JEWISH GROUPS
description: Jewish groups here and in the capital denounced the bombing in Washington yesterday of a Soviet culture office, as they have other acts of violence against Soviet installations.

title: The Tallk of Nowy Targ.
description: NOWY TARG, Poland, Jan. 8The visitor to a mountain village near Nowy Targ in southern Poland comes from Warsawonly six hours away on snowy roadsbut he might as well be coming from another country.

title: Susumu Kobe, 67, Expert On Transportation for U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 8Susumu Kobe, a Japa nese expert on transportation questions, died Wednesday at University Hospital after a heart attack. He was 67 years old and lived at 179 East 44 Street.

title: Celtics Down Suns
description: BOSTON, Jan. 8 (AP)The Boston Celtics, led by John Havlicek and Jo Jo White, opened a commanding early lead tonight and then foiled a Phoenix challenge in the clos ing minutes for a 122114 vic tory over the Suns.

title: Connecticut Welfare Head
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 8 (UPI) Gov. Thomas J. Meskill named a Hartford businessman today to be Connecticut's Welfare Commissioner. The appointee was Henry C. White, a who had been a member of Mr. Meskill's gubernatorial cmapign commit tee. The Welfare job was vacat ed Tuesday by John F. Harder. The post pays $23,866 a year.

title: Rabies Warning Is Issued To 100 Tourists of Mexico
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 8 (AP)The National Center for Disease Control here is looking for about 100 Americans and Ca nadians who may have con tracted rabies from an animal chained in front of a hotel in western Mexico in the last two weeks of December, a spokes man said today.

title: MET DEBUT IS MADE BY MORRIS IN AIDA
description: For James Morris at the Met ropolitan Opera, so far, so good. The young bass from Baltimore (he has also sung with the Santa Fe and other regional companies, as well as in South America) sang the King in Ver di's Aida In his debut with the Met Thursday night.

title: Smith Leads Coast Golf by 2 Strokes
BRAZIL WILL FREE 70 TO RANSOM BUCHER
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan. 8 After a month of stubborn negotiations, the Brazilian Government tonight agreed to free 70 prisoners of its choos ing to ransom Giovanni Enrico Bucher, Switzerland's Ambas sador to Brazil, who was kid napped Dec. 7.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Laird in Saigon for Talks on Troop Withdrawals
description: SAIGON, South Vietnain, Jan. 8Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird arrived in Saigon to night to discuss the pace of future American troop with drawals from Vietnam.

title: Stocks Off on London Board; Frankfurt Market Shows Rise
Computer as Cupid Assailed by Clients
description: There was the longdistance runner, 140 pounds and 6 feet 1, who said the computer dating service matched him with a girl who stood 5 feet 2 and weighted 180 pounds.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: JOBLESS RATE UP TO 6% IN NATION; HIGHEST SINGE '61
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8  The nation's unemployment rate rose to 6 per cent in December, despite the end of the General Motors strike, to reach its highest level in nine years. The November rate was 5.8 per cent.

title: SOLTI ERA BEGINS FOR PARIS MUSIC
description: PARIS, Jan. 8Georg Solti opened the Solti era in the musical life of Paris Wednes day night, conducting the Or chestre de Paris in Gustav Mah ler's. Ninth. Yesterday, at the Thatre des ChampsElyses, he followed up with a press con ference about his plans.

title: Bok, Harvard Law Dean, Picked to Head University
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8The Harvard Corporation has se lected Derek Curtis Bok, the 40yearolddean of the Harvard Law School, as its nominee for the presidency of Harvard University.

title: Charges by Reagan
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Jan. 8 (AP)Governor Reagan ac cused Federal welfare officials today of harassing him and trying to cover up a blunder by canceling the decision to cut off welfare aid to California.

title: ABBATIELLO HURT IN YONKERS SPILL
description: YONKERS, Jan. 8  Carmine Abbatiello was involved in a serious spill in the fourth race at Yonkers Raceway tonight, causing the driver to miss the remainder of the program and possibly be out for a longer times

title: Final Decision Set In Dumping Cases By U.S. Treasury
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8The Treasury made final today three major dumping findings affecting imports from Japan and Britain.

title: Semiz and 4 Others Gain Finals For U.S. Open Bowling Today
description: ST. PAUL, Jan. 8 (UPI) Teater Semiz, a 36yearold professional from River Edge, N. J., rolled a finalgame 254 tonight to lead four others into tomorrow's finals of the first United States open bowl ing tournament.

title: U.S. Sends More Copters And Flood Aid to Malaysia
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 8 (UPI) Four more United States Army helicopters and 12 tons of relief and medical sup plies were delivered today to aid flood victims in Malaysia, the United States Air Force an nounced.
