title: City Acts to Seal 33 Apartment House Incinerators
description: The city has taken the first step toward ordering a shut down of apartment incinerators and commercial oil burners for violation of its airpollution control law since the law was upheld by the state Court of Appeals two months ago.

title: Russian Asserts Hoodlums Trail Diplomats
description: The spokesman for the Soviet Mission to the United Nations said that Soviet diplo mats had been followed yester day on foot and by car by gangs of hoodlums from the Jewish Defense League as major Jewish leaders and Gov ernment officials condemned harassment of Russians in the United States.

title: Text of Statement by Nixon on Changes in Depreciation Provisions
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 11The following is the text of President Nixon's statement on depreciation re form:

title: Virginia Deals South Carolina 3d Loss in 4 Games, 5049
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., Jan. 11 (AP)Barry Parkhill's 15 foot jump shot with seven seconds left gave the Univer sity of Virginia a 5049 basket ball victory over South Caro lina tonight as the Gamecocks went down to their third defeat in the last four games.

title: ALBERT L.WARNER,67, REPORTER IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 Albert Lyman Warner, a former legislative correspond ent for The New York Times, died in George Washington Uni versity Hospital today. He was 67 years old.

title: Manhattan Beaten, 9668
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Jan. 11  Ron King's 28 points led Florida State to a 9668 victory over Manhattan tonight. The Jaspers led at halftime 4039.

title: 31,000 ASK RECALL OF MAYOR WHELAN
description: JERSEY CITY, Jan. 11More than 31,000 signed petitions de manding a special recall elec tion to replace Mayor Thomas J. Whelan and seven of the nine City Councilmen here were filed today with the City Clerk.

title: Dying for a Cigarette
description: Once again the Royal College of Physicians has taken the lead in the anticigarette smoking campaign with a frightening new warning, plus practical alternatives for tobacco addicts. What the prestigious British medical society says should be heeded on this side of the Atlantic, too, for there is nothing nationalistic about lung cancer, heart disease and other disabling ailments.

title: HOFFA LOSES PLEA ON 2D JAIL TERM
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11  James R. Hoffa, the imprisoned president of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, lost his bid to avert a new fiveyear prison term today as the Su preme Court refused to hear his appeal of a conviction for diverting union pension funds.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Being an American of Greek descent and having visited Greece this past summer, may I comment on your Dec. 30 editorial More Tyranny for Greece, and on your seeming oppo sition to a stanch ally of the U.S.

title: JARRING CONVEYS ISRAELI PROPOSAL TO EGYPT'S ENVOY
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 11Indirect Arab  Israeli peace talks approached the negotiation stage today as Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, the United Nations intermediary, con veyed to an Egyptian repre sentative the outlines of an Is raeli proposal for a settlement.

title: BALLOTING AT 18 PASSES IN ALBANY; REFERENDUM DUE
description: ALBANY, Jan. 11The State Senate and the Assembly gave overwhelming, final legislative approval today to a proposed amendment to the State Consti tution that would lower the vot ing age from 21 to 18 in all state and local elections.

title: SO. AFRICA WOOS MISS GOOLAGONG
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Jan. 11 (Reuters)Alf Chalmers, president of the South African Tennis Union, said today the union would in vite Evonne Goolagong, the 19 yearold Australian aborigine star, to play in the South Afri can championships in April.

title: Edwin W. Heister, Served Hearst Advertising Unit
description: POMPANO BEACH Fla., Jan. 11Edwin W. Heister, a retired Hearst newspaper advertising executive, died Saturday in North Broward Hospital after a short illness. He was 63 years old.

title: Rampal Blends With Juilliard Quartet
description: Any concert program on which the most familiar piece is Webern's Five Movements for String Quartet (Op. 5) starts off promisingly in these days when creeping standardization is a knife held at traditional music's throat. The Webern came as a shrewdly placed and totally effective interlude in Sunday night's concert at Alice Tully Hall by the Juilliard String Quartet and its guest, the virtuosic flutist JeanPierre Rampal.

title: Chief of Survey Ship Named
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 (AP) Capt. Robert C. Munson is the new commanding officer of the ocean survey ship Dis coverer, flagship of the Atlantic fleet of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administra tion, the agency announced recently.

title: Market Place: The Certificate,  A Costly Burden
description: Two years ago, before Goodbody & Co.'s backof fice problems began to threaten the firm's existence, some believe the elimination of the stock certificate might have saved the firm.

title: BERTRAM LEWIN, A PSYCHOANALYST
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 11  Dr. Bertram D. Lewin, visiting pro fessor of psychoanalysis at the Western Psychiatric Institute and Clinic of the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine, died Friday at his home in nearby Pipersville. He was 74 years old.

title: 2 AGENCIES FIGHT DRUNKEN DRIVING
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 Two Federal agencies concerned with alcoholism and highway safety joined forces today in an attack on drunken driving, which is held responsible for 28,000 highway traffic deaths every year.

title: Top Senior Golfer Named
description: NORWALK, Conn., Jan. 11 Curtis Person, 60yearold auto mobile dealer from Memphis, has been named senior golfer of the year by Golf Digest mag azine for the fifth straight time. He dominated the circuit by capturing five major tourna ments.

title: OTTO M. SMUCKER
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 11 (UPI) Otto M. Smucker, former finan cial editor of The Chicago Sun Times, died yesterday in St. Anthony's Hospital, Michigan City, Ind. He was 81 years old, and since his retirement in 1960 had lived in Sawyer, Mich.

title: Rutgers Routs Gettysburg
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Jan. 11 (AP)Gene Arnstead tallied 25 points and four other Rutgers players scored in dou ble figures tonight as the Scar let Knights crushed a smaller Gettysburg team, 10172.

title: Russell Suffers Setback In Respiratory Sickness
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 (AP) Senator Richard B. Russell, Democrat of Georgia, has suf fered a setback in his efforts to shake off a respiratory ail ment, an aide said today.

title: FOOD STAMPS BILL SIGNED BY PRESIDENT
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 11 (UPI)  President Nixon signed into law today compro mise legislation easing the cost of food stamps to the poor, but restricting the program to fam ilies whose ablebodied adults are willing to accept work.

title: NAVY DELAYS PLANS TO DEPLOY POSEIDON
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 (AP) Plans of the Navy to deploy the first multiple warhead Po seidon missiles this month have been set backperhaps until next springby production problems.

title: Draft Chief Hails Lottery as Equitable
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11Dr. Curtis W. Tarr, the Director of Selective Service, said to day that the draft lottery sys tem without qualifications had been effective and much more equitable than the system it replaced.

title: New York Reserve Bank Reports Record Earnings
description: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday that its earnings and the re sulting payments to the Treas ury rose to records last year.

title: NEWS LOSES APPEAL IN DIVORCE LIBEL SUIT
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11The Supreme Court declined today to disturb a ruling by New York's highest court that makes the news media subject to suits for libel and invasion of privacy for publishing articles based upon allegations in di vorce actions.

title: Chairman of Correction Board Seeks, the Power to Subpoena
description: The chairman of the Board of Correction said yesterday he would ask the City Council to grant the agency scubpoena power. This would compel wit nesses to come forward with testimony involving alleged mis treatment of prisoners in city jails.

title: A.A.U. Backs Hurdle Mark Pending Receipt of Data
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 11 (UPI) The Amateur Athletic Union approved today the world rec ordtying performance of Tom Hill of Arkansas State in the 120yard hurdles last June, pending receipt of information missing on the original record application.

title: U.S. Protests Harassment Of Americans in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 11The United States Embassy pro tested to the Soviet Government today against what is con sidered an officially inspired campaign of harassment and vandalism against Americans in Moscow.

title: The President and the Press
description: WASHINGTONFrom what I have been hearing and reading recently, it appears to me that the Presidential news conference is in deep trouble, endangered both by its alleged friends and its known enemies.

title: Britain and U.S. Pull Out Of U.N. Colonialism Unit
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 11The United States and Britain withdrew today from membership in the United Na tions' Colonialism Committee. Both countries have long been critical of the committee's work and have complained, at least privately, that its resolutions are onesided and forced through by members from the AfricanAsian and Communist blocs.

title: To Them, Two Children Are Fine, but Three Crowd the World
description: Mrs. Shirley Lewis raised two fingers in the Vshaped peace sign yesterday and said she had her own mean ing for the gesture.

title: Unitas Lauds Cowboys;
description: MIAMI, Jan. 11With one of his hightopped football shoes propped on a wooden box that had been arranged as his personal podium, John Unitas attempted today to minimize the Super Bowl as another game.

title: POLICEMAN ACCUSED IN NARCOTICS BRIBE
description: A Brooklyn plainclothes pa trolman was accused yesterday of shaking down a narcotics dealer whom he had arrested on charges of possessing $250, 000 worth of heroin.

title: Party Chief Ousted in Szczecin In Aftermath of Riots in Poland
description: WARSAW, Jan. 11The Communist party chief in Szczecin Province was dis missed today in what is be lieved to be the start of a wide spread replacement of party officials associated with dis turbances last month.

title: Antitrust Violations Laid To Kennecott Copper
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 (AP)The Government charged the Kennecott Copper Corporation today with using recipro cal purchasing agreements in an attempt to monopolize requirements of actual and potential suppliers and cu tomers.

title: HEARING REFUSED IN CUDAHY CO.CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 (AP)The United States Su preme Court refused today to grant a hearing on an appeal to reverse a $612,000 judgment against a former board chair man of the Cudahy Company in a stock deal involving in sider information.

title: WILLIAM W. HEDGES
description: MADISON, N. J., Jan. 11 William Ward Hedges of 21 Ridgedale Avenue, a senior vice president of Marsh & McLen nan who was known as a spe cialist in casualty insurance, died yesterday in Overlook Hos pital, Summit, after a short illness. He was 51 years old.

title: Plea Filed in Derby Case
description: FRANKFORT, Ky., Jan. 11 (UPI)The Kentucky State Rac ing Commission today formally appealed a court ruling that awarded the $122,600 purse from the disputed 1968 Ken tucky Derby to Dancer's Image. The notice, filed in Franklin County Court, said the appeal would be carried to the state's highest court, the Kentucky Court of Appeals, within 60 days.

title: A Summary of Supreme Court Actions
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11  The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Pros Beat Colonels
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 11 (AP) Steve Jones and Charlie Williams le da thirdperiod out burst tonight as the Memphis Pros rallied and beat Kentucky, 121107.

title: Loew's Paradise Pushed As Bronx Arts Center
description: The Bronx needs and can easily sustain a cultural cen ter for the performing arts, according to Borough Presi dent Robert Abrams.

title: Two Gas Explosions Disrupt the Elegant Life on East 57th Street Block
description: One of the city's more ele gant blocks was jolted and covered with broken glass early yesterday by two un derground explosions of gas ignited by burning electrical cables.

title: Bridge: The Guess Still Has Its Place In Bidding Despite Theories
description: Notrump opening bids and responses might seem to be a wellexplored field. With a welldefined opening bid, a variety of natural responses, and several conventions, such as Stayman and Jacoby Transfer Bids, available to solve special problems, one might suppose that there are no theoretical worlds to con quer.

title: 3 STORES DESTROYED BY HARLEM BLAZE
description: A threealarm fire destroyed three stores in Harlem's central shopping area last night and extended briefly into the third floor of Blumstein's department store at 230 West 125th Street.

title: Vietnamese Force Arrives
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Jan. 11 (Reuters)  A South Viet namese task force commanded by a general arrived today at Kompong Som.

title: Goodby to the Now Generation
description: These excerpts are from an interview with John Lennon that appears in the January 7 edition of Rolling Stone magazine. The interview was conduct ed by Jann Wenner, editor of Rolling Stone. Lennon was a member of the Beatles, the recently disbanded British rock group.

title: Garden Halts Mail Sale Of AliFrazier Tickets
description: No more mail orders for tickets for the Joe Frazier Muhammad Ali heavyweight title bout are being accepted, Madison Square Garden an nounced yesterday.

title: India to Govern a State
description: NEW DELHI, Jan. 11Oris sa state on the eastern coast was put under the administra tion of the central government today following the collapse of the state government. It is as sumed that elections for the state assembly wil be held in March.

title: Great Southwest Puts Its Loss at $100Million
description: The Great Southwest Corpo ration, a Dallasbased real es tate company, told its stock holders yesterday that its op erating and extraordinary loss for 1970, coupled with a pos sible reversal of previously reported profits, could amount to in excess of $100million.

title: Japan Seeks Soviet Accord to Halt Seizure of Fishing Boats
description: TOKYO, Jan. 11  The Jap anese Government has tempo rarily suspended its long cam paign to regain Sovietheld is lands in the southern Kuriles in order to focus on another major irritant in otherwise cordial SovietJapanese rela tions: the continual seizures of Japanese fishermen and boats by Soviet patrol craft in waters surrounding the disputed is land.

title: F.T.C. ASKS RULES ON ADS FOR RADIOS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 (UPI) The Federal Trade Commis sion, alleging wide abuse by industry, proposed rules today for the advertising of radios, phonographs and other home audio equipment.

title: Penn Central Turnaround Seen
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 11 (UPI)A trustee of the Penn Central Railroad testified to day that there was a reason able prospect the debtridden carrier could be turned around in three to five years.

title: The President of Harvard
description: The appointment of Derek Curtis Bok as the 25th president of Harvard is symbolic of the beginning of a new era for the nation's oldest and most prestigious university. His scholarly credentials are impeccable; but what clearly recommended him even more were an experience and a temperament attuned to the present scene of social as well as academic upheaval.

title: Accountants Finish A Set of Guidelines On Life Insurance
description: The American Institute of Certified Public Accountants, after almost a year of behind thescenes activity, announced yesterday that it had completed its proposed new guidelines to reform accounting procedures in the lifeinsurance industry. The longexpected move fol lowed by only a few days the announcement by Investors Di versified Services, the largest mutualfund organization in the country, that it was changing to the new method of account ing in its lifeinsurance opera tions.

title: Articles on Neediest Elicit Donations From Young
description: Although 14yearold Ellen Shapiro of Flushing, Queens, is not a sentimental person, she told the Neediest Cases Fund that she had been troubled by the summaries of needy cases in The New York Times.

title: ComdenGreen Team a Delight In Reprise of Musical Career
description: The trouble with the Broad way musical theaterwell, one of the troublesis that there is no show now running in which Betty Comden and Adolph Green can be singing, dancing and otherwise execut ing their own songs.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The time when a pollutionfree engine replaces all those in use by all means of transportation is still far distant. As the air we breathe gets worse, a return to mass rail trans portation will be forced upon us by nature herself. Our need for rapid transport will still be with us. Thus there is a need for longhaul, high speed rail transport. [Editorial Jan. 11.]

title: HONEYWELL UNVEILS 3 NEW COMPUTERS
description: Honeywell, Inc., introduced yesterday three computers as additions to its previously an nounced Model 115 line.

title: Controlling Nuclear Pollution
description: A recent Federal district court ruling that the Atomic Energy Commission has exclusive power to regulate radioactive pollution from nuclear power plants may be legally correct but it is certainly not sound policy for a nation concerned about protecting its environment.

title: Sports of The Times
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Jan. 11At least Craig Morton now knows he won't have to use sign language to call the plays for Dallas against the Baltimore Colts in the Super Bowl. The Cowboy quarterback has filled the role of a strong, silent man for a week. Last night he was able to whisper. Today he talked normally. By Sunday he'll be barking out the numbers.

title: Judge Orders End to Phone Strike
description: Fifteen hundred repairmen and installers struck the New York Telephone Company yes terday but were ordered last night by a Federal judge to return to work or pay heavy and progressively more severe fines for violating a court or der.

title: Coed Leads R.O.T.C. Unit
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Jan. 11 (UPI)Susan Orkins, a 22year old senior at Ohio State Univer sity, has become the first woman to command a Reserve Officers Training Corps unit at the uni versity and will give orders to nearly 650 cadets, most of them men.

title: Sadat Explains Stand
description: CAIRO, Jan. 11  President Anwar elSadat has told the Egyptian people that a refusal to extend the ceasefire in the Suez Canal area beyond Feb. 5 would not necessarily mean an immediate allout war with Israel.

title: Appeal to Dobrynin
description: Ambassador Dobrynin was asked by the Overseas Press Club of America yesterday to use his influence to halt at tacks on American newsmen in Moscow. A telegram was sent to the ambassador in Washington by Will Oursler, president of the club, and Victor Riesel, chairman of the Freedom of the Press committee.

title: PACERS BEAT STARS IN BATTLE FOR FIRST
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 11 (AP) The Indiana Pacers overcame an early 7point deficit and went on to defeat the Utah Stars, 111101, in the American Basketball Association tonight.

title: HOLY CROSS PLANS TO ADMIT WOMEN
description: Holy Cross College an nounced yesterday that after three years of study it had de cided to admit women as full time students beginning in Sep tember, 1972.

title: JACKSON W. SMART OF ACCOUNTING FIRM
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 11Jackson W. Smart, a retired senior part ner of Touche, Ross & Co., an international public accounting firm, died of a heart attack Friday in. Palm Springs, Fla. He was 72 years old.

title: REV. FRANCIS DEMASI
description: The Rev. Francis P. DeMasi, an assistant priest at the Ro man Catholic Church of the Transfiguration on Mott Street in Manhattan's Chinatown and a member of the Maryknoll order of missioners, died yes terday in BeekmanDowntown Hospital after a long illness. He was 48 years old.

title: New Weather Aide Named
description: NEWARK, Jan. 11 (AP)Er nest O. Schutter has been ap pointed head of the Newark Air port officer of the National Weather Service, it was an nounced today. Mr. Schutter, 43 year old, replaces Carl Boeth ling, who recently retired. Mr. Schutter is a veteran of 22 years with the agency. He was previously a weather service specialist at the Municipal Air port in Bridgeport, Conn.

title: FUTURE BRIGHTER ON E.E.C. PARITIES
description: ARNHEM, the Netherlands, Jan. 11  Prospects have im proved for the resolution of two major monetary questions  ways to make it easier for countries to change their cur rency parities and the problem of establishing a single cur rency area in the European Economic Community.

title: Steel Makers SetAside For Defense Cut by 21%
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 (AP) The Commerce Department said today that steel producers would be required to set aside 21 per cent less steel for de fense purposes in the first three months of the year than in the previous quarter.

title: Miss Kinoy Challenges Grant of Immunity to Compel Testimony
description: A provision of the 1970 Fed eral Omnibus Crime Bill was challenged on constitutional grounds yesterday by lawyers for the 21yearold daughter of a Rutgers University law pro fessor.

title: British Open a College for Dropouts
description: BLETCHLEY, England, Jan. 8The students are taxi driv ers, sanitationmen, secre taries, clerks, teachers and housewives.

title: China Acts to Bar Escapes to Hong Kong
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 11The Chinese Communists have or dered more stringent border controls to prevent people from fleeing to Hong Kong, according to copies of a security directive that have reached here.

title: BUSINESS TAX CUT ORDERED BY NIXON
description: Text of President's statement is printed on Page 44.

title: Ruth's Record: Aaron Pressing, but Mays Is Relaxed
description: The two men who have the best shot at Babe Ruth's ca reer record of 714 home runs have contrasting attitudes to ward their pursuit.

title: Alcindor Looms as Dominant In N.B.A AllStar Test Tonight
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 11The long, lean shadow of Lew Al cindor dominated the players arriving for practice for to morrow night's 21st annual Na tional Basketball Association AllStar game at the Sports Arena.

title: Navy's War With Culebra Ends in a Truce
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Jan. 11  The 18monthold cold war between the Navy and the tiny island of Culebra ended in a truce today as Secretary of the Navy John H. Chafee signed an agreement that surrenders most of the Navy's control over the island.

title: British Curb ForeignCurrency Loans
description: LONDON, Jan. 11Curbs on shortterm borrowings of for eign currency were announced tonight by the British Treasury in a move to heighten the ef fectiveness of this country's tightmoney policy.

title: Bill for Racing on Sunday Introduced in Legislature
description: ALBANY, Jan. 11 (AP)A bill that would permit Sunday horse racing was introduced in the Legislature today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Nixon to Dedicate Center
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 11 (UPI)  The Republican Na tional Committee announced today that President Nixon would take part Friday in the dedication of the Dwight D. Eisenhower National Republi can Center here. Mrs. Eisen hower is expected to cut the ribbon to officially open the building.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: NIXON CONDEMNS INCREASE IN BETHLEHEM STEEL PRICE AND HINTS AT IMPORT RISE
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 12President Nixon condemn ed today a decision by the Beth lehem Steel Corporation to raise prices on some of its prod ucts and indicated that he might permit increases in steel imports to dissuade Bethle hem's competitors from follow ing suit.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: FLUSHING NATIONAL BANK IS STILL OFFERING FREE CHECKING ACCOUNTS FOR SENIOR CITIZENS 53 AND OVER. CALL FL 84400. Advtg.

title: HORACE FLICKINGER, INSURANCE OFFICER
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 12 Hor ace D. Flickinger, executive di rector of the General Agents and Managers Conference of the National Association of Life Underwriters, died of a heart ailment Friday. He was 57 years old.

title: Jackie DeShannon, Experienced at 26, Singing at the Copa
description: Jackie DeShannon, a small, slim girl whose straight, blond hair floods down across her shoulders, is making her New York cafe debut at the Copa cabana, but she is no neophyte.

title: The New Corruption
description: Vice President Agnew has been unusually quiet in recent weeks. But he may not merely be resting from his arduous political campaign efforts. If the reports and speculations emanating from Washington are correct, the nation is about to see a new Agnew.

title: English Take 274Run Lead Over Australia in 4th Test
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 12 (Reuters)England headed for victory in the fourth cricket test with Australia today with a secondinnings score of 178 runs for three wickets and a lead of 274 runs with two days left for play. Darkness ended play.

title: Live Show for WindowShoppers
description: Patrice Verhaaren, who is 17 years old and a student at the Katharine Gibbs School, had her hair cut yesterday. It was somewhat of an oc casion. For one thing, Miss Verhaaren rarely lets anyone come near her waistlength hair with scissors, and when she does, it's riot in full view of hundreds of noonday shoppers on 34th Street.

title: Poor Start at Albany
description: As the New York State Assembly got down to business this week, the dead hand of the past was omnipresent.

title: BLOUNT ASSESSES 2 YEARS IN OFFICE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12  Postmaster General Winton M. Blount forecast today that the conversion of the Post Office from a Cabinet department to a semiindependent public corpo ration would be completed by June 30.

title: Democracy for Kashmir?
description: Parliamentary democracy resides with the people, India's Prime Minister Indira Gandhi declared recently in announcing plans for a general election early this year. That is why we have decided to go to our people and to seek a fresh mandate from them.

title: Bridge: Strange Maneuver Proves A Bonanza for Weaker Side
description: In a competitive auction the weaker side can some times indulge in strange maneuvers. Suppose, for ex ample, that an opening bid of one notrump is doubled and that the next player bids two clubs. This is not a con ventional Stayman bid, but is ostensibly a club suit.

title: Quiet Old Village Near London Fights Plan for a New Airport
description: STEWKLEY, England, Jan 21Agatha Christie's Miss Marple, that shrewd exem plar of village life, could live in Stewkley it typifies the miraculous survival of village and countryside in this populous island.

title: Hargan Signs for $30,000
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 12 (AP) Steve Hargan, who had an 113 pitching record last year, signed with the Cleveland Indians to day at a salary estimated at $30,000.

title: NEW COKE PROCESS SAID TO BE CLEANER
description: The Allied Chemical Corpo ration announced yesterday that it had developed a new pipelinecharging system that had the potential of reducing smoke and gases from byprod uct cokes by as much as 70 per cent.

title: North Vietnamese Shift to Vast Construction Drive
description: THAIBINH, North Vietnam In what appears to be a cal culated shift of emphasis, thousands of young North Viet namese men and women of military conscription age have been assigned to development of the home front.

title: Sports of The Times
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Jan. 12  When Bob Hayes walked proudly toward the victory podium in Tokyo to receive his gold medal for winning the Olympic 100meter championship in 1964, he was wearing a cowboy hat, There was nothing symbolic about it and it was no portent of the future. At that time the newest world's fastest human had no knowledge he would some day be burning up the gridiron for the Dallas Cowboys.

title: Police Kill Assailant
description: A man identified as Louis Angel Rolan, 25 years old, of 709 Franklin Delano Roosevelt Drive, on the Lower East Side, was shot to death early today by policemen attached to the narcotics division. The shoot ing, in the thirdfloor hallway of the building, came as Rolan, one of four men escaping from the policemen, drew a pistol at Patrolman John Rainey, who fired first and killed his assail ant.

title: Pension Plan Advanced For Track Stablehands
description: New York horsemen took a significant step forward yesterday In their campaign to develop a workable pen sion fund for stablehands at Aqueduct, Belmont Park and Saratoga.

title: Panther Bullet Hit Belt, Witness Says
description: A patrolman testified yester day that during a shoot  out near the Harlem River Drive with two Black Panthers, one of their bullets went through the summons pouch he wore at his belt.

title: Robot Theory Cited in Defense Of Manson's 3 CoDefendants
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 12The trial of Charles M. Manson and the three women who are ac cused of having carried out the murders that he allegedly or dered neared an end today with the completion of two weeks of defense summations.

title: Patrick Magee of Britain Will Play Daniel Webster
description: Patrick Magee, one of Eng land's bestknown actors, who was seen here as the Marquis de Sade in Marat/Sade, will portray Daniel Webster in the forthcoming Broadway produc tion of Scratch by Archibald MacLeish, based on Stephen Vincent Bent's story, The Devil and Daniel Webster.

title: Blues Trounce Seals, 82
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 12 (UPI) Jim Lorentz scored two goals and Christian Bordeleau added a goal and three assists tonight to pace the St. Louis Blues to an 82 triumph over the Cali fornia Seals.

title: Cahill Demands U.S. Aid For Newarks of America
description: TRENTON, Jan. 12Warning that the danger of finan cial collapse of New Jersey's cities had become a crucial issue of life or death, Gov. William T. Cahill reiterated his demand today that the Nixon Administration urgently re direct its fiscal priorities to ward the Newarks of America.

title: Pacers Postpone Game
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 12 (UPI) The scheduled American Bas ketball Association game to morrow night between Indiana and Memphis was postponed until at least March 1 because of the Pacers inability to line up talent for a promised half time show, team officials said last night. The game, originally scheduled to be played in An derson, Ind., will now be played in Indianapolis, with proceeds going into a special fund for the building of a new basketball hockey complex.

title: Rockets Triumph, 120112
description: DENVER, Tan. 12 (AP)The Denver Rockets rallied from a 5549 halftime deficit on the shooting of Larry Cannon and Byron Beck to defeat Texas, 120112, tonight in an American Basketball Association game.

title: 3 SHIPSAFETY STEPS PROPOSED BY CURRAN
description: The president of the largest United States seamen's union called today for a threepoint passengership safety program based on the urgent warn ing in the near tragedy of the cruise liner Antilles.

title: 7 Dead, 14 Missing in 2d Sinking in Channel in 2 Days
description: DUNGENESS, England, Jan. 12 (UPI)A German freighter apparently smashed into the submerged wreckage of a naturalgas tanker that sank barely 24 hours earlier in the English Channel, then went down herself today within two minutes. Seven members of the freighter's crew were known dead and 14 others missing.

title: Canada Bars Abbie Hoffman
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 12Canadian immigration authorities have refused to allow Abbie Hoff man, the Yippie leader, to enter Canada for a television appear ance. Mr. Hoffman, who was to have arrived tomorrow, was barred in accordance with a section of the immigration law that prohibits the entry of any. one convicted of a crime involv ing moral turpitude, a Govern ment spokesman said. Mr. Hoff man is appealing his conviction in the Chicago 7 riot con spiracy trial.

title: The White and the Black
description: Harry L. Strong is the leader of a black charitable organization in Mem phis, Tenn., known as the Mallory Knights. These remarks are excerpted from his recent comments at a meet ing devoted to community affairs.

title: Through Traffic Barred In 3 Key Rome Squares
description: ROME, Jan. 12  This city adopted a new strategy today to force private autos out of the congested center  mak ing it maddeningly difficult for them to get in.

title: Hill Works Out in Cowboys'
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Jan, 12The Dallas Cowboys began their final series of prac tices today for Sunday's Super Bowl game against Baltimore, and Calvin Hill, all but for gotten the last two months, was back in the spotlight. Hill, the Yale alumnus voted the Na tional League's rookie of the year in 1969, was running in the first backfield with the 1970 rookie who took his job away, Duane Thomas.

title: CONDORS TRIUMPH OVER FLORIDIANS
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 12 (UPI) The Pittsburg,h Condors, who never trailed, slowly widened their margin In the second half and defeated the Floridians, 122106, tonight in an Amer ican Basketball Association game.

title: Cougars Lose to Stars
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Jan. 12 (UPI)The Utah Stars held off a strong midgame rally by the Carolina Cougars tonight and went on to score a 131120 American Basketball Associa tion victory and maintain their Western Division lead by one game.

title: ROBERT A. DAINE
description: Robert A. Daine, vice presi dent in charge of advanced systems planning for the Chemical Bank, died of a heart ailment Monday at the Pres byterian Hospital. He was 39 years old and lived at 12 Pierce Road, Riverside, Conn.

title: MISS MACCHI WINS SPECIAL SLALOM
description: GRINDELWALD, Switzer land, Jan. 12 (UPI)Francoise Macchi, 19 years old, led an other French sweep today in the first special slalom of the 33d Grindelwald ski races. Six French girls finished among the top 10.

title: S.E.C. Suit Names Keller;
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 (AP)Keller Industries, Inc., and its chief officers were ac cused today of violating anti fraud and reporting require ments of Federal securities laws.

title: Jewish Defense League Plays Grim Game With the Russians
description: The six young men from the Jewish Defense League were standing on the northwest cor ner of 67th Street and Third Avenue, waiting for Russians to harass. Policemen and wood en barricades kept them out of 67th Street between Lexington and Third Avenues, where the Soviet Mission to the United Nations is situated.

title: British Envoy Ends Tour, Has Warm Words for Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 (Reu ters)The retiring British am bassador, John Freeman, left Washington today paying trib ute to the generosity with which he had been treated by President Nixon.

title: Plot to Kidnap Kissinger Is Charged; Philip Berrigan and 5 Others Indicted
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12Six persons, including the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan, were indicted today on Federal charges of plotting to kidnap Henry A. Kis singer, assistant to the Presi dent for national security af fairs, and to blow up the heat ing systems of Federal buildings here.

title: Savings for December Rose Sharply in State
description: The Savings Banks Asso ciation of New York State citing continued caution on the part of consumers  re ported yesterday that savings increased last month by the largest amount for any De cember in 20 years.

title: Shop Talk
description: Budgetpriced modern fur nishings are emphasized in Macy's winter furnishings show in the store's enlarged (by about onethird) collec tion of The Affordahles. (in the past, this show has concentrated on design or decor. Price is going to be very important to consumers in buy ing furnishings during the first half of this year, said Alan Gold, senior vice president in charge of furnishings, in introducing the new offerings in the De sign 9 shop (the number des ignates the floor where they can be found).

title: DeLury Invokes Arbitration Steps In Asking Rest Room CleanUp
description: The sanitationmen's leader, charging that the sanitary fa cilities for his men were in tolerable, invoked arbitration procedures yesterday to force the city to remedy the situation.

title: A Faulty Bolt Is Blamed For Failure of Satellite
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Jan. 12 (UPI)The space agency said today that an explosive bolt that did not fire caused the failure of a $98million satellite mission Nov. 30.

title: WELFARE INCREASE DIPPED IN NOVEMBER
description: An increase of 6,630 persons on the city's welfare rolls dur ing November, the lowest rise in six months, was reported yesterday by Henry J. Rosner, Assistant Commissioner of So cial Services.

title: COFFEE PRODUCERS CONFER ON PRICING
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan. 12 The delegates of nine coffee producing countries met today to formulate a united price and quota front toward the world consuming nations.

title: Advertising
description: One day last fall as he was reading his New York Times in the sunny kitchen of his Southampton home, Jack Herbert looked up to see his wife standing there with a green tomato in hand.

title: Man in the News
description: The elevator slid to a stop at the cluttered loft floor on West 42d Street and the tight, dark figure of Rabbi Meir David Kahane burst out shouting Harass the Rus sians, that's the only way. The young members of the Jewish Defense League crowded around, giving their leader a hero's greeting as he told them in his excited, hyperac tive way of his time in court yes terday. To his followers, the 38yearold rabbi is the spear point of insistence on Jewish rights. To the established Jewish organitations, he is an embarrassment to the lib eral traditions of Judaism and a rightwing danger to the faith. To those who remem ber him when he was a youth in Flatbush, he is a studious rabbi's son who, after years of searching, has found a cause.

title: The Theater: Cornball Romance in a Rock Musical
description: At last I believe everyone who has been telling me that Romance (with a nonnegoti able capital R) has come back into style. At the Ritz Thea ter last night a new rock mu sical, Soon, opened, and it is purest cornball romance all about the sheer agony of selling out as a successful popmusician, and the corn fed blonde who is left be hind, assuring the whole wide world that: Life is rich and sentimental.

title: Harassment Penalty: Up to 15 Days in Jail
description: Under the state's Penal Law, a person is guilty of harassment if, with intent to harass, annoy or alarm, he does any of the following: strike or push someone, or threaten to do so; use abusive or obscene language directed at another person in a public place; follow someone in or about a public place or en gage in conduct that is de signed to alarm or serious ly annoy someone.

title: Books of The Times
description: We have here two works of fictionone a first novel, the other a collection of stories by an established European writer. There is no substantial thematic connection between them; they simply strike me as the best of a dozen or so fictional works I have been trying to read the last few days. But they do have this in common: Both are works of extreme talent, fresh and original. Yet the truth of the matter is that both left me more absorbed with what is wrong with them than what is right. So I am forced to praise them with faint damns.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX SHOW ADVANCES
description: Stocks on the American Stock Exchange made a broad advance yesterday as the list closed at its highest level in more than eight months in steppedup trading.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES SCORE ADVANCES
description: Soybean futures popped back into the limelight yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade and new crop options advanced more than three cents a bushel.

title: Frank S. MacGregor Dead at 73; Former Harper &
description: SANIBEL ISLAND, Fla., Jan. 12  Frank S. MacGregor, former president of Harper & Row Publishers, Inc., died yes terday. He was 73 years old and had been on vacation here.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: In This Boheme, Toy Vender Sells Dirty Postcards
description: In Puccini's La Bohme, Parpignol is a harmless ven der of toys on Christmas Eve outside the Caf Momus in Paris. In Frank Corsaro's staging of the opera, present ed at the Hunter College Playhouse on Monday night, Parpignol has become a seller of dirty French postcards. As well as anything, this indi cates the spirit of the produc tion.

title: Madison Fund's Net Off
description: The Madison Fund, Inc., re ported yesterday that its net assets as of Dec. 31 had de dined to $291,957,248, com pared with $300,447,981 at the end of 1969. This amounted to $14.79 a share on 19,735,894 shares outstanding, against $16.87 a share on 17,805,934 shares a year ago before ad justing for the 1969 longterm capital gains dividends of $1.43 paid last March 30.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 12 (AP)Kris Kemmer of Los An geles defeated Janet Young of Australia, 76, 76, in the second round of the New South Wales tournament.

title: 116,700 Tins of Pepper Recalled as Contaminated
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 (AP) The Food and Drug Adminis tration disclosed today that 116,700 tins of ground black pepper were being recalled from wholesalers nationwide because of bacterial contami nation.

title: Manufacturers Hanover Cites 5.4% Rise in 4thQuarter Net
description: The Manufacturers Hanover Corporation and the Frank lin New York Corporation reported increased earnings yes terday for the fourth quarter of 1970. The Manufacturers Hanover Corporation, parent of the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company, said its net income rose by 5.4 per cent from the level in the 1969 period while income before securities transactions climbed 7.6 per cent.

title: I. Rice Pereira Is Dead at 67; Known for Abstract Paintings
description: I. Rice Pereira the painter, whose abstractionist canvases are in many major collections, died Monday in Marbella, Spain, after a long illness, according to word received by relatives here. She was 67 years old and lived at 121 West 15th Street.

title: Delusions of Grandeur Laid to Pope's Attacker
description: MANILA, Jan. 12 (UPI)  Courtappointed psychiatrists have reported that the Bolivian painter accused of the at tempted assassination of Pope Paul VI here on Nov. 27 ap pears to be normal although he has delusions of grandeur, a Filipino judge said today.

title: MISS GOOLAGONG S. AFRICA BOUND
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Jan. 12 (AP)Evonne Goolagong, Australian aborigi nal tennis star, has accepted an invitation to play in the South African open champion ship in April, the tournament organizer, Owen Williams, said today.

title: Never Confuse Coast Victor
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Jan. 12 (UPI)Never Confuse won the $29,550 San Gorgonio claiming stakes in the rain at Santa Anita today and paid $8.20 for $2.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: New Laws. At the west ern White House in San Cle mente, Calif., President Nixon signed 23 bills. Twelve of the bills make minor changes in the Internal Revenue Code. Among the other bills he signed were the following: Extension until July 1, 1971, of authority for active United States participation in the In ternational Coffee Agreement of 1968; authorization of $250million in the fiscal years 1970 and 1971 for cer tain defense credit sales of some foreign countries, which repeals the socalled Tonkin Gulf Resolution of 1964, and authorization for the loan of eight naval ves sels to Greece, Pakistan, South Vietnam and Turkey.

title: City Unit Bids for a Separate Offtrack Pool at Yonkers
description: Faced with the continued ex pense of $122,000 a week and with no prospects of early rev enue, the city's OffTrack Bet ting Corporation asked its gov erning body yesterday for per mission to begin operating a separate betting pool on races at Yonkers Raceway.

title: Duras Play in Danger
description: A Place Without Doors, a play by Margaret Duras that won a round of highly favor able reviews, will close after its 30th performance on Saturday night at the Stairway Theater, 235 West 46th Street, unless there is a real upsurge at the box office, a spokesman for the producers, Edge Productions, Inc., said yesterday.

title: Selwyn Lloyd Elected Speaker by House of Commons
description: LONDON, Jan. 12  Selwyn Lloyd, Conservative party For eign Minister during the 1956 Suez crisis, was elected Speaker of the House of Commons today in an unexpected contest as Parliament reconvened.

title: Mayor Offers Welfare Housing Plans
description: Speaking of a crisis in the housing of welfare families, Mayor Lindsay yesterday out lined plans to ease the tragic conditions in socalled welfare hotels.

title: Fred D. Schnebbe, Officer Of Insurance Concern, 80
description: VALHALLA, N. Y., Jan. 12 Fred D. Schnebbe, retired vice president of John C. Paige & Co., an insurance concern, died last evening in St. Agnes Hos pital, White Plains, after a long illness. He was 80 years old and lived at 13 Birch Brook Drive here.

title: HIGH COURT RULES WELFARE HOMES MAY BE INSPECTED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12The Supreme Court ruled today that state and local welfare officials could insist on the right to inspect the homes of welfare recipients and could cut off the benefits of those who refused to let them in.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: TOP WEIGHT GOES TO HOIST THE FLAG
description: Lightly raced Hoist the Flag was honored with high weight of 126 pounds in the annual Experimental Handicap ratings announced yesterday by The Jockey Club.

title: Batterymates Light Up as Mets Signal Raise
description: Sometime before the 1971 baseball season starts, a com puter in Timmins, Ontario, may tell the Mets whether they can regain their cham pionship this year.

title: Statement at Hutto Trial Tells Of G.I. Drinking Bout at Mylai
description: FORT McPHERSON, Ga., Jan. 12  A statement by a South Vietnamese Army sergeant tell ing of a drinking bout by American infantrymen after, he said, they had been told that they were going to kill all the inhabitants of Mylai 4 was read today at the courtmartial of Sgt. Charles E. Hutto.

title: CityAided Housing Starts Reported at Peak in 70
description: Mayor Lindsay plans to an nounce today that city assist ance programs helped to start construction of more apart ments last year than in any previous year.

title: COPPER PRICE CUT BY PHELPS DODGE
description: The Phelps Dodge Corpora tion, the second largest pro ducer of American primary copper, cut the price of the metal to 50 cents a pound from 53 cents late yesterday. It was the third reduction in the basic copper quotation in the last four months.

title: N.B.A. CONSIDERS ACTION ON SONICS
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 12  The Board of Governors of the Na tional Basketball Association, meeting today before the league's 21st annual AllStar game at the International Sports Arena, considered bring ing charges against the Seattle SuperSonics that could result in the expulsion of the fran chise.

title: Lord Tovey, Whose Home Fleet Sank the Bismarck, Dead at 85
description: LONDON, Jan. 12Admiral of the Fleet Lord Tovey, one of the leading British naval commanders of World War II, died today in Madeira. His age was 85.

title: Thousands of Soldiers Throng Hanoi
description: HANOI, North Vietnam Troops throng this capital city, crowding its stores and markets and idling in its lakeside cafes.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON: SHOW A DECLINE
description: The London stock, market moved lower in quiet trading yesterday. There was little sell ing and the decline was gen erally attributed to lack of support.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE ON A BROAD FRONT
description: The bull market, to para phrase Mark Twain, proved yes terday that recent reports of its demise were grossly exag gerated.

title: CHRISTIANS URGED TO WIDEN DIALOGUES
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Jan. 12  Christians around the world face an urgent new need to promote dialogue with mem bers of the other major reli gions, according to Protestant and Eastern Orthodox leaders gathered here for a meeting of the World Council of Churches.

title: TV: A Good Idea That Didn't Work
description: Last night's duocast on Channels 13 and 11, The Beginning and the End, was a worthwhile and interesting experiment that failed. The idea itself was fascinating; to present two different but the matically complementary vi sual programs, one depicting the plight of the elderly and the other the beginning world of school children, with a single audio portion to unite the two visualizations. Ideal ly, the action of each portion should have served as a mov ing counterpoint to the action on the other.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Chrysler Corporation has realigned its United States sales and marketing activities under the direction of E. A. Cafiero, group vice president, U.S. and Canadianautomotive. Richard K. Brown, the general manager of the ChryslerPlymouth Divi sion since April, 1970, has been appointed to the newly created post of group vice presidentU.S. automotive sales. Robert B. McCurry, general man ager of the Dodge Division since 1966, has been elevated to the new position of vice presidentU.S. automotive sales and service, reporting to Mr. Brown. The move is aimed at cutting costs because it will enable the company to combine the auxiliary staffs, such as sales, of the two car divisions.

title: LEGISLATORS HAIL CITY SCHOOL UNIT
description: ALBANY, Jan. 12With both Republicans and Democrats praising New York City's in terim Board of Education, the Senate unanimously passed today and sent to the Assem bly a bill that extends the board's life for another year.

title: Big 6 Mayors Ask Decisive State Action on Aid
description: ALBANY, Jan. 12  Unde terred by Governor Rockefel ler's campaign for more Federal aid, the mayors of the state's six largest cities called today for decisive state action to aid the cities.

title: JOHN C. LITT
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Jan. 12 John Carpenter Litt, a semi retired partner in the New York Stock Exchange firm of McMul len & Hard, died today in the Community Hospital at Glen Cove after a short illness. He was 72 years old and lived on Heggenian Lane.

title: Five Officers Say They Seek Formal War Crimes Inquiries
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 Five young Military officers said today that they were ask ing the Secretaries of the Army and the Navy to convene for mal courts of inquiry into the question of war crimes and atrocities in Vietnam.

title: Article 13  No Title
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 12 (AP)President Nixon signed today legislation extending Unit ed States participation in the International Coffee Agreement until June 30.

title: Industry Urged to Begin Control Of Pollution on Voluntary Basis
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 William D. Ruckelshaus, ad ministrator of the Environmen tal Protection Agency, called on industry today to begin voluntarily to use available pollution control technology without waiting for the devel opment of the ultimate tech nology.

title: Jordanian and Israeli Meet With Jarring; Improved Climate for Negotiations Seen
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 12Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, the United Nations interme diary on the Middle East, con ferred today with the repre sentatives of Jordan and Israel amid indications that a climate of serious negotiations was developing.

title: Rangers Win, Take Lead;
description: VANCOUVER, Jan. 12 (UPI) The New York Rangers moved into first place in the East Division of the National Hockey League tonight with an easy 42 victory over the Vancouver Canucks.

title: Mead Plans New Product
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Jan. 12 (AP) Mead Papers announced to day that It would market a carbonless copying paper under the name Mead TransRite Car bonless. Company officials said six to eight copies of a typed or handwritten message could be made on Mead Carbonless.

title: Barney Is ReElected As Horse Show Head
description: William Joshua (Josh) Bar ney Jr. was reelected yester day president of the National Horse Show at the annual meeting of the board of di rectors.

title: 3 SEIZED IN QUEENS IN GAMBLING RAID
description: Detectives posing as airline pilots last night raided what they said was a $100,000aday gambling operation in a luxury apartment in Forest Hills, Queens. Three men were ar rested.

title: U.S. Giving Museums Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 The National Endowment for the Arts will lay $1million in Federal funds on the line this year to help the coun try's museumsmore than the endowment has spent on them over the five years of its existence.

title: Moorer Visits Pnompenh
description: PNOMPENH, Jan. 12 (AP)  Adm. Thomas H. Moorer, chair man of the United States Joint Chiefs of Staff, flew to Pnom penh from Saigon today and conferred with Cambodian and American officials on the military situation in Cambodia.

title: Soviet Incidents Taper Off
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 (Reuters)  A State Depart ment spokesman said today that there appeared to be a tapering off of incidents in Moscow since Sunday. Fewer threatening telephone calls have been received by the United States Embassy and fewer delegations have pre sented petitions.

title: REAGAN RULES OUT INCREASE IN TAXES
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Jan 12Gov. Ronald Reagan told California lawmakers today that an expected 197172 state def icit of nearly threequarters of a billion dollars could be met without new taxes.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Jan. 12 (AP)Kathy Harter of Seal Beach, Calif., scored a 61, 63 victory over Robin Glenie of Auckland today in the first round of the Auckland tennis championship. Mrs. Bar bara Wright was ousted by Irl Shelly of Auckland, 62, 46, 62.

title: Long Captivity in Uruguay Is Predicted for Briton
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 12A source close to the Tupa maro urban guerrillas asserted today that Geoffrey M. S. Jack son, Britain's kidnapped Am bassador to Uruguay, faced the probability of a long captivity, but would come out of it alive.

title: STRANGE ELEMENT IN MOON REPORTED
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 12From an analysis of cosmicray tracks on the moon, scientists said here today that they had con clusive proof of the existence in lunar soil of fossils from chemical elements far heavier than any previously discovered in nature or in laboratory ex periments.

title: Polaroid, Under Attack, Plans to Aid Some South African Blacks
description: The Polaroid Corporation, which has been under attack for its dealings in South Africa, has announced a oneyear ex periment there to improve the salaries, Job opportunities and education of a group of blacks.

title: Compromise Is Set in E. E. C. Dispute
description: ARNHEM, the Netherlands, Jan. 12France and West Ger many have reached an informal compromise in their dispute over establishment of federal authority within the European Economic Community.

title: DR. J. C. KIRKBRIGHT OF ST. LUKE'S STAFF
description: EASTCHESTER, N.Y., Jan. 12Dr. James Calvert Kirk bright, an otolaryhgologist, died today at his home, 2 Laurel Place. He was 68 years old.

title: Market Place: Japan's Output  Is Scrutinized
description: When Walter Oechsle went to Japan a few months before Expo he was already convinced that the celebrated Japanese miracle of econom ic growth was a sometime thing.

title: Du Pont to Cut Production Of Dynamite, Laying Off 300
description: E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co. announced yesterday that it planned to close down two of its dynamiteproduction facil ities, which would result in the layoff of about 300 workers.

title: Money Markets Continue Move to Lower Interest
description: The money and capital mar kets continued to sweep to ward lower interest rates yes terday.

title: 2 Legal Groups Charge Misuse Of Education Funds for Indians
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 Two legal organizations ac cused state and local school officials today of gross misuse of Federal funds earmarked for the education of Indian children.

title: St. Francis Wins, 74to64
description: Hunter College's 10game vic tory streak in basketball ended last night as St. Francis scored a 7464 triumph.

title: JEWISH MILITANT IS ARRESTED HERE
description: Rabbi Meir D. Kahane, the leader of the militant Jewish Defense League, was arrested yesterday in the organization's midtown office on a Criminal Court bench warrant issued after he failed to appear for a hearing on riot charges.

title: N.F.L. INQUIRY HEARS KAPP AND KRAMER
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 12 (AP) Joe Kapp, the Boston Patriots' quarterback, became today the first active professional foot ball player called before a Fed eral grand jury investigating National Football League op erations. He testified for two hours.

title: Boys Wear Market Called High Risk
description: The onceheralded stability of the boys apparel business has disappeared in favor of a much more volatile industry, the president of Sears, Roe buck & Co. said yesterday.

title: TrickleDown Revisited
description: President Nixon's first move of 1971 to spur the economy and reduce unemployment turns out to be an order permitting businesses to write off equipment purchases 20 per cent faster than heretofore and wiping out a previous requirement that businesses actually replace old equipment on a time schedule conforming to the one they claim for tax purposes.

title: Merger News
description: The MacDonnell Douglas Corporation announced yester day plans to acquire 100 per cent control of the Conductron Corporation and the nycon Manufacturing Company, two companies in which it already has a large interest.

title: 2d Air Strike in North Vietnam On Friday Is Disclosed by U.S.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 12  The United States com mand, which previously had disclosed that an American plane mado a protective re action attack inside North Vietnam last Friday, said today that there were actually two such attacks that day.

title: MACKEY OF COLTS PUTS GAME FIRST
description: MIAMI, Jan. 12Toil has priority over labor for John Mackey of the Baltimore Colts this week.

title: JIM WALTER NET UP FOR QUARTER
description: The Jim Walter Corporation, a major building materials pro ducer and leader in shell hous ing, increased earnings in its first fiscal quarter ended Nov. 30 to $7,544,543, or 44 cents a share, from $6,157,796, or 36 cents a share, in the com parable three months a year earlier.

title: JULIA RICHMAN HIGH RESUMES SCHEDULE
description: Regular classes were resumed yesterday at troubled Julia Rich man High School with about twothirds of the school's 4,600 students attending.

title: Brooklyn Park Will Get A Statue of Leif Ericson
description: An 11foottall bronze statue of Leif Ericson, the Viking explorer some schol ars believe visited America before Christopher Columbus, will be dedicated on May 23 in Leif Ericson Park in the Bay Ridge section of Brook lyn.

title: East River Drive Snarled
description: Traffic on the East River Drive was detoured in both di rections from 3 P.M. until about 5 P.M. yesterday because of a manhole explosion at the 66th Street entrance. And from 4 to 4:30 traffic on the drive was snarled when a gasoline tank fell off a truck at 23d Street.

title: 25c ExtraRider Charge Dropped From Taxi Plan
description: The Lindsay administration retreated yesterday from the taxifare package that formed the financial basis for the settlement of last month's taxi strike, agreeing to drop the 25cent charge it had suggested for each addi tional rider.

title: Drives on Route 4
description: PNOMPENH. Cambodia, Jan. I2 (UPI)Allied troop move ments were reported today moving southward along Route 4 from Pnompenh and north ward up the same road from Kompong Som, Cambodia's only deepwater seaport and site of an oil refinery.

title: Women Are Asked to Lobby Against Drunken Drivers
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12  The Nixon Administration moved today to weld 40 million American women into a peo ple's lobby for highway safety that would sweep drunken or drinking drivers off the nation's highways.

title: A Mayor Hauls Garbage
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 12 (UPI) Mayor Peter F. Flaherty, dressed in old clothes, helped haul garbage from 12 hospitals and schools today to comply with a court ruling that the waste created a health hazard.

title: Westchester Bottleneck To Join Memory Lane
description: HAWTHORNE, N. Y., Jan. 12What the Bruckner Traf fic Circle is to the Bronx, the Hawthorne Traffic Circle is to Westchester; a bottleneck, a battleground in the war of nerves, a place for the the unsure driver to avoid.

title: U.S. Starts Moving Mustard Gas From Okinawa to Pacific Island
description: MISATO, Okinawa, Wednes day, Jan. 13 (Reuters)  The United States Army today be gan moving 150 tons of mustard gas from its Chibana ammuni tion depot in central Okinawa for shipment to Johnston Is land, 750 miles southwest of Hawaii.

title: Boston College Triumphs
description: NEWTON, Mass., Jan. 12 (UPI)Capt. Jim O'Brien con verted four free throws in the final 2 minutes tonight to earn Boston College a 7169 victory over the University of Con necticut. It was Boston Col lege's eighth triumph in 13 games. Connecticut is 45.

title: TWO DETERGENT ADS OFF POLLUTION SHOW
description: A spokesman for the Colum bia Broadcasting System said yesterday that Procter & Gam ble had pulled two oneminute commercials from the C.B.S. News program, Is Mercury a Menace? broadcast last night from 10 to 11 P.M.

title: Israel Reports Espionage Ring In Jerusalem Area Is Smashed
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 12  The Israeli authorities reported to day that a ring of Arabs that included employes of the United Nations was among the espio nage and sabotage cells smashed in the Jerusalem area in the last three weeks.

title: JURY ENDS INQUIRY ON ATTACK ON NIXON
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Jan. 12 (AP)The Santa Clara County grand jury says that it has con cluded its investigation into the stonethrowing demonstration here against. President Nixon's campaign motorcade Oct. 29 and that no felony charges will be filed.

title: About Motor Sports
description: When the rubber fuel cell of a racing car is filled to the brim, the car is vulner able to fire. The reason is that the tank is in effect a hydraulic chamber. If there is a collision or other impact, pressure is exerted on the liquid. The liquid has to go somewhere, and thus it exerts pressure elsewhere in the hydraulic system. As it happens, hose connections are the weakest link in the system, and they can give way under hydraulic pressure. If you leave a lee way of 10 gallons or so in the tank, the fuel can move around safely, and there is no danger of burst con nectors.

title: FUND GROUP SEEKS STOCK SEAT TODAY
description: The New York Stock Ex change will take up today the controversial issue of institu tional membership on the ex change when the Dreyfus Cor poration, one of the oldest and largest mutualfund organiza tions, formally applies for approval to join.

title: SUIT BY BUCKLEY ASSAILS UNION TIE
description: William F. Buckley Jr. filed a Federal suit here yesterday challenging the constitution ality of a requirement that he must belong to a broadcasting union in order to work as a television commentator.

title: Both Sides in Jordan Appeal for Peace
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Jan. 12 Both commando and Govern ment leaders today appealed for peace in Jordan after fresh fighting between the Palestinian guerrillas and the army was reported to have broken out in the north and gunfire echoed through Amman for the fifth day.

title: Experts See a Gloomy Outlook on Asia
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Jan. 12Many developing Asian lands face gloomy prospects both politically and economical ly in the years immediately ahead, according to views ex pressed by authorities on the area who concluded a week long conference here today.

title: LUTHER CONANT
description: NORWALK, Conn., Jan. 12 Luther Conant, Federal Com missioner of Corporations under President William Howard Taft, died yesterday at the age of 98.

title: Decline of 15.8% in Operations Reported at Kennedy in Year
description: Airline takeoffs and landings at Kennedy International Air port decreased 15.8 per cent in 1970 below the 1969 vol ume, reflecting the impact of the nation's economic recession and of the Boeing 747 jumbo jet on air travel.

title: Gas Closes Jersey Road
description: HASBROUCK HEIGHTS, N.J., Jan. 12 (AP)A threemile stretch here of Route 17 was closed for three hours last night because of the danger of explo sion after 600 gallons of gaso line from an unknown source seeped into a sewer line run ning along the highway. The police evacuated businesses along a twomile stretch while persons in nearby homes were alerted to the danger. The road was closed at 8:30 P.M. and re opened at 11:30 P.M.

title: U.S. STUDY URGED ON MODEL CITIES Mayor Bids Federal Officials Inspect Program Here
description: Mayor Lindsay invited Fed eral officials yesterday to a firsthand inspection of the Model Cities program here.

title: Kansas Downs Georgia Tech
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 12 (AP) Bud Stallworth scored 27 points tonight as Kansas defeated Georgia Tech, 8471, in an in tersectional basketball game. Kansas wonlost record is now 101. Georgia Tech, which had a fourgame winning streak broken, is 102.

title: Interest Rate Cut to 7.5% On U. S. Home Mortgages
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 In another major step in the recent dramatic decline of in terest rates, the Government announced today the second re duction in six weeks in the ceiling interest rate on home mortgages backed by the Fed eral Housing Administration and the Veterans Administra tion.

title: WILLARD MAAS, 64, A POET, FILMMAKER
description: Willard Maas, a poet and pioneer filmmaker, died of a heart attack on Jan. 2, four days after his wife, Marie Men ken, artist and filmmaker. Mr. Maas was 64 years old and lived at 62 Montague Street, Brooklyn.

title: U.S. Denies Any Softness In Its G.M. Pollution Suit
description: The Justice Department yes terday denied charges that At torney General John N. Mitchell had intervened to ease the pen alties against General Motors for polluting the Hudson River at its plant in North Tarry town, N.Y.

title: Bank of Japan Set to Lend $100Million to World Bank
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 (Reuters)The Bank of Japan has agreed to lend $100million to the World Bank at an annual interest rate of 7.43 per cent, repayable in three equal in stallments from January, 1975, through January, 1976, the World Bank announced today.

title: VERDI QUITS AS PILOT OF YANK FARM CLUB
description: SYRACUSE, Jan. 12 (AP) Frank Verdi, who managed the Syracuse Chiefs of the Inter national Baseball League to a sweep of minor league cham pionships last season, has term inated his contract with the New York Yankees.

title: Marquette Defeats Irish;
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 12 (UPI) Marquette University turned back a late Notre Dame rally with a flurry of free throws to night and beat the Irish, 7166, to avenge its last defeat nearly a year ago. It was the 24th con secutive victory over two sea sons for the Warriors and their 50th in a row on the Milwaukee Arena floor.

title: Two Firemen Injured
description: Two firemen were injured slightly while putting out a kitchen fire in a Roman Cath olic rectory in the Coney Island section of Brooklyn yesterday. The fire broke out on the first floor of the twostory rectory of Our Lady of Solace, 2866 West 17th Street, the police said. The cause of the fire was not known immediately. The two firemen, Michael Calandillo and John Dondero, were taken to Coney Island Hospital and treated for smoke inhalation.

title: Prothro Hires McLaughlin
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 12 (UPI) Tommy Prothro, new coach of the Los Angeles Rams, named Leon McLaughlin, head coach at San Fernando Valley State College the last two sea sons, to his staff today.

title: It Wasn't Easy Selling People on the Idea
description: Gamal ElZoghby, like other architec tural designers, used his own home as a launching pad for an unconven tional interior design concept, both to test its practicality and to promote its sale to others.

title: West Beats East in AllStar Game, 108107, on a 3Point Play by Alcindor
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 12A fall away jump shat that hung on the rim for a second or two before rolling into the basket proved the difference tonight as the West defeated the East 108107, in the 21st annual All Star Game at International Sports Arena.

title: Jordan Is Denounced
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 12 Expressions of anger against the Government of King Hus sein in Jordan came today from several parts of the Arab world.

title: MODERN ART SERIES LISTS 11 OLD FILMS
description: A series of 11 Vintage films dating back to 1914 will be shown from tomorrow through Jan. 25, at the Museum of Mod ern Art. James Card, curator of the George Eastman House film collection in Rochester, which is lending the films to the museum, will introduce the program at 8 P.M. tomorrow.

title: Franco Ousts an Ultrarightist General
description: MADRID, Jan. 12Generalis simo Francisco Franco today dismissed an outspoken right wing general in an apparent at tempt to stem growing rightist dissension in the wake of the recent courtmartial of 15 Basque nationalists in Burgos

title: PHONE RATE RISE BACKED BY F.C.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 The Federal Communications Commission tentatively ap proved today an increase in long distance telephone rates pending results of a new hear ing.

title: International Paper Chief Will Receive Gannt Award
description: The 1970 Henry Laurence Gantt Memorial Gold Medal has been awarded to Frederick R. Kappel, chairman of the board of the International Paper Com pany.

title: Second Attack Protested
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Jan. 12 (Agence FrancePresse) North Vietnam, which has re mained silent over the Ameri can air attack reported Satur day, made public today a For eign Ministry protest against the firing of an American missile in North Vietnamese territorial waters off Hatinh Province.

title: New Governor of Georgia Urges End of Racial Bias
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 12Jimmy Carter was sworn in today as Governor and delighted blacks in his inaugural audience by making an unqualified call for an end to racial discrimina tion in Georgia. Mr. Carter is a 45yearold peanut farmer who bears a strong physical resemblance to President Ken nedy.

title: Solving the Reading Puzzle
description: The results of reading tests recently administered by the city's public schools raised more questions than they answered. The bright spot shown by these statistics is the marked improvement of reading ability In the second grade. The city's secondgraders as a group now register slightly above the national norm, while all other grade levels lag behind.

title: Judge's Ruling Aids Maheu In Move to Summon Hughes
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Jan, 12 (AP)A judge ruled today that Howard Hughes, the industrial ist, must be a personal defen dant in a $50million lawsuit filed by Robert Maheu against the Hughes Tool Company.

title: 4TH NEGRO G.I. HELD IN VIETNAM SLAYING
description: QUANGTRI, South Vietnam, Jan. 12 (UPI)A fourth Negro soldier has been arrested with the slaying of one white major and the wounding of another following an argument over a loudly playing stereo phono graph, United States military sources said today.

title: Economic Analysis
description: In the wake of President Nixon's televised statement that his budget for fiscal. 1972 would be in deficit but that expenditures would not exceed full  employment revenues, there has been a spreading wave of skepticism, on the part of people who just don't be lieve that there is any such thing as, a fullemployment, surplus, and fear, that the President is playing games with them. Take this letter from Virginia Blivis of West Egg, L. I.:

title: Oil Discoveries in Michigan
description: The Standard Oil Company (Indiana) announced yesterday the completion of two wildcat oil well discoveries and the suc cessful testing of a third well in the northern flank of the Michigan basin near Gaylord, Mich.

title: Cosmos No. 390
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 12 (UPI) The Soviet Union today orbited No. 390 in its Cosmos series of unmanned satellites, Tass, the official press agency, said.

title: $46,391 Gift To Neediest Is Recorded
description: Gifts totaling $58,183.93 from 376 contributors. were recorded yesterday by the Neediest Cases Fund, bring ing to $765,980.40 the amount collected during the 59th annual appeal.

title: UNION OBTAINS WRIT BARRING NEWS SHIFT
description: The New York Mailer Union No. 6 got a court order last night staying The Daily News from changing its press run schedules pending a hearing to morrow in Manhattan Supreme Court.

title: MARK MOORING, 71, FASHION DESIGNER
description: Mark Mooring, a fashion de signer, died of complications following a stroke Jan. 5 in Hollywood. He had been living there sinoe 1962.

title: SCRIBNER'S BUDGET DECRIED BY SHANKER
description: Albert Shanker, president of the United federation of Teach ers, charged yesterday that the education budget proposed for 197172 by Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner was a standstill budget that did not meet the needs of the school system.

title: Bolshoi Theater Aide Thrown to the Bears
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 12 (AP) Pyotr F. Abolimov has been named head of the Moscow State Circus. He had been deputy director of the Bolshoi Theater and the Theater of the Kremlin Palace of Con gresses, and the circus job was considered a demotion.

title: Cut Phone Cables in Brooklyn Laid by Company to Sabotage
description: As the strike by 15,000 tele phone repairmen, installers and other mechanics went into its second day, the New York Telephone Company charged yesterday that 800 phones had been put out of service in Brooklyn by sabotage.

title: Soprano Miscast As Met Presents A Mediocre Lucia
description: If it is possible to imagine the height of mediocrity, that is what the Metropolitan Op era achieved Monday night with the seventh Lucia di Lammer moor of the season. Even that suggests too dramatic an image for a performance that found itself with a wholly inadequate Lucia in Roberta Peters and a conductor in Carlo Franci who seemed bored or frustrated, or both.

title: When the Taxi Customer Complains, the Hack Bureau Listens
description: Every Weekday 40 to 50 New Yorkers find their way to an unprepossessing build ing at 325 Hudson Street in lower Manhattan to confront cab drivers they have accused of mistreating them.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: BRUSSELSA few days ago Regis Debray, the young French leftist who has accepted a position in Chile's new regime, boasted that the Chilean revolution would have repercussions in Europe.

title: LESSER PENALTIES IN MARIJUANA ACT URGED FOR STATE
description: ALBANY, Jan. 12The New York State District Attorneys Association called on the Legis lature today to reduce sharply the penalties for possession and sale of marijuana.

title: Gibson to Meet Agnew
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12  Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson of Newark will meet tomorrow with Vice President Agnew to plead for a massive infusion of Federal funds to head off a deepening financial crisis for his and other cities.

title: Advertising
description: Carl Spielvogel, executive vice president and general manager of McCannErickson, has been elected to the addi tional job of chairman of the executive committee.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Lindsay May Fight 3 Beame Consulting Contracts
description: Deputy Mayor Richard R. Aurelio said yesterday that Mayor Lindsay would block three consulting contracts to taling $200,000, requested by Controller Abraham D. Beame, unless Mr. Beame removed the contracts from consideration by the Board of Estimate.

title: Brazilians Get Pledge to Free Envoy When 70 Land in Chile
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan. 12 The kidnappers of the Swiss Ambassador, Giovanni Enrico Bucher, promised tonight to re lease him after 70 political pris oners, promised freedom by Brazil, had arrived in Chile.

title: BILLS EXPLORING MOVE TO SEATTLE
description: SEATTLE, Jan. 12 (AP)  Ralph Wilson Jr., owner of the Buffalo Bills, told Seattle area officials today he was very serious in his desire to move his National Football League team here.

title: Anne Johnson: Social Catalyst and Art Patron
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 12 When this city's uppereche lon society and the level that includes Hollywood learned a couple of years ago that there was to be a Ford in Its future, everyone seemed genuinely delighted.

title: MILTON C. SEELIG
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Jan. 12Milton C. Seelig, a re tired civil engineer, died yester day in Holy Cross Hospital. He was 72 years old.

title: Mylai G.I. Feared Babies Held Grenades
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., Jan. 12 Former Pfc. Paul D. Meadlo testified today at the court martial of First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. that he had shot some babies in their mothers arms at Mylai because he was afraid the babies might be carrying concealed grenades.

title: Head Named for New Preschool Unit
description: An interviewing panel wanted to know whether Georgia Louisa McMurray thought she could handle the job of creating a new city agency to promote opportuni ties and services for the city's 825,000 preschool children.

title: PLAYBOY GIVES $1,000 TO 8 OF ITS WRITERS
description: Irwin Shaw, the novelist, re ceived the best major work award at Playboy magazine's annual writer's awards lunch eon yesterday at the 21 Club, 21 West 52d Street.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: McElroy, Middle Distance Star, To Leave Kansas for Villanova
description: Brian McElroy, a top Eastern schoolboy athlete who went west in search of world rec ords, will transfer from the University of Kansas to Villan ova next week.

title: Court Requires a Warrant for Domestic Wiretaps
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 12A Federal District Court judge has ruled that it is unconsti tutional for the Government to wiretap without a warrant in domestic cases, even if they in volve the national security.

title: NIXON AIDE DENIES CHOTINER 72 ROLE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 12 The White House denied today that it was preparing for a re election campaign by President Nixon in 1972 and Attorney General John N. Mitchell said he did not intend to be a politi cal tutor.

title: N.A.A.C.P. CRITICAL OF THE DAVIS CASE
description: Leaders of the National Asso ciation for the Advancement of Colored People charged yester day that there was an ob vious effort to deny the pre sumption of innocence and thereby convict Miss Angela Davis of murder long before the first witness has been called.

title: Holiday Retail Rise Is Reported Strong
