Wheat, oat and corn futures were irregular at the close. Soybean oil futures were lower but meal prices were irregular. Iced broiler futures made slight gains.

title: Ages of Man Is Homage in Badinage
description: History, which is too con fusing for words, is reduced to a suffix in a new book called The Ages of Man: From Savage to Sewage.

title: Bronx Store Owner Indicted in Fraud
description: A Federal grand jury indicted the owner of a Bronx furniture store yesterday on fraud charges that included the mail ing of false court summonses to customers to make them pay bills and threats to have cus tomers removed from the wel fare rolls if they failed to pay.

title: Point of View
description: NATIONS presumably base their foreign policies on rational views of their self interest. But history is sadly replete with evidence of na tions' pursuing policieS based more on fear and prejudice than on fact and logic, par ticularly in international eco nomic affairs.

title: A Tale From the Underground
description: The indictment of the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan and other priests and nuns on Federal charges of conspiring to kidnap Henry A. Kissinger and blow up the heating systems of Federal buildings in Washington is itself almost a conspiracy against sober reason.

title: ANDREW E. STEWART, CORPORATE LAWYER
description: PLANDOME, L. I., Jan. 14 Andrew E. Stewart, a senior partner in the New York law firm of Royall, Koegel & Wells, died yesterday in St. Francis Hospital, Roslvn. He was 66 years old and lived at 35 Parks wood Road.

title: 9 Die in Fire at Home for the Elderly in Louisville
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Jan. 14 (UPI)Nine elderly persons were killed today in a home for the aged and 44 others were injured when they were overcome by heavy black smoke from a fire.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE COURAGE OF TURTLES. By Edward Hoagland, 239 pages. Random House. $5.95.

title: Comsat Declares Dividend
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14 (AP) The board of directors of Communications Satellite Corp. declared today a dividend of 12 cents a sharethe second in the company's history. The quarterly dividend is payable March 15 to shareholders of record Feb. 12.

title: Erie Starting PushPull to Aid Commuters'
description: HOBOKEN, N. J., Jan. 14 The ErieLackawanna Railroad, which serves 35,000 daily commuters to New York from North Jersey, will introduce next week the first new rail road cars and locomotives de signed for pushpull service.

title: EastWest Trade: Tool For Policy
description: WARSAWA few months ago, the State Depart ment announced that the United States Govern ment had rejected, for the time being, a request by Poland to buy American oilrefinery equipment.

title: Lufkin Indicates A Rise In Earnings
description: Donaldson, Lufkin & Jen rette, Inc., the only publicly owned member house of the New York Stock Exchange, in dicated yesterday that its earn ings in the second half of 1970 had risen sharply from firsthalf results, although net income for the full year de clined.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. List of Missing Is Rejected at Paris Peace Talks
description: PARIS, Jan. 14David K. E. Bruce, United States delegate to the Paris peace talks, was ridi culed as a public amuser to day after he tried to hand to the Communist side a list of 1,534 American servicemen the Pentagon carries as missing in action in Southeast Asia. He said he wanted the North Viet namese and the Vietcong to provide any information on them.

title: Esposito Gets 3 Goals as Bruins Win, 95
description: BOSTON, Jan. 14 (AP)Phil Esposito set a modern record tonight with his fifth threegoal performance of the season and added three assists in sparking the Boston Bruins to a 95 Na tional Hockey League victory over the Los Angeles Kings.

title: A Code for Professional Integrity
description: WASHINGTON  At what point should corporate or government scientists, engineers or other profes sionals dissent openly from their employerorganization's policy? If the professional does dissent, what is there to protect or defend his decision to place his professional conscience over what he believes is his organiza tion's illegal, hazardous or uncon scionable behavior?

title: B.0.A.C. AND PILOTS END DISPUTE ON 747
description: LONDON, Jan. 14Pilots of British Overseas Airways ended a dispute tonight that had kept three Boeing 747 jumbo jets grounded here for eight months.

title: Turks, With Respite in Unrest, Debate Dictatorship VS. Democracy
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Jan. 14 Premier Suleyman Demirel has won another reprieve in his battle to keep the office he has held for more than five years, but his troubles have opened an unusually frank debate in Turkey over whether dictator ship can do more for develop ment than democracy can.

title: News of Skiing
description: Rudi Mattesich, the Aus trianborn cross country en thusiast who founded the Ski Touring Council nine years ago, is afraid his fa vorite sport is becoming too fancy.

title: SCHOOL RESCINDS TRANSFER ORDERS
description: A planned transfer of outof zone students from George Washington High School in up per Manhattan has been re scinded following protests by parents.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: AIR CLEANUP SET BY UNION CARBIDE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14The Union Carbide Corporation bowed to Federal pressure to day and agreed to clean up the air pollution caused by its Mar ietta, Ohio, plant in compliance with Government requirements.

title: Chase Is Taking Control of Big Detroit Bank Loans Are Called
description: The Chase Manhattan Bank, with the approval of the Fed eral Reserve Board and the Michigan State Banking Com missioner, stepped in yesterday to take effective control of the $1billion Bank of the Com monwealth in Detroit.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: JOHNSON PRODUCTS TRADING ON AMEX
description: The Johnson Products Com pany, the first predominantly blackoperated and blackowned company to be listed on a major stock exchange, yesterday be gan trading on the American Stock Exchange.

title: Isuzu Working on G.M. Tie
description: TOKYO, Jan. 14 (Reuters) The Isuzu Motor Co. today said its negotiations for a capital tieup with General Motors would take a few more months to complete.

title: CONDORS CONQUER COLONELS, 122111
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 14 (AP) Skeeter Swift hit on a jump shot late in the final period to night to put Pittsburgh in front and the Condors held on for a 122111 victory over the Ken tucky Colonels in American Basketball Association action.

title: These Phones Go Dead, Too, but They Look Alive
description: These days, there are few people who find their tele phones very lovable. Greeted with wrong numbers, strange noises or, worse yet, dead silence, a lot of rage is being vented on babypink Princess phones as well as the fa miliar black boxes. Bob Ebers doesn't promise any better service with his People Phones, but feels that they might make telephone users more cheerful and better able to bear their frustrations. Phones in themselves are pretty cold, lifeless, says Mr. Ebers, who is a painter, as is his Greek wife, Athena. I wanted to do something to humanize them, make them relate more to life.

title: Legislator Questions Schweitzer's Ethics
description: Senator John H. Hughes, chairman of the State Joint Legislative Committee on Crime, said yesterday that the relationship of State Supreme Court Justice Mitchell D. Schweitzer to Nathan Voloshen, a convicted influencepeddler, raises questions as to the pro priety of the judge's conduct.

title: Abrams Asks $3Million More For a Lead Detection Program
description: Bronx Borough President Robert Abrams announced yes terday that he would ask the Board of Estimate for an addi tional $3million to expand the city's yearold leadpoisoning testing program in an effort to detect a wide range of dis eases tin preschool children.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14You can hardly pick up a newspaper or turn on your. TV these days without coming up against some melancholy character complaining about the helplessness of the individual. The ordinary decent American, according to the current clichs, is numbered, computerized, victimized and depersonalized by a lot of big institutions and monstrous forces beyond his understanding or control.

title: Dance: Kodaly Has World Premiere
description: If the Russians have been getting away with murder for yearsRussian dancers, that iswhy can't we? That, crudely formulated, perhaps represents the basic thinking behind John Clifford's Ko dly Dances, which was given its world premiere by the New York City Ballet at the New York State Theater last night. Although I did not think the ballet was a success, the basic thinking was sound.

title: Bank of England Appoints
description: LONDON, Jan. 14 (Reuters) Sir Leslie O'Brien has been reappointed Governor of the Bank of England for five more years starting July 1, 1971.

title: Oil Fouls English Coast; Hundreds of Birds Die
description: DOVER, England, Jan. 14 (UPI)  A tide of oil from ships involved in recent col lisions in the English Chan nel swept ashore today along Britain's southeast coast, bringing with it hundreds of seabirds caught in the muck.

title: Patti Heuckeroth Is Top Horsewoman
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14  Patti Heuckeroth, the 26year old daughter of the manager of the Ox Ridge Hunt Club in Darien, Conn., was awarded the Horsewoman of the Year trophy today at the American Horse Shows Association con vention.

title: Adversity No Stranger to Niland of Cowboys on Rugged Road to Super Bowl
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Jan. 14John Niland, a 26 yearold guard for the Dal las Cowboys, is at the top of his profession, and he has come a long way. An orphan, he grew up in poverty although I didn't know it at the timein Amityville, L. I.

title: Mystery in Illinois: Millionaire Aide
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Jan. 12 The body of Secretary of State Paul Powell lay on the same catafalque that once bore Lincoln, and a thousand officeholders and party faith ful crowded into the crepe draped rotunda of the ornate capitol to honor the most powerful downstate Demo crat in Illinois.

title: Cartoonists to Cite Condon
description: John F. X. Condon, Madison Square Garden boxing publi cist, will receive a distin guished service award from the National Cartoonists Soci ety at its sports night Jan. 26.

title: A Calley Witness Insists Colonel Told Officers to Wipe Foe Out for Good
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., Jan. 14Officers who participated in the Mylai incident were chid ed on the eve of the alleged massacre for lack of aggressive ness, a witness said today at the courtmartial of Lieut. William L. Calley Jr.

title: Vice President Quits Manila Cabinet Post
description: MANILA, Jan. 15In a split in the leadership of the govern ing Nationalist party, Vice President Fernando Lopez to day submitted his resignation from his Cabinet post as Sec retary of Agriculture and National Resources.

title: Waste Dumping Blocked
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 14 (AP) A United States District judge issued today a restrain ing order preventing Pennsyl vania from carrying out a plan to dump 3.5 million gallons of industrial waste in the Atlantic Ocean off the New Jersey coast.

title: Lack of Jobs Besets Poorer Lands
description: PARIS, Jan. 14While the United States is struggling with an unemployment rate of 6 per cent, the rate in many devel oping countries is two or three times higher and there is little prospect of improvement.

title: Windeatt of Australia Beats Burton in 1,500Meter Swim
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 14 (UPI)  Australian swimmers defeated American entrants at the New South Wales state swimming championships to night in Sydney.

title: BULLS DEAL 76ERS A 108103 SETBACK
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 14 (UPI) Bob Love with 27 points, and Jerry Sloan, with 22, paced the Chicago Bulls to a 108103 victory tonight over the Phila delphia 76ers in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Patrolman Hospitalized Here After Saving Girl in Water
description: A harbor patrol policeman was hopitalized yesterday after braying 30degree temperatures to rescue a 14yearold girl who plunged 55 feet into the Harlem River.

title: Nichols, Shaw and Dill Card 68's for Shot Lead Over Johnson in Crosby Golf
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Jan. 14 Bobby Nichols hit a stray shot into the Pacific Ocean and lost his chance for the undisputed lead in the colorful Bing Cros by proamateur golf tourna ment today.

title: LEO ZWIEBACH
description: LIVINGSTON, N. J., Jan. 14 Leo Zwiebach, senior vice presi dent, of Vornado, Inc., which operates discount and food chains, died today of a heart attack at his home. 37 Rumson Road. He was 50 years old.

title: MUSEUM COURSE LURES TEACHERS
description: Six thousand teachers crowd ed into the Metropolitan Museum of Art last night for an adventure in juxtaposition, in which the royalty of ancient Egypt and the gods of distant Asia hobnob as old familiars.

title: Consumer Forces Told to Eat Cake
description: There are no Ralph Naders in Europe.

title: Mrs. Lyon and S. C. Burden, Investment Banker, to Marry
description: Shirley C. Burden, photog rapher, investment banker and descendant of Commo dore Cornelius Vanderbilt, and Mrs. Julietta Valverde Lyon, a Chilean widow, will marry soon.

title: The Seventh Juror, A White, 67, Picked For Trial of Seale
description: NEW HAVEN, Jan. 14  A 67yearold retired factory worker, a white man, was chosen today as the seventh juror for the trial here of two Black Panthers, Bobby G. Seale and Ericka Huggins.

title: Frontiers of Europe Fade
description: PARISThis continent, striving for greater influence in the world and more affluence at home, was in a process of consolidation on the west and recon ciliation on the east as it stepped deeper into the new decade.

title: A Brick Shatters Aeroflot's Window Here
description: The plateglass window of the Soviet tourist agency and air line, at 45 East 49th Street, was smashed yesterday morning by a brick thrown from a speeding car.

title: Management Association Picks Educator as Its New President
description: The election of James L. Hayes as president and chief executive officer of the Amer ican Management Association was announced yesterday by Lawrence A. Appley, chair man of the board, and Don G. Mitchell, acting chief executive officer and chairman of the executive committee.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today Jan. 15, 1971
description: ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COUNCIL

title: Scope of BusLane Plan To Be Widened in Jersey
description: The success of the busesonly lane between the New Jersey Turnpike and the Lincoln Tun nel has encouraged transporta tion officials to increase the scope of the project greatly.

title: OstpolitikTrade Trails
description: BONN  There was more sound and fury than sub stance to West Germany's trade with the East last year.

title: Eighteen and After
description: The heavy majority by which both the State Senate and Assembly approved an amendment to the State Constitution giving those between the ages of 18 and 21 the right to vote reflects the growing public sentiment for this once highly controversial proposal. Now the amendment only has to receive voter approval in Novem ber for it to become law in time for the Presidential election next year.

title: Israelis Finding Guns and Butter Difficult to Balance
description: JERUSALEM  Using tra ditional yardsticks as a guide, the Israeli economy enters 1971 hopelessly out of kilter. But this is Israel, where some how other problems always make the economic difiicul ties seem almost com fortable by comparison.

title: Payments Problems Past, Britain Faces Inflation
description: LONDON  All those who periodically appraise the state of the British economy have at least one great pleas ure at the turn of this year: the joy of novelty.

title: Covent Garden, Congested and Rather Splendid, Now Pass
description: LONDONAfter thinking about it for a century, the authorities are pre paring to close the ancient Covent Garden fruit and vegetable market in central London. The market will be transferred in 1973 to a new, spacious site two and a half miles away and south of the Thames.

title: Mrs. King Scores Victory Over Miss Durr on Coast
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Jan. 14 (UPI)Mrs. Billie Jean King scored a 46, 76, 61 victory today over Francoise Durr of France in the feature match of the opening round in the $14,000 Billie Jean King invi tation tennis tournament.

title: Growing Pains in Toulouse
description: TOULOUSE, France The citizens here are an amiable bunch most of the time but lately they are showing signs of bad temper. This occurs when they get behind the wheel of a car and find the streets choked with traffic and the parking impossible.

title: Article in Izvestia
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 14 (AP)  The Soviet Government news paper Izvestia said today that Rabbi Kahane violated court instructions by continuing to harass Soviet citizens in the United States.

title: Oil Slick Off Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Jan. 14 (AP)The Coast Guard said a Navy barge loaded with 4,486 barrels of diesel fuel was sink ing and spreading a milelong oil slick off Puerto Rico today but that the slick presented no immediate danger to the is land's coastline.

title: Greeks Flash the Flag to Sell Greek Products
description: ATHENS  Think before you buy, says a voice on Greek television, and the screen shows a shopper's hand pausing as it pulls a bill from a wallet. Then, as a small Greek flag flashes on and off, the voice adds: Think that when you buy Greek, the money returns to you.

title: If 911 Doesn't Answer, Dial 0 in Case of Fire
description: A spokesman for the Fire Department said last night some persons reporting fires by dialing the 911 emergency telephone number had expe rienced unusual delays, ap parently due to the patrol men's job action.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Enjoined on Shrimpers
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Jan. 14 (UPI)  A Federal judge en joined Florida today from in terfereing with Cuban shrimp boats fishing in the Gulf of Mexico more than 12 miles off shore. District Judge David Middlebrooks issued the order after a hearing at which the Government said any such ar rests could bring international complications.

title: ATLANTIC CITY LOSES MODEL CITIES FUNDS
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Jan. 14, (AP)The Federal Government disclosed today that it was dropping this resort city from the Model Cities program.

title: Japan Approves Building Of 3 More Fast Rail Lines
description: TOKYO, Jan. 14 Japan's Government  owned National Railways system, which has ac quired an international reputa tion because of its 120milean hour superexpresses linking To kyo and Osaka, has received permission to construct three more superexpress lines under a program to end in 1975.

title: State Senator Proposes Penal Reform Program
description: State Senator John R. Dunne, chairman of the Senate Com mittee on Crime and Correc tion, proposed a 10point penal reform program yesterday that included guarantees of a speedy trial and a review board to investigate deaths of prisoners.

title: Supreme Court Unanimously Upsets Two Laws Curbing Mail Order Pornography Traffic
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14  The Supreme Court unanimous ly declared unconstitutional to day two Federal laws that had authorized the Post Office De partment to cut off postal serv ice to mail order houses that deal in pornography.

title: EGYPT AND JORDAN SEE NOTHING NEW IN ISRAELIS' STAND
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 14  The United Arab Republic and Jordan were re liably reported today to have concluded that the suggestions Israel made to Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring over the weekend covered old ground and could not be regarded as a step for ward in the indirect peace talks.

title: Muscovite Shops for a Car
description: MOSCOWAs a lark, a Moscow high school teacher put his name on the waiting list to buy a Moskvich sedan. That was in 1969, and he did not have the $5,500 to buy the car then. But he esti mated that it would take about three to four years be fore his name got to the top of the list, and, by then, he might be able to borrow the money from friends, who would share the car with him.

title: H.E.W. Finds North Lags In Rate of Pupil Integration
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14The Nixon Administration reported today that more school systems in the South than in the North were integrated and, thus, the Federal Government would be gin turning its attention to Northern schools.

title: DDay for Britain: 100 Pence to a Pound
description: LONDONOn Feb. 15 Brit ain will change over to dec imal currency, abandoning a monetary system that has been in existence since the eighth century.

title: President Given a Portrait
description: EL TORO, Calif., Jan. 14 (UPI)  Mr. and Mrs. Philip Bielat of Rosemead, Calif., presented President Nixon to day with a crocheted portrait of himself before he left El Toro Marine Corps Air Station for Lincoln, Neb. The portrait, framed in a handcarved, gold painted frame, 22 inches by 24 inches, was described by the President as fantastic.

title: Philip A. Swart, President Of School Food Service
description: Philip A. Swart, president of Campus Chefs, Inc., of Eliza beth, N.J., a food service for schools and colleges, died Saturday of a heart attack in Atlanta, where he lived. His age was 53.

title: DR. MORTIMER EHRLICH
description: Dr. Mortimer E. Ehrlich, a former vice president of the New York Rheumatism Asso ciation, died Wednesday at his home after a long illness. He was 61 years old and lived at 201 East 19th Street.

title: Angels Name Executive
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Jan. 14 (UPI)Tom Sommers was ap pointed director of minor league operations for the Cali fornia Angels.

title: Excerpts From Transcript of Nixon Talk on Youth
description: Following are excerpts from a transcript of President Nix on's speech yesterday after noon at the University of Nebraska, Lincoln, Neb., as recorded by The New York Times through the facilities of A.B.C. News:

title: Italian Reds Seek Revision Of '29 Treaty With Church
description: ROME, Jan. 14The Com munist party called today for the Italian Government to open negotiations with the Vatican to revise the 1929 concordat.

title: Trade Spurt in December Gives Britain '70 Surplus
description: LONDON, Jan. 14An un expectedly strong trade surplus of $134million in December put British merchandise trade $12 million in the black for the whole of 1970, preliminary Government figures showed today.

title: A Discussion If Britain Joins Europe, Then What?
description: FOUR close observers of the European politicaleconomic scene were luncheon guests last month of John M. Lee, eco nomic reporter of The New York Times bureau in London. They ex amined these questions:

title: Arnold L. Boros Dies at 69; A Retired Acting Principal
description: WHITE PLAINS, Jan. 14 Arnold L. Boros, who retired three years ago as acting prin cipal of Public School 17, City Island, the Bronx, died Tuesday in White Plains Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived here at 227 Albemarle Road.

title: PATTERSON, FORTE TO FIGHT TONIGHT
description: MIAMI BEACH, Jan. 14 Floyd Patterson, the former twotime world heavyweight champion, will resume his comeback tomorrow night against Levi Forte, a 30year old bellhop at the Fontaine bleau Hotel here who has been inactive as a boxer for 13 months.

title: Wife Sues Johnny Carson
description: Mrs. Joanne Carson is seek ing $7,000aweek temporary alimony from Johnny Carson, television star, it was disclosed yesterday in Manhattan Su preme Court. In arguments be fore Justice Wilfred A. Walte made, the grounds on which she will seek a divorce or sepa ration were described as cruel and inhuman treatment, aban donment and adultery. Justice Waltemade gave both sides until Monday to submit addi tional papers.

title: Commodity Price Index Slips 0.1 From Last Week
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials slipped to 106.6 Tuesday from 106.7 last week.

title: Pleasure Boat News
description: Of the dozens of plaques to be handed out at the National Boat Show, which opens a week from tomorrow at the Coliseum, one of the most valuable is the Marine Safety Award from the Energy Sys tems Division of the Olin Corporation.

title: The Screen:Museum Series Offers Ambitious 'Akran'
description: The current movie in the Whitney Museum's New American Filmmakers Series is "Akran," by Richard Myers, who lives and works in OhioAkron, of course, "Akran," which is a work of ambition and great technical virtuosity, runs for almost two hours and features a cast of, I do believe, hundreds, along with the public and private places, the street corners and back lots of the city that in some degree is, or helps create, the subject of the film.More immediately, the subject is a young man (Robert Ohlrich) who remembers and experiences and perhaps dreams whatever goes on in "Akran," and who escapes each of the film's crises. It is, therefore, a kind of subjective biographywhich is at the same time meant to be universal, pretty much to the degree to which it is also subjective. In this, "Akran" resembles much recent narrative work, and, in film, the early semi-autobiographical movies of Jerzy Skolimowski. I don't know whether Myers intends "Akran" as autobiography (for what it's worth, Mrs. Myers plays the hero's girl and wife and sometimes, I think, mother) but it doesn't much matter. The film's mode is personal confessionnot so much of conscience as of consciousness.But the film's means are highly unusual, and in technique "Akran" must represent something of a tour de force. With a sound track mix consisting of more or less patterned noise along with snatches of monologue in the air or via tape or television (but almost no ordinary dialogue) and with an overpowering visual style that takes its start in sequences consisting wholly of stop shots, "Akran" leaves no doubt about the range and intensity of its ambitions.I rather like the intensity and resent the range. As it deals with the intimacies of its hero's life and especially his past, "Akran" achieves a density of image, mixing memory and desire, that does more to validate the poetry of the recollected commonplace than anything else I have seen in recent movies.But where it strains toward a major overview of the quality of the American experienceseen through the moods and anxieties of its protagonistit begins to lose as much as it had gained, and curiously, becomes simpler as it means to become more complex.A voice begins intoning "Paul Hindemith is dead; Pope John is dead; Jean Cocteau is dead . . ." Television announcers give notice to all the sublimations of our collective guilt. And finally "life" appears  as a peep show, as a penny arcade, as one or another of those handy metaphors that, at least in cinema, are generally substitutes, rather than symbols, for what cannot possibly be genuine understanding.Occasionally, an attempt at major historical understanding does succeed in film, but only (as in "Rules of the Game" or "Weekend") in works of great clarity, formal control and intellectual precision. I don't think that Richard Myers has, or really pretends to, these virtues. The virtues he does have are real and rare enough  but they have to do with some of the potentials of the screen and with the compulsions of a private imagination, and not with the decline of Western Civilization.But there is enough going on in "Akran" to command anyone's attention. And much of that is lovely and wonderfully difficult, with a regard for strange nuances that is one of the pleasures of the movies.

title: Muskie Reaches Moscow And Confers With Gromyko
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 14 (Reuters) Senator Edmund Muskie, con tender for the Democratic Presi dential nomination in 1972, talked today with Foreign Min ister Andrei A. Gromyko.

title: Phone Union Votes To Continue Strike; Upstate Offices Hit
description: The strike by telephone mechanics here spread yester day to many areas upstate and threatened to involve the parent American Telephone & Tele graph Company and its manu facturing subsidiary, Western Electric.

title: RESEARCH LAG LAID TO POWER INDUSTRY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14The chairman of the Federal Power Commission, John N. Nassikas, chastised the nation's fuel and power industries today for spending too little on research and development.

title: RAIL TONMILEAGE OFF FROM '70 LEVEL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14 Freight traffic on United States railroads and intercity truck tonnage in the week ended Jan. 9 were both below the volume in the corresponding week of last year.

title: Knicks Lose 3d in Row, 10788;
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Jan. 14 Amazing blunders continued to dog the New York Knicks to night as they were outplayed in every department by the Phoenix Suns, who rang up a 10788 victory before a pleased crowd of 9.051 at Veterans Memorial Coliseum.

title: Christianity and Apartheid
description: LONDONLooking back on the past year, I believe that two of the most important events as far as southern Africa is concerned may well prove to have been in the sphere of religion. I am thinking of the Pope's official reception in the Vatican of representa tives of the socalled freedom fight ers in Portuguese Africaa term, I hasten to add, which I find one of the more reprehensible euphemisms of our time. The other was the decision of the World Council of Churches to give moral and financial support to men who try to change by violence the social systems in Portuguese Africa, Rhodesia and the Union of South Africa.

title: N.B.C. TO ANALYZE NIXON'S ADDRESS
description: The National Broadcasting Company, criticized along with the two other major networks by Vice President Agnew for their instant analyses that fol lowed several of President Nix on's addresses, said yesterday it would do a preanalysis of the President's welfare propos als immediately before its tele cast of Mr. Nixon's State of the Union Message.

title: Auto Strike Cost Assayed
description: DETROIT, Jan. 14 (UPI) Mayor Roman S. Gribbs says that the United Automobile Workers 67day strike against the General Motors Corpora tion cost Detroit at least $4 million and that a strike against the Chrysler Corpora tion would be literally catas trophic. He made his remarks at a news conference yester day as union and Chrysler bargainers held negotiations for a new threeyear contract.

title: Lesson for Poland's Planners
description: WARSAW  Economic factors have often played key roles in determining the poli cies of East European gov ernments. Last year, they were responsible for the most dramatic news in the. Com munist bloc  the downfall of the Gomulka regime in Poland.

title: PRICES ON AMEX STAGE LATE GAIN
description: Most prices on the American Stock Exchange finished higher yesterday after a late upswing erased most of the earlier losses.

title: Weight Watchers Change Diet After Mercury Study
description: A weightreducing diet that stressed tuna and other fish has been modified after persons on the diet were found to have higher than normal concentra tions of mercury. None of the concentrations found however, are known to be hazardous.

title: Portugal Is Short of Sailors
description: LISBONThis ancient sea faring nation is seeking solu tions to an embarrassing problem: a shortage of sailors.

title: Ali Opens Training Grind With His Pockets Jingling
description: MIAMI BEACH, Jan. 14 As he sat on a rubbing table in the Fifth Street Gym to day, Muhammad Ali was wrapping an elastic bandage on each hand. He was about to begin training for his heavyweight title showdown with Joe Frazier on March 8 at Madison Square Garden, and three rolls of fat wrinkled his midsection.

title: CeaseFire Quiets Jordan, But the Hatred Remains
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Jan. 14A truce agreement between Arab commandos and the Jordanian Government brought a halt to day to the latest round of fight ing but left the hatecharged situation fundamentally un changed.

title: French Discover Restraint Worked Too Well, and Are Turning to Expansion
description: PARISThe French econo my caused a lot of concern in 1970, but from January to December the reasons for it shifted dramatically,

title: Allegations Denied
description: MANILA, Jan. 14 (UPI)  Vice President Lopez said in a telephone interview today that he knew nothing about the al legations made by President Marcos against his family busi ness interests.

title: Week's G.I. Casualties Are Lowest Since 1965
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 14 (UPI)  The United States command said today that 27 Americans were killed in action in Indochina last week and 83 were wounded.

title: 75 Forced Out by Blast
description: Seventyfive persons were driven out of the Bronx Social Security offices yesterday when a furnace exploded in the base ment. One man working on the furnace was slightly injured. The blast occurred shortly be fore 10 A.M., in the offices at 2359 Jerome Avenue, near 184th Street. All but 10 of those driven out were staff members. The workman in jured was Frederico Roman, 26 years old, of 144 East 150th Street, the Bronx.

title: COSTS STILL STEEP ON CITY BOND SALE
description: While the cost of borrowing money has dropped sharply this winter, New York City has failed to benefit significantly from the decline.

title: Israelis Report Killing 10 Guerrillas in Lebanon
description: TEL AVIV, Friday Jan. 15 Ten Arab guerrillas were reported killed last night when Israeli forces struck at a base eight miles up the Lebanese coast, according to an army announcement here today. Six Israelis were re ported slightly wounded.

title: BETHLEHEM CITES 40% PROFIT DROP
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corpo ration, in the midst of a sharp controversy with the White House about price increases, made public its 1970 earnings yesterday, about two weeks earlier than normal.

title: U.S. PLAYERS BOW IN AUSSIE TENNIS
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 14 (AP)  Mrs. Margaret Smith Court easily swept into the women's semifinals as the last two Americans were defeated today in the New South Wales tennis championships.

title: Podgorny Meets Sadat
description: CAIRO, Jan. 14 (Reuters)  President Nikolai V. Pod gorny of the Soviet Union conferred today with President Anwar elSadat after hailing Egypt's current attempt to ob tain a peaceful settlement with Israel.

title: List Covers Up to Dec. 31
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14An Army spokesman said today that the list that Ambassador Bruce tried to hand over cov ered the period up to Dec. 31, 1970.

title: H. Wilson Lloyd, Director Of Publicity for Hospital
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Jan. 14 H. Wilson Lloyd, director of public relations of Lawrence Hospital since 1966, died yes terday at the hospital. His age was 70. He lived at 9 Midland Gardens.

title: 12 SLATED TO GO IN $64,100 RACE
description: MIAMI, Jan. 14 (UPI)Al Hattab and Judgable will lead 12 horses postward tomorrow for the $64,100 Tropical Park Handicap, the closingday fea ture at the track and the first bigmoney race of the Florida season.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: TARRYTOWN, N. Y., Jan. 14 (AP)Sister Elizabeth has been suspended with pay from her post as art history instructor at Marymount College.

title: Insurance Groups Fight Plan to Curb Policy Cancellations
description: Representatives of insurance company groups yesterday strongly opposed any proposal for new legislation that would make it more difficult for them to cancel policies covering bur glary, household, automobile and other personal lines of in surance.

title: The Parties Start Early Among Crosby Golfers
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif., Jan. 14The temperature in Palm Beach may be a balmy 80, but quite a few of its winter residents are in Peb ble Beach, braving freezing temperatures and chilling winds all in the cause of the 30th annual Bing Crosby Pro Amateur Golf Tournament.

title: U.S. Official Lauds City For Veterans'
description: The chairman of President Nixon's Jobs for Veterans Commission said yesterday that New York City's pro gram for placing returning veterans in jobs might serve as a model for the nation.

title: Trot Tracks Oppose Separate O.T.B. Pool
description: New York's eight harness racing tracks have appealed to the state to block efforts by the city's OffTrack Betting Corporation to set up separate wagering pools.

title: HERBERT O. BERGDAHL
description: Herbert O. Bergdahl of 2 Tudor City Place, who retired in 1956 as executive vice president and general merchan dise manager of the Associated Merchandising Corporation, died Wednesday in Roosevelt Hospital after a short illness. He was 71 years old.

title: SURPLUS BUOYS LONDON MARKET
description: Encouraged by the report of a December trade surplus for Britain of $134.4million, the London stock market moved ahead yesterday with initial gains industrial issues.

title: U.S.Latin Travel at Peak
description: MIAMI, Jan. (UPI)  The American Travel Organization reported today a 11.1 per cent increase in tourist travel be tween the United States and South America in 1970 to a record 513,000 persons who spent about $100million, ex cluding transport. Luis Zala mea, its executive director, said it was the first time the travel figure had crossed the halfmillion mark.

title: Taiwan Said to Execute Man Who Wrote Peking
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Jan. 14 A Taiwanese businessman was executed two months ago for writing a letter to a Communist Chinese official while in Hong Kong, it has been learned from reliable sources.

title: Air Canada to Lay Off 415, Including 32 U.S. Workers
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 14 (UPI) Air Canada said yesterday that it would lay off 415 employes as a result of the rate of de crease in traffic growth and inflationary pressures on oper ating costs. The publicly owned airline has 17,700 employes.

title: Topics of Warsaw: Wages and Rent
description: WARSAWThe specialty of the house at Kawiarnia Telimena on Krakowskie Przedmiescie, a main avenue in this city, is oldstyle Polish coffee, and the place is al most always jammed.

title: Judge Rules Caldwell Belongs to A.B.A. Club
description: The American Basketball As sociation won the right to Joe Caldwell yesterday and skir mishing for Spencer Haywood continued in United States Dis trict Court in Los Angeles.

title: OIL ACCORD SIGNED ON TANKER SPILLAGE
description: The world's major oil com panies signed here yesterday a voluntary agreement that would compensate for damage from tanker spills through pay ments of up to $30million for any incident.

title: Nun Refuses to Give Testimony To Berrigan Case Grand Jury
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Jan. 14 (UPI)A Roman Catholic nun refused today to testify before a Federal grand jury investi gating an alleged plot by Rev. Philip F. Berrigan and five other persons to kidnap Henry A. Kissinger, a Presidential ad viser, and damage Federal buildings.

title: Miss Callahan Becomes Bride Of Stockbroker
description: Miss Frances Wynne Calla han, daughter of Judge Alfred J. Callahan of the Civil Court and Mrs. Callahan of River dale, the Bronx, was married yesterday afternoon to John J. Dalessandro 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. John J. Dalessandro of New York and Southamp ton, L. I.

title: DR. EMIL A. PASCAL
description: Dr. Emil A. Pascal, former director of gynecology at Mother Cabrini and Columbus Hospital here, died yesterday of a heart attack at the home of his daughter, Mrs. Antonino Corigliano, in Rome, where he lived. His age was 87.

title: Indian Victory on Coast
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 14 (UPI)American Indian dem onstrators who have seized surplus Federal property in California and Washington won their first victory today since the occupation of Alcatraz Is land 14 months ago. The Gov ernment, faced with an Indian occupation of a surplus Army site near Davis, Calif., since Nov. 3, issued a temporary per mit allowing its use by a group of Indians and MexicanAmmi

title: INDUSTRY OUTPUT UP IN DECEMBER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14In dustrial production rebounded in December because of the end of the General Motors strike, the Federal Reserve Board re ported today.

title: Stars'
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Jan. 14 (UPI)The Utah Stars rallied tonight to down Memphis, 116102, despite a 29point per formance by Charlie Williams of the Pros.

title: Tate Jury, Together Since July, To Begin Deliberations Today
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 14A jury that has been sequestered longer than any other in Cali fornia history will decide the guilt or innocence of Charles M. Manson and three members of his hippie family who are charged with the TateLaBianca murders.

title: Baker, ExAide of Senate, Enters Prison
description: LEWISBURG, Pa., Jan. 14 Robert G. Baker, who became a millionaire while serving as a United States Senate aide on a salary of $19,600, walked handcuffed and hatless through sleeting rain into the Federal penitentiary here today.

title: $250,000 Real Estate Swindle Is Laid to Lawyer
description: WHITE PLAINS, Jan. 14 Robert E. Henning, a lawyer, was charged today with steal ing a quarter of a million dol lars from more than 100 West chester residents in a reales tate swindle.

title: Pistons Edge Cavaliers
description: DETROIT, Jan. 14 (UPI)  Jimmy Walker sank a 15foot jump shot with four seconds to play to pace a Detroit come back tonight and give the Pistons a 108106 National Basketball Association victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers,

title: Greenwich Village Area Gets New Police Station
description: The Charles Street police sta tion, which has served Green wich Village for 73 years, will be replaced Monday, Police Headquarters announced yes terday.

title: Why Coaches Turn Gray
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Jan. 14 (UPI)  Bill Mitchell, coach of the lastplace Toledo Hornets of the International Hockey League, resigned today because, as ex plained by the general man ager, Jerry Nuerge, Bill has become frustrated with the performance of the team, it has affected his health.

title: Stage: A Lady Hamlet
description: Dame Judith Anderson has had a long, distinguished career in the theater and for some time has dreamed about playing Hamlet. Not just in Hamlet after all, she once was Ger trude to Gielgud's Hamlet but as Hamlet.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: LOUIS F. GREITER, 67, EXPOLICE INSPECTOR
description: Louis F. Greiter, who retired as an inspector in the Police Department in 1960, died, Wednesday in St. Vincent's Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived at 2682 Creston Avenue, the Bronx.

title: 26% IN 6TH GRADE ARE POOR READERS
description: State Education Commission er Ewald B. Nyquist said yes terday that 26 per cent of sixthgrade pupils in the state's public schools were below the minimum competence level in reading.

title: DR. HAROLD H. LEFFT OF MEDICAL CENTER
description: Dr. Harold H. Lefft of 903 Park Avenue, a neurologist who headed the Allied Medical Cen ter at 70 West 40th Street, died Wednesday evening, apparently of a heart attack, while working out at the West Side Y. M. C. A. gymnasium. He was 59 years old.

title: Watered Beaujolais
description: MOULINS, France, Jan. 14 (UPI)  A convoy of trailers spilled 264,000 gallons of Beau jolais into a river yesterday when the tractor pulling them overturned. The wine would have filled a million bottles.

title: Devine Agrees to 5Year Pact With Packers as Coach and General Manager
description: GREEN BAY, Wis., Jan. 14 (AP)Dan Devine, the Univer silty of Missouri coach, was named head coach and general, manager today of the Green Bay Packers, who have suffered through three mediocre Nation al Football League seasons since Vince Lombardi left them.

title: CHILE TO NATIONALIZE BETHLEHEM'S MINES
description: SANTIAGO, Chile Jan. 14, (Reuters)  The Chilean Government has announced that it will nationalize the BethlehemChile Iron Mines, a subsidiary of the Bethlehem Steel Corporation.

title: For Arabs, a Victory in Oil Skirmish
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The Arab states, frustrated in their tedious battle with Israel, consoled them selves with at least one re sounding gain last yeara victory over the Western companies that supply Arab oil to Western Europe and Japan.

title: HUNDREDS OF POLICE OUT; LEAVE BEATS TO PROTEST RULING IN PAYPARITY CASE
description: Hundreds of policemen throughout the city, angered by a State Court of Appeals deci sion yesterday ordering a trial in their payparity case, refused to go out on patrol last night and early today in a spreading wildcat work stoppage.

title: BRIBECASE FIGURE IS OBSCURE HERE
description: Inquiries yesterday indicated that Edward Adams, the 80 yearold advertising agency president indicted Wednesday on charges of conspiring to quash a Federal stockfraud case, lives in comparatively modest style and is virtually unknown among local politi cians.

title: PANTHER LINKED TO SHOOTOUT CAR
description: The automobile involved in an alleged shootout off the Harlem River Drive between two Black Panthers and two policemen was rented in the name of Clark E. Squire, a de fendant in the current trial of 13 Panthers, according to evi dence introduced in State Su preme Court yesterday.

title: Hijacking Costs Linger On
description: Airline executives, badly shaken by a series of hijack ings in the last 12 months rand faced with mounting costs, are searching for ways to revive their once bright image.

title: Haiti Revises Law for Duvalier's Son
description: PORT  AU  PRINCE, Haiti, Jan. 14 (UPI)  Congress re vised Haiti's Constitution today so that Dr. Francois Duvalier, the 63yearold President for Life, could eventually be suc ceeded by his son, Jean Claude.

title: Administration Moving Cautiously on Steel Prices
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14 The Government moved slowly today in its confrontation over prices with parts of the steel industry, with decisions on what actions might he taken still a long way off.

title: State Unit on Drugs Reported to Favor Reduced Penalties
description: ALBANY, Jan. 14The Tem porary State Commission to Evaluate Drug Laws will go be yond the recommendations of its subcommittee and urge even further reductions in the penal ties for possession of marijuana, commission sources said today.

title: Goyette Paces Sabres
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 14 (UPI) Phil Goyette scored his second goal of the game on a tipin from the crease in the third period tonight to give the Buf falo Sabres a 21 victory over the St. Louis Blues.

title: Foe Attacks Force on Pnompenh Route
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Jan. 14 (AP)Cambodian and South Vietnamese troops came under violent attack today as they sought to clear a key supply route to Pnompenh, military spokesmen here reported.

title: POLLUTION FIGHT ON LAKES URGED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14  A joint commission of the United States and Canada recom mended today that the two gov ernments take immediate action to control pollution in the lower Great Lakes and the St. Lawrence River.

title: Hell's Angel Freed By Jury in Slaying At a Rock Concert
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Jan. 14 (UPI)A member of the Hell's Angels motorcycle gang was found not guilty today of a slaying that was recorded on film at the 1969 Altamont Rock Music Concert attended by 300,000 people.

title: U.S. UNIT WARNS OF CORVAIR FUMES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14 The Department of Transporta tion, in a special consumer protection bulletin, warned owners of about 1.4 million Chevrolet Corvairs today of possible health and safety hazards in the heating systems of their cars.

title: Advertising:
description: During one of those rare delays on the Penn Central, Larchmontbound Joseph J. DiBuono while buried in a paperback version of The Godfather, was struck by the thought, Wouldn't a nice fourcolor ad stick out beau tifully amid this vast back ground of black type? (Or thoughts to that effect.)

title: Flyers Halt Loafs, 30
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 14(AP) Cliff Schmautz tallied a goal from just inside the blue line in the opening 24 seconds tonight and the Philadelphia Flyers went on to hand the Toronto Maple Leafs their sec ond defeat in their last 17 games, 30.

title: Italians Shrug As Eggs Pile Up
description: ROME Breakfast, Italian style, is a cup of strong espresso or cappuccino and a roll. If Italians could only be persuaded to start their day less frugally, there would be no egg glut.

title: A FIVEYEAR REVISION OF BUDGET IS URGED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14 (AP) The National Urban Coalition proposed a fiveyear program to change basic national priori ties through a revision of the Federal budget in 1972 through 1976.

title: J. Glenn Beall, Former Senator From Maryland, Is Dead at 76
description: FROSTBURG, Md., Jan. 14 J Glenn Beall, who served as a Representative from 1942 to 1952 and as a Senator from 1952 to 1964, died early today of a heart ailment. He was 76 year old.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14 President Nixon's confrontation with Big Steel over a big price increase will be a drawnout drama. There'll be no midnight calls on reporters to testify as to who said what, as in the Kennedy years. There'll be no bear hugs of the tycoons by a Johnsonian figure explaining nose to nose why his interests are also theirs. There will be some cool calculations of bal ance sheets, some discreet searching for weap ons to influence the market place and a determined effort to demonstrate to the men of steel and other major indus tries that excessive wage de mands will never be checked if they insist on keeping the lead up the ladder of inflation.

title: Rome Decrees Austerity for 2 Nations
description: ROMEChristmas business was sluggish in the glittering, trafficchoked Italian cities, and the next few months will show whether the country is merely pulling out of an in flationary crisis or heading toward a recession.

title: Point of View
description: MUCH has been said and written about the com mon agricultural policy of the European Economic Corn munity especially in the United States, and most of this is of en unkind nature. Do the facts confirm these Complaints?

title: Army Clears Hutto in Deaths at Mylai
description: FORT McPHERSON, Ga., Jan. 14Sgt. Charles E. Hutto, the former Louisiana farm hand accused of joining in the al leged slaughter of South Viet namese civilians at Mylai 4, was acquitted today by a court martial jury of six officers.

title: Cameroon Oppositionist Bishop Spared
description: YAOUNDE, Cameroon, Jan 14 (AP)President Ahmadou Ahi djo commuted to life imprison ment today the death sentence of Msgr. Albert Ndongmo, Ro man Catholic Bishop of Nkong samba, in southwest Cameroon.

title: John Glenn's Mother Dies
description: NEW CONCORD, Ohio, Jan. 14 (UPI)Mrs. Cora Glenn, mother of the former astronaut, John H. Glenn Jr., was found dead at her home today, ap parently a heart attack victim. She was 73 years old. A neigh bor found the body on a couch in front of a television set. The authorities said she could have been dead for as long as 36 hours. Mr. Glenn had visited his mother Tuesday night.

title: Merger News
description: MetroGoldwynMayer, Inc., is holding merger discussions with major stockholders of the Twentieth CenturyFox Film Corporation, it was disclosed yesterday by James T. Aubrey Jr., president and chief execu tive officer of MGM.

title: MEDICAL FREEDOM URGED FOR MINORS
description: An official of Planned Parent hood of New York City called yesterday for enactment of pro posed state legislation that would give minors the right to obtain medical careincluding contraception and abortion without parental consent.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: GENEVAThe European Free Trade Association can look back on decade of accomplishments and look ahead with increased confidence to achieving a paradoxical goal: its disappearance.

title: Vermont Business Program
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., Jan. 14 (AP)Gov. Deane C. Davis announced today a program designed to, revive Vermont's sagging economy, now in its worst slump since the early nineteen sixties. He plans a campaign aimed, to attract new industry to Vermont and a study of the state's economic problems to be coupled with detailed suggested solutions.

title: Allied Chemical Sees Sharp Drop In 1970 Earnings
description: John T. Connor, chairman of the Allied Chemical Corpora tion told a news conference yesterday that the company's earnings in 1970 before extra ordinary income would drop to $1.55 a share from $2.44 a share in 1969.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: ABSORBING DUO GIVES A CHAMBER PROGRAM
description: Peter Rosenfeld, cellist, and Seymour Bernstein, pianist, make an uncomplicated but absorbing chamber music duo. In their concert Wednesday night at the New York Cultural Center they showed that they are, singly and together, highly skilled, natural, outgoing musi cians without idiosyncrasies of style. Their playing was direct, heartfelt and open.

title: 2 Weekend Menus
description: In the menus below, dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: Upstate and Suburban Increases In Welfare Said to Exceed City's
description: ALBANY, Jan. 14Welfare rolls have been increasing at faster rates upstate and in the suburbs than in New York City, according to data released today by the State Department of Social Services.

title: Sorry, Wrong Tactic
description: The strike of telephone repairmen and installers, totally irresponsible to begin with, has become totally inexcusable as it spreads across the state. Here is the unique spectacle of an organized labor group walking off the job because other members of the same union, presumably more skilled and experienced, have been brought in from various cities to help in the urgent task of restoring a telephone service already in an extreme stage of deterioration.

title: Unemployment Up in Canada
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 14 (UPI) Canada's seasonally adjusted unemployment rate rose to 6.6 per cent in December from 6.5 per cent in November, with a total of 538,000 persons out of work, the Dominion Bureau of Statistics reported today. There was an aboveaverage increase in unemployment among men 25 years and older and a small than  average increase among persons 14 to 24, the bureau reported.

title: 4 BUSINESS GROUPS ASK PENSION STAND
description: Four of New York City's leading business organizations joined yesterday in what they called an unprecedented joint statement urging Mayor Lind say to resist any expansion of current pension plans for the uniformed services.

title: In Ulster, Strife and Worry
description: BELFAST, Northern Ire landAgainst a background of two years of periodic civil strife and a widespread in ternational business reces sion, Northern Ireland is con fronting a worrisome eco nomic future.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: PARIS  The European Common Market made some dramatic prog ress in the last year as it estab lished a common commercial policy, extended its network of preferential trade agreements, opened negotiations for enlargement and started on the long, obstaclestrewn path toward monetary union.

title: Bridge: Color Code on Master Pins May Show Skill of Opponent
description: Gauging the skill and ex perience of another player in the huryburly of a major tournament where one can only know a small minority of those present can be a difficult problem. It may, however, be necessary when assessing an opponent or a potential partner, or when furnishing explanations re quested during the bidding.

title: Little 727 Dressed to Look Like a Jumbo Jet
description: The Boeing Company is getting deeper into the inte rior design business, offering remodeled interiors on its 707 and 727 jets at what the Seattlebased aircraft produc er considers the bargain price of $160,000.

title: Fascinating Quilt, New Dance Work, Is True to Its Title
description: Quilt, a fascinating new work by the moderndance choreographer Elizabeth Keen, had its premiere on Wednesday night at the Judson Theater.

title: Play for Alice Theater
description: Alive and So Bold, a new play by Richard Joel Davis and presented by Ronald Robert Dener, will start previews at the Alice Theater, 137 A West 14th Street, on Thursday, Jan. 28.

title: 70 Freed by Brazil for Envoy Arrive Jubilantly in Santiago
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Jan. 14 Seventy Brazilian revolution. aries, Jubilant over their release from prison in exchange for a kidnapped Swiss diplomat, ar rived in Chile today and were granted political asylum.

title: PRUDENTIAL SEEKS TO JOIN EXCHANGE
description: The Prudential Insurance Company, the world's largest insurance concern, is trying to get approval to join the Phila delphia  Baltimore Washington Stock Exchange.

title: German Company Drops Plans For Complex in South Carolina
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Jan. 14 (UPI)An environmental con troversy ended today when the Germanowned B.A.S.F. Corpo ration announced it was aban doning plans to build a $100 million petrochemical complex along an unspoiled section of the South Carolina coast.

title: BankAmerica and Chase Report Record Earnings
description: Two of the nation's largest banks reported yesterday that net income, assets and deposits advanced to new highs during 1970.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: MIAMI, Jan. 14Dick Nolan of the San Francisco 49ers and Paul Brown of the Cincinnati Bengals were named to coach oftheyear honors today in their conferences of the Nation al Football League by the Pro fessional Football Writers of America.

title: CITY RIGHTS UNIT PONDERS SEX LAW
description: The Barbizon Hotel for Women, the New York Mets, a chain of Bowery hotels and restaurant and hotel associa tions were among the disparate institutions that urged the City Commission on Human Rights yesterday to honor their long standing practices of discrimin ating between the sexes.

title: Alaskans Hail Federal Report Approving Arctic Oil Pipeline
description: FAIRBANKS, Jan. 14An In terior Department report term ing acceptable the environ mental damage that would re sult from building an 800mile long pipeline to carry crude oil from the rich Arctic Slope fields met with wide approval among Alaskans today.

title: Where Are the Judges?
description: Upholding the principle that justice delayed is justice denied, the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit has laid down an admirable regulation for the District Courts in its jurisdiction, including the Southern District of Now York. Suspects in criminal cases will from now on be brought to trial in six months or enjoy an excellent chance of having their cases dismissed. The only question posed by this essential speedup of the system is: where are the judges who are to speed it up?

title: WILLIAM B. BOULTON
description: William B. Boulton, a retired stockbroker, died Monday in St. Luke's Hospital after a short illness. He was 88 years old and lived at 400 East 58th Street.

title: Eureka! A Good Hamburger
description: The restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored where indicated.

title: U.S. Terms Cambodia Airlift Possible
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14  The United States left open the possibility today that it might provide logistic and airlift sup port for the South Vietnamese forces in Cambodia if required by the deteriorating military situation there.

title: Taxi Commission
description: The City Council's growing skepticism toward the demand for a large increase in taxi rates reflects an understandable lack of confidence in the figures sup plied by the industry and underscores the public's need for an independent taxi commission to regulate it.

title: Opposition Tribally Based
description: YAOUNDE, Jan. 14 (Agence FrancePresse)Most of the oppositionists in the recent trials are members of the Bantuspeaking Bamileke peo ple of southern Cameroon. The Bamileke have long felt that they are deprived of a suffi cient part in the government.

title: Cougars Down Floridians
description: MIAMI BEACH, Jan. 14 (AP) George Lehman sank two free throws with four seconds remaining tonight and clinched a 133130 victory for the Caro lina Cougars over the Floridi ans. It was the fifth loss in a row for the lastplace club.

title: Advertising:
description: Young & Rubicam, which with Doyle Dane Bernbach has dominated advertising awards competitions for years, has cut back drasti cally on the number of such events it will enter, it was learned yesterday.

title: Soviet Retrenching as BigGrowth Period Ends
description: MOSCOW  Under heavy prodding from the Communist party and helped by good weather conditions, the Soviet economy rebounded in 1970 from the serious slump of the previous year. But the out look for 1971the first in a new fiveyear plan  is for continued strains, in almost all sectors of the economy.

title: Jerusalem's Expansion
description: A recent dispute in the Jerusalem City Council reflects growing concern among Israelis, as well as Arabs, over the future of the Holy City, a question which may well hold the key to the ultimate success or failure of the renewed ArabIsraeli peace talks.

title: Turkish Friend's Warning
description: ISTANBUL, TurkeyOne of the most successful and thoughtful businessmen in Turkeynow 57 years old can remember from his child hood the scorn genteel Turk ish families once held for commerce.

title: Volcker Calls Inflation's Rise Checked
description: Paul A. Volcker, Under Secre tary of the Treasury for Mone tary Affairs, said yesterday that the momentum of infla tion has clearly been checked and a stronger expansion of the economy should be pos sible for some time ahead without refueling inflationary pressures.

title: Omsk Troupe Begins U.S. Tour Next Week
description: The 100member Siberian Singers and Dancers of Omsk will arrive here next Wednes day on its first American tour and will start a brief New England run in Storrs, Conn., next Friday, coming to New York for a 10day engagement at Carnegie Hall, starting Jan. 28. The engage ment was confirmed yester day by Columbia Artists Management, in association with J. H. Zaravich.

title: TURNAROUND MADE ON THE BIG BOARD
description: The stock market staged an impressive turnaround yester day, shrugging off a morning spell of profit taking to finish with an advance.

title: BRITAIN BARS GUARD FOR MOST IN CABINET
description: LONDON, Jan. 14The Cabi net decided today that it would not at present assign personal bodyguards to all members of the Government.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: BRUSSELSIn a sense, as the seat of NATO and of the Common Market, Brussels has become West Europe's capital although Paris, Rome or even modest Bonn are not yet ready to concede it parity as a status symbol.

title: Hamer Budge Elected To Fund Post by I.D.S.
description: Hamer H. Budge, recently resigned chairman of the Se curities and Exchange Com mission, yesterday was elect ed president of the mutual funds managed by Investors Diversified Services.

title: Bears Trample Over the Bourses
description: If it is any comfort to the Wall Street speculator who didn't quite get even in the yearend rally, 1970 was a better year for him than it was for his fellows watching other tickers around the world.

title: Student Found Hanged
description: ATHENS, Ga., Jan. 14 (AP) John M. Vantrease Jr., 25 years old, of Bernardsville, N. J., a graduate student at the Uni versity of Georgia, was found yesterday hanged in his room in a privately owned dormitory, a university spokesman said.

title: Market Place:The Real Estate Investment Trust
description: Shopping centers, apart ment buildings and skyscrap ers go up all over the coun try and it is obvious that it takes a pile of dough to put them up.

title: Mrs. Marcello Caetano, 64. Portuguese Premier's Wife
description: LISBBON, Jan. 14  Doa Maria Teresa de Barros Caetano, wife of the Premier of Portugal, died today after a long illness. She was 64 years old.

title: Shirley MacLaine, Concerned With Causes and Fashion Also
description: Hardly anyone lifted his head from his book in the main reading room of the New York Public Library to stare at the woman in the brown pants suit even though there was a camera trained on her. She was Shirley MacLaine, filming a scene for The Possession of Joel Delaney, but she could just as well have been a fashionable suburbanite.

title: BABIN IS PLEASING IN PIANO RECITAL
description: Stanley Babin's piano recital at Tully Hall on Wednesday night made for an evening of pleasant listening on the whole. It was that of a musician whose talents, skills and interpretative ideas seemed about evenly matched, and who did not seem to be aiming for effects or goals beyond his powers.

title: ROBERT CARSE, 67, WROTE SEA BOOKS
description: EAST HAMPTON, L.I., Jan. 14Robert Carse, a writer whose own experience as a merchant mariner in war and peace provided a theme for many of his books, died here today, apparently of a heart attack. He was 67 years old.

title: Colts' Positive Attitude Rubs Off on Two ExSteelers
description: MIAMI, Jan. 14For two members of the Baltimore Colts, the Super Bowl game symbolizes a successful es cape.

title: Johnson Enters Texas Hospital; Mild Viral Pneumonia Feared
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Jan. 14 (AP)  Former President Lyn don B. Johnson has been hos pitalized for a probable viral pneumonia. Friends said he had a bad cold and indicated that he had been brought here as a precaution.

title: Royal, McClendon Tie In CoachofYear Vote
description: HOUSTON, Tex., Jan. 14 Darrell Royal of the University of Texas became the first man to be named University Divi sion coach of the year two times by his colleagues as he and Charlie McClendon of Lou isiana State University were voted cowinners of the Ameri can Football Coaches Associa tion's annual award today.

title: Stars Deadlock Canadiens
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Jan. 14 (UPI)Murray Oliver drove in Danny O'Shea's pass with 3:57 remaining tonight to give the Minnesota North Stars a 33 tie with the Montreal Ca nadiens.

title: Trade Fairs Range From Pollution Control to Catering
description: Nearly 1,000 trade fairs and specialized exhibitions have been scheduled during 1971 in more than 60 countries, accord ing to a compilation by the United States Department of Commerce. The following listing is a sampling of the compila tion, designed to show the variety of exhibits and the wide range of countries in which they are held.

title: Opposition Deputy Slain By Gunmen in Guatemala
description: GUATEMALA, Jan. 14 (UPI) The Government reported to day the killing of an opposition deputy, Adolfo Mijangos Lopez, by three gunmen last night.

title: Poor Lebanese Say Hashish Is Richer Than Grain, More Moral Than Bombs
description: BEIRUT, LebanonTour ists innocently visiting the magnificent Roman ruins at Baalbek, beautifully situated among the abundant crops of Lebanon's Bekaa Valley, have been disconcerted to find themselves in the midst of the flourishing and nom inally illegal hashish busi ness.

title: Executive Changes
description: K. Wade Bennett has been named president of Macy's New York and Mark Handler has been named president of Bamberger's, both store divisions of R. H. Macy & Co., Inc., effective Aug. 1.

title: Pittsburgh Strike Enjoined
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 14 (AP) An Allegheny County Com mon Pleas Court judge today ordered striking nonuniformed city employes back to work immediately. The workers have been on strike since Jan. 4, halting garbage collections and street maintenance in this city of 600,000. They began return ing to their Jobs tonight. Judge Loran Lewis also ordered the city to begin negotiations to settle the dispute, brought on when the city docked five Plumbers a day's pay for re fusing to drive their own trucks.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Germans Wonder: '71, Bad or Worse
description: BONN  An economic guessing game being played by millions of West Germans now could be entitled: How bad will 1971 be?

title: Delayed Issue of Scanlan's Is on Sale at Stands in City
description: Distribution of a controver sial and longdelayed issue of Scanlan's Monthly began yes terday in the city, according to Sidney E. Zion, an editor of the magazine.

title: Spain Is Feeling Pressure from Growth
description: MADRID  In a month or so, license plate number 900,000 will be assigned here, making some member of Spain's rising middleclass very happy, and adding to the difficulties of Madrid's Mayor, Carlos Arias Navarro. Mr. Arias was once Spain's Chief of Police: His present job is much more difficult.

title: CARRIER INTRODUCES NEW AIRCONDITIONER
description: SYRACUSE, Jan. 14 The Carrier Corporation demon strated here today a new cen tral airconditioning system aimed specifically at the apart ment building market. Called the Volumaster, the new sys tem combines a solidstate variable air volume control with a 232yearold aerodynam ic effect known as Bernoulli's Principle, which causes condi tioned air to cling to the ceiling and at the same time regulate the air temperature.

title: Bucher Still Held
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan, 14 (UPI)  Photographs of the arrival in Chile of 70 Brazilian political prisoners, whose free dom was demanded as ransom for Mr. Bucher, were published in newspapers today. Mr. Bucher's release was believed imminent.

title: Abernathy Plans 3 Protest Rallies
description: The Rev. Ralph David Aber nathy announced last night that the Southern Christian Leadership Conference, would sponsor national conferences of black leaders, minority groups and students this spring in an attempt to save this critically sick nation.

title: The Swiss Job Problem: A Difference
description: GENEVAAt latest count, there were 59 unemployed persons in all of Switzerland. At the same time, 4,885 jobs were going begging.

title: Hard Judgments Urged by Agnew On Welfare Issues
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Jan. 14 (UPI)  Vice President Agnew said today the welfare problem would never be re solved until hard social judg ments were faced about whether taxpayers should fi nance illegitimate children and keep terminal patients alive.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE PARAGON, By John Knowles, 210 pages. Random House, $5.95.

title: Relief in Vatican
description: ROME, Jan. 14 (AP)The Vatican expressed relief today after receiving word that the death sentence of Bishop Ndongmo had been commuted.

title: 7 Arabs Wounded in Gaza
description: GAZA, Jan. 14 (Reuters)  Israeli forces shot and wounded seven Arabs  including two guerrillashere today in the latest of a series of incidents in the occupied Gaza Strip of Palestine.

title: McGovern Declares He'll Enter Primaries
description: SHIPPENSBURG, Pa., Jan. 14 (AP)Senator George S. McGovern, Democrat of South Dakota, said tonight he planned to enter all Presiden tial primaries in the principal states during 1972 because that's where the Democratic Presidential nomination will be decided.

title: Monetary Policy Is Eased Another Notch by Reserve
description: The Federal Reserve's weekly banking statistics ap peared yesterday to give added support to the notion that the credit managers had eased policy by another notch in recent weeks. The money supply, for example, averaged $214.7bil lion in the four weeks ended Jan. 6, up at an annual rate of 5.1 per cent from the four weeks ended Nov. 4.

title: Nordic Nations Are Ravaged by High Prices
description: STOCKHOLM  It was a year of keen economic disap pointment in the Nordic coun tries. Inflation ravaged the area, and winter ushered in the great price freeze.

title: In Harlem, Muddle Instead of Muster
description: Normally at midnight, the grimy green walls of the cen turyold building housing the 25th Precinct in East Harlem look down on a scene of almost military precision.

title: NUCLEAR MONITORING BY STATES PROPOSED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14The Atomic Energy Commission is negotiating with a few states, including New York, to give them a larger role in monitor ing emissions from nuclear power plants.

title: Valley of Faucets Prospers
description: SAN MAURIZIO D'OPA GLIO, ItalyItaly exported nearly $100million worth of faucets last year, many of them cast, cut, turned, chro miumplated, polished and assembled in this small town and two even smaller ones nearby.

title: Episcopal Bishop Elected in Hartford
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 14The Right Rev. Joseph Warren Hutchens was elected Bishop of the Episcopal Diocese of Connecticut today.

title: Police PayRatio Pact at Issue in Court
description: The dispute between the city and its patrolmen that the Court of Appeals yesterday asked the State Supreme Court to decide concerns the validity of a contract that the patrolmen contend requires the relationship between the salaries of patrolmen and sergeants to be maintained at a 3to3.5 ratio.

title: PROGRESS REPORTED IN L.I.R. BARGAINING
description: Progress was reported yes terday in negotiations between the strikethreatened Long Is land Railroad and unions repre senting electricians, machinists and boilermakers.

title: Man in the News
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14 There must be 200 idealistic plumbers out of a labor force of thirteen and a half mil lion, This recent remark by Joseph Blatchford as he labored to remold the Peace Corps from college boy ideal ism to a practical, bluecollar program, expressed the essence of the man who has been trying to create a Peace Corps in his and the Nixon Administration's image. The 35year old Mr. Blatchford is a complex man, idealist and pragmatist, organization man and utopian, unquenchable optimist and realist. He puz zles his critics.

title: With Agenda of 280 Items, Board of Estimate Continues in Session Into the Night
description: When the Board of Estimate meeting got under way yester day morning, the old hard bench hearing room on the second floor at City Hall had its usual jam of humanity and no less than 280 items to keep things humming long past nightfall.

title: Lakers Win in Toronto
description: TORONTO, Jan. 14 (UPI) Jerry West scored 33 points and Wilt Chamberlain 30 to night as the Los Angeles Lak ers rallied to defeat the Cin cinnati Royals, 126120, before 11,589 fans in the first N.B.A. game in Toronto since 1947.

title: Bitter South Africa Issue Opens Commonwealth Parley
description: SINGAPORE, Jan. 14Heads of government of the 31 mem bers of the Commonwealth convened here today in their first regular meeting outside Britain, and the nineday con ferenoe was less than a minute old when it was presented with the divisive issue that is ex pected to dominate it.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: LONDON, Jan. 14 (Reuters) The police arrested four men trying to break into the House of Commons early today. The accused were identified as members of the Welsh Lan guage Society, a Welsh nation alist group.

title: Penguins Tie Wings, 22
description: DETROIT, Jan. 14 (UPI) Jean Pronovost converted a rare penalty shot in the third period tonight to give the Pittsburgh Penguins a 22 tie with the Detroit Red Wings.

title: BONN MINISTER, HERE, CITES TIES TO WEST
description: West Germany's Minister of the Interior, Hans Dietrich Gen scher, said here yesterday that Chancellor Willy Brandt's moves to improve relations with Moscow and Eastern Europe still left Bonn's policy firmly based on the alliance with the West.

title: Romney, in Shift, Freezes Disputed Home Aid to Poor
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 14  The Federal Government froze today part of a major program of home ownership for lower income families, which a Con gressional report last week con demned as a national scandal.

title: Peter Brook's Theater Is a Living Event
description: LONDON, Jan. 14I think there is only one sort of theater, and that is a living event. There is a whole range of events, from the most trivi al to the most intense, one that involves you right through to the core Of your being. That is what one calls the dramatic life.

title: Thomas Conducts Bostonians With Flair
description: Michael Tilson Thomas, now firmly established in Boston as the associate con ductor of the Boston Sym phony Orchestra, demon strated his and his orchestra's respective skills on Wednes day evening in Philharmonic Hall. He chose an interesting and varied program, and he conducted it with the flair one has come to expect of him.

title: Sports of The Times
description: MIAMI, Jan. 14The Chicago Bears had Intercepted three of my passes and led us by 17 points, Johnny Unitas was say ing. So I waswhat's a polite word for what I'm thinking?chagrined.

title: MISS LAFFORGUE VICTOR IN SLALOM
description: GRINDELWALD, Switzerland, Jan. 14 (UPI)Britt Lafforgue had a dazzling second run today to lead a 123 sweep by France in the World Cup special slalom of the 33d Grindelwald wo men's ski races.

title: KENNECOTT FOLLOWS CUT IN COPPER PRICE
description: The Kennecott Copper Cor poration, the largest domestic copper producer, said yesterday that its price for fullplate elec trolytic copper cathodes pro duced and sold in the United States would be cut to 49 cents a pound, effective today. The action matches the Phelps Dodge Corporation's recent re duction of 2 cents a pound and makes it virtually certain to become industrywide.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: WALKER'S CAY, Bahamas While trolling in approxi mately 90 feet of water aboard the 55foot Sea Lion II with Capt. Les Flato as skipper, our first barracuda was caught and placed in a 6footlong box nearly half full of water.

title: Foster Promises Action
description: TAMPA, Fla., Jan. 14 (UPI)  Lou Viscusi, manager of Bob Foster, whose lightheavy weight title was taken away last month by the World Box ing Association, said today Foster would fight the top two contenders if reinstated. Foster was stripped of the title for failing to defend in an appro priate length of time against the No. 1 contender, Jimmy Du pree. The No. 2 contender is Vincente Rondon.

title: Net and Sales Set Marks At General Foods Corp.
description: The General Foods Corpora tion achieved record earnings and sales in the three and nine months ended Dec. 26, the leading food processor reported from its White Plains, N. Y. headquarters yesterday.

title: Institutions to the Exchange?
description: The Dreyfus Corporation, one of the nation's largest mutual fund organizations, has applied for membership on the New York Stock Exchange, bringing to a head the highly controversial issue of whether financial insti tutions should be allowed to join the Exchange. Resolu tion of this issue will have a major impact on the future of the Exchange and the securities industry generally.

title: CHARLES A. HARTER OF HILL SCHOOL DIES
description: POTTSTOWN, Pa., Jan. 15 Charles A. Harter, who retired as head of the science depart ment of The Hill School in 1958, died today at the age of 78.

title: South Africa to Try Again
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Jan. 15South Africa, barred today in London from the 1971 Davis Cup, will apply for admission again next year, Alfred Chambers, the President of the South African Lawn Ten nis Union, said here.

title: GOODBODY ADMITS COMMODITY ERROR
