description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (AP) The Agriculture Department announced today that Good body & Co., a New York brok erage firm, admitted that it vi olated Federal commodity fu tures regulations last year.

title: 1919 Police Strike in Boston Gave Coolidge Key to Fame
description: Policemen are almost univer sally forbidden by law to strike.

title: Mergers in West Germany Will Exceed 300 for 1970
description: BONN, Jan. 15  Spurred by a longthreatened Government action to tighten cartel laws, West Germany's merger car rousel spun at record speed throughout 1970, its bells jingling 300 times to greet ma jor amalgamations.

title: One Prosecutor Asserts Another Fabricated Rap Brown Charge
description: ELLICOTT CITY, Md., Jan. 15  A Maryland prosecutor said here today that a fellow prosecutor had told him that he had fabricated an arson charge against H. Rap Brown so the Federal Bureau of In vestigation could be called in if Mr. Brown should ever flee.

title: Archie Lochhead ls Dead at 78; Banker Led Stabilization Fund
description: VERONA, N.J., Jan. 15 Archie Lochhead, a retired banker who headed the Treas ury's $2billion Stabilization Fund from its inception in 1934 to 1939, died today at his home in the Claridge Apart ments. He was 78 years old and formerly lived in Montclair.

title: Jersey Strips Shelton College of Its Accreditation
description: TRENTON, Jan. 15  The New Jersey Board of Higher Education today stripped aca demic accreditation from Shel ton College, a small, fundamen talist Bible institution in Cape May headed by the controver sial radio evangelist, the Rev. Dr. Carl McIntire.

title: Barenboim in an Imaginative Concert
description: One thing about the new breed of conductors: They show more imagination in programing than the crop that sprouted after World War II. Those postWar ba bies came in with a repertory that seemed to stop at Rich ard Strauss. Solemnly they conducted the same Bee thoven, the same Brahms, the same Mahler. But the new ones demonstrate a much broader musical culture.

title: The Talk of Oradour
description: ORADOUR  SUR  GLANE, France, Jan. 15Nearly 27 years later, the events of June 10, 1944, still burn in the memory of what is left of this village in westcentral France.

title: I.T.T. Sets Meeting Date
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation an nounced yesterday that it would hold its annual meeting of stockholders on Wednesday, May 12, in the Westgate Plaza Hotel, San Diego, Calif.

title: Welfare Program in a College Setting
description: FARMINGDALE, L.I.One of the graduates said she had lost 60 pounds, and another said proudly that the course had given her the courage to get a driver's license.

title: BORROWING PLANNED OFFSHORE BY BANK
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15The ExportImport Bank of Wash ington announced today plans to borrow up to $1billion in offshore funds from overseas branches of United States banks. The bank said it was borrowing the offshore funds because of the present substantial availability of Eurodollars to the overseas branches.

title: Hudson River Panel Approves G.M. Sewage Treatment Plan
description: NORTH TARRYTOWN, N.Y. Jan. 15  The Hudson River Valley Commission today ap proved plans by the General Motors assembly division plant to construct three primary sew age treatment tanks along the riverbank.

title: COAST JURY GETS THE MANSON CASE
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 15 The murder trial of Charles M. Manson and three young wom en who were members of his hippie family went to the jury today, seven months after the trial began.

title: J. B. Wilson Jr. Weds Andrea Robinson
description: MADISON, Wis., Jan. 15 Miss Andrea Robinson, a student at the University of Wisconsin, was married here this evening to Joe Brans ford Wilson Jr., who expects to be graduated from Wis consin in June.

title: AL COHN, ZOOT SIMS EXCEL AT DOWNBEAT
description: After almost a quarter of a century of chasing each other through innumerable jazz per formances on their tenor saxo phones, Al Cohn and Zoot Sims have a matchless musical em pathy, which might be ex pected.

title: W. GERMANS LEAD IN BOBSLEDDING
description: IGLS, Austria, Jan. 15 (UPI)  A West German fourman bobsled team flashed down the Olympic track today at a top speed of about 87 miles an hour to take the halfway lead of the European championships.

title: Chicago Teachers Given 8% Increase In Tentative Pact
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 15Chicago's 25,000 public school teachers would be among the best paid in the nation under a tentative agreement reached early today in settlement of a strike that began Tuesday.

title: Crane Kills Man in Georgia
description: SAVANNAH, Ga., Jan. 15 (AP)A huge loading crane collapsed at the Georgia Ports Authority docks yesterday, kill ing one man and injuring four others. The dead man was John Blatz, 25 years old, of Malverne, N. Y., a representa tive of the Industrial Division of General Electric.

title: School Aid Cutoff Fought
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Jan. 15 (AP)Springfield filed a suit in the Superior Court today, ask ing for a judicial review of the State Board of Education's de cision to withhold $7.4million in state aid to city schools. The state board plans to withhold the funds if the city does not set up and implement an ac ceptable plan to ease racial segregation in the city schools.

title: SOVIET WARSHIPS A HELP TO HEATH
description: SINGAPORE, Jan. 15Two Soviet warships gave un expected support to Prime Min ister Heath's argument in favor of selling arms to South Africa today just as the Prime Min ister was putting his case be fore the Commonwealth heads of government here.

title: Metroliner Holding Own Despite Loss on Route
description: The dramatic upsurge in rail passenger traffic between New York and Washington that be gan with the debut of the 120 mileanhour Metroliner exactly two years ago has leveled off.

title: Grandmother and a Barber Winners in Jersey Lottery
description: TRENTON, Jan. 15 (AP)A 61yearold Philadelphia grand mother and a 26yearold Clif ton barber claimed their $50,000 state lottery prizes today.

title: A U.S.Soviet Lunar Exchange Likely
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 15Ameri can and Soviet scientists held unofficial talks in Houston this week that were expected to open the way for an exchange of moon samples between the two countries.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Historians have written that the weeks leading up to that ancient American religious spectacle, the Super Bowl, were filled not only with song and celebration, but with mass national seminars. In 1967, before the event was offi cially called Super Bowl (supposedly after a child's high bounce black ball), the entire country was divided into two antagonistic factions, called the National Football League and the American Football League. Followers of each league argued endlessly in journals and on street corners. They argued not only the relative merits of the competing teams, but about the Larger Issues that would be resolved by The Game. N.F.L. fans believed it essential that the Green Bay Packers win to uphold tradition, orderly change and basic national values. A.F.L. fans came to believe that if the Kansas City Chiefs won, all mankind would realize that youth, new money and inferior talent were no handi caps in the battle for the top. After Green Bay won, N.F.L. fans, with noblesse oblige, said: It's only a game. A.F.L. fans, realizing there would be always youth, new money and inferior talent making life tense for everyone else, seemed willing to wait for success until they got older. They, too, said: It's only a game.

title: Mothers in Harlem Maintain Barricade To Get Traffic Light
description: Following an automobile ac cident last Tuesday in which a 9yearold child was seriously injured, a group of Harlem mothers and children has set up barricades blocking off several streets in the area.

title: Prince Juan Carlos and Wife To Visit the U.S. This Month
description: MADRID, Jan. 15General issimo Francisco Franco's po litical heirdesignate, Prince Juan Carlos, will visit the United States later this month at the invitation of President Nixon, it was announced today.

title: $24,000 Reward Offered
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 15 (Reuters)A $24,000 reward for information leading to the release of Ambassador Jackson has been offered by a group of the British diplomat's friends.

title: Political Revolution After 1972?
description: In recent months I have come to some uncomfortable conclusions.

title: New Rochelle Will Lose Arnold Constable Store
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Jan. 15  When the Arnold Constable store opened here on Main Street 33 years ago, fashionconscious Westchest er County residents were thrilled that they were get ting a slice of Fifth Avenue in the downtown area.

title: Art: Where Else but in New York
description: My rent has gone up again and a friend of mine got mugged last week, as did the aged motherinlaw of an other friend. My telephone isn't working too good and when the E train stopped for no explained reason and rest ed for five minutes between the Fifth Avenue and the LexingtonThird Avenue sta tions the other day I broke out into en awful sweat. In a crowded elevator a few weeks ago I felt something funny going on and looked down to see that the respect ablelooking young man next to me had put a hand into my outer breast pocket where I keep nothing but a handkerchief, and he looked at me pitifully and said, I can't help it. I can't help it. It's a compulsion. It's a com pulsion.

title: G.E. TO BUILD PLANT IN NEW HAMPSHIRE
description: MERRIMACK, N.H., Jan. 15 (UPI)  The General Electric Company announced today that it would build a large heavy machinery plant here. The company said that it expected 1,500 people would be em ployed at the plant.

title: MANY CAB DRIVERS WALK OUT BRIEFLY
description: Several hundred taxi drivers, angered by the City Council's delay in approving a fare in crease, staged brief work stop pages yesterday afternoon at selected garages throughout the city.

title: Casbah Kid Beats Choice
description: PIMLICO, Md., San. 15 (UPI)  Casbah Kid set the pace throughout under Ben Felicia no and won the $7,000 allow ance feature for 3yearolds by a length today at Pimlico race course.

title: PRESIDENT TO OFFER HEALTH CARE PLAN
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Jan. 15 (AP)President Nixon will submit a health care program to Congress in a few weeks, Vice President Agnew said here today.

title: Governor Watching Police Strike
description: ALBANY, Jan. 15Governor Rockefeller said today that he was watching the police situa tion in New York City closely but that he had no plans to step in at this time.

title: U.S.SAIGON COMMAND TO BE REORGANIZED
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (AP) A Pentagon spokesman dis closed tonight the United States headquarters command struc ture in Vietnam would be reor ganized, but he said that Gen. Creighton W. Abrams's role as commander would not be af fected.

title: Israel Raids Village On Lebanese Coast
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 15 Israeli raiders staged an attack last night on the Lebanese coast 28 miles north of the Israeli border. Palestinian guer rillas and Lebanese troops in the area said today they had fought the intruders.

title: Metreveli Beaten by Dent
description: SYDNEY, Jan. 15 (AP)The foreign challenge for New South Wales tennis titles dimin ished today with the defeat of Alex Metreveli of the Soviet Union in the men's singles semifinals and the elimination of Brenda Kirk and Laura Ros souw of South Africa from the women's doubles.

title: Abraham Gribetz, 73, Executive Of Hebrew Loan Society, Dies
description: Abraham Gribetz, executive vice president of the Hebrew Free Loan Society, died Thurs day in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 73 years old and lived at 315 East 86th Street.

title: Seals Snap Rangers' SixGame Winning Streak With a 31 Triumph
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Jan. 15 The Rangers, with a chance to take over first place in the Na tional League's East Division, fell victims for the second time this season to the California Golden Seals tonight at Oakland Coliseum.

title: U.S PROTESTS RISE TO ECONOMIC BLOC
description: PARIS, Jan. 15The United States has been stepping up its diplomatic representations to the European Common Market to complain about policies seen as endangering American trad ing interests.

title: SUGAR PRICE RISE SET BY REFINERS
description: Consumers can look for slightly higher sugar prices in the wake of increases posted yesterday at the wholesale lev el.

title: FRANK T. OSTRANDER OF STEEL COMPANY
description: CHAPPAQUA, N.Y., Jan. 15 Frank T. Ostrander, who re tired in 1948 as vice president of the National Supply Export Corporation, died yesterday in the Somers Man nursing home. He was 92 years old.

title: Briton to Go to Saigon for U.S. Again
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15  President Nixon is sending Sir Robert Thompson, the British expert on guerrilla warfare, back to South Vietnam next month for an urgent evaluation of the Saigon Government's po lice and publicsafety programs, State Department officials said today.

title: MISSOURI SELECTS ONOFRIO AS COACH
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 15 (UPI)  Al Onofrio, an assistant coach to Dan Devine at the Universi ty of Missouri, was named head coach today, one day after Devine announced he had ac cepted a fiveyear pact as head coach and general man ager of the Green Bay Packers.

title: Mrs. King and Mrs. Gunter Gain in Long Beach Tennis
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Jan. 15 (AP)Led by Mrs. Billie Jean King, the topseeded star play ing in her hometown, favorites advanced through the second round today of the $14,000 wo men's invitation tennis tourna ment named after Mrs. King.

title: The Blizzard of Words Ends as Colts and Cowboys Take Cover
description: MIAMI, Jan. 15The train ing sites of the Super Bowl opponents, the Baltimore Colts and Dallas Cowboys, were closed to outsiders to day and the daily interviews by 800 members of the press, radio and television corps ceased. Seldom have so many athletes responded to so many questions.

title: Chaparrals Triumph, 125104
description: DALLAS, Jan. 15 (UPI)  Rich Jones, Joe Hamilton and Donnie Freeman led the Texas Chaparrals to a 125104 victory over the Utah Stars tonight. Jones scored 25 points, Hamil ton 24 and Freeman 22.

title: Harney, Shaw and Johnson Set Pace in Crosby Golf With 139 for 36 Holes
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif., Jan. 15Paul Harney, who recently left snowy Massachusetts for a goodwill golfing trip to Burma for the State Department carried out another mission to day. With a 68 he tied Tom Shaw and Howie Johnson for the 36hole lead in the Bing Crosby proamateur tourney at 139.

title: Sidman I. Barber, 72, Dies; Retired Law Partner Here
description: SSHORT HILL, N. J., Jan. 15 Sidman I. Barber, who re tired as a partner in the New York law firm of Reid & Priest in 1967, died yesterday in St, Barnabas Hospital, Livingston. He was 72 years old and lived at 31 Notingham Road.

title: Copter Use Envisaged
description: SAIGON, Jan. 15Military sources reported tonight that American pilots would fly med ical evacuation helicopters into Cambodia to pick up wounded South Vietnamese troops if necessary.

title: MUSKIE, KOSYGIN CONFER 4 HOURS
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 15  Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin told Senator Edmund S. Muskie today, in a Kremlin meeting lasting nearly four hours, that both the United States and the Soviet Union would benefit from peace in the Middle East and Indochina and a general improvement in rela tions.

title: CELTICS SET BACK HAWKS BY 134123
description: BOSTON, Jan. 15 (AP)  John Havlicek, Jo Jo White and Dave Cowens combined for 78 points tonight in leading the Boston Celtics to a 134123 National Basketball Associa tion victory over the Atlanta Hawks.

title: Frankie Frisch's Wife Dies
description: WESTERLY, R. I., Jan. 15 (AP)Mrs. Ada E. Frisch, wife of Frankie Frisch, the old base ball star, died today at Wester ly Hospital. She was 72 years old. She also leaves two sis ters, Mrs. Charles Softy of Bronxville, N. Y., and Mrs. Robert Betty of Westerly.

title: Railroad Asks Fare Rise
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 15 (AP)The Chicago & North. Western Rail way said today it would seek a 7 per cent increase in suburban fares, effective March 1. The railroad serves about 45,000 riders a day on its three sub urban lines. The proposed in crease is expected to generate approximately $1,200,000 in 1971 to offset pay increases es timated at $1,100,000.

title: School Meet Success On and Off Track
description: The first Martin Luther King track meet, staged by the Public Schools Athletic League at the 102d Engineers' Armory, almost was a victim of the New York City police slowdown yesterday.

title: BRITISH MAIL STRIKE SET FOR WEDNESDAY
description: LONDON, Jan. 15  Britain's postal workers union has called its first complete strike for Wednesday. The walkout by the 230,000 members of the Union of Post Office Workers would affect all mail and communica tion services.

title: Full Fund for Arts Is Sought by Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15In a time of economic stringency, when many Government budget requests are likely to be cut back, President Nixon has de cided to ask Congress to ap propriate the full authorized $60million for the National Arts and Humanities Endow ments in the fiscal year begin ning July 1.

title: Officers of the 19th Precinct Tackle Unfamiliar Chores
description: It's mass confusion, the lieutenant behind the desk said. I don't know what's going on.

description: To the Editor:

title: ARRESTS FALL OFF
description: The police responded to 50 per cent fewer calls for assist ance from New Yorkers during the first two tours of duty yesterday than they did during the corresponding 16hour pe riod last week, a Police Depart ment spokesman said yesterday.

title: Monroe Stars for Bullets
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 15 (AP) Earl Monroe got 7 straight points in the final three min utes to pace the Baltimore Bul lets to a 124117 victory to night over the San Diego Rockets.

title: Pacers Take 7th in Row
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 15 (AP) The Indiana Pacers posted their seventh consecutive vic tory tonight, a 125119 decision over the Virginia Squires.

title: Press Club in Capital Votes to Take Women
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (AP) A male stronghold in the nation's capital fell today when the National Press Club agreed to accept women as members.

title: A1 Hattab, $7, Wins Tropical Handicap
description: MIAMI, Jan. 15  Tropical Park closed its 52day meeting today, unable to reverse a se vere downward trend in at tendance and mutual play that began on opening day, last Nov, 14. Hialeah will begin a 40day meeting tomorrow.

title: U.S. Judge Temporarily Bans Work on Florida Barge Canal
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15A Federal judge ordered a halt today to further major con struction of the $210million CrossFlorida Barge Canal.

title: Garrison of Cowboys Will Start at Fullback Against Colts in Super Bowl
description: MIAMI, Jan. 15  Despite a sprained ankle and a bruised shoulder, Walt Garrison, the only cowboy on the Cowboys, will start at fullback for Dal las in the Super Bowl game against the Baltimore Colts here on Sunday.

title: Class 44: A Few Lessons On the Legacy of Dr. King
description: Violence, prejudice, segre gation, freedom, discrimi nation, oppression and resistance were the seven dictionary words in Class ?? this week. The words came up in lessons on the ?? of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., whose birth day was observed yesterday as a public holiday by the schools.

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: I.B.M. FOREIGN NET TOPS U.S. PROFIT
description: The International Business MachinesCorporationregistered its 19th consecutive year of in creased profits during 1970, but only because of overseas earn ings, which for the first time in the giant computer com pany's record exceeded domes tic net income.

title: BANK PRIME RATE IS CUT % TO 6%

title: U.C.L.A. Takes 12th in Row
