title: ABBADO IS NAMED TO POST IN VIENNA
description: VIENNA, Jan. 15Claudio Abbado, the 37yearold Italian maestro, is to be the new per manent conductor of the Vien na Philharmonic, it was an nounced here today.

title: Nonsense, Israelis Say
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 15 (Reuters) Israeli officials described to day as nonsense the guerrilla and Lebanese reports of last night's Israeli raid in the Sara fand area.

title: Chotiner, Divorced, Is Told To Pay His Wife $42,087
description: SANTA ANA, Calif., Jan. 15 (AP)  The marriage of Mur ray Chotiner, longtime politi cal adviser to President Nixon, has been dissolved with Mr. Chotiner ordered to pay a $42, 087 settlement.

title: Jack Dreyfus Purchases  A Seat on the Big Board
description: Jack J. Dreyfus Jr., the re tired founder of the Dreyfus Corporation investment house, has purchased a seat on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Pistons Win in Overtime
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 15 (UPI) Jim Walker sank a 20foot jump shot with 17 seconds left in overtime tonight to give the Detroit Pistons a 9997 triumph over the Buffalo Braves.

title: Parity Dispute Goes Back to 1966 and the Views of Two FactFinding Panels
description: The payparity case that precipitated the police stoppage grew out of disputes over long established salary relationships between police and firefighting groups.

title: U.S.C. Trounces California
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Jan. 15 (AP)  Thirdranked Southern California, successfully switch ing to a zone defense midway in the first half, routed Califor nia, 9066, tonight to remain unbeaten. The Trojans posted their 13th victory.

title: Fiery Coast Crash Kills 6
description: COMPTON, Calif., Jan. 15 (UPI)  Five teenagers and an infant burned to death last night when flames from a gas tank explosion trapped them inside their vehicle in a fiery threecar accident. The driver of one of the cars, John Alex ander, 29 years old, of Comp ton, received, minor injuries and was arrested on suspicion of six counts of felony man slaughter in the deaths.

title: Tariff Unit Is Split 22 On Shoe Industry Relief
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15The United States Tariff Com mission was divided 22 today over whether the shoe industry qualifies for relief from import competition through higher tariffs or otherwise.

title: Final Buzzer Helps Hofstra Beat American U., 5453
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Jan. 15 Hofstra strengthened its hold on the Middle Atlantic Basket ball Conference Eastern Section lead tonight with a 5453 vic tory over American University.

title: Aswan High Dam Is Dedicated by Sadat and Podgorny
description: ASWAN, United Arab Repub lic, Jan. 15President Anwar elSadat of the United Arab Republic and Nikolai V. Pod gorny, the Soviet chief of state, snipped a green silk ribbon to day to dedicate the Aswan High Darn, a billiondollar project to give Egypt en ex panded and stable agriculture and an abundance of electricity for new industry.

title: Merger News
description: Termination of the merger agreement between Northwest Airlines, Inc., and Northeast Airlines, Inc., was threatened yesterday unless the Civil Aero nautics Board withdraws two conditions under which its ap proval was made. Officials of the two airlines announced that they will file a petition with the C.A.B. for recon sideration of its ap proval terms. The conditions are that the board will reinstitute a New England service investigation that could result in removal of extensive New England routes from the merged carrier.

title: AUTO OUTPUT GOALS SEEN HARD TO MAKE
description: DETROIT, Jan. 15 (UPI)Al though the General Motors Cor poration has scheduled heavy overtime, two of its competitors plan some plant closings and the auto industry will be hard put to achieve its production goal of 755,000 new cars in January, Ward's automotive re ports said today.

title: AD AGENCY OFFICERS CONVICTED ON TAXES
description: An advertising agency and its two top officers were con victed in Federal Court here yesterday on charges of in cometax evasion.

title: GI's Demonstrate in Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 15 (UPI)  About 40 United States soldiers chanting Free Angela Davis and calling for an end to racial discrimination in the Army marched on Amer ican headquarters today, the birthday of Martin Luther King Jr.

title: Pearl, Last Album Janis Joplin Made, May Be Her Finest
description: Janis Joplin's last recording has been released by Columbia Records; sadly, it's her most impressive one.

title: 2 Dutch Speed Skaters Break World Records
description: DAVOS, Switzerland, Jan. 15 (AP)Two Dutch skaters broke world records and a Norwegian equaled a world standard today on the open ing day of the Swiss inter national speed skating meet.

title: Nixon Aide Hopeful on Congress Ties
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15  President Nixon's new adviser on Congressional relations voiced optimism today about increasing receptivity on Capitol Hill to White House proposals and described steps he was taking to assure that the cooperation was deserved.

title: Rockland Hospital Director
description: ALBANY, Jan. 15 (AP)Dr. Hyman Pleasure, deputy com missioner for local services in the State Mental Hygiene De partment, has been named director of Rockland State Hos pital at Orangeburg. Commis sioner Alan D. Miller, head of the department, said that Dr. Pleasure had requested the appointment to fullfill a per sonal desire to return to direct patient care. Dr. Pleasure has been with the department for 30 years and served as director of Middletown State Hospital before becoming a deputy com missioner in 1966.

title: $55,000 MORE LINKED TO POWELL INQUIRY
description: SPRINGFIELD, III., Jan. 15 (UPI)  Another $55,000 in cash connected to the Paul Powell hoard controversy has been found in a safety deposit box at a Springfield bank to day.

title: Safety in the Mines
description: Thirtyeight men died at the end of the year in a mine explosion at Hyden, Kentucky. Their loss brought the number of workers killed in the coal mines in 1970 to a total of 254, an increase of 25 per cent over the previous year.

title: PRUDENTIAL'S PLANS FOR UNIT CONFIRMED
description: The New Jersey insurance commissioner confirmed yester day that he had received an application from the Prudential Insurance Company of America to establish a brokeragehouse subsidiary that would belong to the PhiladelphiaBaltimore Washington Stock Exchange.

title: Miami Tourist Business Lags for 2d Straight Year
description: MIAMI, Jan. 15The hotels, restaurants and other enter prises here that flourish or founder at the caprice of the Northern tourist are feeling the squeeze of the nation's economic slump for the sec ond successive winter.

title: Personal Income Rose $5.25Billion During December
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (AP)Personal income ad vanced $5.25billion in De cember to an adjusted an nual rate of $817.75billion, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Rozelle Misses an A.F.L. Rival
description: MIAMI, Jan. 15Pete Ro zelle, the commissioner of the National Football League, acknowledged today that the flair of the Super Bowl game had been detracted from somewhat by the absence of a participant from the old American Football League.

title: PATTERSON STOPS FORTE IN 2D ROUND
description: MIAMI BEACH, Jan. 15De spite a performance that dissat isfied him, Floyd Patterson, the former twotime heavyweight champion, was awarded a sec ondround knockout tonight over Levi Forte, 38yearold Fontainbleau Hotel bellhop.

title: Texas Cuts Output Of Oil for February
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Jan. 15  Texas oil production in Febru ary will be 10,000 barrels a day less than in January, under a proration order adopted by the Texas Railroad Commission today.

title: Article 10  No Title
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15  Samuel R. Pierce Jr., General Counsel to the Treasury Depart ment, said tonight that the Nix on Administration would con tinue its efforts to aid black banks despite an attack on the banks by a Federal Reserve Board member, Anarew F. Brirnrner.

title: Letter From Uruguay Asks $1Million For Release of Abducted U.S. Expert
description: A letter purporting to be from the Tupamaro urban guer rillas who kidnapped a United States agricultural expert in Uruguay last Aug. 7 demands $1million for his release.

title: Ruckelshaus Takes First Steps To Ban Remaining DDT Uses
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15  William D. Ruckelshaus, ad ministrator of the Environment al Protection Agency, an nounced today that he would issue next week notices of in tended cancellation of all uses of the pesticide DDT for which notices have not already been issued.

title: Mobile Homes Are Attracting Purchasers
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Jan. 15 The future was spread all over the Kentucky Exposi tion Center this week, three andahalf miles of mobile homes and their accessories, a plastic and aluminum world that is rarely men tioned in the American Dream but that is rapidly be coming part of reality.

title: MRS. V. P. BEVELACQUA
description: BOSTON, Jan. 15  Mrs. Elizabeth Ralph Bevelacqua wife of Veryl P. Bevelacqua, former publisher of Venture Magazine, died Tuesday in the Newton  Wellesley Hospital after a long illness.

title: Ecuador Frees Tuna Boat
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (AP) Ecuador has released the American tuna boat Lexington after her owners paid penalties of $34,160, a State Department source reported today. The Lex ington was seized Monday 55 miles off the Ecuador coast, which claims jurisdiction 200 200 miles from her coast.

title: Use of Private Guards Increases
description: I'm just holding my breath, said Irving Rose, the solitary security guard at the Amuse ment Center off Times Square on 42d Street last night. I've been lucky so far, but if any thing happens and I make a mistake, I'm dead.

title: Police Strike Is Unnoticed in BedfordStuyvesant
description: There were no policemen to be seen walking the streets of BedfordStuyvesant yesterday, but to many members of the Brooklyn community it did not seem to make much of a dif ference. In fact, some said there was no difference.

title: 6 Downtown Belfast Stores Struck by Gasoline Bombs
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Jan. 15 (Reuters)  Gasoline bombs exploded in six stores in downtown Belfast tonight as unrest in Ulster's capital con tinued.

title: 7 SoftDrink Makers Charged With Violations
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15The Federal Trade Commission charged seven major softdrink companies today with keeping beverage prices high by assign ing exclusive sales territories to their local bottling companies.

title: S. AFRICA BARRED FROM DAVIS CUP
description: LONDON, Jan. 15 (UPI)  South Africa and Rhodesia were barred from 1971 Davis Cup tennis competition today as the European Zone draw was completed with 28 nations in the field.

title: Books of The Times
description: KING IN HELL. By Beverly Balin. 568 pages. CowardMcCann. $7.85.

title: Lincoln Center Adds Film
description: The motion picture version of Hans Werner Henz's The Young Lord has been added to Lincoln Center's current Opera on Film series and will be shown at Tully Hall on Feb. 14 at 2 P.M. The picture was included in the Opera on Film series presented last summer and won favorable critical comment.

title: 76ers Top Bulls, 9996
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 15 (AP) The Philadelphia 76ers lost all but a point of a 13point lead in the last five minutes before going on to defeat the Chicago Bull, 9996, tonight.

title: Black Woman Doctor Cited
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 15 (UPI) A Negro woman doctor who founded a clinic here for preg nant teenage girls was pre sented yesterday the Gimbel's Service to Humanity Award. She is Dr. Helen O. Dickens, associate professor of clinical obstetrics and gynecology at the hospital of the University of Pennsylvania.

title: Mideast Oil Talks Nearing Crucial Stage
description: LONDON, Jan 15The price and the supply of much of the Western world's oil are at stake in negotiations moving to a climax with unexpected speed in Tripoli and Teheran.

title: 3 IN J.D.L. INDICTED ON GUN CHARGES
description: Two leaders of the Jewish Defense League and an asso ciate were indicted by a Fed eral grand jury here yesterday on charges that they used fic titious names to buy three rifles.

title: Behind Some Designer Labels, Fashion Conglomerates Prosper
description: Robert H. Kenmore wears a Valen tino belt, a $250 Cartier love bracelet and says that he personally has no interest in fashion. The belt and the bracelet are legitimate business props for the man who calls himself a paper shuffler and a traditionalist in clothes.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Jan. 15  This month's Barnum prize for ingenuity goes to Jerry W. Friedheim, spokesman for the Defense Department. He was defend ing the Vietnam defoliation program against a profoundly critical report just made to the American Association for the Advancement of Science. Mr. Friedheim argued that the South Viet namese economy might actually have benefited from herbicide.

title: Church Council Leaders Irked by Catholic Stand
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Jan. 15Friction emerged here today between leaders of the World Council of Churches and representatives of the Roman Catholic Church over possible Catholic membership in the or ganization.

title: FLORIDIANS MAKE COACHING MANGE
description: MIAMI BEACH, Jan. 15 (UPI) The Floridians, resting in last place in the American Basket ball Association's Eastern Divi sion, dismissed Coach Hal Blit man today and hired Bob Bass, head coach at Texas Tech.

title: F.B.I. CLEARS VOTES IN U.M.W. ELECTION
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15The Labor Department said today that an investigation of chal lenged absentee ballots in a disputed United Mine Workers of America district election in Pittsburgh found no evidence of tampering with the sealed ballot envelopes, as charged by a dissident union faction.

title: Calley Jury Told of Bitterness Of G.I.'s Over Atrocity Stories
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., Jan. 15  The American force that in vaded Mylal was frightened by earlier losses to Vietcong mines and booby traps and embitter ed by reports of atrocities, a maimed veteran said today at the courtmartial of First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr.

title: 85% OF PATROLMEN STRIKE HERE; OTHERS MAINTAIN BASIC SERVICE; CITY GETS A WRIT AGAINST P.B.A.
description: Rebellious policemen spread their wildcat strike through the five boroughs of the city yester day in an action that stripped the police force of 85 per cent of the patrolmen scheduled to work.

title: Theater: Uris's Ari at the Hellinger
description: No novel that has sold 20 million copies can be said to be devoid of popular inter est, and although I have never read Leon Uris's novel Exodus, or even seen the film made from it, it was clearly within its own terms of reference highly success ful.

title: Joseph Schlossberg Dies at 95; CoFounder of Clothing Union
description: Joseph Schlossberg, secre tarytreasurer emeritus and a founder of the Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America, died yesterday at his home, 675 Walton Avenue, the Bronx. His age was 95.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON SHOW DECLINES
description: The London stock market closed in the doldrums yes terday. Declining prices re flected uneasiness over the forthcoming postal strike.

title: Cabinet Unit Sets Steel Price Parley
description: The President's Cabinet Com mittee on Economic Policy, which has been ordered to re view major price increases an nounced by the Bethlehem Steel Corporation, will hold its first meeting on the subject next Monday, a White House spokesman said yesterday.

title: SHORT COVERING LIFTS SOYBEANS
description: Strong commercial buying and short covering sent the prices of soybean futures soar ing yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. The soybean activity spurred rises for grains.

title: LEO FISH
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Jan. Leo Fish, an underwriter with the New York Life Insurance Company, died today at the New Rochelle Medical Center. He was 75 years old and lived at 8 Huguenot Drive.

title: HATCHER WILL RUN FOR 2D GARY TERM
description: GARY, Ind., Jan. 15  Rich ard G. Hatcher, the Negro May or of this city, announced to day that he would run for a second term of office. He said the choice for the city was be tween himself and those who plundered it for so many years.

title: PRIME RATE CUT BUOYS MARKET
description: Another cut in the prime lending rate  spelling lower interest costs and higher mar ket hopeshelped to move the DowJones industrial average yesterday to its best level in 15 months.

title: News Analysis
description: There'll be no smiles to day, boys, Mayor Lindsay told photographers at 8:17 A.M. yesterday as he walked up the City Hall steps escorted by his bodyguard, Detective Sgt. Ernest Latty.

title: AMEX STOCKS UP IN ACTIVE TRADING
description: Another reduction in the prime rate helped send prices higher along a broad front yes terday on the American Stock Exchange in active trading.

title: Report From Sarafand
description: SARAFAND, Lebanon, Jan. 15 (AP)The Israeli raid was carried out by troops flying in from the sea in four helicop ters, it was reported here to day.

title: 3 Singers to Take New Roles at Met During 22d Week
description: Three American singers will appear in roles new to them at the Metropolitan Opera dur ing the 22d week of the com pany's current season.

title: Barry Scores 53 Points
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Jan. 15Rick Barry set two New York Nets scoring records tonight, but the Pittsburgh Condors gained a 120117 American Basketball Associa tion victory in a game spiced by three fights.

title: R.P.I. Sextet Wins by 60
description: BOSTON, Jan. 15 (AP) Brian Ronayne scored two goals as Rensselaer improved its wonlosttied record to 12 11 with a 60 hockey victory over Northeastern tonight at the Arena.

title: Lawlessness and Law
description: The failure of thousands of New York City policemen to walk their beats and man their patrol cars yesterday is a crime against society, an inexcusable affront to citi zens and an almost frivolous abnegation of a solemn responsibility.

title: Brodie Athlete of Month
description: John Brodie, who led the San Francisco 49ers to a Na tional Football League division championship for the first time in the team's history, out pointed Johnny Unitas and Muhammad Ali to win the December poll for the Hickok professional athlete of the year award. Brodie, with 28 votes for first, had a total of 132 points to top Unitas, with 20 firstplace ballots and 104 points, and Ali, with 91 points. Ali had eighteen votes for first.

title: Savings Merger Approved
description: New York State Superintend ent of Banks, William T. Dent zer Jr., announced yesterday his approval of the proposed merger of the First Federal Savings and Loan Association of Niagara County into the Western New York Savings Bank.

title: JOHN BROOKS, LED ELECTRONICS FIRM
description: DETROIT, Jan. 15John G. Brooks, chairman and presi dent of Lear Siegler, Inc., a manufacturer of power heating, airconditioning and aerospace, equipment, died today of a stroke. His age was 58. He had been attending a convention of the Society of Automotive En gineers here. His home was in the Bel Air district of Los Angeles.

title: School Board's Future
description: In voting a oneyear extension of the tenure of the city's interim Board of Education, the State Senate has acted sensibly in the interest of an orderly transition to a decentralized school system. The elected commu nity school boards are in their infancy. Although Dr. Harvey B. Scribner, the new chancellor, has taken charge with remarkable dispatch and sophistication, it would add needlessly to his burden to present him with a new board before the end of his first year.

title: Chilean Line to Fly to Cuba
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Jan. 15 (UPI)  Chile's airline, LAN, will start flying to Cuba in March, it was announced to day. Chile and Cuba resumed diplomatic relations late last year after a sixyear lapse.

title: Board Refuses to Restore Charter Airline's License
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (UPI) The National Trans portation Safety Board has re fused to reverse an order re voking the license of the char ter airline in last fall's crash of a plane carrying the Wichita State University football team. Thirtyone persons died n the crash.

title: FILIBUSTER FIGHT LOOMS IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 A Senate that ended its business in the last Congress in a snarl of filibusters will begin the new Congress with an extend ed debate on whether to mod ify the rule that makes it dif ficult to stop a filibuster.

title: Chicago Editor Gets College Post
description: ST. LOUIS, Mo., Jan. 15 (UPI)Roy M. Fisher, editor of The Chicago Daily News, was approved today by the University of Missouri Board of Curators as dean of the university's school of journal ism.

title: Jarring Gets U.A.R.Response To Israel's Peace Suggestions
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Jan. 15The United Arab Republic stated its position in the in direct ArabIsraeli peace talks today in a written document handed to Dr. Gunnar V. Jar ring, the United Nations inter mediary.

title: Blast Kills 2 in Argentina
description: MAR DEL PLATA, Argentina, Jan. 15 (AP)  An explosion shook the center of this vaca tion resort on the Atlantic today, killing two persons, in juring scores and causing wide spread damage. Authorities said a workman's torch might have ignited leaking gas from a line under repair.

title: Experts Feel Dulles Blundered In Dropping Offer to Aid Cairo
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15In retrospect, specialists in Middle Eastern affairs believe that Secretary of State John Foster Dulles committed a diplomatic blunder July 19, 1956, when he curtly withdrew a United States offer to help Egypt begin the Aswan High Dam.

title: The Screen: From Ear to Ear' Is Without Importance
description: "From Ear to Ear," the English-dubbed French melodrama that opened yesterday at the Forum Theater, is of such little interest that to compare it with bad movies would give it something akin to identity and status. Although it is unpleasant, it is without importance, like bad breath, greasy food, junk mail or a slight fever.Very early in the movie, which is said to be adapted from a prose work called "The Night of the Perverted Women," there are indications that someone connected with it has heard of Genet's "The Maids," but never bothered to read it. Two disagreeable women, who are cousins as well as lovers, and who appear to be in their late 20's, live with the mother of one, a widow, and the widow's second daughter, a completely paralyzed mute.When the girls aren't making love to each other or to a couple of available men, or when they aren't whipping up little dinners from a cookbook called "La Cuisine  Eros," they torture the third girl, usually by exposing their bodies to her. "From Ear to Ear" is a film of failed sex scenes, and very little mystery, except that I never did figure out who plucked the paralytic's eyebrows, or why.On the same bill with the feature is an equally unmemorable short, sponsored by the Fur Information and Fashion Bureau of New York, in which a lot of ghastly, breastless models swish around in various mammalian pelts, all ranch-bred, of course.For the record I should point out that although the ads for the feature show a woman's severed head and ask the question: "How long does it take a razor sharp knife to slice . . . .?" "From Ear to Ear" contains no decapitations. I suppose that people who really feel the lack of this sort of thing might take their case to Mrs. Bess Myerson Grant.

title: Man in the News
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 For the two years that he has been in the Senate, Robert J. Dole of Kansas has made a point to ride shotgun for the Nixon Administration. Invari ably, if a Kennedy or a Muskie or a Fulbright rises on the Senate floor to criti cize the Administration, Mr. Dole is on his feet, too, some times needling, sometimes droll, but always de fending Presi dent Nixon's interests.

title: Basques' Defense Lawyer Suspended for 3 Months
description: MADRID, Jan, 15, (Reuters) One of the main defense lawyers in last month's trial of 15 Basque nationalists in Bur gos said today that he had been suspended from practice for three months.

title: Utility Reports Gains
description: The Southern New England Telephone Company reported yesterday gains in operating revenues and net income for 1970. The preliminary report placed revenues at $301,900, 000, against $273,968,000 a year earlier. Net income rose to $35,500,000, or $3.67 a share, from $32,844,000, or $3.44 a share, in 1969. The company is 17.7 per centowned by the American Telephone and Tele graph Company.

title: Steady Progress Noted for Week For New Issues
description: The newissue market con tinued to make steady progress in trading this week, although only four concerns made first public offerings of their stock.

title: BRADFORD O. PERU
description: NAPLES, Fla., Jan. 15  Bradford 0. Peru, a retired vice president of Diamond Interna tional Corporation, a producer of pulp products and packag ing materials, died here yes terday at the age of 70.

title: Bail Cut for Three in Alleged Bomb Plot
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Jan. 15 (APA Federal judge reduced bail today for two priests and a former priest indicted in an alleged kidnapping and bomb plot and placed them under the supervision of Lawrence Cardi nal Shehan, Roman Catholic Archbishop of Baltimore.

title: Hattie Winston Is Married to Mark Linn
description: Hattie Winston, who plays Nell in The Me Nobody Knows at the Helen Hayes Theater, was married here early last evening to Mark Elliot Linn, a teacher of social studies and mathe matics at Elijah Clark Junior School in the Bronx. Rabbi Daniel Isaacs performed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Paul A. Meyers, friends of the couple. The bride, a former member of the Negro Ensemble Company, is the foster daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George Wray of New York. Mr. and Mrs. Herman Linn of Riverdale, the Bronx, are the bridegroom's parents.

title: WITNESS RECALLS VAN IN DAVIS CASE
description: SAN RAFEL, Calif., Jan. 15 The prosecution has a wit ness who has tentatively iden tified Angela Davis as being near the Marin County court house on the day before a shooting last summer in which a judge, two convicts and a friend of Miss Davis's were killed in an escape attempt.

title: Co ALAN HUDSON, 83, REYNOLDS PARTNER
description: RUMSON, N.J., Jan. 15 C. Alan Hudson, a senior part ner of Reynolds & Co., member of the New York Stock Ex change and other exchanges, died today at his home. He was 83 years old and lived at 52 Buena Vista Avenue.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Janis's Annual 20thCentury Roundup
description: For many yearsfor some of us, as long as we can remember making the rounds of the New York galleries one of the special pleasures of the season has been the periodic exhibition of 20th Century European Art at the Sidney. Janis Gallery. These exhibitions have no particu lar theme or fixed historical boundaries. We are simply offered a generous selection of paintings, sculptures, col lages, watercolors and draw ings by some of the best known names in modern Eu ropean art, and as a general rule the quality of the works on view is high. The current installment, at 6 West 57th Street, upholds the custom ary standard. It is a won derful show.

title: F.A.A Acts to Avert Air Collisions Here
description: Spurred by the collision of an airliner and a private plane near Newark airport last Sat urday, the Government has de cided to expedite the adop tion here of a system aimed at a much more rigid segrega tion of controlled and uncon trolled flights.

title: An Unwise U.S. Walkout
description: The United Nations Colonialism Committee has long been run in highhanded fashion by its African and Asian members with loud verbal backing from the Soviet bloc. Totally ineffective in hastening the end of white minority rule in southern Africa, the stridency of its resolutions and the unreality of its demands have but increased in proportion to its frustrations.

title: G.M. PLACES FUNDS IN MINORITY RANKS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (UPI) The General Motors Corpora tion deposited $5million today in 32 banks owned by members of minority groups as part of a Federal program to increase by $100million the resources of banks serving black and Span ishAmerican communities.

title: New N.Y.U. Film Aide
description: New York University's School of Continuing Education has appointed Bernard Lewis, a pub licity specialist in motion pic tures, as coordinator of the advisory council of the school's new section, the Entertainment Arts As Business.

title: RAIL LABOR CHIEF SEES A PACT SOON
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15  The president of the largest of four unions that shut down the nation's railroads for 18 hours last month said today that he hoped for a settlement of the longdeadlocked wage negotia tions within a week.

title: Swiss Caution Brazil
description: BERN, Switzerland, Jan. 15 (AP)  Swiss Government sources expressed hope today that the Brazilian Government would not take any action that might upset arrangements for the release of Ambassador Bucher.

title: RAYMOND C. KELLY
description: YONKERS, Jan. 15  Ray mond C. Kelly, retired city en gineer of Yonkers, died today in St. John's Hospital after a brief illness. He was 69 years old and lived at 110 Colgate Avenue.

title: 70 Prisoners Released by. Brazilians Charge Torture
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Jan, l5  Seventy political exiles from Brazil said today that the kidnapping of a Swiss diplo mat to obtain their release from jail was an act of legitimate defense against the torture of prisoners by Brazilian authorities.

title: CAMEROON EXECUTES 3 CONVICTED OF PLOT
description: YAOUNDE, Cameroon, Jan. 15 (Agence FrancePresse)  Three Cameroonians convicted of rebellion and plotting to assassinate President Ahmadou Ahidjo were executed today, it was announced officially.

title: RELEVANT STUDIES ASKED IN COLLEGE
description: Ninetyone per cent of 70,000 college undergraduates polled in a survey for the Carnegie Commission on Higher Educa tion would like their course work to be more relevant to contemporary life and prob lems. But 71 per cent say they are generally satisfied with the education they are receiving.

title: Poland's New Artful Dodger
description: In 1960 a young member of the Polish United Workers Party from Silesia came and showed me a sheaf of antiGerman leaflets, mimeographed during the occupation. Thanks to the initiative of First Secretary Edward Gierekhe explainedwork had been started on the history of the resistance movement in Silesia. Could I, as an old Silesian partisan fighter, throw any light on the origins of those leaflets?

title: INSKO WINS TWICE IN PAGING SERIES
description: YONKERS, Jan. 15 Big Champ and Leander Lobell, both driven by Del Iisko, cap tured divisions of the Snowball Pacing Series at Yonkers Race way tonight.

title: DR. KING HONORED ALL OVER COUNTRY
description: The 42d anniversary of the birth of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. was observed yesterday with memorial serv ices, school holidays and a demonstration here in the tradi tion of the late civil rights leader.

title: The Eternal Nile: A Blessing and a Curse
description: ASWAN, United Arab Repub lic, Jan. 15Behold there come seven years of great plenty throughout the land of Egypt, and there shall arise after them seven years of famine.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Bucks Rout Royals, 135110
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 15 (AP) A 21to4 burst at the start of the third period started the Milwaukee Bucks toward 135116 rout of the Cincinnati Royals tonight.

title: Queens Man Seized in Murder of Wife and Son
description: A 25yearold Queens man was charged last night with the murder of his wife and 17 monthold son last Sunday in their fourroom apartment in the Glen Oaks section.

title: NEWSDAY EMPLOYES VOTE AGAINST GUILD
description: Editorial employes at News day, the Long Island newspaper, have voted not to be repre sented by the American News paper Guild.

title: Chavez Says His Union Is Suing the Pentagon
description: Csar Chavez, head of the United Farm Workers Union, announced at a rally here yesterday that the union had sued the Defense Department to prohibit the Army from buying lettuce from a con cern being boycotted by the farm workers.

title: Bucknell Group Testifies
description: LEWISBURG, Pa., Jan. 15 Two students and two librarians from Bucknell University are among persons who have been questioned by the grand jury in Harrisburg.

title: DOLE CONFIRMED AS HEAD OF G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 The Republican National Com mittee ratified today President Nixon's choice of Senator Rob ert J. Dole of Kansas as the party's National Chairman.

title: Slight Gains Reported in Bonn ln Germans' Parley on Transit
description: BONN, Jan. 15  Negotia tiors representing East Germany and West Germany made slight progress today for the first time in their third round of confidential talks on transit questions, a knowledgeable in formant reported here.

title: Dump Owner Gets Aid For Growing No Crops
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 UPI)Congressional investi gators charged today that land owners were getting Government farm subsidies for not growing crops in a garbage dump, a gravel pit, housing developments and even on a blacktop road.

title: Orr Is Suing Restaurant, Charges Misuse of Name
description: CONCORD, N. H., Jan. 15 (AP)The Boston Bruins star, Bobby Orr, filed a $100,000 suit in United States District Court today against Pasquale F. Alosa of Concord and Robert K. Orr of Gilford, charging damages to his name, reputation and good will.

title: McCormack Leaving A Gift for Successor
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (AP)Except for a mounted pair of horns from a Texas longhorn steer, the office of former House Speaker John W. McCormack, Democrat of Massachusetts, was stripped bare today.

title: Antiques: Prized Chairs
description: Slover and Taylor was a firm of early 19thcentury New York cabinetmakers whose name was only estab lished less than 10 years ago.

title: Nassau Police Threaten Job Action This Monday
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Jan. 15 The head of the Nassau County Patrolmen's Benevolent Asso ciation warned today of a pos sible job action by the county police this Monday unless au thorities yielded to his de mands for a 24 per cent wage increase.

title: Jesuit Weekly Says Ecumenism, Far From Dead, Is Thriving
description: In an editorial that coincides with the annual observance of the Week of Prayer for Chris tian Unity, which begins Mon day, a Roman Catholic weekly takes issue with churchmen who say that ecumenism has lost its luster.

title: Feb, 4 Blue Cross Hearing
description: Public hearings will he held Feb. 4 on a proposed 19.3 per cent hospital insurance rate in crease sought by Blue Cross in the city and in 17 counties, the State Insurance Department an nounced yesterday. The hear ings on the proposed increases, which would affat the New A.M. and 7 P.M. at the New Your County Lawyers Associa tion offices, 14 Vesey Street.

title: Soviet Jews Assail U.S.
description: MOSCOW, Jan, 15 (Reuters) A group of Jewish citizens of the Soviet Union demanded today that Washington put an end to antiSoviet incidents in the United States.

title: ExHughes Aide Lives in Desert Inn Mansion but All Else Is Gone
description: LAS VEGAS, Jan. 11Robert A. Maheu's days of living like a pasha appear to be about over. He still lives in the $500, 000 mansion that Howard R. Hughes built for him, but the other perquisites are gone.

title: No Radical Chic in Brooklyn
description: There was nothing spectacularly unique about the white, workingclass, Brooklyn neighborhood in which I was born and raised. It was, I should imagine, much like other neighbor hoods in New York: closed, provincial, and bigoted. It had very little in com mon with that fabled city which serves as backdrop in advertisements for divers assortments of chic junk, and in which devastatingly attractive men and women pursue their vital and interesting careers.

title: BOND PRICES HIT AN 18MONTH HIGH
description: Another primerate cut caught the credit markets by surprise yesterday and it pushed interest rates through out the money and capital mar kets down further.

title: FEES ON POLLUTERS HINTED BY U.S. AIDE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 (AP) Russell E. Train, chairman of the President's. Council on En vironmental Quality, indicated today that the Nixon Adminis tration would probably adopt a system of fees on waste discharges.

title: Mare Posts $17.60 Payoff;
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 15 William Clayton Prickett Jr.'s Double the Bet, Who won only once in 22 starts last year, scored a twolength victory to day in the $19,000 Delano Purse at Liberty Bell race track.

title: Market Place: An Income Fund That Stands Out
description: William B. Altschuler runs the $75million Channing In come Fund. He's mild in man nera far cry from the up tight gogo money manager.

title: Callas Seeking Divorce
description: BRESCIA, Italy (UPI) Jan. 15 Maria Callas, the opera star, told a judge today that she wanted a divorce and did not intend to be reconciled with her estranged husband, Gio vanni Battista Meneghini, an industrialist. Judge Alfonso Mascolo set March 1 as the date for the first hearing on the divorce suit after he had failed in effecting a reconcilia tion. Miss Callas was one of thousands who had filed for divorce under a Dec. 1 law that introduced divorce in modern Italy for the first time.

title: THREATENED STRIKE ON L.I.R. IS AVERTED
description: A possible strike on the Long Island Railroad was averted last night when the carrier and three unions announced a set tlement in a payparity dispute.

title: Some Soviet Emigres in Israel Back Harassment Tactics Here
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 15A mili tant group of former Soviet Jews living in Israel voiced sup port today for the Jewish De fense League's harassment of Soviet institutions in the United States.

title: U.N. Protest by Lebanon
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 15Lebanon charged to day that Israel had arranged an intrusion into her territorial waters for a pretext for yes terday's raid.

title: Court Fines Phone Union; 48,500 in State on Strike
description: A $112,500 fine was levied here yesterday on the striking telephone mechanics union as union and company lawyers tried to reach agreement on a formula to end the walkout by arbitration.

title: KEYBOARD LID FALLS, PIANIST CARRIES ON
description: As she was beginning the last and biggest work on her Chopin program, the B minor Sonata, in Tully Hall on Thurs day night, Maria Augusta had a bizarre accident.

title: Court Levies $5,000 Fine On ExL.I. Labor Leader
description: William DeKoning Jr. was sentenced in Federal Court in Brooklyn yesterday to serve two months in prison for using his office as president of Operating Engineers Local 318 to enlarge the house of a woman friend.

title: Article 11  No Title
description: BURLINGTON, Mass., Jan. 15 (AP)  The aerospace sys tems division of the RCA Cor poration announced today that it was laying off 275 employes, or 14 per cent of its work force, effective immediately.

title: WEEK'S TRUCE IS SET IN MANILA WALKOUT
description: MANILA, Jan. 15The week old transit strike, which led to an open break between Presi dent Ferdinand E. Marcos and Vice President Fernando Lopez, was called off tonight.

title: Johnson's Condition Called Satisfactory
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Jan. 15 (AP)  Former President Lyndon B. Johnson, 62 years old, was in satisfactory con dition today with mild viral pneumonia and slept well last night, his physician said.

title: TRUSTEE APPOINTED TO JERSEY CENTRAL
description: NEWARK, Jan. 15 (AP)  Ignoring suggestions from the Governor's office, United States District Court Judge Anthony T. Augelli in a surprise move today appointed Robert D. Tim pany, a Penn Central Railroad vice president, as a trustee of the Jersey Central Railroad, now undergoing reorganization.

title: U.S. REPORTS RAID ON 3 MISSILE SITES
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sat urday, Jan. 16United States Air Force fighterbombers es corting B52's on raids along the LaotianNorth Vietnamese border attacked three missile sites inside North Vietnam yesterday, military spokesmen reported.

title: Ambassador Still Held
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan. 15 The kidnappers of Ambassador Bucher have not yet released the diplomat although the Bra zilian Government fulfilled their ransom demands by flying 70 prisoners to asylum in Chile.

title: WALLACE K. SEELY
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Jan. 15 Wallace K. Seely, a former hotel executive in New York, died today after a long illness. He was 75 years old and had lived here since he retired in 1968.

title: A Female Impersonator Who Likes Being a Man
description: Lynne Carter wouldn't be caught dead in one of those horrible long midiskirts, thinks women should get equal pay for equal jobs, and spends at least an hour put ting on makeup.

title: Vatican Says It Revoked Its Death Penalty in '69
description: ROME, Jan. 15 (AP)The Vatican said today that it abolished the death penalty a year and a half ago. The abolition went virtually un noticed.

title: Tornado Kills Motorist
description: AMERICUS, Ga., Jan. 15 (UPI)  A tornado touched down about 12 miles east of here this afternoon, overturn ing a house trailer that was being towed by a truck and killing the driver. The tornado also struck the Spring Creek community near Lake Black shear, uprooting trees and knocking down boathouses and power lines.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Singer Company has announced the appoint ment of Alexander H. Dunbar as group vice presi dent. Mr. Dunbar will be in charge of the company's international group, which includes the marketing and manufacturing of consumer products in more than 40 countries. In 1970, the group had estimated sales of $225million. He was previously vice presi dent of the group, in charge of manufacturing, engi neering and supply.

title: Taxes, Not Graft, Irk Jersey City
description: JERSEY CITY, Jan. 15For the 250,000 residents of this city of dreary brick row houses, grinding factories and a heavily entrenched political organization, rising taxes are a greater concern than the drive to recall Mayor Thomas J. Whelan.

title: Suburban Trust Assets Up
description: WESTFIELD, N. J., Jan. 15 The Suburban Trust Company, has topped the $100million mark in assets, Robert S. Corbin, chairman, and Paul C. Roseland, president, announced today. At year's end, assets were $1000,819,811, or 7.5 per cent higher than at the com parable period a year ago. Deposits were $86,716,150, UP 6.5 per cent. The bank started 78 years ago as the First National Bank of Westfield and through a series of mergers, attained its present name in 1952. It has 10 offices in the western part of Union County.

title: Slipshod Play Has Knicks Distressed; Reed the Key Man
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Jan. 15 Although no signs of panic were visible, the Knicks\ were a disturbed basketball team when they arrived here today to close out what had become a nightmarish fivegame Na tional Basketball Association trip.

title: How to End the War
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.How can we end the Indochina war?

title: Chief of Polish Trade Unions Loses Post
description: WARSAW, Jan. 15Ignacy LogaSowinski, Poland's trade union chief, was replaced to day by Wladyslaw Kruczek as the new Communist leadership continued to remove key fig ures associated with the De cember riots. Both men are Politburo members.

title: Patents of the Week
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 15 Engineers of Texas Instru ments, Inc., have invented an aerial drop to sound for oil in inaccessible areas. The seismic shocks created are to be sensed, trans mitted by radio and analyzed by an airborne com puter. Paul D.Dav is Jr. and Ed win B. Neitzel of the tech nical staff at Dallas were granted Patent 3,555,502 this week. Their twopart probe is designed for release over water, marshland or desert. The light upper section floats or rests on the surface, and the lower part embeds itself at some depth, depending on soil conditions. The lower sec tion carries a sensor.

title: U.S. Draft Laws Criticized By Amnesty International
description: LONDON, Jan. 15 (UPI)  Amnesty International has de clared that the United States' draft laws are discriminatory and that penalties for their violation are unevenly applied.

title: HARAHAN GAINS FINAL IN BOWLING
description: DENVER, Jan. 15 (AP)Tim Harahan, who hasn't won a pro fessional bowling title in more than two years, was only one game away from his fourth championship after a display of clutch bowling all day today in the $50,000 Denver open bowl ing tournament.

title: Bridge:Inspired Defensive Deception Could Ruin an Expert's Slam
description: Some ideas in bridge come to fruition in strange ways. The diagramed deal, a rare bloom, budded in France but reached its full beauty in South Africa.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Michigan Beats Indiana
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Jan. 16 (UPI)Henry Wilmore, 6 feet 3 inches, lost the battle of Big Ten star sophomores by 2 points to George McGinnis but helped Michigan defeat In diana, 9281, today by scoring 20 of his 35 points in the sec ond half.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Headliners
description: Faith and Grace

title: South Vietnamese Report Retaking Cambodian Pass
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, Jan. 17 (AP)  The South Vietnamese command said yesterday that a Govern ment armored force had dis lodged enemy troops from a key mountain pass on Route 4 in Cambodia and was pushing] on north.

title: Books:
description: HOW TO MAKE YOUR MONEY DO MORE. By Da vid L. Markstein. 285 pages. Trident Press. $6.95.

title: Sports of The Times
description: MIAMI, Jan. 16In its original concep tion the Super Bowl was built on mutual loathing and deepseated animosity. The aristocrats of the National Football League had regarded the nouveau riche upstarts from the American Football League with such contempt that they referred to them as the Mickey Mouse League. The newer A.F.L. resented its second class citizenship and correctly blamed all its troubles on those supercilious snobs in the N.F.L.

title: City Is Seeking a Study For Jumbo Jetport in Sea
description: Where can a jumbo jetport be shoehorned into the metro politan area? Somewhere in the boondocks, or close by, in the ocean, on a platform of con crete blocks?

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Prayer Breakfast Introduced in Ethiopia
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Jan. 16American contributions to international culture have ranged from the assembly line to the hamburger. It is now time to add a rather unlikely new export  the Presidential prayer breakfast.

title: St. Mark's a Forum for City's Militants
description: Black slaves sat in the gal lery of St. Mark's in the Bowery hundreds of years ago and listened as the preacher at the altar below intoned: In the name of the Father, the Son and the Holy Ghost.

title: EQUESTRIAN TEAM TO TOUR EUROPE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16  The United States Equestrian Team will make a tour of ma jor European shows this year, but will not send a complete squad to the panAmerican games in Cali, Columbia.

title: The Robinson Crusoe BitSans Friday
description: ON A DESERT ISLAND IN THE CARIBBEANI am sitting on a matchless beach on this uninhab ited speckin the sea, thinking about my copy for the editor. How should I send it? A bottle perhaps, launched into the blue Caribbean? or should I deposit my epistle in a coco nut buried in the sand, with a flag planted on top, and hope that some day someone will find it?

title: Lindsay Says School Violence Robs Children of an Education
description: Mayor Lindsay scored the use of violence in the city's public school system yesterday, asserting that a cimate of fear in the schools posed a grave threat to the future of children.

title: Victory for Revolutionaries
description: For the second time last week, Brazilian revolutionaries forced a victory over Brazil's military Government as the result of kidnapping a foreign diplomat.

title: Miss Margaret Blettner Wed To Christopher Curtis Angell
description: WINNETKA, Ill., Jan. 16 Miss Margaret Jean Blettner, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Frederick Blettner, was married here this after noon to Christopher Curtis Angell, son of Ernest Angell of New York and Newtown, Conn., and the late Mrs. An gell.

title: Security Grows Tighter In Nation's Courtrooms
description: The American courthouse, where free and open public access has been a revered tra dition, is becoming a restricted, nervous enclave as the threat of violence haunts the judicial process.

title: Leaders of Taxi Drivers Union Halt Scattered Work Stoppages
description: Wildcat work stoppages by taxi drivers were baited yes terday morning after union offi cials persuaded some 100 driv ers to go to work.

title: Ad Majora Captures $29,000 Germantown for Fifth in Row at Liberty Bell
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 16 Briardale Farm's Ad Majora provided evidence for the school of thought that weight is rela tively unimportant in thorough bred racing. The 5yearold New Jersey bred horse did so today by carrying 130 pounds in his frontrunning triumph over a 10horse field in the $29,000 Germantown Handicap at Liberty Bell race track.

title: 2 SOVIET JEWS GET VISAS TO EMIGRATE
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 16 (Reuters) Two Soviet Jews, one of them a leading campaigner for Jewish rights in the Soviet Union, have been granted exit visas to emigrate to Israel, Jewish sources said here today.

title: Another No.1 for George Richey
description: If anyone were to ask Cliff Richey who was mostly responsible for his dramatic rise to the No. 1 spot in the national tennis ranking, the 24yearold Texan would open his gray eyes widely and say: My father, of course.

title: Reader's Report
description: 168 pp. New York: Doubleday & Co. $5.95.

title: Joseph Roach to Wed Victoria Castano
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Jan. 16 Miss Victoria Lynne Cas tafio and Joseph Justin Roach will be married Feb. 20.

title: Le Duan Is Found to Be Popular After Hanoi's Economic Reforms
description: The following dispatch is by Michael Maclear, the London correspondent of the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, who visited North Vietnam last month.

title: Joe Val, Former Sports Editor Of World Telegram, 68, Dead
description: Joseph P. Val, former sports editor of The New York World Telegram and The Sun, died yesterday of a heart attack at his home 3431 81st Street, Jackson Heights, Queens. He was 68 years old.

title: Crocodile Kills U.S. Major
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 (Reu iers)Maj. Hugh A. Bauer of the United States Army was killed by a crocodile while on a picnic with friends in Congo Sunday, the Army has reported. Major Bauer. 36 years old, of Eau Gallic, Fla., was a member of the United States Military Mission to the Congo. He was swimming in the Congo River when the crocodile attacked him and pulled him under water.

title: The best thing to happen to music since jazz
description: Chuck Berry's exuberant declara tion of musical independenceHail, hail, rock n roll! Deliver me from the days of old!commands the sympathy even of a moldy devotee of Jelly Roll Morton and Jack Tea garden. No question about it: rock and roll, in its many and varied manifestations, is the best thing to happen to music since the great jazz years of 191040. The blessing is, however, decidedly mixed, for rock's musical vigor, insouciance and in ventiveness too often go hand in hand with the youth culture's mind less political preachments and sleazy commercial exploitation. Consider the journalism of rock.

title: Vicki E. Penziner Prospective Bride
description: WHITE PLAINS, Jan. 16 Mr. and Mrs. Michael L. Pen ziner have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Vicki Ellen Penziner, to Laurence D. Matson, son of Dr. and Mrs. Edward J. Mat son of Libertyville, III.

title: Miss Donahue Becomes Bride Of Stephen Gray
description: SOMERVILLE, Mass., Jan. 16Miss Patricia Donahue, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Leo C. Donahue, was married this afternoon to Stephen Vail Gray, son of Mr. and Mrs. John D. Gray of New York. Msgr. George W. Casey, a cousin of the bride, per formed the ceremony in St. Catherine of Genoa Roman Catholic Church.

title: To teach a few to see it a bit differently
description: Richard Gilman's new collection of writings (The Confusion of Realms was published only last year) con tinues the selfexamination of a sensibility in search of a subject. Common and Uncommon Masks, an uncommonly turgid title for a book of brisk insights, contains 74 of the author's pieces (most rela tively short), a refreshingly candid introduction and an invaluable index. What is both disconcerting and dis arming about Mr. Gilman is that he seems to have become a drama critic almost in spite of himself.

title: THREAT OF BOYCOTT TO FIGHT IS EASED
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 16 (AP)  The threat of a national black boycott of the March 8 heavyweight title fight between Muhammad Ali and Joe Frazier in New York appeared to have abated today.

title: JOBLESSNESS RISES TO 6% IN NEW JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Jan. 16 (UPI) The unemployment rate in New Jersey rose to 6 per cent in December, the highest for that month since 1963, according to figures released by the State Department of Labor and In dustry today.

title: Clifford Ruderman, Harvard'70, To Marry Miss Helen Fraser
description: TENAFLY, N. J., Jan. 16 Dr. and Mrs. Robert Welling ton Fraser Jr. have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Helen (Bon) Roemer Fraser, to Clif ford Eric Ruderman. He is the son of Dr. and Mrs. Warren Ruderman of Dema rest. The couple plan to be married in June.

title: A Funny Play, A Beautiful Play
description: WELL, there's wonders hidden in the heart of man, muses Philip Bosco admiringly, in the Lincoln Center produc tion of The Playboy of the Western World, immediately upon learning that a certain young chap has up and split the skull of his tyrannical father. And, it would seem, there's wonders hidden in the heart of the Vivian Beaumont as well. For in spite of the fact that director John Hirsch has laid a physically coarse hand on John Millington Synge's play, an unexpected boon has befallen us all. For the first time in its history, the Beaumont has by accident or design or a little bit of bothassembled a tight, right com pany for a play it meant to produce.

title: Mary R. Carter Is Future Bride Of Howard Berg
description: WHITE STONE, Va., Jan. 16  Miss Mary Randolph Carter, youth marketing edi tor of Mademoiselle maga zine, will be married next month to Howard Berg, an account supervisor with the Lampert Advertising Agency in New York.

title: Nixon vs. Steel
description: For the first time in about six years, the steel industry was in a loud, public argu ment about prices last week with the President of the Unit ed States. The antagonists this time were President Nixon and the Bethlehem Steel Cor poration, the nation's second largest steel producer.

title: Home Improvement
description: THE combination bath tub and shower fixture pictured below com bines the equivalent of five plumbing fixtures in one unit. It controls water tem perature within one degree by sensing differences in hot and cold water pressures and then compensating automat ically to keep the original set ting. It is also a singlecontrol faucet that regulates the amount of water flow with out varying the temperature; it has a diverter, for directing water to tub or shower as de sired; it includes a builtin soap dish, and it serves as a convenient grab bar which will resist straight pulls up to 325 pounds. The unit is also strong enough to support a weight of 250 pounds on the tub spout without breaking. Like all the single control faucets produced by this manufacturer, this tubshow er unit uses an interchange able selflubricating cartridge that can be easily replaced. Moenique, approximately $40. (Moen Faucet Company, 377 Woodland Avenue, Elyria, Ohio 44035.)

title: Vanderbilt Hires Bradshaw
description: NASHVILLE, Tenn., Jan. 16 (AP)Charlie Bradshaw, former head football coach at Ken tucky, was named offensive line coach at Vanderbilt today. He coached the offensive line last season at Texas A.&M.

title: ASPROMONTE SIGNED; 13 METS NOW IN FOLD
description: Bob Aspromonte, the newest Met but the last remaining Brooklyn Dodger playing in the major leagues, has signed his 1971 contract. Bob Scheffing the Mets' general manager, also announced yesterday that he has received signed contracts from Rich Folkers and Dave Schneck, bringing the total of players signed to 13.

title: Stamps
description: THE 1970 Christmas stamps, which were precancelled, are valid for postage only through Jan. 31, John R. Strachan Postmaster of New York has announced. Anyone with unused precancelled Christmas stamps on hand after that date may exchange them for equivalent value in other postage stamps at their local post offices.

title: Churches Join to Aid Appalachia
description: JACKSON, Ky., Jan. 13 The private labor force in Breathitt County took a tre mendous surge this month with the opening of a new chair factory at Sulphur Gap.

title: WILLIAM M. RIORDAN
description: William M. Riordan, who re tired five years ago as execu tive secretary of the National Fire and Burglary Alarm As sociation, died Friday in Booth Memorial Medical Center, Flushing, Queens. He was 77 years old and lived at 15711 Sanford Avenue, Flushing.

title: U.S. Jets Bomb Pass
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Jan. 16 (UPI)American F4 Phan tom jets dropped napalm near Pica Nil Pass in support of Cambodian troops seeking to clear Route 4.

title: The Battle of Stewkley Church
description: The very names call up English rural scenesCubling ton, Stewkley, Aston Abbotts, Soulsbury. It is in the midst of these villages in Buckinghamshire that a British Government commission proposes to build an airport four times bigger than the existing London airport. The English are fighting back as they would against any dread invader.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16A child's history of football, for women:

title: Weber Defeats Harahan, 183173, to Capture $50,000 Denver Open Bowling
description: DENVER, Jan. 16 (UPI)Dick Weber defeated Tim Harahan, 183173, for first place today in the $50,000 Denver open bowling tournament.

title: Article 11  No Title
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Jan. 16 (AP) William Chatmon paced Baylor to its first Southwest Confer ence victory today, 7770, over Texas.

title: Russia's SALT Offer
description: The Soviet Union's suggestion of a preliminary strategic arms agreement restricting antiballistic missile (ABM) defenses in both countries deserves an immediate, favorable American response without waiting for resumption of formal talks March 15 in Vienna.

title: BRODIE IS SELECTED AS PLAYER OF YEAR
description: DETROIT, Jan. 16 (UPI) John Brodie of the San Fran cisco 49ers and Paul Brown of the Cincinnati Bengals have been named player and coach of the year by the weekly news paper Football News.

title: BUSINESS LETTER
description: A year ago, the Nixon Administration was talking about a possible $1billion surplus in the Federal budget for the fiscal year ending in June, 1971. Most economic. observers snickered knowing ly and pronounced the fore cast highly tenuous.

title: Geraldine Hraban to Be Married
description: STONY BROOK, L.I., Jan. 16 Mr. and Mrs. Walter Louis Hraban have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Geraldine Susan Elizazeth Anne Hraban, to Robert Chanler Herrick, a Watson Scholar and senior at Brown University. He is the son of Dr. and Mrs. Clif ford Ernest Herrick Jr. of Lexington, Ky., where Dr. Herrick is resident manager of the research division of International Business Ma chines.

title: Just a Few of My Fearless Exploits In the Jungle
description: ISLA BANANAL NATIONAL PARK AND INDIAN RESERVE, BrazilWhile wheez ing and choking on the mixture of fly ash and carbon monoxide that passes for air in New York City, I read recently that onefifth of all the oxygen in the earth's atmosphere is generated by the 575 million acres of tropical forest in the Amazon basin. Or maybe it was onefiftieth. At any rate it was a lot of O2, and I recall hoping that some of it might seep up to Manhattan. Then, by Jorge, a friend telephoned to ask if I'd like to fly down to Brazil and spend a few days on a house boat here on the Araguaia River, fishing and bird watching and loafing. And even if the air in the Great Metropolis hadn't been lumpier than usual that day, I'd have said yes.

title: Starr Kostner to Be Bride July 3
description: VALLEY STREAM, L. I., Jan. 16Miss Starr Kostner, a senior at George Washing ton University, and Jerold Fagelbaum, who attends the Georgetown Law School, plan to be married July 3.

title: GAME MADE TO AID SCHOOL HARMONY
description: A white pupil assigned to plan a skit with three blacks asked her teacher if she could change groups because I just don't like Negroes.

title: The Nation
description: When agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation finally captured the Rev. Daniel J. Berrigan on Block Island last August, one of them is said to have intoned under his breath: Ad Majorem Dei Gloriam (the Jesuit motto meaning For the greater glory of God).

title: The Mailbox:
description: To the Editor:

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: WALKER'S CAY, The Ba hamasThe second night of our stay at this remote and lovely island in the northern Bahamas the main course at supper was a magnificent platter of huge stone crabs that had been taken from the water only a few hours before.

title: NETS WIN, 117116, ON BARRY'S GOAL
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Jan. 16 (UPI)Rick Barry hooked in the winning field goal in the final second tonight to give the New York Nets a 117116 victory over the Kentucky Colonels in the American Basketball Association.

title: KurdishAid Group Formed in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 Emir Kamuran Bedir Khan, a representative of the Kur dish leader, Gen. Mustafa al Barzani, today announced the formation of a Kurdish American Relief Society.

title: Poker and Mozart helped with the atom
description: Werner Heisenberg, formulator of the concept of indeterminacy and director of the Max Planck Institute for Physics and Astrophysics in Mu nich, explains in this book what it was like to be an atomic physicist in the extraordinary years from 1920 to 1965. Science, he says in his preface, is made by men and is rooted in con versations. By reconstructing count less discussions among his colleagues in physics over the last half cen tury and by reproducing the pre cise atmosphere in which the con versations took place, he hopes to reduce the gap between the two cultures, between art and science. His aim is to give people like me, untrained in physics and without ap titude for mathematics, some idea of the mental processes that have gone into the development of quantum theory and to draw us all into vi tal discussion.

title: Valerie Matturro Wed To Wendell Putney
description: YONKERS, Jan. 16  Miss Valerie Fae Matturro and Wendell Carpenter Putney were married here this after noon in the chapel of the Hud son River Chateau. The Rev. Harold L. Hiemstra of the Bethany Memorial Reformed Church in New York per formed the ceremony.

title: In Former Biafra, the Scars of War Fade
description: OWERRI, Nigeria, Jan. 12 One year after its military de feat, the land that used to call itself Biafra is coming back to life.

title: That our presence in Vietnam is unwise, absurd and wrong
description: American participation in the Indochina war can be opposed from three points of view: the absolute moral one that this kind of indiscriminate destruc tion of man and nature cannot be condoned on any ground; the deterministic one that this kind of war inevitably derives from a particular economic and po litical system Which must be changed in order to bring that war to an end and prevent new ones of a similar nature; and the pragmatic one that this particular war happens to he indefensible on moral, polit ical and military grounds. The position Noam Chomsky takes here is that of moral absolut ism, supported at least by a degree of economic determin ism.

title: FRENCH TROT BODY IS REORGANIZED
description: PARIS, Jan. 16The French trotting industry has at last carried out a modicum of re form under heavy pressure from the government.

title: Law and orderand death
description: On the night of Feb. 8, 1968, state highway patrolmen opened gunfire on student dem onstrators on the campus of South Carolina State College in Orangeburg, S.C. When the gunfire ceased, three students were dead and 27 others were wounded; the victims were all black. In The Orangeburg Massacre, Jack Nelson (until recently the Southern corres pondent of The Los Angeles Times) and Jack Bass (South Carolina correspondent of The Charlotte Observer) have gone back two and a half years and reexamined this incident.

title: Lafayette Conquers Rider, 6260, as Tripucka Excels
description: EASTON, Pa., Jan. 16 (AP) Tracy Tripucka scored 32 points and made a key pass late in the game to pace La fayette to a 6260 victory over Rider in a Middle Atlantic Con ference college basketball game today.

title: In Dylan Thomas's Footsteps
description: SWANSEA, Wales  During the early 1950's Dylan Thomas made extensive lecture tours of Amer ican campusesgiving read ings and making recordings  and it could almost be said that he was dis covered in the United States. Certainly Thomas was more admired in Amer ica during his lifetime than elsewhere, and thus, as Thomas lovers, we regarded our visit to Wales as a kind of exchange journey.

title: SOME PRICES RAISED 6.8% BY U.S. STEEL
description: The United States Steel Com poration announced yesterday price increases of about 6.8 per cent on major construction products.

title: Belgian Official to Visit U.S.
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 16 (Reuters) Foreign Minister Pierre Har mel will leave Tuesday for an official visit to the United States, the Belgian Foreign Min istry has announced.

title: Madagascar Plans Hotel
description: TANANARIVE, Madagascar, Jan. 16 (Agence FrancePress) Work will start within two months on a resort hotel to be built with South African aid on NossiBe, an island off Mada gascar's northeast coast, Presi dent Philibert Tsiranana an nounced this week.

title: Miss Rieber Will Be Bride Of Law Student
description: Mr. and Mrs. Frank Rieber Jr. of Singapore, New York and Denver, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Catherine Dunne Rieber, to Henry Anson Barber 4th of Las Vegas, Nev.

title: Cabooses at End of the Line Are Turned Into Ski Village Chalets
description: LA RIVIERE, Manitoba One of the strangest ski vil lages in North America is nestled in the Pembina Valley here, 100 miles southwest of Winnipeg.

title: Bygone Cars and Guns Amid the Rhododendrons
description: SANDWICH, Mass.Within five minutes of the busy traffic on the Bourne Bridge over the Cape Cod Canal, it is possible to relax in an atmosphere of bygone eras among the antique automobiles and firearms on display at the Heritage Plantation of Sandwich.

title: Nuclear Attack Submarine Launched in Connecticut
description: GROTON, Conn., Jan. 16 (AP) The nuclear attack submarine Archerfish was launched into the Thames River here today at the shipyards of General Dy namics' Electric Boat Division.

title: Corelli Takes Ernani Role
description: Franco Corelli replaced Pla cido Domingo last night in the title role of Ernani at the Metropolitan Opera on a five hour notice. Mr. Corelli first substituted for Mr. Domingo in Ernani on Jan. 7, a role that he had not done in five years. Francis Robinson, assistant manager of the Met, was moved to ask: What other opera house in the world could have Corelli as a replacement?

title: Protection Held Adequate
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 16 (AP)A spokesman for the United Mission at the United Nations said today that the Soviet Union's United Nations Mission and its per sonnel were adequately pro tected despite the strike by New York City Policemen.

title: Best of show
description: Part show biz, part museum tour is an apt summing up of the 17th Annual Winter Antiques Show, which opens Jan. 22 at the Seventh Regiment Armory. At this most prestigious of Amer ican antique fairs, dealers display their choicest wares. Chinese porcelains, Lowestoft and silver, 18thcentury French and Eng lish furniture rub shoulders with their fine American cousins and vigorous folk art. The latter is especially charming because it captures the vitality of a youthful nation. Though many elements combine to make a piece noteworthyassociation with a his toric event, for instancemost often it is the grace and spirit of the design that marks a piece for greatness. This show assembles many greats. Trends? Only that prices are still going up, up, up.

title: APARTHEID KEEPS BUS JOBS UNFILLED
description: CAPETOWN, Jan. 16Johan nesburg, short of bus drivers because of South Africa's policy of racial separation, plans to recruit in Britain and the Neth erlands.

title: Key to the Back Office
description: The back office of a Wall Street brokerage house is an intricate jumble of men and machines dedicated to one purpose, moving paper. Designed to facilitate the transfer of ownership shares, the stock certificate has taken on a life of its ownlike the dancing slippers in the Red Shoes. In McLuhanesque terms, Gerald T. Dunne (Har vard Business Review, MayJune, 1970) describes the process as papyrization. The medium has become the message. Paper is the name of the mess.

title: City to Ask Power to Hear Housing and Pollution Cases in Tribunals
description: ALBANY, Jan. 16  New York City will ask the Legis lature to grant it the power to handle many housing and environmental violations by es tablishing administrative tri bunals that could ease court congestion and strengthen the enforcement of penalties for infractions.

title: Lombardi Golf Tourney To Aid Fight on Cancer
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 16 (UPI)A celebrity golf tour nament, named in honor of the late Vince Lombardi, with proceeds to go for cancer re search, will be held here June 25. Clarence Dittmar, president of North Hills Country Club in suburban Menominee Falls, and Wil liam Kostecke, president of the Miller Brewing Company, made the announcement.

title: 25,000 IN WALKOUT
description: With his Police Commissioner warning that emergency serv ices could be maintained only a few more days, Mayor Lind say yesterday denounced the policemen's wildcat strike as an attack on the people of this city and on the rule of law itself.

title: Excerpts From the News Conference Held by Lindsay and Murphy
description: Following are excerpts from the news conference held by Mayor Lindsay and Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy yesterday, as re corded by The New York Times:

title: DR. GASPAR ANGELO
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 16 Dr. Gaspar Angelo, a special ist in proctology and head sur geon at Mount Auburn Hospital here, died last night at the age of 65.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Pacers Set Back Condors
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 16 (AP) Mel Daniels chipped in with 20 points in the second half as the Indiana Pacers tallied to beat the Pittsburgh Condors, 115 107, tonight.

title: 66 Double BowOut: Colts Ready With Big Pass Play
description: When the Baltimore Colts are confronted today with an obvious passing situation, such as third down with 8 yards to go for a first down, the Dallas Cowboy defensive unit will be alert for the big play that put the Colts in the Super Bowl game.

title: Letters
description: Dr. Solomon H. Snyder's laudatory article about mari juana (What We Have For gotten About Pot, Dec. 13) deserves some sort of rebut tal. No drug known to man is Without its negative properties and cannabis is no exception, although this fact does not emerge in Dr. Snyder's pane gyric about the miracle drug and the delight giver.

title: Multimedia Class
description: If you were an astronaut stranded on the moon and had to walk 200 miles to a rendezvous point, would you rather carry a case of de hydrated milk or a portable heating unit in your knapsack?

title: McClellands Have Child
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Jan. 16A daughter was born on Dec. 24 to Mr. and Mrs. David L. McClelland in St. John's Hospital, Yonkers.

title: Jordan's Petra: Silent and Alone
description: AMMAN, JordanWhen a friend first suggested a visit to the classical ruins of Petra, one of Jordan's few remaining unoccupied tour ist attractions, I muttered something about being more interested in the pres ent inhabitants of that land.

title: GREECE BACKS PLAN FOR PEKING TRADE
description: ATHENS, Jan. 16The Greek Government today gave its blessing to a privatebusiness effort to stimulate trade be tween Greece and Communist China, although the two coun tries have no diplomatic ties.

title: At 93 or 94, or Whatever She Is, Lillie Lewisohn Vogel Still Looks Ahead
description: WASHINGTONHer age is only cal culable, although there's a persistent ru mor that she's more than 94. But all Lillie Lewisohn VogelCall me Lillie; everybody doeswill say on the sub ject is, Don't ask me. I can't remember and I'm sure if I did, I'd be so old, I'd have to bury me.

title: ALLWHITE LODGES AWAIT COURT RULE
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Jan. 15 The State Liquor Control Board mailed an annual license re newal today to Moose Lodge 107, across State Street from the Capitol.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: U.S., British Crews to Race Tomorrow
description: For the second year in a rows, a threeman crew from the United States will race a similar British crew to morrow at 10:30 A.M. in the National Boat Show chal lenge race in the East River.

title: Player's 68 for 269 Wins Dunlop Golf by Two Shots
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Jan. 16 (AP)  Gary Play er of South Africa posted a final round ?? 68 to day for a 269 total to win the Dunlop Masters golf champion ship.

title: Leafs Extend Home Streak
description: TORONTO, Jan. 16 (UPI) Paul Henderson scored two goals tonight as the Toronto Maple Leafs beat the Los Angeles Kings, 81, for their 11th consecutive unbeaten game at home.

title: LA SALLE UPSETS WEST. KENTUCKY
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 16 (UPI)Ken Durrett scored 45 points to lead La Salle to a 9176 upset over fifthranked Western Kentucky tonight in the Palestra.

title: BOSTON U. SEXTET GETS 12TH VICTORY
description: BOSTON, Jan. 16 (AP)Un beaten Boston University, the nation's topranked college hockey team, outshot Bowling Green by a 4117 margin to night in recording a 61 victory.

title: Tribe to Construct Recreation Project Costing $6Million
description: RUIDOSO, N. M., Jan. 16 A $6.8million, 150,000acre rec reation and tourist project is to be constructed on the sprawl ing Mescalero Apache Indian reservation near here, with work to begin this summer and scheduled to be completed by December, 1973.

title: An Expedition South Through Trinidad's Sugar Country
description: PORT OF SPAIN, Trinidad That is where the true Trinidad is to be found, the tourism official said, pointing south. I had already told him that we were heading in that directionsouth where the rhapsody of tourist brochures runs thin and the tour ists themselves run hardly at all.

title: Royals Win in Last Seconds
description: CINCINNATI, Jan. 16 (UPI) Johnny Green scored on a layup with 16 seconds left to give the Cincinnati Royals a 114113 victory over the Buf falo Braves tonight in a National Basketball Association game.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: The teams in the Super Bowl today may switch from the offensive to the defensive, but network advertisers dur ing the game will be on the offensive all the way.

The championship of pro foot ball will be seen by 80,000 persons in the Orange Bowl stadium and an estimated 64 million on television.

description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 16Miss To Kim Hoa, a social worker, and Thomas C. Fox, a parttime correspond ent here for The New York Times, were married today.

title: NEW STAFFS FOR U.N. FAVORED BY HAMBRO
description: STANFORD, Calif., Jan. 16 (UPI)  Dr. Edvard I. Hambro, Norwegian delegate to the United Nations, suggests that the United Nations consider establishing its own intelli gence, diplomatic and univer sity systems.
