description: CHICAGO, Jan. 16 (UPI) Lew Alcindor scored 22 of his 25 points in the last half to night to lead the Milwaukee Bucks to a 11090 victory over Chicago before the Bulls' biggest crowd of the season, 14,013.

title: S.M.U. Extends Fry's Pact
description: DALLAS, Jan. 16 (UPI)Hay den Fry, the head football coach and athletic director at South ern Methodist University, was awarded today a threeyear ex tension of his contract to Dec. 31, 1974.

title: St. Lawrence's Coach Records 100th Victory
description: CANTON, N. Y., Jan. 16 St. Lawrence University's hockey coach, George Men ard, has a brandnew plaque. It was presented to him by his players after they had de feated Penn, 76, last Wednes day night at Appleton Arena here.

title: Dominican Republic Awaits Rediscovery
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Re public  Can a lush tropical land of 4 million people, almost as big as West Virginia, only three hours by jet (and $160 round trip) from New York, exist largely unknown to Ameri cans?

title: NAVY CHIEF HEARS ANTIWAR OFFICER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16A young naval officer, who has asked the Navy to convene an official court of inquiry to study alleged war crimes and atrocities in Vietnam, present ed his views briefly last night at a dinner here attended by the new Chief of Naval Op erations, Adm. Elmo R. Zum walt Jr.

title: Schools Shut in Czech Town
description: PRAGUE, Jan. 16 (Reuters) All schools in Plzen have been closed for a week as a result of a measure to save electric power, coal and gas, the Communist party daily RudePravo reports.

title: 3 IN ALLEGED PLOT FAIL TO RAISE BOND
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Jan. 16 (UPI)Two Roman Catholic priests and a former priest, in dicted on charges of conspir ing to kidnap a Presidential adviser, were unable today to raise $25,000 bond and re mained in Lebanon County Jail.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: The multimilliondollar in terstate industrial develop ment sweepstakes, custom arily involving large new plant openings or expansions, are still far removed from such remote communities, as Sulphur Gap, near Jackson, Ky., the county seat of Breathitt County in the heart of the mountainous Appala chia region.

title: Sue Ellen Stevenson and Michael John Boyle Are Married
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Jan. 16 St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church here was the setting this morning for the mar riage of Miss Sue Ellen Ste venson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas J. Stevenson Jr. of Manhasset, and Mi chael John Boyle, son of Mr. and Mrs. James P. Boyle of Stamford, Conn. The cere mony was performed by the Rev. Robert L. Brown.

title: Whistling Swans Wear Necklaces and Radios as Scientists Chart Migration Routes to Aid Air Safety
description: Bird watchers need not doubt their eyes, Some of those mi gratory whistling swans really are wearing plastic necklaces of yellow, black, red or brown and midget radios, too.

title: U. S. Sending Guards Here To Protect Soviet Mission
description: Federal guards, specially trained to work at diplomatic buildings, were sent here from Washington at Mayor Lind say's request yesterday to replace policemen who have been on duty outside the Soviet Union's Mission to the United Nations.

title: Reader's Report
description: By Laura Z. Hobson. 286 pp. New York: Simon & Schuster. $6.95.

title: Barbara Doubleday Betrothed To John Perry, Astrophysicist
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J., Jan. 16 Miss Barbara Doubleday plans to be married March 6 to John Ferguson Weir Perry of Cambridge, Mass., and Jaffrey, N.H., son of Dr. John Weir Perry of San Francisco and the late Mrs. Martha Kingman Perry.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 16The wind shield of a station wagon owned by Pan American World Air ways was smashed last night in apparent retaliation for the stoning on Thursday of the Aeroflot office window in New York.

title: Centralized Talks Sought
description: LONDON, Jan. 16Fifteen in ternational oil companies, 12 of them American, called tonight for centralized negotiations with Arab and other oil producers for a fiveyear price agreement to head off a threatening crisis in Middle Eastern oil.

title: Environment
description: DETROITDr. William G. Ag new wears the typical General Motors whitecollaremploye uni form: white shirt, narrowish tie, glasses and two ballpoint pens in his shirt pocket.

title: 38 Freighters Idle in Month
description: LONDON, Jan. 16 (Reuters) A total of 38 freighters of the world merchant fleet are idle this month, three more than in December, the British Chamber of Shipping reported.

title: Prostate Cancer Called Curable; Treatment of Symptoms Scored
description: A University of Minnesota cancer expert has found that an annual examination of the pros tate gland, followed by surgical removal of those glands found to be cancerous, can enable pa tients to live out their lives as if they never had had this often fatal disease.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: MIAMI, Jan. 16In both intercollegiate and professional sports, coach after coach expresses the new need for understanding and explaining in dealing with the athletes. Motivation seems to follow compassion. Going, if not gone, are Vince Lombardi's shouting, militant ways.

title: Books:
description: MANAGE MORE BY DO ING LESS. By Raymond O. Loen. 254 pages. McGraw Hill. $10.95.

title: The World
description: JERUSALEM  It was a big moment when Natan Cherulni kov, his wife and 23yearold daughter, stepped off an El Al airliner at Lydda Airport last Monday. With their arrival, the Government declared that the population of Israel had reached three million.

title: For Young Readers
description: Although more than a year has passed since Apollo 11, 25,000 lettersmostly from the youngarrive at NASA each week, asking for something about the astronauts or a pic ture of the men who walked on the moon.

title: Denim comes to town
description: What fabric is more applepie American than denim? This sturdy dark cotton used in jeans and work clothes looks like the allstar favorite for 1971. Denim overalls won't be confined to the farm this year. They promise to be one of the big, young, kicky, status fash ions. Denim has gone fancy, too, but in the nicest way. Even sophisticated cityslicker designs preserve its cleancut look.

title: Lion Sleeps Wins 5th in Row, Taking Super Bowl Handicap
Prince of Ascot Takes Feature at Fair Grounds
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 16 (AP) Prince Of Ascot charged from off the pace and won the $20, 000 Lone Star Handicap by two lengths at the Fair Grounds be fore 17,148 today.

title: Harvard Beats Navy, 8972
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Jan. 16 (AP)James Brown scored 27 points tonight to lead Harvard to an 8972 victory over Navy.

title: SENATE TO PLAY MUSICAL CHAIRS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16The Senators will soon be playing the game they like the best musical chairs to determine who goes where in the party structure and on the commit tees.

title: Stemming the Cost Of a Ski Holiday in Switzerland
description: INTERLAKEN, Switzerland  Swiss air and the Swiss National Tourist Office have been saying for a long while that it costs no more to go skiing  transportation included  in the Swiss Alps than in Aspen or Sun Valley, and while that may not be quite correct if you try your schussing at some of the more fashionable spots in Switzerland it comes pretty close to being a fact if you land in the Bernese Oberland.

title: Hanging Is Urged For Drug Peddlers By South Africans
description: CAPETOWN, Jan. 16The Government of South Africa, where there are more execu tions than in any other coun try in the world, is considering introducing the death penalty for peddling drugs.

description: On the nights his wife goes to her women's liberation meeting, Arthur Powell takes care of their 12weekold son and watches television.

description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Music
description: THERE was an interesting head line in the lead story of the Jan. 5 edition of the Wall Street Journal: Increased Federal Aid in Home Mortgage Field Nears Take over Point. In the Jan. 11 Newsweek there was a story about the Federal Government galloping to the aid of the Lockheed Aircraft Corp. Deputy Defense Secretary David Packard, said the story, carefully refrained from dis closing the total cost of his plan to the nation's taxpayers, but outside es timates ranged from $750million to $1.4billion. Good old private enter prise.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Article 9  No Title
description: MIAMI, Jan. 16  In speaking of Craig Morton, the Dallas Cowboy quarter back for the Super Bowl game tomorrow against Baltimore, the seasoned coach of the San Diego Chargers, Sid Gillman, ob served recently, He can only improve.

title: Pros Win in Overtime
description: DALLAS, Jan. 16 (UPI) Wendell Laddner led the Mem phis Pros to a 114112 victory over the Texas Chaparrals in overtime tonight.

title: Baseball Writers to Cite Davidson of the Braves
description: Donald L. Davidson, who rose from errand boy in the old Boston Braves clubhouse in his early teens to traveling secretary and director of games for the Atlanta Braves, was named yester day by the New York Chap ter of the Baseball Writers' Association of America to receive the William Slocum Award for long and meri torious service to baseball.

title: Television
description: LOS ANGELES.

title: To the Rescue  of a Tree
description: IN an age beset by so many major crises, the threatened demise of a tree may seem to many of insignificant importance. But not to members of the environmentconscious Inwood Civic Council in Upper Manhattan. For esthetic, historical and educational reasons, they have placed preservation of the big ginkgo in Isham Park at 212th and Broad way high on their agenda.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  The United States today is suffering from a poor distribution of doctorsand it is as acute in Manhattan's teeming Upper West Side as it is in the tiny town of Kirkland, cradled in the rolling cornfields of Illinois. It's not that New York and Illinois are short of doctors. They have more doc tors per residents than most oth er states. The problem is that these doctors are poorly distrib uted.

title: Basketball Date Changed
description: Southern Connecticut State College's basketball game with the University of Hartford, originally scheduled on Friday, Jan. 29, at New Haven, will be played Feb. 22.

title: Science/Medicine
description: HOUSTON  The moon has a surface as great as the conti nent of Africa, and so far man has laid his hands on only 123 pounds of its topsoil and ancient rocks. But for a year and a half those precious few pounds, gathered at a cost of 824billion, have been the object of the most intensive study in the history of science.

title: MRS. FRANK RUBANE
description: Mrs. Lillian Levetown Ru bane, a retired optician and the widow of Frank Rubane, a jew eler, died yesterday at the home of a sister, Mrs. Jack Nieren burg in Waterbury, Conn. She was 70 years old and lived at 30 Bogardus Place.

title: 69DayOld Strike On 2 Papers Ends In Rockford, III.
description: ROCKFORD, III., Jan. 16 (AP) A 69day strike by the Rock ford Newspaper Guild against The Rockford Star and The Reg isterRepublic ended today.

title: TWO U.S. TUNA BOATS SHOT AT OFF ECUADOR
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif., Jan. 16 (AP)  Unidentified fighter planes strafed two San Diego based tuna boats today about 60 miles off the coast of Ecuador, according to radio reports from the boats.

title: A Motorist's Trail Through the Florida Boots and Saddle Land
description: ARCADIA, Fla,On the surface, Ar cadia looks much like an average small town in Alabama or Geor gia. There is a residential section of frame houses set well back from oaklined streets, the usual small busi ness district. There is nothing distinctive about itexcept that the clothing stores here display widebrimmed hats, Levi's and boots as their most popular year round items, and the hardware stores sell saddles, lassos and branding irons. There is a rodeo shop where you can buy lame stretch pants in blue or gold, purple or orange, along with an assort ment of fringed jackets, cowboy hats, spurs and kerchiefs that would be hard to duplicate on the lot of a Western movie.

title: But Artificial Turf Could Be
description: MIAMI, Jan. 16For the first time, the Super Bowl game will be played on arti ficial turf tomorrow and an artificial con troversy has been swept out from under the green rug.

title: Smith in Garden State Post
description: CHERRY HILL. N. J. (UPI) Richard H. Smith, a former executive for a chain of week lies in southern New Jersey, has been named publicity di rector for Garden State Park. Smith, 43, succeeds Jack Tay lor, who is handling public information for New Jersey's state lotteries.

title: A strict and subtle, wise and entertaining guide
description: Even before his death of a heart attack at the age of 53 in 1966, in a horrible state of selfimposed isola tion in a New York hotel room, Del more Schwartz was a legendary fig ure on the New York literary scene. Like his improbable name, he was a compelling set of contradictions. He had a genius for friendship, yet he died estranged from all his friends, who remember him with an almost religious tenderness. He was a pro digious talent and hard worker, fret ting over the state of American let ters and contributing fiction, poetry, essays, advice, direction, encourage ment and conscience to it. He ad dressed not only the avantgarde but a frequently disheartened cultural community in such journals as Parti san Review, Kenyon Review and The New Republic. Yet his work never quite fulfilled his friends' and his own high expectations. He had the gift of gab, a mind of comic invention which could swoop down on any sub ject and hold a single friend or the entire White Horse bar spellbound, yet he seldom permitted that voice to appear in his writings.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: NIXON SENDS AIDE TO MIDDLE EAST TO BAR OIL CRISIS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 President Nixon today sent Under Secretary of State John N. Irwin 2d on a mission to three Middle East oilproduc ing countries to try to avert a threatened world oil crisis.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Winthrop P. Rockefeller to Wed Deborah Sage.
description: Winthrop Paul Rockefeller, the 22yearold son of former Arkansas Gov. Winthrop Rockefeller and Mrs. Barbara (Bobo) Sears Rockefeller, the Cinderella bride of 1948, plans to marry Miss Deborah Cluett Sage, a Chapin gradu ate he met at Oxford.

title: Apollo 14 Crew Is Found Physically Fit for Mission
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Jan. 16 (UPI)The three Apollo 14 astronauts passed fourhour medical examinations today and were pronounced physical ly ready for launching to the moon in two weeks.

title: Son to the Alexanders
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Jules Alexander of New York on Jan. 5 at Doctors Hospital. The child will be named Geoffrey. Mrs. Alex ander is the former Miss Sue Weinstein, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Walter Weinstein. Mr. Weinstein, former presi dent of Russeks Fifth Ave nue, is now a private in vestor. Mr. Alexander is head of the science department of the Columbia Grammar School.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: SWISS DIPLOMAT FREED IN BRAZIL
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan. 16 Giovanni Enrico Bucher, the Swiss Ambassador who was kidnapped 40 days ago, was released early this morning.

title: Caroline Chapman Escher Wed In Jersey to Luis Alberto Simian
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., Jan. 16Miss Caroline Chapman Escher and Luis Alberto Simian were married here this afternoon in St. Paul's Episcopal Church by the Rev. David M. Gillespie. The bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. David Adolph Escher were married in the church as were the bride's grandparents, Mrs. Edward Simmons Brockie and the late Mr. Brockie.

title: Son to the Mitchells
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Malcolm Lewis Mitchell of Greenwich, Conn., on Dec. 30 in the Greenwich Hospital. Mrs. Mitchell is the former Miss Angelica Ritter, daugh ter of Mrs. Graefin Joan Saurma of Munich, Germany, and George Ritter of Santi ago, Chile. The child, who is named Daniel Laurence, is a grandson also of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Mitchell of New York. The baby's father and paternal grandfather are part ners in Samuel Mitchell & Co., investment firm.

title: Pistons Down Celtics, 121118
description: DETROIT, Jan. 16 (UPI)  Dave Bing scored 31 points and Detroit used free throws to its advantage tonight as the Pis tons won their fourth straight by defeating the Boston Celtics, 121118, in a National Basket ball Association game.

title: Fled the drought, drowned in the flood
description: New Orleans has its streetcar named Desire, but Recife, in Brazil's Northeast, has its bus named Pleas ures. Closer to the heart of this tale of poverty, however, is another sec tion of the city called Afogados, the drowned. Since Recife is built on the confluence of the rivers Capiberibe and Beberibe and is crossed by a network of estuaries and canals (the Dutch ruled here for a time), the city has quite naturally and quite banally been called the Venice of Brazil. Only recently, as the 20th cen tury oozes into Venice, has the com parison been apt. Along the water ways and on the mudflats of Recife live people caught up in the crab cycle, a seemingly perfect symbiosis comparable in logic only to the snake who disappears by swallowing him self from the tail up: man eats crab, man defecates in river, crab eats feces, man eats crab, and so on.

title: FORDHAM STREAK IS SNAPPED AT 12 BY TEMPLE, 6766
description: Fordham University's dreams of equaling the 17game win ning streak set by the Rams of 19281929 were rudely inter rupted yesterday afternoon by a tenacious Temple squad. The Rams crashed into the Owls' rugged zone defense and bowed in the final seconds of play, 6766, at the Rose Hill gym nasium.

title: To Wright, Fanon, Ellison add Killens and Cain
description: In 1968, the search for a Black Aesthetica critical criterion that distinguishes the writings of blacks from those of whites was initiated. At that time, the application of the concept was more apparent in poetry than in fiction or drama. Langston Hughes, Jean Toomer and Gwendolyn Brooks offered new and exciting ways of dealing with black life in terms of form, symbolism and imagery; and their young successors Imamu Amiri Baraka, Don L. Lee, James A. Emanuel and Nikki Gio vanniin experimenting with style, precipitated a revolution in black poetry.

title: RECORDS SHATTERED IN FOOTBALL LEAGUE
description: Don Alley of the Pennsylva nia Firebirds led the Atlantic Coast Football League in scor ing with 96 points, final statistics showed yesterday. Doug Watts of the Firebirds was No. 1 in rushing as the league's first 1,000yard man. He gained 1,062.

title: White House Gets Portraits
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Jan. 16 (UPI)The White House has acquired portraits of John Quincy Adams and his wife, Louisa, and will unveil them later this month. The portraits of the sixth President and his wife, both painted by Gilbert Stuart during their lifetimes, are gifts of a direct descendant, John Quincy Adams of Dover, Mass.

title: U.S.C. Downs Stanford
description: STANFORD, Calif., Jan. 16 (UPI)  Southern California's guard duo of Dennis Layton and Paul Westphal led the un beaten Trojans to a 7151 vic tory over Stanford tonight. It was the 14th triumph for U.S.C.

title: Florida Judge Calls Super Bowl Blackout Illegal but Lacks Power to Rule
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Jan. 16, (UPI)State Circuit Judge Arthur Franza ruled to day he had no jurisdiction to lift the Super Bowl television blackout, but said the blackout violated Federal antitrust law.

title: Switching Careers in Midstream
description: When Farris Swackhamer, then 48 years old and direc tor of research for Shell Chemical, suffered a mild heart attack, his doctor sug gested he find a less tension ridden job. He did  taking a salary cut from $30,000 to $8,500 a year  to teach chemistry at Union College in Cranford, N. J.

title: For Critics, a Valenti Day Massacre
description: IN its issue of Jan. 1, The Washington Post fea tured on the first page of its amusement sec tion a piece by Jack Valenti, the president of the Motion Picture Association of Amer ica, taking issue with Gary Arnold, the Post film critic, on his unfavorable review of Love Story and expressing concern about the terrible state of American film crit icism in general.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: INTEREST RATES declined again as major banks, led by First National City, reduced prime rates to 6 per cent; cut was fifth in three months.  Nixon Administra tion moved to spur investment in business and industrial equipment through changes in depreciation periods; shift could save business about $2.6billion of taxes in first year.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: If you want to buy cloth ing and apparel from the most complete selections at competitive prices, use your mailorder catalogue. So say the giant mailorder houses that have dressed up their spring catalogues with spe cial emphasis on soft goods.

title: Tennessee Governor Sworn
description: NASHVILLE, Jan. 16 (UPI) Winfield C. Dunn, a former Memphis dentist, was sworn in today as Tennessee's first Republican Governor in half a century. In his inaugural ad dress, the 43yearold Governor expressed confidence that his relationship with the Demo craticcontrolled Legislature would be one of partnership, not partisanship.

title: U.N. Unit Grants Aid to 96 Countries
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Jan. I6The United Nations Devel opment Program has approved $130.9million in aid to 96 de veloping countries for projects ranging from a study of the effect or improved seed varie ties on the world's food supply to a study of water supply and sewereage in Kabul, Afghani stan.

title: Stamps
description: IRELAND goes to decimal currency on Feb. 15, in keeping with the move by Britain, which also converts to decimal currency the same day. Ireland is independent of Britain, but its commerce continues large in the sterling area.

title: Diane Fischer To Be a Bride
description: HOLYOKE, Mass., Jan. 16 Mrs. Suzanne H. Fischer has announced the engage ment of her daughter, Miss Diane Fischer, to David Stet son Stevens 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Phillips Stevens of Easthampton. The senior Mr. Stevens is headmaster of Wil liston Academy there. Miss Fischer's father, Robert E. Fischer of Endwell, N. Y., is deputy attorney general in charge of the organized crime task force for the State of New York.

title: Girl Runner Is Barred at Schoolboy Meet
description: The Women's Liberation movement tried to invade the sanctum of New York City schoolboy track yesterday, but was rebuffed at the gate.

title: Floridians Win, 123119
description: MIAMI BEACH, Jan. 16 (AP) Mack Calvin scored a 17foot jump shot with six seconds to play in regulation time and then sank four free throws in overtime to give the Floridians a 123119 victory over the Utah Stars tonight.

title: Dance
description: IT is impossible not to have an enormous regard for the people who really build things in the per forming arts, Forty years ago there was virtually no in digenous classic dance in the United States, and yet now American classic ballet Is among the world's leaders in the field.

title: Religion
description: The fourth mark of American Catholicism in those halcyon days of contented clergy, flour ishing schools and crowded church parking lots on Sundays was, of course, the Saturday confession line.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16Within the next few days, President Nixon will deliver the 187th State of the Union address in person to the members of the House and Senate, and a few days later he will publish his budget. Then an odd and unfortunate thing will happen.

title: New Englanders Buck Trend Toward Bulldozer
description: EXETER, N. H., Jan. 16 Allen B. Wright, president of the Rockingham National Bank, played with the end of a cigar stub as he tried to frame a statement of his concept of what is good for the future of Exeter.

title: Massachusetts Road Funds
description: BOSTON, Jan. 16 (AP)The state's Department of Public Works announced yesterday the approval of allotments of $16.8 million in road repair funds for the 351 cities and towns in Massachusetts.

title: Patricia C. Reinhimer Is Married
description: TUNKHANNOCK, Pa., Jan. 16Miss Patricia Courtenay Rinehimer, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. John Stanley Rine himer Jr. of Tunkhannock, was married here at home this afternoon to James Ed ward Boudreau Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Boudreau of Darien, Conn.

title: Though the frontier waned, the West endured
description: The men of A. B. Guthrie's peerless Northwestern chroni cles came to explore and plun der the land (The Big Sky), to traverse and colonize it (The Way West), and to raise cattle on its unfenced pasturage (These Thousand Hills). In Arfive, the fourth and pre sumably last novel of the series, they come to civilize it.

title: Marilyn Horne Becomes A Prima Donna
description: SINGING  real singing, into space rather than into a micro phone  is something that comes from the gut. Because great singers are their own instruments, and draw from so deep within them selves the means of delighting their auditors, they command a devotion that political and military leaders may envy. Spiritual, as a voice teacher has pointed out, is a word that means breath. One can imag ine a brave new art world without much that occupies our own, but an art world without singers would be indeed inhuman.

title: Son to Frank Emblens
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Frank Emblen of City Island, the Bronx, on Dec. 17 in Doctors Hospital. Mrs. Emblen is the former Miss Mary Lou Singer of Wheel ing, W. Va. Mr. Emblen is a copy editor for The New York Times. The child, the couple's second, is named Jefferson York.

title: Walsh Urges Social Services in Public Housing
description: Albert A. Walsh, the city's Housing and Development Ad ministrator, warned yesterday that unless extensive social services were made part of pub lic housing the housing would decline to the level of the worst welfare hotels.

title: Toboggan Study to Be Made
description: VALDAORA, Italy, Jan. 16, ReutersFive members of the Denver 1976 Winter Olympic Committee will attend the world toboggan championships here at the end of this month. The organizers announced to day that the Americans would study the toboggan run in view of their plans to construct a run at Denver for the 1976 Olympics.

title: U. S. Reform Rabbis Name Glaser as Vice President
description: Rabbi Joseph B. Glaser, for mer official with the congrega tional arm of American Reform Judaism, has been named as the new executive vice presi dent of the Central Conference of American Rabbis, it was an nounced last night by Rabbi Roland B. Gittelsohn, president of the conference.

title: Penultimon was more popular than the Pill
description: Ends is set in the future; at least for the moment it is. It thus threatens to be science fiction, though technology ad vances at such a rate that by the time a writer completes a sciencefiction novel its hard ware may already be obsolete. James Hughes's gifts as well as his intentions clearly transcend the genre, reaching past distrac tions toward constant consider ations, with an admirable if slightly inhuman grasp of things.

title: Movie Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Panel Calls on Colleges to Give Adults Easier Access to Programs
description: College students should be allowed to interrupt their stu dies for long periods and adults, with or without degrees, should have much easier access to un dergraduate and advanced pro grams, a study group of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences said yesterday.

title: London Letters Falling Down
description: An outsider to the London literary scene has certain obvious disadvan tages in assessing it; on the other hand, the outsider though less fa miliar with the ins and outs  may have a better view of the game as a whole. It reminds one of Henry James's prerequisite for a writer: He needs to be half in life, and half out of it; sufficiently involved in life to know what it is about, but enough outside the aquarium to be able to see what is going on within.

title: WHALE WATCHERS ACTIVE ON COAST
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 16Capt. Melvin Shears edged his crowd ed excursion boat, the Islandia, closer to where a great gray whale rolled lazily on the sur face off San Diego's Point Loma. Suddenly the 45foot mammal tossed its splayed tail fluke into the air and disap peared beneath white foam.

title: The World
description: SAIGONOne lazy evening a few weeks ago, five bored American G.I.'s, most of them strangers to each other, were sitting around the lounge of an Army transients' quarters in Cantho, reading Playboy and motorcycle magazines. After a while, a new arrival, barechest ed and wearing love beads, wandered in from the bunk room, sat down and sloppily filled a pipe from a large, plastic Excedrin bottle. He lit the pipe, inhaled deeply of the fragrant marijuana and wordlessly passed the pipe to the man next to him.

title: Leslie Ann Shaw to Become Bride
description: WHITE PLAINS, Jan. 16 Mr. and Mrs. Eugene Shaw of White Plains, formerly of Atlanta, have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Leslie Ann Shaw, to William Lewis Camp 4th. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Camp 3d of Farming ton, Conn.

title: Art
description: THERE are artists who turn widely  practiced styles or techniques to such personal ends that the results are uniquely their own. This was the case with Arthur Dove, a firstgenera tion American modernist, whose paintings and col lages drew upon the tech nical discoveries of ad vanced European art in his time, but whose native and idyllic themes shaped his work in the American grain. A sympathetic critic  Paul Rosenfeld  once described Dove's painting as a sort of Leaves of Grass through pigment.

title: Deep Diving System Developed
description: SAN DIEGO, Jan. 16After nearly eight years of effort plagued by technical problems and mishaps, the Navy has de veloped and accepted a new deep submergence system that enables divers to carry out protracted rescue and salvage operations at ocean depths of 850 to 1,000 feet.

title: Music
description: WTHEN I started my first tours 20 years ago, the audiences were made up almost entirely of old people. Today, at least half of them are young. That was Dietrich FischerDieskau's immediate reaction to my suggestion that song recitals were part of a vanishing age, and he himself, by implication, the last of a breed of tail coated dodos.

title: Profiting From Waste
description: Some 30 companies in the Port of Philadelphia area have found a way of taking care of their often hazardous or toxic pollutants.

title: State Tennis Next Weekend
description: The New York State men's indoor championships will be held at the Port Washington Tennis Academy, 100 Harbor Road, Port Washington, L.I., next Saturday and Sunday.

title: Schlossberg Rites Today
description: A funeral service for Joseph Schlossberg, secretarytreasurer emeritus of the Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America, will be held today at 9 A.M. at the Riverside, Amsterdam Ave nue and 76th Street. The day was incorrectly given in yester day's New York Times. The name of a sister, Anna, was inadvertently omitted from the survivors.

title: Ohia State 8369 Victor
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Jan. 16 (UPI) Ohio State halted a secondhalf Wisconsin rally to night and posted an 8369 Big Ten victory behind the scoring of Luke Witte, Allan Hornyak and Jim Cleamons.

title: Drive for Unleaded Gas Is Causing Wide Confusion
description: DETROIT, Jan. 16Another miracle ingredient is being added to gasoline. It's P. C., short for Pollution Confusion.

title: SHAW TAKES LEAD BY SHOT AT 208, WITH PALMER 2D
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif., Jan. 16Tom Shaw held the 54hole lead in the Bing Crosby pro amateur golf tourney today by one stroke. With a third round of 69 over the Pebble Beach course that borders the Pacific Ocean, and a total of 208, the 28yearold Oregonian held a slim edge over Arnold Palmer.

title: Art
description: THE Baltimore Museum of Art opened last week an exhibition, Matisse as a Draughtsman, whichto get the essential information out of the way quicklyis splendid. The earliest of the 83 drawings go back to 1900, when Ma tisse, a late bloomer still in bud at the age of 31, was how shall we call it, academy oriented? The latest are cut outs of 1952. (Matisse died in 1954.)

title: Article 7  No Title
description: MIAMI, Jan. 16  John Unitas is 37 years old and owns all the career passing records possible in pro foot ball after 15 seasons.

title: MANPOWER PLANS OFFERED FOR CITY
description: A Federal labor expert, has called for an improvement here in the match between labor supply and demand by remov ing unnecessary educational re quirements for jobs, expanding training programs and enhanc ing job prestige.

title: A history of the cold war by a shackled historian
description: Herbert Feis was once an epitome of the midcentury for eignpolicy establishmentthat group of men with roots vari ously in government, the major law firms and the great univer sities who shared similar ?? of a world (beneficently organized by the United States. After half a career as an aca demic economist (Harvard A.B. 1916, Ph.D. 1921) and a short stint as a staff member with the Council on Foreign Rela tions, he joined the State De partment in 1931 as economic adviser and remained for 15 years. In 1946 he began his third career as a historian of American interwar and wartime diplomacy. His precise, tightly organized volumes appeared every two years on the aver age. They were informed by his personal participation in the events described and by the ex traordinary access he enjoyed to the Department of State's archives.

title: Adelaide Frick, Jotham Trafton Marry in Jersey
description: ALPINE, N. J., Jan. 16 Miss Adelaide H. C. Frick, a junior at Colorado College, was married here today to Jotham Allen Trafton, a December graduate of the college. The Rev. Peter Moore performed the Episcopal ceremony at the home of Dr. and Mrs. Henry Clay Frick 2d, parents of the bride. Only members of the immediate families attended.

title: An MacGraw Has Son
description: Ali MacGraw, star of the movie Love Story, gave birth to a son yesterday in Doctors Hospital. The baby was named Joshua. The actress is married to Robert Evans, a Paramount executive vice president.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Mrs. Baker Honored
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 16 (AP) Mrs. Mary Baker, sharprolling southpaw from Central Islip, L. I., was chosen woman bowler of 1970 today by the Bowling Writers Association of Amer ica.

title: POLICE TRADE DATA ON DEATH THREATS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 (AP) Law enforcement agencies are trading information on per sons who threaten to kill po licemen, according to a spokes man for 15 top officials who met with Attorney General John N. Mitchell.

title: WEST VIRGINIANS IN LAND DISPUTE
description: DAVIS, W. Va., Jan. 16Ten years ago, a dead rattlesnake caused a minor commotion near this oncethriving timber town. It was traced to a truck of logsan apparent hitchhiker much to the relief of Canaan Valley residents who had al ways lived without fear of poi son ivy or poison snakes.

title: Meeting on Construction
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16The White House said today that President Nixon would enter a meeting with the Construction Industry Collective Bargaining Commission on Monday with out preconceived ideas of what should be done to curb spiraling wages in the industry.

title: New York
description: Perhaps the problem is that few of the city's more than 2,500 correction officers wanted to be prison guards in the first place.

title: Stamps
description: ISRAEL did not withdraw late in November a stamp with the word God in Hebrew letters, as re ported here at the time. The actual withdrawal was as of Dec. 31, although protests against the stamp were re corded soon after its appear ance in September as one of a group of five stamps.

title: R.P.I. Downs Bishops, 53
description: TROY, N. Y., Jan. 16 (AP) Rensselaer Polytech overcame a strong firstperiod perform ance by Bishops of Quebec to record a 53 victory tonight. The Engineers broke their school's record for shots on goal with a total of 139. Bishops had 33.

title: Johnson, in Good Condition, Goes Home From Hospital
description: SAN ANTONIS, Tex., Jan. 16 (UPI)Former President Lyn don B. Johnson, who has been suffering from viral pneumonia, returned home to the LBJ ranch today in what his doctors termed good condition.

title: Arabs' delight
description: Couscous may not be as re fined as one of the great class ics of the French cuisine, but it is one of the ultimate treats of the world  for those who dote on it, at least Couscous, a sem olinalike cereal, is the base for the dish, also called couscous, which consists of a bowl of the cereal accompanied by a stew of lamb or chicken. Here is a recipe picked up recently in Morocco, where couscous is, more or less, the national dish.

title: Miss Alice Boatwright Is Fiancee
description: FAYETTEVILLE, N. Y., Jan, 16The engagement of Miss Alice Karth Boatwright to Peter Thompson Bennett, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles W. Bennett, has been an nounced by the future bride's parents, Dean and Mrs. How ard Leake Boatwright Jr. Both families reside here.

title: Norwich Triumphs, 52
description: NORTHFIELD, Vt., Jan. 16 (AP)Jim Tait scored two goals tonight to lead Norwich to a 52 victory over American In ternational College.

title: LAVER EXTENDS SKEIN BY BEATING EMERSON
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 16  Rod Laver reached the $40,000 mark for a fortnight of action when he defeated Roy Emerson, 62, 63, 75, tonight in the fourth match of the $210,000 Tennis Champions Classic at The Spectrum.

title: What It Means To Be a Homosexual
description: EDWARD MORGAN FORSTER was a very good writer and a very gutsy man. In the es say What I Believe, he said: I hate the idea of causes, and if I had to choose between betraying my country and betraying my friend, I hope I would have the guts to betray my country. Such a choice may scan dalize the modern reader, and he may stretch out his patriotic hand to the telephone at once and ring up the police. It would not have shocked Dante, though. Dante places Brutus and Cassius in the lowest circle of Hell because they had chosen to be tray their friend Julius Caesar rather than their country Rome.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  For many months now, the White House has been playing a game of ideological calculus, attempting to balance a conservative ap pointment with a liberal one, a conciliatory speech with a belli cose one, a groundbreaking pol icy proposal with a retreat or retrenchment.

title: U.S. AIDES CITED PRICES' PRESSURE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16  High Government officials told leaders of the United States Steel Corporation at a meeting here early today that a mas sive increase in steel prices would intensify pressures for mandatory wage and price con trols.

title: Swiss Pay Tribute
description: GENEVA, Jan. 16The Swiss Government paid tribute today to the successful efforts of the Brazilian Government to obtain the release of Ambassador Bucher.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Sammartino to Face Koloff On Garden Mat Tomorrow
description: Bruno Sammartino will op pose Ivan Koloff of the Soviet Union in a wrestling exhibition tomorrow night at Madison Square Garden. Pedro Morales will wrestle the Canadian Wolf man. Both matches will be to the finish.

title: Church Council Supports Antiracism Grants
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Jan. 16Leaders of the World Council of Churches over whelmingly endorsed today the controversial action of its ex ecutive committee granting $200,000 to 19 organizations representing victims of racial injustice.

title: U.S.AID PROGRAM IN CITY IS PRAISED
description: The head of a special Federal team evaluating the problems of New York's Model Cities pro gram met with Mayor Lindsay at City Hall yesterday, then said New York's progress, compared with other cities, has been ex cellent.

title: News of the Rialto
description: HOW can a baby be born without its mother? whim pered Shelley Win ters. She was in Hollywood making a bloodbath movie with Debbie Reynolds, and her baby  One Night Stands of a Noisy Passenger would have to come into the cold, cold world of Off Broadway that night without Mama because the producers of Mama's movie wouldn't let Mama take time off to fly to New York.

title: 13,424 See Russell's Rullah Capture Dash in 8 Degrees
description: LINCOLN, R. I., Jan. 16 (AP) Favored Russell's Rullah ral lied in the stretch today and won the $7,500 Pawtucket Han dicap at Lincoln Downs.

title: MYSTERY ILLNESS STIFFENS VICTIMS
description: Their muscles become pain fully stiff, like boards, from a rare disease for which doctors have found a treatment but not a clue to its cause.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONPresident Nix on, having long foresworn jaw boning as a means of influenc ing private price and wage deci sions, moved closer than ever last week to a direct confronta tion with a major American in dustry.

title: News of the Rialto
description: LO, the poor Englishman dropping out of the skies these days at Ken nedy and then taxiing into Man hattan. If for just a fleeting moment he thinks there must be some mistake, that he's still in London, no wonder. On marquee after marquee there are reminders of home: Conduct Unbecoming, Sleuth, Home and this week the Royal Shakespeare Com pany's A Midsummer Night's Dream. Come March, come more: the already announced Abelard and Heloise, How the Other Half Loves and this morn ing's addendum, Christopher Hampton's The Philanthropist, with a cast headed by Alec McCowen.

title: ST. FRANCIS BOWS TO KING'S, 81 TO 80
description: Paul Victores scored 24 points to lead King's College of WilkesBarre, Pa., to a 8180 victory over St. Francis last night at the 69th Regiment Armory.

title: Coins
description: AN attractive series of limited edition first day covers, combining new issues of United Nations stamps with special commemorative medals, will be sponsored by the United Nations Association of the United States of America, it was announced by Porter McKeever, U.N.A.  U.S.A. president, last week.

title: Longden's Wife Keeps Horse Training in the Family
description: LOS ANGELES, (AP)Mrs. Hazel Longden's day begins every morning at 5:30 but not in the kitchen. She goes to the barn and trains her family's stable of five race horses at Santa Anita for five hours.

title: DR. SANFORD SARNEY
description: Dr. Sanford Sarney, an in ternist, died Friday in Kings County Hospital. He was 57 years old and lived at 48 Nas sau Drive, Great Neck, L. I. His office was at 1 Grand Army Plaza, Brooklyn.

title: E. W. Nordberg to Wed Miss Olivia Schieffelin
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., Jan. 16Mr. and Mrs. Bayard Schieffelin of Short Hills and Ashville, Me., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Olivia Lang don Schieffelin, to E. Wayne Nordberg of New York and Carversville, Pa. An April wedding is planned.

title: E. EDSON POLER, DIES, L.I. REAL ESTATE MAN
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., Jan. 16 E. Edson Poler, a former ad vertising, executive who was with the North Shore Realty Company, died last night in Huntington Hospital, after hav ing suffered a stroke. He would have been 63 years old next Saturday. His home was at 38 Russet Lane.

title: Fans Wait All Night to Buy Last Block of Bruin Tickets
description: BOSTON, Jan. 16 (AP)The 28,000 tickets for the 18 re maining Boston Bruins' Nation al Hockey League home games were sold today to fans who began lining up early yesterday morning.

title: Sudden Death Will Settle Tie
description: MIAMI, Jan. 16 (AP) The Super Bowl between the Baltimore Colts and Dallas Cowboys will be played to a suddendeath finish if the teams are tied at the end of regluation time.

title: The Mailbox:
description: To the Editor:

title: Knicks Lose 4th in Row, 10293
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Jan. 16 The unexpected slump that has afflicted the Knicks for the last week continued tonight as they suffered their fourth straight defeat, losing to the San Fran cisco Warriors, 10293, at the Coliseum Arena.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Music
description: Two operas, both out of the 18th century, will get around to their New York premieres this week. Above, Camilla Williams (top), Justino Diaz and Rosalind Elias, in the title role originally composed for a castrato tenor, will be heard in Handel's 1735 opera, Orlando, to be given in concert form to morrow night at Carnegie Hall by the Handel Society of New York. Stephen Simon conducts.

title: CENTROWITZ WINS MILE RUN IN 4:24
description: Power Memorial, which has had several track stars in the last decade, has another one on the horizon and, according, to his coach, he may be the best of all.

title: U.S. FORCES REDUCED BY 5,800 IN THAILAND
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Jan. 16 (AP)The withdrawal of 5,800 Americans from Thailand was announced by the United States Embassy today. The with drawals took place in the last four months of 1970.

title: London Paper Raises Price
description: LONDON, Jan. 16 (UPI)  The Daily Telegraph will in crease its price from 6 to 7 cents Monday.

title: ABRAHAM HYMAN
description: Abraham Hyman, former president of the New York So ciety for the Deaf and the Hebrew Home for the Deaf in Brooklyn, died yesterday in Montefiore Hospital, the Bronx. He was 83 years old and lived in the Bronx.

title: January Thaw
description: What we cal the January Thaw is totally unpredict able. On average, we get one three years out of every four. Usually it comes around the third week in January, but there are times when it doesn't come till February. There are years when it doesn't come at all, when the snowdrifts and the ice simply persist right through till the breakup in late March or early April. Then we have one of those memorable winters that are hard to en dure at the time but are fascinating to remember.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Despite its natural setting for explosive incident and extrav agant emotion, grand opera is seldom the scene of fictional murderonly Helen Traubel's The Metropolitan Opera Mur ders (1951) and several entries by Queena Mario come to mind. A new entry has now climbed onstage, MURDER AT THE MET (CowardMcCann, $5.95) by Fred G. Jarvis. The follies and foibles of the milieu are brought to life remarkably well. Un fortunately, though the death of a diva surrounded by a cast of shattered psyches who fer vently wish her dead is a reasonable puzzle, detective Todd Clark and his superior come off the costumeshop racks. And, inasmuch as Mr. Jarvis is inclined to slip in references to great fictional detectives, he would do well to brush up on his homework. (Chesterton's Old Man in the Corner indeed!)

title: PEACE UNIT SEEKS PENTAGON CURBS
description: A major new peace initiative, aimed at the entire military industrial complex, was for mulated yesterday by the national board of the nation's oldest continuously operating coldwar peace group.

title: Theater: Musical Ari
description: No novel that has sold 20 million copies can be said to be devoid of popular inter est, and although I have never read Leon Uris's novel Exodus, or even seen the film made from it, it was clearly within its own terms of reference highly success ful.

title: TigersOrioles Draw Well
description: The Detroit Tigers and Bal timore Orioles played before 53,959 in Tiger Stadium last July 12. It was the largest crowd in Detroit in nine years, including the World Series.

title: Television
description: SO often when blacks are given an opportunity by whites to do their own thing, they have to do it with one arm tied behind their backs. An example of this is the series called Soul!, Channel 13's hourlong weekly program, Thursdays at 10, featuring black talent. It is conceived by blacks for black viewers but receives a major part of its fundingwhich is insufficient from the Ford Foundation.

title: Schussing Down Memory Lane: Skiing in the Good Old Days
description: CLIMB up on my knee, sonny boy you, too, sunny girl. Careful of that leg, fractured it on Mount Mansfield 10 years ago. Fell out of the chairlift. Consarned newfangled contraptions!

title: Cornfeld Sells All Of His I.O.S. Stock
description: GENEVA, Jan. 16Bernard Cornfeld has sold his inter est in the Investors Overseas Services and resigned his re maining functions in the big mutual fund complex that he founded.

title: Jane S. Grenley And E. C. Hanes To Be Married
description: TACOMA, Wash., Jan. 16 Miss Jane Scott Grenley and Eldridge Copenhaver Hanes plan to be married here March 6 in the chapel of the Annie Wright Semi nary, of which the bridetobe is an alumna.

title: Squires Down Rockets
description: NORFOLK, Va., Jan. 16 (AP)  The Virginia Squires used a 26point effort by George Carter and an unexpected offensive burst from Roland Taylor to post a 141131 victory over the Denver Rockets tonight.

title: Suns Defeat Bullets
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Jan. 16 (AP) The Phoenix Suns took ad vantage of a disastrous third quarter by the Baltimore Bul lets to rally for a 117100 vic tory tonight.

title: St. Mary's 8883 Victor
description: MORAGA, Calif., Jan. 16 (UPI)St. Mary's rallied behind the shooting of Sam Hill today to post an 8883 victory over NevadaLas Vegas in a West Coast Athletic Conference game. St. Mary's trailed by as many as 15 points in the first half and was down, 4943, at the intermission.

title: the traveler's world
description: DAR ES SALAAM, TanzaniaOur Sunday afternoon flight from Mombasa, Kenya, was a few minutes late because of a sud den torrent of rain at the airport here just before we arrived. It was the only rain we saw or felt in two weeks in Africa, and apparently not a drop feil outside the airport boundaries.

title: Hope for Payments?
description: The sharp deterioration in the United States balance of payments, as measured on the officialsettlements basis from a $2.7billion surplus in 1969 to an estimated $10 billion deficit (excluding the allocation of special drawing rights, or paper gold) in 1970 has created much concern.

title: Kunstier Suit Challenges Policy Limiting Questioning of Jurors
description: William M. Kunstier, repre senting six black men accused of conspiring to murder city po licemen, has filed suit charging that a policy allowing judges alone to question potential jurors is unconstitutional and will deprive his clients and all black men of a fair trial.

title: Bacallao and Holmes Gain In Squash Tennis Doubles
description: Dr. Pedro Bacallao, the na tional singles champion, and Joe Holmes advanced to the semifinal round of the National squash tennis doubles cham pionship yesterday at the City Athletic Club. They eliminated John Halpern, the New York State squash racquets cham pion, and Dr. Arthur Sicular, 155, 1510, 1512.

title: SCHENK SETS MARK IN SPEED SKATING
description: DAVOS, Switzerland, Jan. 16 (AP)Skaters from the Nether lands continued their forld rec ordbreaking performances to day by setting two marks and equaling another in the Swiss in ternational speedskating meet.

title: Hanoi Says Industrial Output In 1970 Rose 5% Over 1969
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Jan. 16 (Agence FrancePresse) Industrial production in North Vietnam rose by 5 per cent in 1970 compared with 1969, according to statistics published here this week.

title: Holyoke Guilty of Dumping
description: HOLYOKE, Mass., Jan. 16 (AP)This city was convicted yesterday of dumping raw sew age into the Connecticut River. Judge George Beauregard in Holyoke District Court returned the guilty ruling and said the city would be subject to $5,000 fine if the violation oc curred again.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: EXECUTIVES URGE CHANGE IN COURTS
description: After a sixmonth study of the city's Criminal Court, a task force or prominent busi nessmen has recommended ways of applying good basic management concepts to the judicial process.

title: Dole Declares That Republicans Made Errors in 1970 Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16  Senator Robert J. Dole of Kan sas acknowledged today that the Republican party made mis takes in the 1970 campaign. Republican National Committee performing a coordinating func tion,

title: New Mexico Wins, 6553
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M., Jan. 16 (AP)New Mexico befuddled TexasEI Paso with a tight de fense as the Lobos downed the Miners, 6553, today in a West ern Athletic Conference game.

title: TWO IMMIGRANTS AID THE NEEDIEST
description: Among the latest donors to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund were two young immigrants from England and France to whom America has been very gen erous.

title: New YorktoMiami Train Is Proving to Be Popular
description: ABOARD THE FLORIDA SPECIALBetween Philadel phia and Washington, Rock Hudson pursued Doris Day in a 1959 movie, Pillow Talk.

title: Movies
description: PRODUCER  DIRECTOR Joshua Logan, who's been out of the spot light since 1969 and Paint Your Wagon, reports that Sumner Locke Elliott's first novel, Careful, He Might Hear You, a property he has nurtured ever since its publication in 1963, is now ready for shooting. Elizabeth Taylor has agreed to do it providing she can do it in Spain in May when Richard Burton will be mak ing Don Quixote there. Naturally, we'll do it there since it does call for outdoor scenes that can be shot in Spain.

title: Havana and Ottawa Plan Compensation Negotiations
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 16 (Canadian Press)  The Canadian and Cuban governments will begin negotiations soon to agree on a lumpsum payment of claims of Canadian citizens for pro perty, rights and interests na tionalized or taken over by the Cuban government, Foreign Affair Minister Mitchell Sharp. has announced.

title: URUGUAY SAID TO ASK FOR NOTE TO TIMES
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 16 (UPI)The newspaper Ac cion said today that Uruguayan authorities had asked the Inter national Police Organization, Interpol, to obtain a letter pur portedly sent by Tupamaro urban guerrillas to the New York Times.

title: ILLINOIS DEFEATS MICH. STATE, 6967
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., Jan. 16 (UPI)Illinois reeled off 10 straight points midway in the second half today and then withstood a furious Michigan State rally to gain a 6967 vic tory and remain undefeated in the Big Ten.

title: Coast Scientists Find Huge Dinosaur's Bones
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 16 (AP)  Researchers say they have found the bones of a 100footlong dinosaur, by far the largest example of its species ever unearthed and among the largest dino saurs ever discovered.

title: 2d Girl Real Daughter, African President Says
description: BANGUI, Central African Republic, Jan. 16 (AP)The street vender brought to Ban gui in November as the Pres ident's daughter is going back to Saigon because President Jean Bedel Bokassa says an other Vietnamese girl who ar rived this week is his real daughter.

title: U.C.L.A. TOPPLES CALIFORNIA, 9476
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Jan. 16 (UPI)Sidney Wicks tallied 33 points, got 17 rebounds and as sisted on five baskets to lead topranked University of Cali fornia, Los Angeles, to a 9476 victory over California today. It was the unbeaten Bruins' 13th straight this season.

title: Goal Posts Too Slick for Coast Fans
description: MIAMI, Jan. 16 (AP)For the first time in 69 years, fans of the victorious Rose Bowl team didn't tear down the goal posts in Pasadena.

title: QUICK LONGO PENSION STIRS IT ALIAN ANGER
description: ROME, Jan. 16 (AP)  Two million Italians have been wait ing years for their pensions, but Luigi Longo, Italy's Communist leader, got his in less than six weeks. The Minister of Labor is investigating.

title: Seal Goalie Seeks Chance to Score Goals
description: Gary Smith, the California Golden Seals' freewheeling goalie who on Friday night al most became the first net minder to score in National Hockey League play, asked yesterday for the end of the rule that prohibits goalies from skating the length of the ice.

title: MRS. COURT DOWNS FRENCH FOE, 64, 75
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 16 (AP)Mrs. Margaret Court of Australia defeated Mrs. Gail Chanfreau of France, 64, 75, in the semifinals of the New South Wales tennis champion ships today.

title: Stamps
description: ANCIENT myths will be represented on three Laos stamps in designs by Ky Phungchaleun based on frescoes inside the dome of the Arch of Triumph in Vientiane. The frescoes were the work of Chanmane Prisayan, a winner of the Grand Prix de Rome.

title: Text of Statement Issued by Governor Rockefeller
description: Following is the text of the statement released by Gov ernor Rockefeller yesterday:

title: FilterTip Marijuana Cigarettes Reported on Sale in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 16 (AP) Smoking Park Lane Ciga rettes May Be Hazardous to Your Health But You'll Never Care, says the warning on the pack of a new brand of ciga rettes being sold here.

title: Penn U. Is Issuing Guidelines to Insure Equality for Women
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 16 Martin Meyerson, president of the University of Pennsylvania, announced yesterday several new guidelines and programs designed to provide equal op portunity to women in the uni versity.

title: Education
description: The search had scoured the continent, but it wound up right back in Harvard Yard with Mon day's announcement that Derek Curtis Bok, the 40yearold dean of the Law School, would be the 25th president of Harvard, the oldest university in the country. Mr. Bolt's appointment to re place retiring Nathan M. Pusey on July 1 told much about the mood on the nation's campuses and about the current role of university presidents.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 16 (AP)  The withdrawal of additional United States units totaling 540 men was an nounced here today.

title: The Ballad Of Red Rock
description: If and when peace comes to the Middle East, the Jor danians can look forward to a flood of visits from a hereto fore untapped tourist sourceIsrael. Mention Petra and most Israelis who are over 30 react as if they are getting news of an old friend.

title: SPAAK ASKS SWISS TO END NEUTRALITY
description: GENEVA, Jan. 16  Paul Henri Spaak, former Premier of Belgium, has urged Switzerland to abandon its centuriesold policy of neutrality and join the European Economic Com munity.

title: Music
description: THE moody, poetic tragedies of the Spanish playwright Federico Gar cia Lorca would seem to be natu ral material for opera librettos. His Blood Wedding has, in fact, been turned into operas by four composers: Hale Smith, an American; Wolfgang Fortner, a German (Die Bluthochzeit); Kresimir Fribec, a Yugoslav (Krvava svadba, and Sandor Szokolay, a Hun garian (Vernasz).

title: BUSINESS LETTER
description: Stock market observers who have been wondering when the recent era of good feeling on the New York Stock Exchange would spread to more speculative arenas, such as the American Stock Exchange, may have to won der a while longer.

title: Bridge
description: ONE of the lesserknown require ments for success at the bridge table is a builtin mental metronome. If you are alive to the fact that an opponent took one second rather than five to make a key lead or play, your chances of judging the situation in that suit are improved.

title: Article 8  No Title
description: MIAMI, Jan. 16Tom Landry was a smalltown Texas boy who went to New York and made good as a football player 21 years ago. He was a player and assist ant coach for the Giants for a decade, then he went back to Texas and took command of the Dallas Cowboys, a brand new team, in 1960.

title: Recordings
description: THE urge to simplify Bach is understand able, as is the desire to simplify the world, and deeply rooted in history. Carl Zelter, the old curmudg eon whose discovery of a score of the St. Matthew Pas sion led to the work's famous revival in 1829 under Men delssohn's direction, had to be restrained from editing the chorales, tightening up the recitatives otherwise simplifying the music. To Zelter and to many a modern Zelter, the ornateness of Bach's scores could only be explained as the aberration of a great mind. Zelter blamed the French influence and especially Couperin for cluttering up the solid Ger man ideas of Bach with tin sel.

title: Chamber Concert at Juilliard Offers Premieres of 2 Works
description: There were two premieres in the Juilliard School's con cert of chamber music at Alice Tully Hall on Friday night. One was a Wind Quintet by Emil Petrovics, a 40yearold Hun garian composer and the other was a Concertino for Clarinet and Chamber Ochestra by Luciano Berio, the wellknown Italian avantgarde composer who teaches at Juilliard. Both works turned out to be examples of conservative modernism. They are not masterpieces, yet they were worth doing and could be use ful items for the chamber ensemble repertory.

title: Gen. Assad, Syria's New Premier, Is Acclaimed by Festive Throngs as He Tours Cities in the North
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 16 There was dancing in the streets of Latakia, Syria's main port on the Mediterranean. Ships that were docked in the harbor, including units of the Soviet fleet, sounded their sirens. Women on balconies and rooftops ululated in the Arab expression of joy.

title: The World
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y.Is rael, perhaps temporarily, seized the initiative in the indirect peace talks with the Arabs last week when it submitted to Dr. Gun nar V. Jarring, the United Na tions intermediary, a written out line of suggestions it wanted to put to Jordan and Egypt as a first step in the negotiation.

title: Many on Campus Shifting to Softer Drugs and Alcohol
description: A 22yearold University of Wisconsin student who has snorted cocaine, been strung out on amphetamine, taken something like 60 trips on LSD, and run through the whole range of synthetic drugs, has found a new way to get high.

title: On Lower East Side, Opinions on Police Strike Parallel the Generation Gap
description: It was 7 o'clock as a bitter cold wind whipped down Second Avenue, hustling the theatergoers from their taxis into the Eden Theater in the East Village last night.

title: Science/Medicine
description: You've come a long way, babytoward a shorter life. That's the comment of many health experts on the millions of American women who have suc cumbed to the enticements of cigarette advertising.

title: Stamps
description: LAST Aug. 12 telephone operators at the sprawling building on Pennsylvania Avenue, Washington, answered in coming calls by saying Post Office Department. The very next day the young women had changed their greeting to Postal Service. This us ually efficient service and some new insignia have been the only indications that a change had taken place  a rather large change: The Post Office Department es tablished by Benjamin Frank lin was being transformed from a strict Federal opera tion into a governmentoper ated corporation that, it was hoped, would not have to turn to Congress with its hands out.

title: Nader's Consumer Message Draws Crowds in Japan
description: TOKYO, Jan. 16For Mrs. Akiko Tamba of Kobe, the most memorable moment in Ralph Nader's talk at a small Protestant church here the other night came when the intense, darkhaired young advocate of consumers rights explained what he meant by whistle blowing.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Marquette Triumphs, 6553, For 25th Consecutive Victory
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 16Mar quette, looking more sluggish than a nationally ranked team should, took advantage of poor shooting by New Mexico State today to win, 6553.

title: U.S.L.T.A. Warns New Women Pros
description: Women's Lib may be fine along Fifth Avenue, but Wom en's Lob, as the new profes sional tennis tour has become known, will not dictate policy to the United States Lawn Tennis Association, an of ficial said yesterday.

title: NIXON PROPOSES U.S. LAW REFORM
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16  President Nixon directed At torney General John N. Mitch ell today to prepare a com prehensive reform of Federal criminal laws for submission to Congress.

title: Siena Names TriCaptains
description: Joe Grasso of Albany, a half back, Bob Burns of Watervliet, N.Y., a guard, and Bud Guido of Mohawk, N.Y., a fullback all juniors, were elected tricap tains of Siena College's club football team for next fall.

title: R.P.I. Tops M.I.T., 7760, As Neufer Gets 25 Points
description: TROY, Jan. 16 (AP)Rensse laer Polytechnic Institute de feated the Massachusetts In stitute of Technology basket ball team, 7760, today for its sixth victory in 13 games.

title: Article 13  No Title
description: HANOVER, N. H., Jan. 16 Brown broke a 11 tie with two goals in the second period and went on to a 32 Ivy League hockey victory over Dartmouth tonight at Davis Rink. Dave McCay scored the deciding goal for the Bruins after Irwin Gold stein had put Brown ahead early in the second period.

title: Kissinger Quits Harvard Staff To Remain an Adviser to Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16  Henry A. Kissinger, the national security adviser to President Nixon, said today that he would remain at the White House as long as I feel I am being use ful, but did not expect that to be longer than two more years.

title: Warriors Get Turner
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 16 (AP)The San Francisco War riors today signed Bill Turner, 6foot7inch forward, as a free agent.

title: Transit Patrolman Kills Holdup Man in the Bronx
description: A transit patrolman last night shot a man dead who had robbed the change clerk at gun point in the IRT's East Tremont Avenue station in the Bronx, the police said.

title: Jeffrey Sayre Bruner To Wed Zoe E. Durrell
description: Miss Zo Elizabeth Durrell and Jeffrey Sayre Bruner plan to be married in St. Bartholomew's Episcopal Church here on April 3. The ceremony will be performed by the Rev. Dr. Laman Har mon Bruner, father of the future bridegroom, and for merly at St. Bartholomew's.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: In an era when economics is increasingly being sold like soap, it is becoming more and more difficult to discriminate among the claims being made for and against different brands of business forecasts. Particu larly strident right now is the claim that the strongest seller of the preceding three yearsmonetarism  some how had a bad year in 1970 and is therefore in the proc ess of being discredited.

title: Army Beats Dartmouth, 6957, as Clevenger Gets CareerHigh 37 Points
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Jan. 16  Doug Clevenger, Army's basketball captain, had the best scoring effort of his varsity career with 37 points and also contributed an outstanding de fensive effort as the cadets de feated Dartmouth, 6957, at the Army field house tonight.

title: How to Keep Mustangs From Going to the Dogs
description: Mrs. Edward E. Murray, the former Daphne Peabody, has never been swept up in the North Shore society charity whirl on Long Island. She makes her donations, of course, but as a widow with five children to raise, she hasn't had much time for the committee thing.

title: St. Lawrence Tops McGill
description: CANTON, N. Y., Jan. 16 (AP) St. Lawrence scored three goals in the first period tonight and controlled play throughout to win, 72, from McGill of Montreal. Brian Hind paced the Larries with three goals.

title: The Nation
description: ATLANTARight from the be ginning the inauguration of Jimmy Carter as Governor of Georgia last week had a remark able quality about it that por tended change. The United States Navy Band (Mr. Carter at tended Annapolis) played Dixie and an allblack choir from Morris Brown College in Atlanta sang a soaring Battle Hymn of the Republic.

title: Dorothy Ferguson To Be June Bride
description: AVON, Conn., Jan. 16 Miss Dorothy Merrill Fergu son, who expects to receive a master's degree in educa tion from Boston University in June, plans to be married here June 12 to Adrian Bas tianelli Corbire Jr., a mathe matics teacher at Suffield Academy, where he also is an athletic coach.

title: Vacuum Crime Denied
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Jan. 16 (UPI)John Henry Cannon, a janitor, has pleaded not guilty to charges that he stole quar ters from the bank where he worked. He was accused this week of cleaning quarters from the bank vault with his vacuum cleaner.

title: The Mailbox:
description: To the Editor:

title: Photography
description: THE American Society of Magazine Photogra phers will present the second in their Photographer Exploration Series tomorrow at 7 P.M. in the Carnegie Endowment Building, 345 East 46th Street. Ben Rose will be interviewed by Daniel Kramer and will discuss the new photogra phy with particular empha sis on Rose's technique for motionized images in still photography  a process in which he uses the sweep cam era combined with repetitive flash to create multiple views of one subject. There will be $2 admission fee.

title: The Mailbox:
description: To the Editor:

title: The Nation
description: It was early Saturday morn ing and a patrolman was where he was supposed to be, on the corner of Seventh Avenue and 42d Street. Why? I'm out here, he answered, because I want the cop who covers my district to protect my family.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISA United StatesSouth Viet namese invasion of Cambodia was under consideration in 196768 but was postponed as a result of Chester Bowles's diplomatic mission to Pnom penh in January 1968. The account of this operation is told by the former U.S. Ambassador to India in his forth coming book, Promises to Keep, to be published by Harper & Row.

title: Miss Marjorie Dotts Planning Bridal to Nicholas P. Greville
description: RICHMOND, Jan. 16Mr. and Mrs. Walter Maxwell Dotts Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Marjorie Dotts of New York to Nicholas Peter Gre ville, son of Mr. and Mrs. Pe ter Eugene Greville of Black rock, County Dublin, Ireland.

title: Rum Triumphs by Six Lengths in Role of 35 Favorite in Dash at Pimlico
description: BALTIMORE, Jan. 16Alfred G. Vanderbilt's Rum, the 35 favorite, took the lead today after a quartermile and romped to a sixlength victory in the $29,450 Challedon Stakes at Pimlico Race Course.

description: To the Editor:

title: Moorer Confers With Sato
description: TOKYO, Jan. 16 (Reuters) Adm. Thomas H. Moorer, Chair man of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, conferred today with the Japanese Premier, Eisaku Sato, about the effect of United States troop withdrawals from Japan. Informed sources said they discussed closer coopera tion following the withdrawals.

title: MOSCOW'S EMBASSY IN CANBERRA BOMBED
description: CANBERRA, Australia, Jan. 16 (UPI)A bomb damaged the Soviet Embassy in Canberra early today after a letter sent to a newspaper and signed the Australian Jewish Defense League threatened harassment of Soviet diplomats in Aus tralia.

title: Compromise Sought By Commonwealth At Singapore Talks
description: SINGAPORE, Jan. 16Prime Minister Lee Kuan Yew of Sin gapore, chairman of the Com monwealth conference, said today that a fairly large area of common agreement was being maintained in the meet ings.

title: Home Improvement
description: MANY people do their own painting be cause they have to others because they enjoy it. But practically all have one thing in common  the part they like the least is the job of cleaning up afterward.

title: 64 Million Are Expected To Watch Game on TV
description: The National Broadcasting Company and the Columbia Broadcasting System alter nate in televising the Super Bowl. It is N.B.C.'s turn this year. The network will have 11 color cameras covering the action, five at field level.

title: The World of Bellevue
description: Many years ago, a Bellevue physician said, If you sit in the emergency rooms at Bellevue Hospital especially at night you can see everything. Psychiatric tragedies brought in for imme diate admission make the epi demic of psychiatric dramatic productions, on and off Broad way, seem pale in comparison.

title: Law
description: Four years ago the National Commission on Reform of Fed eral Criminal Laws was, estab lished to reorganize the hodge podge of laws on Federal crimes scattered through the United States Code. When it issued its final report last week, the ma jor emphasis in the news stories was on the Commission's rec ommendation that possession of marijuana be punished only by a fine and that capital punish ment be abolished for all Fed eral crimes. (The power of the states to execute for certain crimes would not be affected.) The Commission also proposed that handguns be barred from private usea suggestion sure to arouse the gun lobby.

title: Thousands Cheer as 58 Yachts Get Under Way in 3,500 Mile CapetowntoRio Race
description: CAPETOWN, South Africa, Jan. 16 (AP)More than 100, 000 spectators cheered from dockside today as 58 yachts moved out for the start of the first Capetown to Rio de Janeiro race.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Eight growth  industry prospects for the Upper Great Lakes Region, compris ing 119 counties in upper Minnesota, Wisconsin and Michigan, have been singled out in a study by two Michi gan Department of Commerce economists.

description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Jan. 16Jesse Sammis 3d and Gor don Gray of the Field Club of Greenwich, the national plat form tennis doubles champions, were upset today in the third round of the New Canaan tour nament.

title: Horse Show News
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 Arthur McCashin sat on the dais at the annual luncheon of the United States Eques trian Team in the Sheraton Park Hotel today and his thoughts went back more than two decades.

title: LOUISVILLE BEATEN BY BRADLEY, 7874
description: PEORIA, Ill., Jan. 16 (AP) Bradley, led by Al Smith's 24 points, rallied in the second half today to defeat Louisville, 7874, keeping the Braves in the thick of the Missouri Valley Conference race.

description: West Virginia's Mountaineers came to town afeudin' and ashootin' last night and were gunned out of town by St. John's 10082 victory as the Redmen tied an Alumni Gym scoring record before 3,392 fans.

description: ST. MORITZ, Switzerland, Jan. 16 (AP)Switzerland's Al pine skiers captured the first three places and six of the top 10 today in the Piz Nair World Cup downhill race.

description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 16 (AP)  The Philadelphia 76ers scored 16 straight points in a 2minute span of the third period today as they walloped the Cleveland Cavaliers, 115 96, in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Movies
description: WHOEVER would have thought that the heroine of incom municability, the ac knowledged high priestess of alienation, would one day appear in an earthy, rollick ing movie called The Pizza Triangle?

description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Patricia Young Plans Nuptials
description: NORWICH, N. Y., Jan. 16  Miss Patricia Ann Young and Stephen Weld Sawyer, son of John E. Sawyer, presi dent of Williams College, and Mrs. Sawyer of Williams town, Mass., plan to be mar ried in April. The ceremony will be performed in the Mead Memorial Chapel of Middlebury College, from which Miss Young was graduated and where Mr. Sawyer is a senior.

title: Glicks Have Daughter
description: BETHESDA, Md., Jan. 16 A daughter was born here Dec. 25 to Lieut. Comdr. Rob ert A. Glick, U.S.N., and Mrs. Glick at the Naval Medical Center, where the baby's father is a staff psychiatrist. Mrs. Glick is the former Miss Vivian S. Bachrach of New York, where her father, Kurt J. BachrachBaker, is corre spondent for Der Spiegel, the West German magazine. The child has been named Melissa Lauren.

title: The Steel Confrontation
description: President Nixon's confrontation with the steel industry over prices was a crucial test for his Administration's price and wage policiesand, indeed, for its overall approach to dealing with the nation's domestic and international economic problems.

title: SANTA ANITA RACE GOES TO ACK ACK
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Jan. 16 (UPI) Willie Shoemaker achieved personal milestone today as Ack Ack captured the 33d run ning of the $56,650 San Carlos Handicap at Santa Anita.

title: SOME IN POLAND SEE NO CHANGES
description: WARSAW, Jan. 16Expres sions of disillusion appear to be seeping through some levels of Polish society as the new Government of Edward Gierek, the Communist party leader, nears its first month in office.

title: EGYPT TO RESCUE PHILAE TEMPLES
description: CAIRO, Jan. 16 (UPI)Work will begin soon to rescue one of ancient Egypt's most beauti ful temple complexesthe Tem ples of Philaefrom the rising waters of the Nile.

title: McBean, ExPirate Reliever, To Go South With Phillies
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 16 (UPI)Eleven nonroster play ers, including the former Pitts burgh Pirate relief pitcher, Al McBean, will train with the Philadelphia Phillies this spring in Clearwater, Fla.

title: LEFTIST CIVILIANS RULE IN SHANGHAI
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 16  A new Communist party commit tee for Shanghai, announced from Peking, has confirmed in power the leftist civilian lead ership of China's largest city.

title: (Deleted) Is What G.I. Terms the Vietnamese
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 (Reuters)State Department censors deleted answers to questions about derogatory terms applied by American soldiers to Vietnamese in a Congressional transcript re leased recently.

title: To Wright, Fanon, Ellison add Killens and Cain
description: Whatever else it may beand the possibilities are infiniteThe Cotil lion is clearly not what timid tradi tionalists have agreed to call a novel. And John Oliver Killens (one of a small group of writers in whose hands, according to J. Saunders Red ding, lies the future of fiction by blacks) is both aware and proud of his book's refusal to fit into the neat, safe little white categories con structed by theorists like Percy Lub bock.

title: Bills List Stadium Talks
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 16 (UPI) Erie County Executive B. John Tutska said today he would meet with the Buffalo Bills' owner, Ralph C. Wilson Jr., on Monday to discuss the Erie County Stadium situation. Wil son announced last Tuesday that the Bills' franchise would move out of Buffalo if the stadium question was not set tled.
