description: The French DefenseI P. K4, PK3begins with a bit of sparring for control of me dian squares. White has three obvious continuations: he might defend his king pawn by 3 NQB3 or 3 NQ2, ex change with 3 PxP, or ad vance with 3 PK5. The al ternatives have their pros and cons.

title: OffDuty Commission?
description: There is a good chance that City Council will finally create a taxi commission to begin regulating this largely unregulated industry. The Council's Consumer Affairs Committee is expected to vote favorably on the commis sion issue this morning and the whole Council is expected to follow suit later this afternoon.

title: Church Council Urges Nations To Abolish Capital Punishment
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Jan. 20The Centre Commit tee of the World Council of Churches called upon the na tions of the world today to abolish capital punishment on the ground that it constituted violation of the sanctity of life.

title: The Depression Taught Him to Cook
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y. Some of the best cooks around today are people once known as Depression babies. And one of the best Arme nian cooks around is a fel low named Courtney Keating Shabazian, a Depression baby and bachelor, who holds forth with omelet parties and Armenian feasts in a six room apartment here.

title: Cambodians Pressed
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Jan. 20 (AP)Cambodian spokesmen said today that their troops were being hard pressed at Pich Nil Pass, but the field com mander, Brig. Gen. Sosthene Fernandez, reiterated that the capture of the mountain pass was imminent.

title: Idea of Price Rise Accepted By OilConsuming Nations
description: PARIS, Jan. 20  The ma jor industrial nations today ac cepted the idea that oil will cost them more over the next five years as part of a global settlement international oil companies are trying to reach with producer countries.

title: Bridge: Silence Is Usually Golden In Face of NoTrump Opening
description: To bid in the face of an opposing notrump opening is always risky. When in doubt, silence is usually golden. However, there are many un balanced hands, particularly of a twosuited variety, that call for some action. The problem is to locate a good fit in a suit if one is avail able.

title: HERBERT F. CARLS
description: SPRINGFIELD, N. J., Jan. 20 Herbert F. Carls of 40 Troy Drive, former chief examiner of the New Jersey Department of Banking and Insurance, died yesterday in Overlook Hospital, Summit after a short illness. He was 68 years old.

title: LINDSAY APPOINTS UNIT TO MARK '76
description: Mayor Lindsay appointed 45 persons yesterday to the city's American Revolution Bicenten nial Committee. The group will formulate plans for commemo rating, in 1976, the 200th anni versary of the American Rev olution.

title: Bronco Billy Anderson Is Dead at 88
description: HOLLYWOOD, Jan. 20 (AP) Gilbert M. (Bronco Billy) Ander son, who made his debut in the first movie with a story, The Great Train Robbery in 1903, and became the first star of Westerns, died in a sanitariumm, here today. He was 88 years, old.

title: Denial by Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20A Defense Department spokesman today denied a report from Hanoi that the United States was carrying on a bombing of fensive against North Vietnam.

title: Barry Paces Nets To 113106 Victory Over Floridians
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Jan. 20Rick Barry scored 32 points, 15 in the Last quarter, to lead the New York Nets to a 113106 American Basketball Association victory tonight over the Floridians.

title: SAIGON REPORTS CAMBODIA LINKUP
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 20  With a 10mile stretch of Cambodia's major supply route still mostly under Com munist control, advance ele ments of two allied forces re portedly linked up today in their roadclearing drive.

title: Knicks Toppled
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 20In a hec tic finish suggestive of the Na tional Basketball Association's earlier and less distinguished days, the New York Knicker bockers dropped their fifth road game in a row tonight, losing to the Chicago Bulls, 109103.

title: News of Skiing
description: STOWE, Vt., Jan. 20This winter could well become known as the one that was a throwback to the Ice Age. For the last six days, the temperature has had a rough time climbing even to zero. Two days ago, it was 34 be low at Mount Mansfield's crest. It has been so cold that the moun tain's two ski shops have done a goldrush busi ness in face masks. Almost 1,000 masksin wool, Orlon and chamoiswere sold to visiting skiers last weekend.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20  Shortly after 9 this morning, with a few reporters on hand, President Nixon appeared be fore his staff in the White House theater to tell them that his legislative program next year would he the most com prehensive, the most farreach ing, the most bold program in the domestic field ever presented to an American Con gress. He then dismissed the re porters, talked some more and finally re treated to the privacy of his hideaway office across the street from the White House to enter, as he put it, a period of solitary struggle with his private thoughts and the rough drafts of the State of the Union Message he will give at 9 P.M. Friday. For the rest of the day, such thoughts as he wished to make public were communicated  as usual  through his press secretary, Ronald L. Ziegler.

title: U.S. Says Ecuador Has Fined 9 Boats $484,600 in 10 Days
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20The State Department disclosed to day that Ecuador had collected a total of $484,600 from nine United States tuna boats seized since Jan. 11 for allegedly hav ing violated Ecuadorian terri torial waters. Six of the boats have been released, department officials said, and the three others are expected to be re leased soon.

title: Advertising:
description: The name is Schneider, but he owns a home in Ireland.

title: Pulsing of Hydraulic Fluid Called Cause of F14 Crash
description: The Dec. 30 crash of the Navy's new F14 fighter was caused by pumpingpressure fluctuations that ruptured hy draulic lines somewhat the way musical notes can shatter a drinking glass.

title: Film Shows Renfro Deflected Ball on Colts' First Score
description: In the film viewed yester day of the Super Bowl game's most controversial play, Mel Renfro of the Dallas Cow boys clearly deflected the football to John Mackey when the Baltimore Colts scored the first touchdown last Sunday in their 1613 victory.

title: Manson Jury Deliberates Fifth Day Without Decision
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 20 (UPI) The jury in the murder trial of Charles M. Manson and three women deliberated for a fifth day today and retired without reaching a decision.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Mrs. Grant Again Backs Unit Prices
description: The city's Consumer Af fairs Commissioner, Bess Myerson Grant, told a City Council hearing yesterday that properly used unit pricing could help shoppers save an average of 10 per cent on their weekly food budgets.

title: 7 POSTAL UNIONS SUBMIT DEMANDS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20 (AP)  Seven unions representing postal workers presented pro posals today as contract talks began with the United States Postal Service.

title: I.O.S. Head's Staff Note Refers To Trouble From ExEmployes
description: GENEVA, Jan. 20Investors Overseas Services cannot af ford to give in to blackmail, the troubled financial group's president and chief executive officer said today.

title: U.N. RELEASES NOTE BY MOSCOW ON J.D.L.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. Jan. 20The United Nations made public today the text of a Soviet letter complaining about harassment by the Jew ish Defense League.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Now in its seventh con secutive year, the American Broadcasting Company's American Sportsman tele vision series is devoting more time to the problems, habitat and habits of wild animals and less to the hunting of them.

title: ERNST LEHNER
description: Ernst Lehner, author of books on symbols and other graphic arts subjects, died Tuesday in University Hospital. He was 75 years old and lived at 135 East 39th Street.

title: Silver Contracts Continue to Decline In Active Trading
description: Silver futures prices con tinued to slide yesterday on the Commodity Exchange here in fairly active trading, with 2,862 sales being completed.

title: News of Dogs
description: A single reservation on Tuesday brought the num ber of participants in the Dog Fanciers Club excursion to England's famous Cruft's show to 335, which is likely to be the final figure when two airplanes take off from John F. Kennedy Interna tional Airport on Feb. 3. William Moore of the Moore Travel Agency, Trenton, handling the proj ect, pointed out that time was running out, although reser vations still could be made and seven seats were left.

title: North Carolina Supreme Court Approves Busing for Integration
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Jan, 20 (AP) North Carolina's Supreme Court upheld today the state's policy of providing buses for city children in school desegre gation programs as lone as state funds were used to carry rural children to school.

title: Fines in Phone Strike Will Top Million Today if Dispute Goes On
description: New fines, to be levied if there is still a strike of tele phone repairmen at 8 A.M. to day, were imposed yesterday on the local that started the statewide walkout and against its president.

title: Racial Tensions Ease at Camp Lejeune
description: CAMP LEJEUNE, N. C., Jan. 16A Marine corporal was beaten to death here during season of racial tension and violence 18 months ago. As saults and brawls were com mon. Armed guards, in addition to the normal complement of military policemen, patrolled much of the barracks areas.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20  It has been a bad week for old people. Another bad week. Bad weeks for old people seem to occur with increasing frequency. If it isn't Where's Poppa? at the movie house it's another rise in the realestate tax, the kind that must make you say Oof! if you are over 65 and, therefore, automatically in eligible for those 17.4 percent salary increases that make it easier for the rest of us to roll with the punch.

title: CARDINAL BACCI, VATICAN LATINIST
description: ROME, Jan. 20Antonio Car dinal Bacci, the Roman Cath olic Church's ranking Latinist, died in his home in the Vatican today after an illness of several months. He was 85 years old.

title: Berra and Kiner Top Candidates For Hall Today
description: Ralph Kiner, Early Wynn and Yogi Berra, three of baseball's outstanding stars of the nine teenforties and nineteenfifties, are the leading candidates for election to the Hall of Fame today.

title: Judith S. Celler, 48, Dies; Representative's Daughter
description: Judith S. Celler, a daughter of Representative Emanuel Celler of Brooklyn, who lived with him at 9 Prospect Park West, died yesterday in Brook lyn Jewish Hospital after a short illness. She was 48 years old.

title: Government Is Planning $29.6Billion Financing
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20The Treasury announced today massive refunding involving $19.5billion of publicly held securities maturing as far ahead as February of next year.

title: Rockefeller Will Propose A Community Bond Issue
description: ALBANY, Jan. 20 Gover nor Rockefeller will soon pro pose a multibilliondollar com munity development bond issue and will campaign extensively for its approval in a November referendum, Rockefeller aides said today.

title: Mitford Mathews Jr., Served National Security Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20  Mitford M. Mathews Jr., an as sistant director of the National Security Agency, died Monday of a heart attack, while on Government business in Roch ester. He was 48 years old and lived in Sliver Springs, Md.

title: Cab Owners Inspect New Equipment to Foil Thugs
description: Climbing into and out of taxis on exhibition at the Tavernon theGreen's parking lot yester day, cab owners pounded and poked at safety features that soon will be required of all cabs in the city.

title: State's 2d Special Lottery Nets Schools $3.9Million
description: ALBANY, Jan. 20 (AP)The state lottery's million  dollar holiday special drew more than $8.6 million, the Tax De partment announced today. Of that amount, $3.9milion will be used to support education in the state.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: A.T. &
description: The bond market wavered yesterday and then regained its balance after it heard terms for major financing efforts by the Bell System, the Federal Government and the New York State Urban Develop ment Corporation.

title: Head of P.B.A. Testifies That the City Agreed in 1969 to Clause Assuring Parity
description: The president of the Patrol men's Benevolent Association, Edward J. Kiernan, testified in State Supreme Court yesterday that an agreement negotiated with the city on Jan. 29, 1969, contained a clause assuring the patrolmen of an equalizing ad justment if police sergeants subsequently received a pay in crease.

title: Boston U. Sextet Wins
description: BOSTON, Jan. 20 (AP)Bos ton University's unbeaten hock ey powerhouse exploded for three goals in 39 seconds mid way in the second period to night and went on to crush Dartmouth, 134. Wayne Gow ing had four goals and an assist for the Terriers, while Bob Gryp scored three times. Boston Uni versity now has a 1301 won losttied record.

title: Text of the Statement by Murphy
description: Following is the statement by Police Commissioner Pat rick V. Murphy on discipline:

title: SOVIET SPY ALLOWED BY U.S. TO GO HOME
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20 (AP) The State Department an nounced today that the Gov ernment had agreed to allow a convicted Soviet spy, current ly out on $100,000 bail, to return to the Soviet Union for humanitarian and other rea sons.

title: Market Place: KDI's Decline From 19 to 1
description: This is a changing world and nothing changes so dra matically as fortunes in Wall Street during a bear market. Take the KDI Corporation.

title: No Excuse for Another Crisis
description: The order issued by Mayor Lindsay for imposition of the penalties mandated by the Taylor Law is a straight forward exercise of legal obligation, not an act of vengeance against the 20,000 patrolmen who illegally abandoned their posts in recent days.

title: Indictments Protested
description: BOSTON, Jan. 20 (AP) About 80 persons jammed into the Federal Bureau of Investiga tion office today and protested recent indictments on conspir acy charges against the Rev. Philip Berrigan and five other persons.

title: Women Fight Slick to Save Birds
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan, 20 (AP)Thousands of house wives, refinery workers and young people waded into the biggest oil slick in San Fran cisco Bay history today to try to save thousands of birds.

title: U.S. Colonel in Saigon Faces Marijuana Trial
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 20 (UPI)A United States Air Force colonel is to he tried by general court martial Feb. 8 on marijuana charges, Air Force spokes men announced today.

title: CONSERVATIONISTS APPLAUD SEYMOUR
description: Three leading conservation organizations have issued a joint statement praising United States Attorney Whitney North Seymour Jr. for what they said was his vigorous prosecution of polluters.

title: College Sports Notes
description: The American Broadcast ing Company may not be interested in televising col lege football after next sea son unless the National Col legiate Athletic Association changes its policy. The net work's contract with the N.C.A.A. runs through next season, marking six straight years of A.B.C.'s college game of the week. Chuck Howard, vice pres ident of program production for A.B.C. Sports, said: Given current economic circum stances next winter, the N.C.A.A. will have to lower its price demand or become more lenient in the selection of games to be televised. And maybe the N.C.A.A. will have to do both for us to buy the package again.

title: Judge Rejects Suit To Halt Abortions By the Air Force
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Jan. 20  A Federal judge has dis missed a suit seeking to bar an Air Force hospital here from performing abortions.

title: Shift by Guerrillas Reported and Denied
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 20 The semiofficial Egyptian news paper Al Ahram reported today] in a dispatch from Amman, Jordan, that the Central Com mittee of the Palestine com mando movement had decided to support moves by the United Arab Republic and Jordan for a political settlement of the ArabIsraeli conflict. But guer rilla spokesmen here denied any change in their opposition to such an accord.

title: News Analysis
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 20Uruguay, simultaneously in the throes of an urban guerrilla campaign and a presidential election this year, has taken on the appearance of a laboratory for some of South America's most fashionable current politi cal ideas. The small country's urban guerrillas, the Tupama ros, appear to he fighting the Gov ernment to prove the Cubaninspired theory that only armed revolution can bring about social and eco nomic change in South America.

title: 4 ARE INDICTED HERE IN STOCK CONSPIRACY
description: Two businessmen and two lawyers were indicted by Federal grand jury here yester day on charges of a fraud con spiracy to sell $1.4million in stock.

title: British Expert Disagrees
description: LONDON, Jan. 21 (Reuters) Victor Zorza, an authority on Communist affairs, said to day that the Khrushchev mem oirs were a forgery in which both Soviet and United States intelligence agencies played a part.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 20 (UPI)  Lenny Wilkens sank two free throws in the last 19 seconds to clinch a 112108 victory for the Seattle Sonics over the At lanta Hawks tonight.

title: Ailey Troupe Powerful In Reised Dance Piece
description: The only dance company sure to hit you in the solar plexus nowadays remains the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theateras anybody who runs to the ANTA Thea ter for its current engage ment can see.

title: Chairman and Former Chief Of JohnsManville Resigns
description: The JohnsManville Corpora tion announced yesterday that Clinton B. Burnett had resigned as chairman, effective Dec. 31, 1970

title: Pants Get Big Hand In Clothes By Schn
description: ROME, Jan. 20You can too make clothes that look modern. Mila Schn showed how. All you need is taste, talent and technique. A dramatic color sense is use ful too.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: More Players to Be Nominated In Baseball AllStar Revisions
description: The major leagues announced yesterday a broadening of the nominating system for base ball's 42d AllStar game, which will be played in Detroit on July 13.

title: Murphy Is Rehired by Toledo As Coach of Its Football Team
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Jan. 20 (UPI) John A. (Jack) Murphy, 38 yearold head coach at Heidel berg University, was named to day as head football coach at the University of Toledo. He succeeds Frank Lauterbur, re cently appointed head coach at the University of Iowa.

title: ASHE IS NEW PRO WITH OLD WORRY
Music: FischerDieskau
description: Take any song by Hugo Wolf and it is a complete, selfcontained expression of a mood, an incident, a bit of introspection, a dramatic story. Their individual total ity could not have been more completely encompassed than they were in the recital of Wolf songs given by Dietrich FischerDieskau and Daniel Barenboim in Carnegie Hall on Tuesday night.

title: HIGH COURT CURBS CONTEMPT POWER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20  The Supreme Court declared to day that a judge who has been insulted in court may instantly impose a contempt sentence, but that if he waits until the end of the trial, he should let another judge punish the of fender.

title: Theater: A Magical Midsummer Night's Dream
description: Many people have seen magic in Shakespeare's A Midsummer Night's Dream, the magic of moonshine and fairyland, and  since no Shakespearean play has been so foully encrusted over with 19thcentury romanticism the magic of Mendelssohn and bosky scenery looking good enough to eat. Peter Brook has also seen magic in the Dream, but it is the magic of man. His produc tion of the play, first seen last summer at Stratfordon Avon and now gloriously come to the Billy Rose Thea ter, is also full of the magic of the theater.

title: Men in the News
description: When Louis Nizer appeared in court Tuesday on behalf of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association, he was a little perturbed at being kept from the opening of his first major oneman art show.

title: Nanette Brings Out the Nostalgia Buffs
description: By 2:30 P.M. Yesterday, the boxoffice sales for New York's newest stage hit, No, No, Nanette, had passed the $20,000 mark and the 46th Street Theater's man agement was predicting un usually high. Daily receipts of $35,000 before the windows closed at 9 P.M.

title: Jewish Defense League to Boycott Products of Concerns Dealing With Soviet
description: The Jewish Defense League began a consumer boycott yes terday against the products of United States companies doing business with the Soviet Union.

title: RALPH MILLS
description: Ralph (Eddie) Mills, former head bank man in the makeup department of the composing room of The New York Times, and former chairman of The Times Chapel of the Interna tional Typographical Union, died Tuesday in Hollywood, Fla., where he lived in retire ment. He was 69 years old.

title: Overhead Power Lines Assailed by State Official
description: The state's Environmental Conservation Commissioner called yesterday for steppedup action to eliminate overhead lines that distribute electricity within local areas and to cus tomers.

title: 5 on Relief Put Up at Waldorf; Lindsay Suspends 3 in H.R.A.
description: A mother and four children on welfare were found living at the WaldorfAstoria yester day, and Mayor Lindsay ordered the suspension of three Human Resources Administration em ployes who had placed them there at a cost of $152.64 for two days.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Sports of The Times Don't Outrage Us
description: Long before Norman Mailer explained to Jos Torres that words are jabs, phrases are hooks and sentences are knockout rights, writers and fighters had found common ground. Aristotle is said to have picked up the training ex penses of Philammon of Athens, an Olympic boxing victor, and Lucilius wrote snide epigrams about cauliflower ears and canvasbacks. Lord Byron sparred, although he was never as tough as John Keats. William Hazlitt went to one fight about 150 years ago, wrote about it, and put boxing in all the high school anthologies ever since. Jack London called for a white hope to dim Jack Johnson's golden smile.

title: Havlicek and White Excel
description: BOSTON, Jan. 20 (UPI) John Havlicek and Jo Jo White both returning to action after missing two games, combined for 55 points tonight to leadthe Boston Celtics to a 142112 rout of the San Diego Rockets.

title: Freshman Named Humphrey Is Home
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20 Which was is the trolley? asked the man with the high forehead and jutting chin as he peered about the basement of the old Senate Office Building.

title: European Executives Are Tense, Too
description: PARIS, Jan. 20  Europe's corporate managers are class of overworked, over stressed and overanxious individuals whose jobs take precedence over family life, leisure, even health.

title: Lee Joins Kansas Staff
description: LAWRENCE, Kan., Jan. 20 (AP)Bob Lee, 35, who played football four years at Florida A. and M. in the late nineteen fifties, joined the Kansas foot ball staff today as an assist ant coach. Lee was defensive coordinator for Ottawa Univer sity's Kansas Conference cham pions last year.

title: Court of Appeals Assails State And Localities for Trial Delays
description: ALBANY, Jan. 20Congested court calendars, due primarily to the failure of state and local governments to provide services and facilities rapidly enough, were blamed by the Court of Appeals today for causing a 16 month delay in bringing a de fendant to trial.

title: Census Shows a Gain in City and Suburbs
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20 Final census figures made pub lic today showed that New York City's population gained slightly, by 35,??, in the last decade while suburban counties in the state had sharp increases.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: PENNSYLVANIA BARS THE DEATH PENALTY
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Jan. 20 (AP)The outgoing State At torney General declared the death penalty abolished in Pennsylvania today, asserting that it was cruel and inhuman punishment and as such is pro hibited by the United States Constitution.

title: Robbery Suspect Arrested
description: A Manhattan man was ar reste yesterday in connection with the $25,350 holdup of a Kennedy International Airport restaurant last Labor Day. The suspect, Jorge Sarmiento, 29 years old, of 665 West 165th Street, who already was under indictment, was arraigned be fore Queens Supreme Court Justice Albert Bosch and held in $10,000 bail.

title: McGovern Announces
description: By normal political standards, Senator George Mc Govern is early in announcing his Presidential candidacy eighteen months before the Democratic National Con vention meets. But without substantial financial backing or a strong organization, Senator McGovern has to make use of the assets he does possesstime and his own skillsto cope with the formidable problems of creating a viable national campaign. He knows that a constituency exists which shares his outlook. It may well be a majority of his party. The problem is to convince that constituency that he is the leader it seeks.

title: RUMANIA SEEKING U.S. INDUSTRY TIES
description: Your are Interested in prof it, we are interested in profit, Rumania's Ambassador to the United States, Corneliu Bogdan, said in introducing two trade delegations from his country at la news conference here yes terday.

title: Mutual Funds Stepped Up Stock Buying in December
description: The nation's mutual funds dug deeply into cash reserves last month to make their larg est net stock purchases since June, 1969, data published by the Investment Company In stitute showed yesterday.

title: Nader Calls Carbide Job Threat Act of Environmental Blackmail
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20 Ralph Nader, the consumer ad vocate, accused the Union Car bide Corporation today of committing an act of eco nomic and environmental blackmail in saying that compliance with a Federal antipollution order would re quire the laying off of 625 workers at its Plant in Mariet ta. Ohio.

title: DEATHS IN CHICAGO TIED TO POOR CARE
description: Health care neglect was the real though unofficial cause of death last year for approxi mately 1,000 Chicago citizens, the principal investigator for a continuing fiveyear study of Chicago's hospital care said yesterday.

title: U.S. Experts Find Khrushchev Memoirs Authentic
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20  A group of 30 experts on the Soviet Union concluded in a meeting here last week that the recently published memoirs of Nikita S. Khrushchev were authentic and that they had been released to the West with out the approval of the present Soviet leadership.

title: Army Engineers Suspend Work on Canal in Florida
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 20 (AP)  The chief of the Army Corps of Engineers ordered immediate action today to suspend all work on the crossFlorida barge canal, pursuant to yesterday's order from President Nixon.

title: Boat Show Preview
description: New York State has bad news for the owners of boats with heads: Despite the prospect of Federal standards that would declare maceratorchlorinators acceptable barriers to water pollution, the state expects that its own regula tion, requiring holding tanks for sewage, will remain in effect and be enforced this year.

title: MILLS REINTRODUCES TEXTILE IMPORT BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21  Representative Wilbur D. Mills reintroduced in the House today the importlimiting trade bill that barely failed last year to become law.

title: Arrival of Santa Rosa Closes Era for Liners
description: The liner Santa Rosa docked here shortly after 11 A.M. yesterday, completing the last scheduled voyage of a United Statesflag passen ger ship serving the East or Gulf Coasts. Only four such liners are still operat ing, all from the West Coast.

title: RYUN WILL START IN MILE TONIGHT
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 21 (UPI)  Jim Ryun, world rec ord holder in the mile, begins a comeback tomorrow night at the age of 23.

title: Snow Cancels Ski Finale
description: DURANGO, Colo., Jan. 21 (AP)Deteriorating snow con ditions forced cancelation to day of the men's 50kilometer crosscountry race, final event of the United States Ski Asso ciation's national nordic cham pionships.

title: Alcoa Net Fell 6.6% in '70
description: Earnings of the Aluminum Company of America fell 6.6 per cent in 1970. Slowing de mand caused by economic weakness plus a sizable in crease in industry capacity along with higher operating costs were factors in the de cline.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Unitas Is Sued for Divorce
description: TOWSON, Md., Jan, 21 (UPI) The wife of Johnny Unitas of the Baltimore Colts filed for divorce today, charging adul tery and saying in her petition there was no chance for recon ciliation. Mrs. Dorothy Unitas married the quarterback in 1954. They have five children.

title: Sailing Instructor's Job Tour of Exotic Resorts
description: MARTINIQUE, French West IndiesWho has the best job in the world?

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21In expanding American air op erations in Cambodia, the Nixon Administration took the calculated risk that Congress and the public would tolerate such a move provided no American ground troops or ad visers were involved.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Union Is Accused By Jacobi Hospital In Loss of Power
description: Jacobi Hospital in the Bronx had to operate with only half its power and was forced to curtail surgery for four days this week while a union dispute held up repairs on a burned out transformer, the hospital's administrator said yesterday.

title: Martin Samuels, ExAide With Bing & Bing Here, 74
description: Martin Samuels, who retired in 1953 as vice president of Bing & Bing Inc., the real es tate concern, died Wednesday in St. Clare's Hospital after a long illness. His age was 85 and he lived at 30 West 54th Street.

title: Sosin Will Be Given The Directors' Award
description: Mark Sosin, the outdoor editor of CBS Radio here, has been named the winner of the annual directors' award, sponsored by the National Association of Engine and Boat Manufacturers. The award is given for outstand ing contribution by an indi vidual in the communications profession to the sport of boating and allied water sports.

title: Mood Across the Nation: Concern but Not Despair
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 Americans today are dis couraged but not despairing about the state of the union.

title: Truffaut's Diary Unreels in Bed and Board
description: The new year is scarcely three weeks old, but I can't help believing that Francois Truffaut's latest Antoine Doinel comedy, Bed and Board, which opened yes terday at the Fine Arts The ater, will turn out to be one of the loveliest, most intelli gent movies we'll see in all of 1971.

title: Outboard Motors Are Getting Quieter All the Time
description: Noise pollution is as much a concern of the marine and recreational industries as wa ter pollution, says Dick Lin coln, engineer in Outboard Marine Corporation's en vironmental affairs.

title: Uniformed Employes Face Move To Require Them to Live in City
description: Two state legislators and two City Councilmen announced joint plans yesterday for a law to require all new city police men, firemen and sanitation ary to live in the city.

title: Canadiens Tie Flyers, 55
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 21 (UPI) Henri Richard's goal with 12 minutes 27 seconds remaining capped at fourgoal Montreal outburst in the final period that enabled the Canadiens to tie the Philadelphia Flyers 55 tonight.

title: YULE PARTY COSTS CITY AIDE HIS JOB
description: A city housing official was discharged yesterday for ac cepting money for an office Christmas party from contract ors doing business with the city.

title: Kelly Will Speak Tonight At Rowing Dinner Here
description: John B. (Jack) Kelly Jr., presi dent of the Amateur Athletic Union and a threetime Olympic oarsman, will be the leading speaker at the National Rowing Foundation's annual awards dinner tonight in the Hotel Biltmore.

title: BUILDING LEADERS MOVE TO CONTROL PAYPRICE SPIRAL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 The Administration and the nation's construction industry are moving toward the forma tion of a stabilization board or similar machinery to oversee collective bargaining and wage price levels, industry officials disclosed today.

title: Walter Reade Seeks to Sublet All Its Space in New 1 Astor Pl.
description: The Walter Reade Organiza tion is trying to find a sub tenant for the six floors of of fice space it rented two years ago in 1 Astor Plaza, the 54 story tower nearing comple tion on Times Square.

title: Thousand Islands Offers Boatmen Unspoiled BacktoNature Atmosphere
description: The Indians called them Manitoanna, the Garden of the Great Spirit the 1000 Islandsan archipelago ex tending over 50 miles in the St. Lawrence River within the boundaries of Canada and the United States.

title: U.S. Lists Week's Toll: 37 Killed, 211 Wounded
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 21 (AP)  The United States command reported to day that 37 Americans were killed in action in Indochina last week, 10 more than the week before.

title: Death of a Boondoggle
description: President Nixon's belated but most welcome decision to halt further construction of the CrossFlorida Barge Canal is a major victory for the environment. The canal would have been an ecological disaster destroying the Oklawaha River, which as we noted in an editorial opposing the canal as far back as June 1965, was one of this country's most beautiful freeflowing streams, and still, for much of its length, is dark, peaceful and untamed.

title: A Formidable Debate
description: The boy wonder of Georgia politics, Richard Brevard Rus sell, who died Thursday at 2:25 P.M., E.S.T., had many of the credentials a man would need to become President. He en tered the state Legislature at age 23, became Georgia's youngest Governor at 33 and, moving on to the United States Senate, became one of the most powerful men in Congress.

title: Commonwealth Chiefs Dispose Of Final Agenda Items Quickly
description: SINGAPORE, Jan. 21Tired government leaders of the 31 Commonwealth nations, who debated the proposed British arms sale to South Africa until 4 o'clock this morning, moved swiftly through two compli cated items on their agenda today and prepared for the close of their conference tomor row.

title: Smashed Boat Fails to Deter Sailor
description: Jean Lacombe watched the blackhulled tanker disappear over the horizon and then looked at the smashed rig ging of his 23foot sloop. The 50  year  old photographer was in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean with no way to get anywhere else.

title: SHOT QUESTIONED AT PANTHER TRIAL
description: A police laboratory expert testified yesterday that he did not see how a bullet that al legedly went through a police man's summons pouch could have done so without touching the pouch's contents.

title: N.Y.U. Welcomes LightRolyPoly With Sanasardo
description: It is impossible not to re spect Paul Sanasardo as a cho reographer even when all his work is not necessarily to one's personal taste. He is an uncom promising artist: Some of his pieces can be obscure. Certainly none are devised as mere enter tainment.

title: Patton to Visit Tokyo in Effort To Keep Ship Terminal Here
description: In an effort to keep Japanese ship lines from moving their Main East Coast cargo opera tions out of the city, Economic Development Administrator Ken Patton is flying to Tokyo next Tuesday.

title: SUSPENSIONS STIR WALKOUT IN H.R.A.
description: The suspension of three Hu man Resources Administration employes accused of placing a welfare family in the Wal dorfAstoria Hotel touched off a major dispute yesterday be tween the city and the union representing some 15,000 H.R.A workers.

title: Coast Bank's Net Cut by Swiss Loss
description: A $19.1million loss by the United California Bank in Ba sel, Switzerland, pulled down the 1970 earnings of both the United California Bank and of the giant parent company, the Western Bancorporation, the two disclosed yesterday.

title: Comment by Segal
description: TOKYO, Friday, Jan. 22 Reached here, where he is giving a lecture and piano concert sponsored by Maini chi News, Mr. Segal said:

title: Vandiver, ExGovernor, Held Likely Appointee
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 27 (UPI) Ernest Vandiver, a former Governor of Georgia, is gen erally regarded as the man who will probably be chosen to fill the remaining two years of the late Senator Richard B. Russell's term.

title: Boat Show Preview
description: An analysis of last year's America's Cup races signals an important message for yacht racers everywhere in all classes. Because of mod ern instrumentation, today's best boats are so evenly matched, hull for hull and sail for sail, that skillful sail ing is at the greatest premi um ever.

title: Market Place: Certificate Use Increases Costs
description: If American Telephone and Telegraph took a page from the mutual fund industry's book and eliminated its stock certificate, the world's largest utility might be able to raise money continuously at sub stantially reduced costs.

title: Ethiopians Investigating
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Jan. 21  Ethiopian offi cials are continuing their investigation into the kill ing of Socialist Echeandia, and it still seems to be an open question whether the killing was an accident or intentional harassment of American forces.

title: TRUMAN IS FACING TESTS IN HOSPITAL
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Jan 21  Former President Harry S. Truman was admitted to Re search Hospital this morning after complaining of abdominal pains.

title: Snowdon Flies to Barbados
description: LONDON, Jan. 21 (Reuters) Lord Snowdon, the husband of Princess Margaret, left here by air for Barbados today as part of his convalescence from a recent hemorrhoid op eration. He said: I do not know how long I will be away. My wife is due to join me next week.

title: Pacer Burst Pays Off
description: DENVER, Jan. 21 (AP) Indiana broke an 8888 tie in the final eight minutes tonight and went on to down the Denver Rockets, 118106. Bill Keller and Roger Brown led the scoring burst as the Pacers hit 8 straight points.

title: Class 44: An Occasion for Sadness
description: For three months after she received a curt notice that the tenement building in which her family had its small railroad flat was about to be demolished, Mrs. Felic ita Romero searched for an apartment nearby that would make it possible for her to keep her two sons at Public School 198.

title: Moffat, a Champion in Yachting, Turns to Sailplaning and Scores Again
description: George B. Moffat Jr. came before Big Bird, and after Icarus, which puts him some where on the list of persons who can fly without motors and things like that.

title: KENNEDY OUSTED AS WHIP;
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 Senator Edward M. Kennedy, was toppled as assistant ma jority leader of the Senate to day as the Democraticcon trolled 92d Congress convened amid infighting in the Demo cratic ranks.

title: Piloting, Navigation Tested In Predicted Log Events
description: Predicted log competition is not racing, but a contest in piloting and navigation.

title: Victims Are Identified
description: PARIS, Jan. 21According to the Defense Ministry state ment, the 21 persons who died in the crash included four members of the plane's crew. The 17 others included 7 sen ior officers of the French Atomic Energy Commission and 6 senior military officers in charge of atomic affairs.

title: Tax Aid for Single People Asked by 55 in the House
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP)  Fiftyfive House members urged Congress today to give 25 million single Americans the taxlowering benefits accorded to married people.

title: EYEFILLING SHOW OF ANTIQUES OPENS
description: The feast of antiques that ap pears annually as a benefit for the East Side House Settlement opens today in the 7th Regi ment Armory, Park Avenue and 67th Street, a banquet of un usually varied and rich ingre dients.

title: Bomb Found in Building, 40 Families Are Evacuated
description: The police removed an eight inch pipe bomb from a third floor fire escape of a rooming house at 359 West 47th Street shortly after 1 A.M. today.

title: Valentino Revivifies Fashions of 40's
description: ROME, Jan. 21Skip the shortypants for a minute. Let's talk about the music. Any fashion show that swings along to Glenn Miller and Tommy Dorsey can't be all bad. Valentino's was quite good.

title: Japanese Party Backs a 3Year Term for Premiers
description: TOKYO, Jan. 21How long a Premier should stay in officean issue that in other countries has been the subject of intense debate and even of coups d'tatwas decided casually here today by a burst of applause and not even a counting of hands.

title: Split Mars Council's Closing in Ethiopia
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Jan. 21Greeks and other Eastern Orthodox leaders boycotted the final business session of the World Council of Churches to day and the closing worship service at St. Stephen's Church.

title: 21 Die in French Plane Crash, Including Generals and Admiral
description: PARIS, Jan. 21 (Reuters) All 21 persons aboard a French Air Force transport plane, in cluding two generals and an admiral, were killed when it crashed today, the Defense Ministry announced.

title: HAWKS' ESPOSITO TOPS WINGS, 20
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 21 (UPI)  Tony Esposito, goalie, earned his fourth shutout of the Na tiona Hockey League season tonight, stopping 30 Detroit Red Wing shots in a 20 victory by the Chicago Black Hawks.

title: North Stars Top Blues, 53
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Jan. 21 (AP)Danny Grant and J. P. Parise bounced scoring shots off Glenn Hall's pads and led the Minnesota North Stars to a 53 victory over the St. Louis Blues tonight.

title: MERCURY OFFERING VARIETY OF POWER
description: Kiekhaefer Mercury's out board line at the show ranges from a singlecylinder 4 horsepower Merc, through twins, fours and sixes up to 135 horsepower.

title: Britain Producing a New Plastic VacuumStamped Small Boat for the 1970's
description: If Erskine Childers's clas sic hero, Arthur Davis, could be persuaded to take his mind from the Riddle of the Sands for a while and come for a sail into the 1970's, he would be astonished at the vast number of boats in the water; at the owners, no long er necessarily from among the affluent, and at the shapes of hulls and sails.

title: F.T.C. SEEKS BAN ON CREDIT ABUSES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21  The Federal Trade Commission acted today to ban a number of installmentcredit practices that have been criticized by con sumer advocates.

title: Seat of the Problem
description: Never sit on a wet life pre server. Doing so will pack the filling and cause the pre server to lose buoyancy.

title: Arrested for Threat to Nixon
description: ST. LOUIS, Jan. 21 (AP) Darrell Lee Patt, 42 years olld, was arrested by Secret Service agents yesterday and charged with threatening the life of President Nixon.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: The invasion of public and private lands and wilderness areas by snowmobiles, trail bikes, dune buggies and all terrain vehicles is intensify ing at a startling rate.

title: 1,200 Sheep Dead, More Dying From Unknown Causes in Utah
description: GARRISON, Utah, Jan. 21 (AP)More than 1,200 sheep were dead and others were dying today on a remote desert range in western Utah. A multiagency investigation was opened to determine the cause of the deaths.

title: 12 BLACKS TO SKIP NIXON'S MESSAGE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21  The 12 black members of the House of Representatives, all of them Democrats, told Pres ident Nixon today that they would boycott his State of the Union Message tomorrow night because of what they termed the President's consistent re fusal to hear the pleas and concerns of black Americans.

title: NEW SCHOONER RELIVES PAST
description: For well over a year, 28 yearold Joe Davis has been driving from Rhode Island to South Bristol, Me., once week to build a dreamthe gafftopsail schooner called Bill of Rights.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON CLOSE DAY STEADY
description: The London stock market closed steady yesterday.

title: Gourmet in the Galley
description: The mainstay in the gal ley lockers and shelves is still canned food. No other comestibles can match the convenience of stocking these nonperishables during food sales and then storing them away wherever space can be found. Besides such prac tical aspects, the addition of just a few sophisticated items can make a dinner at sea to a gourmet's liking.

title: Gilbert's Two Goals in Third Period Give Rangers 55 Tie With Sabres
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 21Rod Gil bert, who saved the New York Rangers from defeat by Phila delphia last night in Madison Square Garden, did it again to night against the pesky Buffalo Sabres in Memorial Auditorium.

title: Evinrade Is Showing Molinari Racing Hull
description: An Evinrudepowered Glas tronMolinari racing hull, the winner of outboard cham pionships from Arizona to South Africa, is being ex hibited by Evinrude Motors at the show.

title: Brooklyn G.I. Slain in Ethiopia In Region of Guerrilla Activity
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21The Army announced today that United States soldier was shot and killed Jan. 11 while driving on the road between Asmara and Massawa in Ethiopia deliv ering army mail. He was Spe cialist Ricardo Echeandia of 345 Berry Street, Brooklyn, the Army said.

title: BUCKLEY SWORN; JOINS G.O.P. BLOC
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21  At 12:10 P.M. today, a grin ning Senator Jacob K. Javits patted James L. Buckley on the shoulder and marched along side him down the center aisle of the Senate for Mr. Buckley to be sworn in as the first Con servativeRepublican Senator from New York.

title: Gabriel's Injury Disclosed
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 21 (AP) The Los Angeles Rams dis closed today that Roman Ga briel, quarterback, played all season with a torn cartilage in his right knee because he didn't think it was serious. A spokes man said Gabriel would under go surgery for the injured knee Feb. 3 at St. John's Hospital in Santa Monica.

title: Nassau Garbage Men Strike
description: LAWRENCE, L. I., Jan. 21 (UPI)A wildcat strike today left 15,000 residents of the Five Towns area in southwestern Nassau County without garbage collections. About 125 employes of Sanitary District 1, reported for work but refused to take their trucks out. Their union, the Nassau chapter of the Civil Service Employes' Association, said the workers were protest ing changes in pickup schedules and other alleged contract vio lations.

title: SCHOOL OFFICIALS TO VOTE ON UNION
description: Members of the independent Council of Supervisory Asso ciations will vote early next month on a proposal by the group's leaders to affiliate with the American Federation of LaborCongress of Industrial Organizations.

title: Webster, Upstate Driver, Paces Yonkers Reinsmen
description: YONKERS, Jan. 21  In the image of the American sport's hero, Ben Webster would fall far short of most people's idea of a champion. The 31yearold native of Rochester is 5 feet 8 inches and weighs 135 pounds.

title: Joys of Long Island Sound Night Sailing Savored
description: On any weekend day dur ing the boating season, the western half of Long Is land Sound writhes and twists in a turmoil of acti vity. Fishing boats troll methodically back and forth while cruisers and runabouts roar along at high speed to ward all points of the com pass. Sailboats are every where and in races stretch out in barrierlike lines, seemingly from shore to shore. Through it all tugs drag their tows, heading for unseen destinations.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE NEW CENTURIONS. By Joseph Wam bough. AtlanticLittle, Brown. $6.95.

title: Harbors Proliferate Dramatically as France Meets Growth in Yachting
description: PARISWhen the drug store came to France, it underwent so complete an adaptation that it has since been reexported to its birth place under its new form. A similar transformation ap pears to be under way in the domain of the marina, the yacht harbor. It includes the whole harbor and every thing that goes with it.

title: Prisoners'Escape Plot Foiled Here
description: Armed with black pepper and handcuff keys crudely fashioned from brass ballpoint pens, 26 prisoners in the Federal House of Detention for Men unsuc cessfully attempted to escape yesterday as they were being transferred to the Federal Courthouse in Brooklyn.

title: Coffee Exchange Elects
description: Charles W. Chapin, manag ing partner of the Lamborn Company, sugar brokers, has been elected to a oneyear term as president of the 89 yearold New Coffee and Sugar Exchange.

title: Police Ask Aid of Public In Brooklyn Murder Case
description: The police yesterday an nounced a special telephone number persons may call with information concerning the shooting of a 67yearold widow Wednesday night in the elevator of a Brooklyn apart ment house.

title: Europe's Banks Balk At Following U.S. In Reducing Rates
description: PARIS, Jan. 21  European monetary authorities are show ing increasing reluctance to follow the United States tail spin in interest rates.

title: Free Market Urged in the Telecommunications Field
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 Nearly a dozen young micro wave companies argued before the Federal Communications Commission today that the traditionally monopolistic tele communications field was ripe for competition.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21In the last decade, the ebb and flow of Senatorial power has become more intimately related to Presidential politics.

title: Redskin Aides Named
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (UPI)  George Allen, new head coach of the Washington Red skins, today hired five of his former assistants at Los An geles to join him in the same capacity. Allen also retained Mike McCormick, Redskin as sistant under Bill Austin.

title: Book Unit Rejects Love Story
description: Erich Segal's novel Love Story, one of the most ex traordinary book and movie successes in years, has been thrown out as a candidate for the coveted fiction award of the National Book Committee after the fivemember jury threatened to resign.

title: Russell's Proxy Kept Byrd in the Race
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 Through favors, promises and shrewd politicking, Senator Robert C. Byrd of West Vir ginia had been planning for weeks to try to unseat Sena tor Edward M. Kennedy as majority whip of the Senate. But what finally led to his successful coup was word that Senator Richard B. Rus sell was still alive.

title: Bridge: A wellCoached Team Leads Metropolitan Commercial Play
description: The team representing the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company has established a clear lead in the premier division of the Metropolitan Commercial Bridge League.

title: New Fiberglass Scull Is Exhibited
description: A new scull with carbon fiber reinforcement in its fiberglass construction is re ported by its British developer to be stronger and less ex pensive than conventional wooden sculling boats and yet to have the same handling and response characteristics.

title: Boat Show Preview
description: A funny thing happened between the end of last year's National Boat Show and tomorrow's 10 A.M. open ing of the 61st edition of the Coliseum spectacular. The economy caved in. For the first consecutive year since 1962, records will not be expected, especially in regard to the number of boats (around 500), engines or accessories on exhibit here.

title: COCACOLA BOTTLER SELLS SOME SHARES
description: A total of 2.55 million shares of common stock of the Coca Cola Bottling Company of New York, Inc., was offered for sale yesterday at $27.75 a share.

title: News of Skiing
description: WARREN, Vt., Jan. 21 Sugarbush, the inspot for the sophisticated jet set ever since it was opened as a ski area in 1958, is an interest ing reflection these days of the national economic down turn.

title: Three Women in State Assembly Seek Feminist Reforms, Gently
description: ALBANY, Jan. 21Connie, Mary and Ann and Rosemary, the thin powdered line of fem inity in the State Legislature, will have the ranks of the wo men's rights movement forti fied next month during a day long lobbyist visit by a wide spectrum of colleagues.

title: PROS WIN, 116106, FROM FLORIDIANS
description: NASHVILLE, Jan. 21 (UPI) The Jones boys scored 64 points among them as the Memphis Pros beat the Floridians, 116 106, in an American Basketball Association game tonight.

title: Mrs. McDonnell Is Remarried
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Jan. 21Mrs. Sandra Dixon Mc Donnell, widow of Sean McDonnell, was married here this afternoon to Barrington Boardman, a widower. The ceremony in St. Timothy's Roman Catholic Chapel was performed by the Rev. Eu gene O'Neill.

title: RUBINSTEIN SHARP IN BENEFIT OUTING
description: A gala audience, dressed to the teeth, came to the New York Philharmonic's Pension Fund Benefit Concert Wednes day night at Philharmonic Hall, and were treated to a program in kind.

title: Elizabeth Factory to Close
description: ELIZABETH, N.J., Jan. 21 The Inmont Corporation, a major producer of printing inks, announced today that it would close its industrialfinishes divi sion on Magnolia Avenue here before Aug. 1. A corporation spokesman said 80 employes, members of Local 8411 of the Oil, Chemical and Atomic Workers International Union, and Local 478 of the Teamsters Union, would be affected.

title: Century Helps Australia Lead England in Cricket
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Jan. 21 (Reuters)A century by Ian Chappell led Australia today to a solid total of 260 runs for 1 wicket declared on the opening day of the fifth cricket test match against England.

title: A TruthSeeker Finds Caribbean Islands Are Equal to Their Superlatives
description: As tired as I am of hear ing about unheard of islands, fab Grens, dreamy Wind wards, gems of the Antilles, or the eighth continent of the world, I must admit it's all true.

title: Advertising:
description: Liberty magazine, which succumbed after a lingering illness over 20 years ago, will be brought back from the grave in the spring.

title: Anglican Dean of Johannesburg Seized
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Jan. 21  The Anglican Dean of Johannesburg, who has been openly critical of the Gov ernment's policy of racial sep aration, was detained yesterday under an act designed to com bat black terrorism.

title: The Mourning Line
description: When Howard Samuels walked into Grand Central Station yesterday to inspect the offtrack betting facilities there, people reached out to shake his hand.

title: Compact Depth Sounder Introduced for Sailboats
description: A new depth sounder de signed for sailboats has been introduced by Ray Jefferson, a division of Jetronics Indus tries of Philadelphia.

title: ARTHUR S. DEWING OF HARVARD DEAD
description: BOSTON, Jan. 21Dr. Ar thur Stone Dewing, who was once called in a magazine ar ticle the bestloved professor at the Harvard University Graduate School of Business Administration, died yester day in Massachusetts General Hospital. He was 90 years old and lived at 8 Willard Street, Cambridge.

title: Boat Show Preview
description: I have been to the boat show, man and boy, for about 20 years and it has become the official beginning of sum mer for me.

title: Sports of The Times A Bust at Cooperstown
description: Nobody was named a baseball immortal yesterday. There are days like that. The electors issued this state ment: Despite the heaviest vote in the history of Hall of Fame balloting, the Baseball Writers' Association of Amer ica was unable to elect a candidate for enshrinement next summer. Commissioner Bowie Kuhn, while reluctantly admitting disappointment at the failure to elect a candidate for enshrinement, said, The fact that nobody was elected points up the integrity of the institution. Several men were almost named base ball immortals yesterday. Yogi Berra got 242 votes, Early Wynn 240 and Ralph Kiner 212. Before a man can be enshrined, he must play 10 years in the major leagues, be retired for five, and gather 75 per cent of votes cast by the enshrin ers, 10year members of the B.B.W.A.A. This year, with 360 ballots cast, the magic number 270.

title: Hanner Stays With Packers
description: GREEN BAY, Wis., Jan. 21 (AP)Dan Devine named the first of his new Green Bay Packer coaching staff today. Dave Hanner, who has been with the team 13 years as play er and six as defensive line coach, will retain the latter role.

title: Man in the News
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 Four minutes before David Hall was scheduled to be sworn in as Governor of Oklahoma last week, a short man moved unobtrusively to the microphone and said cas ually: The only reason I'm here is to kill four minutes. It was a typically selfeffacing remark by the man who, with in days, would become one of the highest rank ing public officialsin the nation: Speaker of the House of Representatives and third in the Presidential line of succession.

title: TV Stations to Carry Nixon Speech Tonight
description: Six local television sta tions will broadcast Presi dent Nixon's State of the Union Message to a joint ses sion of Congress live tonight at 9 o'clock. They are Channel 2 (WCBSTV), Chan nell 4 (WNBCTV), Channel 7 (WABCTV), Channel 11 (WPIXTV), Channel 13 (WNDTTV) and Channel 31 (WNYCTV).

title: Bill Kinard Gets Post at Ole Miss; Replaces Vaught
description: JACKSON, Miss., Jan. 21 (UPI)  The resignation of John H. Vaught as head foot ball coach at Mississippi was announced today and Billy Kinard was named as his suc cessor.

title: Boat Show Preview
description: Midway throug?? the boat show, the 31yearold adven tureryachtsman, Chay Blyth, hopes to be settling down somewhere in the South Paci fic to eat his haggis.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Credit Is Up Moderately
description: The Federal Reserve contin ued in the last few weeks to pursue a policy of moderate credit expansion, the weekly banking data published yester day indicated.

title: The Right to Leave
description: The recent vengeful trial of Jews attempting to leave Leningrad, the brutal beating and recapture of the Lithuanian seaman seeking asylum on an American Coast Guard vessel, the expressed fear of Solzhenitsyn that if he accepted a Nobel prize in Stock holm, he would be barred forever from his Russian homelandall these events say something sad and signifi cant about the Soviet Union fifty years after the Revolution.

title: British Postal Strike in 2d Day; Telephone CutOff Is Threatened
description: LONDON, Jan. 21 (AP)  Britain, in the second day of a nationwide postal strike, was threatened tonight with a world ban on her manual tele phone, telegraph and Telex links with overseas countries.

title: Kings Sink Penguins
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Jan. 21 (UPI)Bob Berry scored twice and assisted on Al McDon ough's first N.H.L. goal to night as the Los Angeles Kings topped the Pittsburgh Pen guins, 42.

title: Powerboat's Bite Just Too Much for 50Foot Whale
description: Except for the fact that a whale is a mammal, the fol lowing might read like a fish story, but it is true and documented.

title: Sony Develops a Receiver To Get 2 Color Telecasts
description: TOKYO, Jan. 21 (AP)The Sony Corporation announced today it had developed Trini trontype color television re ceivers that can receive the two types of European telecasts.

title: STATE CUTS URGED BY CONSERVATIVES
description: ALBANY, Jan. 21The Con servative party announced its proposed legislative program today. It includes a call for 10 per cent cut in state spend ing because taxpayers are faced in 1971 with another monumental tax increase to pay for the follies of 1970.

title: Nixon to Ask a Wider Environmental Role for States
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21In his environmental message to Congress, now scheduled for Feb. 9, President Nixon will propose a national land use policy that would give states more authority and responsibil ity to conserve areas of criti cal environmental concern than they now have.

title: Ailing Horton of Indians Seen Missing Season
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 21 (UPI) Tony Horton, Cleveland In dian first baseman, will ap parently miss the 1971 sea son because of an emotional illness that has kept him in a hospital almost continuous ly since last August, Man ager Alvin Dark said today.

title: Foreign Policy: Disquiet Over Intelligence Setup
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21  President Nixon has become dissatisfied with the size, cost and loose coordination of the Government's worldwide in telligence operations.

title: ADM. ROY A. GANO, WAR HERO, WAS 68
description: FALLS CHURCH, Va., Jan. 21 Vice Adm. Roy A. Gano, a World War II destroyer com mander who retired in 1964 as commander of the Military Sea Transportation Service, died yesterday at his home, after a long illness, His age was 68.

title: Theater: Condemning an Insidious Form of Racism
description: This season the Negro En semble Company is empha sizing themes of black struggle. In its second pro duction, two short oneact plays, Perry's Mission and Rosalee Prichett, the strug gle is not so much against white supremacy as against a more insidious form of racismthe imposition of values by whites on blacks and the acceptance by blacks of those values. The plays, which opened last night at the St. Marks Playhouse, condemn whites as models, blacks as passive receivers.

title: Boat Show Preview
description: Vincenzo Balestrieri, the 1970 world off shore power boat champion from Rome, is already two races ahead of his nearest rivals, following two victories in the first con tests of 1971.

title: Hughes, 49ers' Aide on Offense, Named to Succeed Lemm as Oilers' Coach
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 21 (AP) The Houston Oilers selected Ed Hughes, the offensive assistant for the San Francisco 49ers, as their new head coach today.

title: Stock Exchange Fills Its No. 2 Position;
description: The New York Stock Ex change filled a key executive position yesterday with the ap pointment of Richard B. How land as executive vice pres ident, effective March 1. He will replace R. John Cunning ham, whose resignation takes effect the same date.

title: Executive Changes
description: Edward I. O'Brien has been named chairman of the executive committee of Bache & Co., succeed ing John E. Leslie, who continues as chaiman and chief executive of ficer. Mr. O'Brien, who had been an executive vice president of the brokerage firm, con tinues to be in charge of its branch office system. The firm also appointed Frank A. Digaetano and Stanley F. Klimczak ex ecutive vice presidents. Mr. Digaetano, who con tiaues as controller and vice chairman of the fi nance committee, will will head the operations group, while Mr. Klimczak, formerly head of opera tions, will be in charge of the United States and Canadian branch office system.

title: Richard B. Russell Dead at 73; Georgian Was Dean of Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 Richard B. Russell, one of the most powerful men in the Sen ate, died today at Walter Reed Army Medical Center, where he had been since Dec. 8. The center listed the cause of death as respiratory insufficiency, re sulting from pulmonary defi ciency. The Georgia Democrat, the senior member of the Sen ate, was 73 old.

title: 64 IN HOUSE SEEK CURB IN CAMBODIA
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21Leg islation to ban the use of funds to provide United States air or sea combat support for any military operations in Cam bodia was introduced in the House by 64 Democratic Repre sentatives today as concern mounted in the new Congress over further American involve ment in the Indochina war.

title: Theater: Promises Kept
description: There are moments when old quotes can be acutely embarrassing to old critics. For shows do occasionally outlive their virtues and, as a consequence, outwear their praise. A show that in, say, 1966, appealed to a critic as just about the funniest damned tragedy in town, may a mere two years later have lost not only both its humor and its tragedy, but also its cast.

title: Registration Infractions, Lack Of Equipment Chief Violations
description: Boat registration infrac tions and lack of approved lifesaving devices proved to be the major violations among pleasure boaters in the Middle Atlantic states last year, acoording to Coast Guard officials.

title: Small Craft Instructors Prepare for 4th Season
description: If you are more than 16 years old, can float fully clothed for 10 minutes and want to learn how to sail or canoe safely, the Amer ican Small Craft Association will teach you in just six weeks, and for free.

title: WARSAW LEADERS SEE WEST GERMAN
description: WARSAW, Jan. 21Dr. Rainer Barzel, head of the West German opposition party, con ferred with Polish leaders to day on the sensitive issue of ethnic German emigration.

title: DR. GEORGE W. SHERA
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., Jan. 21 Dr. George W. Shera of Eton Hall, Garth Road, a member of the Academy of Dentistry, died yesterday in White Plains Hos pital after a short Illness. His age was 79.

title: Cast Begins Rehearsal For Albee's All Over
description: Edward Albee's now full length play, All Over, goes into rehearsal Feb. 8 with a cast of Jessica Tandy, Col leen Dewhurst, George Vos kovec, Peggy Wood, Madeline Sherwood, Edgar Stehli and James Ray. Sir John Gielgud will direct.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Schumann and Sensibility
description: A pianist who can hold the listener's interest despite un even playing is more to be prized than one who is note perfect but brings no imagi nation to the music. A re minder of this truism was the recital by Maria Clodes in Alice Tully Hall on Wednesday evening. The Brazilianborn artist, who made her New York debut four years ago and now teaches at Boston University, can blur phrases, scramble notes or even lose her way on occasion despite an ad mirable technique. Yet she has enough sensibility and temperament to make one ignore the flaws and attend to what and how she is playing.

title: MRS. CHARLES KRASNER
description: Mrs. Frances Wein Krasner of 14010 Franklin Avenue, Flushing, Queens, wife of Dr. Charles Krasner, a past presi dent of the Chiropractic Asso ciation of New York, died Wednesday in Whitestone Gen eral Hospital after a short ill ness. She was 43 years old.

title: Merger News
description: Heublein, Inc., a leading producer of alcoholic beverages and specialty foods, announced plans yesterday to enter the fastfood retailoutlet business by combining with the Ken tucky Fried Chicken Corpora tion, through an exchange of stock worth approximately $250million. Both companies said they were en gaged in explora tory discussions with a view to ward a possible business combina tion. If any preliminary agreement is reached by the two concerns, it will be subject to negotiation of a definitive merger contract that would re quire approval of the directors and shareholders of both com panies.

title: War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Jan, 21 (UPI) The Defense Department said today that the following serv icemen from the New York area had been killed in action in Southeast Asia.

title: THREE CARD 64'S IN PHOENIX OPEN
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Jan. 21  Subpar rounds were so numer ous today that the top of the scoring column was crowded in the opening round of the $125,000 Phoenix open golf tournament.

title: SOLOMON HECHT
description: Solomon Hecht, an artist, sculptor, author and inventor, died yesterday of a ruptured appendix in Doctors Hospital. He was 83 years old and lived at 425 West 25th Street.

title: Screen:
description: In bringing Promise at Dawn to the screen, Jules Dassin has, not unfairly, turned Romain Gary's mem oir into what I believe is called an affectionate por trait. Although it possesses certain generic virtuesaf fectionateness, for example the affectionate portrait is not by any stretch a major dramatic or cinematic form. And because Dassin is a film maker whose movies, no mat ter what they lack, never lack a sense of formal identity, he has, as if by way of com pensation added a lot of his own to what might otherwise be a rather conventional study of an unconventional woman.

title: A Salvage Case Tests Sanitation Department
description: New York's Sanitation Department tows away more than 50,000 abandoned cars from the city's streets each year.

title: Nixon Cites Gains in Programs That Provide Food for the Poor
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 President Nixon said today that the number of persons re ceiving food stamps had tri pled in the last year, but warned that this is no time to sit back or case off in our ef forts to feed the poor.

title: The NotSoSilent Soviet Jews
description: It was only a halfdecade ago that Elie Wiesel referred to Soviet Jewry as the Jews of silence who spoke only with their eyes. How distant does this characterization now seem. The Sim chat Torah demonstration in front of the main synagogue in Moscow has been an annual affair with thousands of youngsters singing and dancing to Yiddish and Hebrew songs. A specifi cally Jewish samizdat, manuscripts of Jewish interest, poetry and tapes of Yiddish and Hebrew songs, circulates widely in underground fashion.

title: Excerpts From Speech by Mansfield to Senate Democratic Caucus
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 Following are excerpts from a speech to a Senate Demo cratic caucus today by the majority leader, Mike Mans field of Montana:

title: 1971 Is the Year of Decision for Choosing Radiotelephones
description: Just when most boatmen were getting introduced to electronic equipment and nomenclature and were be ginning to differentiate be tween a megacycle and a small imported motorcycle, the people in the electronics industry changed it to mega hertz.

title: City Bid on Parity Accord Turned Down by P.B.A.
description: The Lindsay administration has explored unsuccess fully an outofcourt settlement with the Patrolmen's Benev olent Association on the parity issue to avoid a protracted lawsuit that could exacerbate present tensions.

title: Boat Show Preview
description: Although the 21st chal lenge for the America's Cup ended last September with the defeat of Gretel II, four races to one, by Intrepid, the controversy of that match lingers on.

title: Marines on Carriers
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 21An American military spokesman today corrected an earlier statement by the United States command that no com bat marines were aboard two American helicopter carriers off the Cambodian coast that were launching missions in support of the allies on Route 4.

title: Of Fish, Oil and Oceans
description: The latest tiff between the United States and Ecuador over the seizing of American tuna boats underscores again the imperative need for an international regime to govern the orderly development of oceanic resources for all countries. There is no practical alternative to international authority, preferably exercized under the United Nations. At stake among other considerations is the ancient and precious doctrine of freedom of the seas.

title: Monday Holidays Called New Spur To Boat Industry
description: Smallboat skippersno tably sportfishermen will pump millions of dollars into the nation's economy with they socalled Monday Holi day Law taking effect this year.

title: S.I. HIGH SCHOOL REMAINS CLOSED
description: Classes at Port Richmond High School on Staten Island remained suspended yesterday as school officials met with teachers, students, parents and community leaders in an effort to ease the racial tensions that forced classes to be suspended on Wednesday.

title: Russell of Georgia
description: The death of Richard B. Russell of Georgia removes from the national scene the ablest and most widely respected of the orthodox Southern conservatives. In thirtyeight years in the Senate, he moved from a young New Deal supporter to dean and chief strategist of the Senate Establishment.

title: Democratic Chiefs Assail Port Authority on Transit
description: ALBANY, Jan. 21  The Democratic leaders of the Leg islature urged Governor Rocke feller and Gov. William T. Ca hill of New Jersey today to take immediate positive steps to require the Port of New York Authority to help solve masstransportation problems in the New York metropolitan area.

title: Bernard Cehan, an Official Of Radio Free Europe, Dies
description: Bernard Cehan, chief of the Rumanian desk of Radio Free Europe in New York City, died yesterday in St. Luke's Hospital, after a long illness. He was 60 years old and lived at 201 East 21st Street.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: AMEX REGISTERS 9TH GAIN IN A ROW
description: The American Stock Exchange turned in its ninth consecu tive advance yesterday in steppedup trading.

title: Computer Science Joins Hands With Tradition in the Art of Sailmaking
description: A few thousand years ago, mana toolusing and work avoiding animal  noticed that wind could move a boat on water. The art of sailmak ing was born.

title: Short-Film Program
description: The Whitney Museum's second program of short films by experimental movie-makers, opening yesterday and running 70 minutes, continues a worthy policy and project.The 12 films themselves, as invariably happens whenever more than four avant-garde exercises cluster together, are something else. Approach with caution. A sense of humor, believe us, will help. Some viewers may even race home and flick on a Hardy Family feature on television. The Kettles will do.The shifting, abstract color imagery of Jordan Belson's "Cosmos," which unfurls to electronic sound, is attributed in the program notes to the artist's insight from experience with drugs and yoga. Fair enough.Barry Spinello's "Six Loop Paintings" uses dots and lines, coming on with rat-a-tat-tat beep-beep precision, while "Electronic Moon #2" is a circular-shaped mass of colors that shift to a piano tinkling of Debussy's "Clair de Lune." Jud Yalkut and Nam June Paik made this one.Michael Mideke's "The Secret of the Golden Flower" whisks past like lightning, using sacred symbols and religious drawings. Nor is "Yantra" by James Whitney a slouch, as shimmering, splintering and floating color forms suggest a Fourth of July celebration. The sound tracktake it from one who was there  suggests the Battle of the Bulge.Fred Mogubgub's "What the Hell," our favorite title, uses a folk ballad, "Mister Bojangles," animated sketches and random shots of various people simpering at the camera. In Robert Breer's "Breathing," black line fragments move on a white screen, to the sound of panting and gulping.Set to rock rhythm, Charles Wyndham's "Air-born" contains blue-green-white images denoting space movement. The painfully specific abstracts of John Hawkins's "LSD Wall" are in extremely questionable taste. Michael Whitney's "Binary Bit Patterns" is a mercifully short exercise in graphics.Patrick O'Neill's "7362" uses twin abstracts and sounds like Judgment Day. Much more attractive is the slapdash brevity and flavor of Mr. Mogubgub's "Unknown Reasons," with some nice bittersweet music by a piano and small ensemble.

title: 4 Held After Ad Man Is Beaten
description: A 61yearold advertising ex ecutive was beaten by a gang of 20 youths and men early yesterday in Times Square when he resisted being robbed.

title: NAVY TOP SERVES SEVERAL PURPOSES
description: Among the many accessa ries available to the boat owner is the folding top, sometimes called the navy top. Many boat manufactur ers offer tailoredtofit mod els, while a number of accessory firms offer assorted tops of various lengths and widths, which will fit on most boats.

title: Cryan, ExRider Star, Dies
description: TRENTON, Jan. 21 (AP) Jack Cryan, the highest scorer in Rider College basketball his tory, died today of cancer at the age of 27. He had been ill for a year. Cryan scored 1,387 points during his career at Rider and led the nation in foul shooting in 1996, his senior year, with a 91.9 percentage.

title: Delegate Is Not Seated
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Jan. 21 (UPI)The West Virginia House of Delegates voted 6137 not to seat Delegateelect W. R. Wilson, athletic director of Fairmount State College. The Rules Committee held Mr. Wil son was ineligible under an amendment passed Nov. 3 that bars from the Legislature em ployes of the state or Federal Governments.

title: Myriad of New Products Range From OneMan Winch to Antiburglar Device
description: Woolsey, the paintmaker, has prepared 19 new prod ucts for the boat show, and one of the most appealing, and probably most impor tant, is a revolutionary new type of winch.

title: Cowles and Hearst Accused by F.T.C. In Magazine Sales
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP) The Federal Trade Commis sion said today it had filed formal complaints against Cowles Communications, Inc., and the Hearst Corporation for allegedly using deceptive means to get magazine subscriptions.

title: Anne Haigney Becomes Bride Of Philip Roome in Larchmont
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Jan. 21 Miss Anne Haigney, daugh of John Eustace Haigney, president of the Rheingold Corporation, and Mrs. Haig ney, was married here this afternoon to Philip Lee Roome, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Lee Roome of New York and Scottsdale, Ariz. The cere mony in St. Augustine's Ro man Catholic Church was performed by the Rev. Vin cent McShane.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
NIXON TO ASK 92D CONGRESS FOR RESHAPING OF CABINET
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 President Nixon has informed his Cabinet that he will seek the most massive reorganiza tion of the Federal Government in history, eliminating seven ex ecutive departments and fusing them into four new ones.

title: Short Interest Declines by 1% At Big Board and 12% at Amex
description: A small drop in the monthly short interest figures at the New York Stock Exchange was reported yesterday.

title: State by State List of Safety, Health Regulations
description: This diagram indicates states' regulations on safety and health.

title: Evanson Sloops at Show
description: P. Evanson of Riverside, N.J., is back in the show with its Robin and Celebrity Class fiberglass sloops.

title: BUILDING STARTED IN RENEWAL AREA
description: Franklin A. Thomas, the head of the BedfordStuyvesant Restoration Corporation, said yesterday that his organization had broken ground for the construction of a sixstory apartment house that marked the beginning of a building pro gram.

title: Advertising:
description: At a buffet luncheon at Gaynor & Ducas yesterday, B. John Heistein, the new North American chief of Scan dinavian Airlines Systems, unveiled the first advertising campaign since he restructured the marketing operation.
