title: 6 Die in U.S. Copter Crash
description: SAIGON, Friday Jan. 22 (Reu ters)Six United States Ma rines were killed and 16 were injured yesterday when a Ma rine CH46 Sea Knight heli copter crashed 20 miles south west of Danang, the United States military command re ported today.

title: Menu Suggestions For the Weekend
description: In the menus below, dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: ARMY CLEARS A G.I. OF MYLAI CHARGES
description: FORT McPHERSON, Ga., Jan. 21 (AP)The Army an nounced today that it had dropped charges against an other enlisted man accused of murdering civilians during an assault on the hamlet of Mylai 4 in South Vietnam in 1968.

title: Fans Urge Patriots to Go for Broke: Draft Plunkett
description: On Monday, the Boston Patriots will announce their intentions regarding Jim Plunkett, the Heisman Tro phy quarterback from Stan ford, in next Thursday's Na tional Football League draft.

title: Lawyer Is Ordered to Testify On Alleged Attempt to Fix Case
description: A lawyer described as a very important witness in a Brooklyn investigation of possi ble official corruption, includ ing an alleged attempt to bribe a judge, was directed yesterday to testify before a grand jury.

title: Cruisers, Inc., Showing 6
description: Six fiberglass powerboats, all with either cathedral or Vhulls and ranging in size from 17 to 22 feet, are being shown by Cruisers, Inc., of Oconto, Wis. Two models are new. They are the 19foot Vacationer Camper, an out boardpowered family boat, and the 17foot Charger, a deepV sports runabout.

title: ST. PETERSBURG
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Jan. 21 The Old South is mourning the death of Senator Richard Russell of Georgia, but there is a New South, now partly liberated from history, and the tragedy of Dick Russell is that he was sick and old when the political transforma tion of the South took place.

title: Pope Paul and Alfrink Confer On Tensions in Dutch Church
description: ROME, Jan. 21Pope Paul VI and the Roman Catholic primate of the Netherlands, Bernard Cardinal Alfrink, had their first meeting in six months today, and for 90 minutes discussed tensions within the Dutch church.

title: Authentic Chinese Dishes and Questionable New Orleans
description: The restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored where indicated.

title: NEW YORK PLAN FOES SCORE RULE CHANGE
description: Spokesmen for groups that oppose the New York Plana program to train black and Puerto Rican workers for jobs in the construction industry charged yesterday that Mayor Lindsay issued a secret execu tive order earlier this week that weakened regulations on minor ity employment.

title: Pompidou Terms British Unrealistic on Market
description: PARIS, Jan. 21President Pompidou asserted today that Britain had not yet adopted a serious negotiating position for membership in the Common Market and called for more realism on her part.

title: LAYER HALTS ASHE IN STRAIGHT SETS
description: Rod Laver won two thrilling tiebreaker sets from Arthur Ashe last night in Madison Square Garden and continued as King of the Hill in the $210,000 Tennis Champions Classic.

title: The Delta Wing Kite Is Providing New Twist for WaterSkiers
description: The hottest new twist in waterskiing is an idea put forth by Leonardo da Vinci about 500 years ago  the concept of wings for man. This now takes form in the dartshaped, delta wing kite which is breaking all rec ords for air borne skiers.

title: A House of Lords Sought
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (UPI)  Representative Clarence J. Brown, Republican of Ohio, cir culated a proposal today to replace the United States Sen ate with a House of Lords em powered to do little except issue resolutions. Mr. Brown framed his proposal as a con stitutional amendment and sent copies to his colleagues. He said his proposal was inspired by the inability of the last Senate to make the legislative process work.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: New Army Guard Chief Named by Governor
description: ALBANY, Jan. 21 (UPI) Maj. Gen. John C. Baker to day was named chief of staff to Governor Rockefeller and commanding general of the New York Army National Guard.

title: Colombo Named Man of Year by Paper
description: Joseph Colombo, who is listed by the Department of Justice as a member of organ ized crime's national commis sion, has been named Man of the Year for 1970 by a weekly newspaper regarded in Italian American circles as the un official voice of the Italian American Civil Rights League.

title: Winnipeg Cruise Traces Old Fur Route
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba If your maxicruise to South America has been scuttled by the stock market and a mini cruise bareboat charter in the Caribbean is beyond your nautical skill, don't give up the ship. Wait till summer and try a 600mile midicruise on Lake Winnipeg.

title: UNCLEAN WATER AN OLD PROBLEM
description: Don't get the idea that water pollution is a new problem for boatmen.

title: Government Says Arms Dealer Owes $2Million Taxes
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21The Federal Government is seeking more than $2.4million in back income taxes from the world's largest private arms dealer, Samuel A. Cummings.

title: COUNCILMEN MULL TAXI LEGISLATION
description: The City Council's Consumer Affairs Committee met all day yesterday and into this morning in an unsuccessful attempt to hammer out new taxi legislation.

title: Jury Deliberates Sixth Day In Manson's Murder Trial
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 21The jury in the murder trial of Charles M, Manson deliberated for a sixth day today but again failed to reach a verdict.

title: Raiders Wore Uniforms Of Guards, One Reports
description: PNOMPENH, Friday, Jan. 22 (AP)  The raid on the airport was carried out by enemy sappers who slipped into the civilian terminal and killed the guards, a guard who escaped said. They then stripped the dead of their uniforms and disguised them selves as Cambodians. They threw satchel charges among the building and planes and shot at the surprised per sonnel.

title: Keep the First Ride Calm
description: If you have ever been in a group of people discussing flying, you probably heard an older person tell about his first airplane ride back in the barnstorming days. The usual line is that the youngster at the plane's con trols couldn't resist the urge to do a few stunts while giving somebody his first ride, thereby scaring the poor fellow out of any further desire to fly.

title: PHILIP M. KELLY
description: PORT SALERNO, Fla., Jan. 21  Philip M. Kelly, who re tired in 1960 as controller of the Central Railroad of New Jersey, died here Tuesday at Martin Memorial Hospital. He was 75 years old and lived at 999 Woodland Avenue, Plain field, N. J.

title: KIERNAN SAYS CITY AFFIRMED PARITY
description: Edward J. Kiernan, president of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association, testified yesterday that the city's Director of La bor Relations acknowledged orally at various times last winter that the city owed the patrolmen a pay parity adjust ment.

title: MRS. SAM T. GIBSON
description: BETHESDA, Md., Jan. 21 Mrs. Alice Chase Gibson, wife of Dr. Sam T. Gibson, assistant director of the division of bio logical standards of the Na tional Institutes of Health, died Tuesday in Suburban Hospital of injuries suffered in an auto mobile accident last week. She was 54 years old.

title: Reeling Knicks Face Toughest Part of Schedule
description: A natural dividing line has turned up on the schedule for the New York Knicks, who returned from Chicago yesterday and went straight from the airport to a prac tice session.

title: A Soviet View On Jews
description: MOSCOWSoviet public opinion is quite naturally disturbed by the ter rorist acts perpetrated against Soviet institutions and their personnel in the United States by the Zionist Jewish Defense League. It cannot help but wonder about the implications of this campaign for AmericanSoviet rela tions and the cause of international peace.

title: Books of The Times
description: THIS BOOK IS ABOUT SCHOOLS. Edited by Satu Repo. With an Introduction by Herbert Kohl. 457 pages. Pantheon. $7.95.

title: Air Fare Rise Backed
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (Reu ters)  The Department of Transportation recommended today that the Civil Aeronau tics Board approve proposed transatlantic airline fare in creases of about 6 per cent. The increases would become effec tive April 1.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: BONNAssaying Chinese intentions according to Chinese statements is more like reading tea leaves than studying an electrocardiogram. Never theless, with this caution in mind, there are hints that Peking is adjusting to the thought that China is not the hub of a dream world and must face the realities around it.

title: EAGLESHAM FIRST ON HIALEAH TURF
description: MIAMI, Jan. 21 (AP)John M. Olin's Eaglesham, closing with a rush, captured the fea ture at Hialeah Park today, scoring by 1 lengths from Hydronaut. Native Orphan was third, 2 lengths behind Hy dronaut and a head in front of Swamp Fighter.

title: U.S. AND RUSSIANS REACH MOON PACT
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 21The United States and the Soviet Union agreed today to ex change moon samples as part of a wideranging accord on increasing space cooperation between the two countries.

title: Entrance to Pass Freed
description: PNOMPENH, Friday, Jan. 22 (AP)  Cambodian soldiers re portedly captured the craggy northern entrance to Pich Nil Pass yesterday, ousting enemy troops who for two months have blocked fuel and other supplies from reaching Pnom penh.

title: ROCKEFELLER PLANS RISE IN SALES TAX
description: ALBANY, Jan. 21The Rocke feller administration has pre pared an $8.4billion budget for fiscal 197172 that would re quire tax increases of more than $750million, including a 1cent increase in the state sales tax.

title: General Electric Reports Peak Results in Quarter
description: The General Electric Com pany reported yesterday its best fourth quarter ever and as a result sales and earnings for 1970 ran well above 1969 results despite effects of the 14week strike that ended last January.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 0.7 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials rose to 107.3 Tuesday from 106.6 last week.

title: Roche of G. M. Urges Easing of Inflation
description: DETROIT, Jan. 21  Infla tion must be eased if our economy is to survive, and if we are to maintain our com petitive position in the market places of the world, James M. Roche, chairman of the Gener al Motors Corporation, said to day.

title: Flyers Get Bruins' Schock
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 21 (AP)The Philadelphia Flyers acquired Danny Schock, a 22 yearold forward, from the Boston Bruins today in a trade for a player to be named later.

title: Spain's Reserve Brakeman Killed in a Bobsled Crash
description: CERVINIA, Italy, Jan. 21 (AP)  Luis Lopez Solanes, substituting as brakeman on Spain's No. 1 bobsled, was killed today on the final day of trials for the world champ ionship for twoman sleds.

title: Plea Made for Bonn Aide
description: BONN, Jan. 21  President Gustav Heinemann telephoned Skou Tour, the President of Guinea, today to plead for lenient treatment of Adolf Marx, a West German technical aid worker who faces a death sentence in Conakry, the capital of Guinea.

title: Associate Law Dean Picked To Succeed Bok at Harvard
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Jan. 21 (AP  Albert M. Sacks, asso ciate dean of the Harvard Law School, has been appointed act ing dean to replace Derek Cur tis Bok, the newly named pres ident of the university.

title: North Sea Oil May Affect Price Dispute
description: LONDON, Jan. 20The emer gence of the North Sea as major oil produc'ng area on Northern Europe's doorstep is expected to prove both a bar gaining counter and a psycho logical complication in the present price negotiations be tween the big oil companies and producing countries.

title: No Oil Accord Is Reached But Talks Will Continue
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Jan. 21 Representatives of oilproduc ing countries and Western oil companies failed to reconcile any of their differences at a meeting here today but agreed to continue talks here next week.

title: After the Parity Decision
description: Now that the police parity case is back on its way to orderly resolution through the courts, it is important that the city have a clear strategy to guard against repeating the errors that led up to the present litigation, with all its dismaying economic potentialities.

title: A Coalition Seeks Quiet On Campus
description: NEW HAVEN, Jan. 21A coalition of politically liberal and conservative college stu dents announced today the formation of an organization to fight violence and destruc tion on Connecticut campuses.

title: SLALOM RACE WON BY MISS CLIFFORD
description: SCHRUNS, Austria, Jan. 21 (UPI)The French domination of women's skiing this season came to a halt today as Betsy Clifford of Canada and Wiltrud Drexel of Austria captured top honors at the Golden Key ski meet.

title: Freshman's First Day: Four Little Words
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 Les Aspin of Racine, Wis, spoke four words in public here todayhere Albert and I do.

title: 3 BANKS HERE CUT HOMELOAN RATE
description: Three of the leading commer cial banks in New York First National City Bank, Chase Manhattan Bank and Chemical Bankyesterday announced re ductions in the mortgage rate on residential housing.

title: Miss Jane Carolyn Spaeth Is Married
description: Miss Jane Carolyn Spaeth and Peter Raymond Eyes were married Dec. 27 in the South United Methodist Church, Manchester, Conn., by the Rev. Earle Custer, who was assisted by the Rev. Gary Cornell and by the bride's uncle, the Rev. David Bauer. Mr. and Mrs. Charles Spaeth of Manchester and Mr. and Mrs. Raymond Eyes of West port, Conn., are the parents of the couple. Mr. Spaeth is a project engineer with Pratt & Whitney Aircraft, and the bridegroom's father is pub lisher of McCall's magazine.

title: TV Review
description: Henry Fonda, the actor who apparently has found a better pill, than Geritol to ward off geriatric attrition, is handsome and personable enough to make a viewer listen to his arguments for buying a camera.

title: Mrs. Henry C. Marks Dies; ExCity Draft Board Aide
description: Mrs. Eva Breger Marks, widow of Henry C. Marks, a founder and former vice presi dent of the Howard Stores Cor poration, men's clothing manu facturers, died yesterday in Doctors Hospital. She lived in the SherryNetherland Hotel.

title: Union, Phone Company Heads to Meet
description: The president of the New York Telephone Company last night accepted an offer from the head of the Communica tions Workers of America for a meeting between them to seek an end to the 11dayold repairmen's strike against the company.

title: CHARGES BY NADER DENIED BY CARBIDE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP) An executive of the Union Carbide Corporation acknowl edged today that the company had made a mistake in resisting Federal efforts to curb air pol lution from its plant in Marietta, Ohio.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Top Aqua Cats Win Clamato Bowls
description: Gretel II and Intrepid weren't the only boats racing in Newport, R. I., during the two weeks at took to run off the America's Cup. The press covering the event competed among themselves on days the 12 meters were not racing and the top sailors in the catamaran races were awarded Clamato Bowls.

title: Head of Investor Insurance Plan Named
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21  Byron D. Woodside, a Republi can and former member of the Securities and Exchange Com mission, was nominated by Pres ident Nixon today to be chair man of the New Securities In vestor Protection Corporation. This is the organization that will insure customers of bank rupt brokerage firms against losses of up to $20,000 in cash and $50,000 in cash and se curities combined.

title: Rates of Bonds Decline;
description: Interest rates declined throughout the money and cap ital markets yesterday as Wall Street confidently asserted it could handle all the new fi nancing announced on Wednes day.

title: Bronx High School of Science Accused of Bias in Admissions
description: A Manhattan community school board charged yester day that an admissions policy based on entrance examina tions made the Bronx High School of Science the most seg regated school in the city.

title: DR. FREDERIC KENNY OF HUNTER FACULTY
description: BRICK TOWN, N.J., Jan. 21  Dr. Frederic J. Kenny, pro fessor emeritus of chemistry at Hunter College, died yesterday at his home, 395 Princeton Avenue. He was 76 years old.

title: DOW INDEX HITS 14MONTH PEAK
description: While Wall Street analysts kept waiting for the stock mar ket to ease back and consoli date, a spurt of power in General Electric and Westing house Electric sent the Dow Jones industrial average to a fresh 14month high.

title: Progress in the House
description: For those optimists who had hoped the House of Representatives would overnight rid itself of its least desirable features, the achievements of its current re formers will be greeted with but moderate rapture.

title: Nautical Reading: Practical to Esoteric
description: There are two kinds of boating books: The ones you buy for yourself, and the ones your friends buy for you.

title: 100th Peace Talks Session: Each Blames Other
description: PARIS, Jan. 21The Vietnam peace negotiators completed their 100th session today, but the milestone was not a festive occasion.

title: West Indies Charter Group Expanding
description: Chartering a luxury yacht for a sailing vacation in the British West Indies may soon be as simple as renting an automobile.

title: Boat Show Preview
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla. Students of ocean sailboat racing are brushing up on their nautical alphabet as the winter bluewater super test ing tank, also known as the Southern Ocean Racing Con ference (S.O.R.C.), near its opening race, the 105mile St. PetersburgoVenice event, next Friday.

title: Potential Outstrips Facilities in North Queens Yachting
description: The north shore of Queens may not be the boating capi tal of the East, but it has natural assets to become a leader when facilities are made available to match Queens's population and scenery.

title: Soybean Futures Show Price Drop; Grains Also Down
description: Profit taking and apparent speculative liquidation sent soy bean futures prices reeling on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday dragging down the prices of grains as well. Soy bean oil and meal prices also cased along with iced broilers.

title: Yacht Photography Rife With Peril, Frustration
description: As anyone who has ever raced anything from a Sun fish to an oceangoing yawl knows, the last thing in the world you need is some little stinkpot throwing a wake at you.

title: New York to Offer 94 Stakes Races
description: The New York Racing Asso ciation will offer 94 stakes races on the flat through its 1971 campaign, which will run from March 8 through Dec. 4, officials said yesterday. The slate includes a dozen races worth $100,000 or more, the richest being the BelmontStakes and the Champagne, each worth $125,000.

title: 3 Sophomore Deans Find Running Law Schools a Bit of a Trial
description: The law school deans at Columbia, Yale and the Uni versity of Pennsylvania are separated by geography, but joined by problems, goals and discoveries.

title: Merrick Sues for $1 Million On Unauthorized Bus Ad
description: David Merrick, the producer, has filed a $1million invasion ofprivacy suit alleging that his name and picture were used without authorization in bus advertisements for an exotic fruit and rice salad.

title: THEFT OF SERVICE LAID TO 8 ON L.I.R.
description: Eight commuters on the Long Island Railroad have been arrested in the last two weeks and charged with using coun terfeit or invalid tickets, and the railroad is considering dropping its present system.

title: Repertory Theater Names Coggeshall as President
description: Clarke Coggeshall, a for mer banker who has been executive vice president of the Repertory Company of Lincoln Center since April, has been named president of the board and chief operating officer.

title: 2 Dead Miners Are Faulted in Blast That Killed 38
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Jan. 21 Two miners who died in an ex plosion near Hyden on Dec. 30 were charged with a share of the blame today following a report by the Kentucky Depart ment of Mines and Minerals.

title: Joseph J. Meggs, 53, Clown For Ringling Bros., Dies
description: CLINTON, Iowa (UPI)  Jo seph Meggs, a Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey clown, died yesterday after a heart attack at a construction site near Cordova, Ill. He was 53 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Store Sales Increase
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21The Commerce Department today estimated last week's depart ment store sales at $593 million, up 7 per cent from the yearearlier $555million.

title: Texaco Yearly Profit Up;
description: Net income and revenues of Texaco, Inc., advanced in the fourth quarter and for the year in 1970, the giant oil company announced yesterday.

title: Floridians to Discuss Canal
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP) The Florida Congressional delegation will meet tomorrow to discuss President Nixon's action halting construction of the CrossFlorida Barge Canal. Col. Avery Fullerton, the Army Engineers' district engineer at Jacksonville, Fla., is expected to be present, along with a rep resentative of Secretary of the Army Stanley R. Resor.

title: Mayors Oppose Aid Cuts To Fund Revenue Sharing
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21  The mayors of 15 big cities, meeting on the eve of President Nixon's State of the Union Message, said today that they would oppose any cuts or al terations in present urban pro grams to make way for rev enue sharing.

title: PHILIP J. BOWERS
description: RED BANK, N.J., Jan. 21 Philip J. Bowers, vice president of the Philip J. Bowers Com pany, a real estate and build ing company here, died ap parently of a heart attack yes terday on a business trip to Fort Lauderdale, Fla. He was 56 years old.

title: COLUMBIA REMOVES LEGAL AID DIRECTOR
description: The director of a federally financed legal aid program at the Columbia University Law School charged yesterday that he had been dismissed by the school's dean for telling the Government that it was paying too much for the program.

title: Photography Enthusiasts Given Seaworthy Advice
description: Perched alternately on the deck and flying bridge of a powerboat, a photographer snapped hundreds of pictures of majestic yachts under sail. Sometimes a companion held his belt to prevent his being swept overboard.

title: Indiana LosingR.O.T.C.Units
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21 (AP) The Air Force announced to day that Reserve Officer Train ing Corps units would be abol ished at two Indiana universi ties where enrollment in the program had dropped off. It said the unit at Ball State Uni versity would be dropped July 31 and the unit at Butler would be discontinued by July, 1974.

title: In Carlisle, Bitterness Over Tory Plan to Sell Pubs
description: CARLISLE, England, Jan. 21In the Sportsman Inn, the men in cloth caps sipped beer at noon today in a sul len mood.

title: Lon Nol, Ending Visit in Saigon, Reaches Accords
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 21Ending a twoday visit here, Premier Lon Nol of Cambodia announced agree ments today to expand rela tions and reduce tensions with South Vietnam.

title: Eleanor French Is Dead at 66; In Y.W.C.A. and Church Posts
description: Eleanor French, a former staff member of the National Board of the Young Women's Christian Association of the U.S.A., the World Y.W.C.A. and Church Women United, died Wednesday of a heart at tack in St. Luke's Hospital. She was 66 years old and lived at 549 West 123d Street.

title: BIG MAN TARGET OF SECRET DRAFT
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Jan. 21 With the exception of the Utah Stars, who have Zelmo Beaty, the American Basketball Association owners, general managers and coaches agreed today that what they need most for parity with the Na tional Basketball Association are centers with glamour.

title: Voltage in State Cut 5% by Breakdowns And Heavy Demand
description: The Consolidated Edison Company and four other pow er companies in the New York State Power Pool reduced vol tage late yesterday afternoon as the result of a tight power supply attributed to heavy de mand and equipment break downs.

title: Berra Comes Closest, but No Player Gains Enough Votes for Hall of Fame
F.C.C. Plans a Wide A.T.&T. Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 21The Federal Communications Com mission announced tonight comprehensive Investigation of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company. The F.C.C. will examine not only A.T.&T.'s request for a major rate in crease but also its mounting costs, charges of discriminatory hiring practices and the com pany's control of the Western Electric manufacturing sub sidiary.

title: The 1980's: New Food and Armchair Shopping?
description: Ten years from now, peo ple will be eating imitation meat made from spun soy protein. Housewives will do their shopping via cable tele vision, microwave ovens will cook meals in 10 seconds, and children will be making fewer visits to the dentist be cause tooth decay will be on its last legs.

title: Perjury in Gambling Case Laid to Harlem Police Unit
description: All four members of a Har lem police precinct's special gambling enforcement unit were indicted yesterday on perjury charges.

title: DUNN SAYS GUILTY IN MORTGAGE CASE
description: WHITE PLAINS, Jan. 21  Tom Dunn, the television news caster indicted last month on a charge of participating in fraudulent mortgage transac tions, pleaded guilty to a re duced charge in County Court here today.

title: Time Inc. Names Chairman Of Its Finance Committee
description: Time Inc. announced yester day the appointment of Roy E. Larsen as chairman of its finance committee. He succeeds David W. Brumbaugh, who is retiring at the end of May.

title: LEONARD SCHIFF, COAST PHYSICIST
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Jan. 22 Dr. Leonard Schiff, a dis tinguished scientist and mem ber of the Stanford University faculty, died apparently of a heart attack on Tuesday. He was 55 years old. A funeral service was held today.

title: More of Factory Capacity Was Idle in 4th Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22  The nation's factories operated on the average at only 72.3 per cent of capacity in the fourth quarter of last year, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Jan. 22Just before the Commonwealth Prime Ministers' con ference in Singapore, a British poli tician notably free of illusions ex pressed the hope that Prime Minister Heath would agree there to a six month delay in his plans to sell mari time arms to South Africa.

title: Market Moves Urged
description: BRUSSELS, Jan. 21  A spokesman of the European Common Market said today that the Teheran talks sharpened the need for the six member nations to harmonize their en ergy policies instead of leav ing them dispersed at the na tional level.

title: EUGENE WOOD DEAD; STAGE ACTOR WAS 67
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., Jan. 22Eugene R. Wood, a stage and film actor who had been appearing here with Shir ley Booth in The Vinegar Tree, died here today of a heart attack. He was 67 years old and lived at the Wellington Hotel, Seventh Avenue and 55th Street, New York.

title: Weed Caused Sheep Deaths, Utah Governor Says
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Jan. 22  Gov, Calvin L. Rampton ?? a noxious weed called halogeton today for the death of 1,200 sheep in a re note hillside in western Utah.

title: U.S. Copter Is Called to Carry Shells Up Hill to Idle Laotians
description: MUONG SOUI, Laos, Jan. 22 It took an American heli copter two hours the other day to haul ammunition 200 yards uphill to an artillery emplace ment after idle neutralist troops had left the shells exposed on the airstrip here for two days.

title: Staff Turnover and Boys' Solitude Frustrate Spofford
description: Frank Sawchuck, head counselor at the Spofford Juvenile Center, was not startled on a recent night to find that a police van had just brought in three young sters he knew. Admission of a youngster more than once is not unusual at Spofford.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Johnson Has CheckUp
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Jan. 22 (Reuters)  Former President Lyndon B. Johnson returned to Brooke Army Hospital here to day for a checkup on his re covery from viral pneumonia. Mr. Johnson spent three days in his special suite at the hospi tal last week. A hospital spokes man said his visit today was a brief one.

title: Proposal for City Taxi Commission Gains in Council
description: A regulatory commission for the taxicab business, which would not supervise the con troversial gypsy cabs, was informally agreed to yesterday by a shaky majority of the City Council.

title: Coop City Manager Named
description: Edward Aronov, a deputy assistant to the Mayor of Wash ington, was named general manager yesterday of Coop City in the northern Bronx, the nation's largest private housing development. Harold Ostroff, president of Coop City said the job was similar to that of a mayor. Mr. Aronov, 56 years old, succeeds Arnold Merritt, who was appointed assistant to the president, effective March 1.

title: 53,600 Vehicles Recalled By G.M. for Clutch Flaw
description: PONTIAC, Mich. Jan. 22 (AP)  The General Motors Corporation's G.M.C. Truck and Coach Division announced today that it had recalled 53, 600 vehicles, including 9,600 school buses, because their clutch linkages might be sub ject to breakage.

title: WINNER TO COACH REDSKIN DEFENSE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 (AP) Charley Winner, dropped as head coach of the St. Louis Cardinals at the close of the 1970 National Football League season, was named a defensive coach of the Washington Red skins today.

title: InterestRate Drop Spurs HouseHunting in Nation
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 22 Americans are starting to househunt again.

title: Transcript of President's State of the Union Message to Joint Session of Congress
description: Following is a transcript of Presi dent Nixon's preliminary remarks and State of the Union Message to a joint session of Congress last night, as re corded by The New York Times:

title: Gains Are Seen for Oil Talks; Controversial Issue Set Aside
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Jan. 22  Highly placed sources said today that representatives of oilproducing nations and Western oil companies had taken an important step toward a settlement yesterday by get ting around the controversial issue of whether their talks should cover only the Persian Gulf area or all the members of the Organization of Petro leum Exporting Countries.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: MANSFIELD SHIFTS STEERING PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23  Senator Mike Mansfield did the unorthodox today by naming a freshman Senator from the South to the Democratic Steer ing Committee, which controls Senate committee assignments.

title: 25 Classes on Card Today At Horse Show in Jersey
description: READINGTON, N.J., Jan. 22 The second of the Four Sea sons Farm's winter indoor horse show series is scheduled for tomorrow, with 25 classes on the program.

title: MRS. PHILIP LINKER
description: ISLIP, L. I., Jan. 22Mrs. Carrie Delia Linker, widow of Philip Y. Linker, an engineer who died in 1949, died today in a nursing home after a brief illness. She was 96 years old and lived with her son, Wil murt R. Linker, at 58 Elder Road here.

title: AMEX LIST GAINS IN HEAVY TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange continued to advance yesterday in the heaviest trad ing in almost four months.

title: Dobrynin Returns to U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 (AP) Ambassador Anatoly F. Do brynin of the Soviet Union has returned from nearly two weeks of consultations in Moscow.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Talks at U.N. Continue
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 22Indirect peace talks continued here today as Dr. Jarring conferred separately with the representatives of Jordan and Israel.

title: Leander Lobell Triumphs In Yonkers Snowball Pace
description: YONKERS, Jan. 22Leander Lobell, in the quickest clocking of the Yonkers Raceway meet ing, dashed to his third straight victory of 1971 tonight in the third round of the Snowball Pacing Series.

title: F.C.C. BEGINS STUDY OF TV ADS FOR YOUNG
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22The Federal Communications Com mission is embarking on a gen eral study of commercialis in children's television. But in an nouncing the state of a rule making procedure, it carefully avoided suggesting what kind of advertising controls it has in mind.

title: Bridge: Declarer CueBids His Void And Partner, Wisely, Passes
description: There comes a moment in the life of every bridge player when he believes that his parther is suffering from a fit of temporary insanity.

title: Shipping Embargo Imposed On Florida's Citrus Crop
description: LAKELAND, Fla., Jan. 22 (UPI)A sevenday shipping embargo was imposed on Flor ida's fresh citrus today to pre vent consumers from getting fruit damaged by the state's worst freeze in nine years.

title: NIXON URGES $16BILLION GO TO STATES AND CITIES AS REVENUESHARING AID
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22  President Nixon asked Con gress tonight to set a goal of giving state and local govern ments at least $16billion an nually in largely unrestricted funds as part of a broad pro gram to closethe gap between promise and performance at all levels of government.

title: Africa's Hidden Wars
description: For a year the guns have been silent in Nigeria. The civil war that gripped the world's attention is ended; the Ibos who powered the Biafran secession are resigned most of themto working back their passage within united Nigeria. But the first anniversary of Biafra's sur render serves as a reminder that three other bloody civil wars have been grinding on almost unnoticed in Africa.

title: ExGovernor of Georgia Is Probable Choice to Succeed Russell
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 22  There is persuasive evidence here that Ernest Vandiver, a former Gov ernor of Georgia and once an energetic advocate of racial segregation, will succeed Rich ard B. Russell in the United States Senate.

title: U.S. and Singapore in Pact
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 (Reu ers)The United States and Singapore have agreed to a new fouryear pact voluntarily limit ing Singapore's cotton textile imports here, the State Depart ment announced today. The pact replaces an earlier two year agreement that expired Dec. 31 and increases imports of cotton cloth and goods by about 5 per cent per year.

title: Setback for a Kennedy
description: When Senator Edward M. Kennedy was elected assist ant majority leader of the Senate two years ago, his unexpected triumph was heralded as a giant step toward leadership of his party and a way station on the road to the Presidency. That exaggeration returns now to haunt him. His defeat for reelection to the same post this year is almost as unjustifiably being trumpeted as a fatal blow to whatever aspirations he may still have for the Presi dential nomination.

title: Cabbies Say Business Is Off, but Differ on Extent
description: The city's cabbies ended their strike five weeks ago and most of the taxi industry has been suffering a drop in business, but there is disagreement on the size of the slump.

title: Insurer's Income Drops
description: The Continental Corporation, parent of the giant Continental Insurance Companies and the financially ailing Diners Club, reported yesterday that net op erating income fell to $56.1 million last year from $59.9 million a year earlier.

title: Sliding Tuition Plan Is Weighed For Undergraduates at City U.
description: A commission on the future of the City University is con sidering whether to propose a sliding scale of student charges of $100 to $500 a year for full time undergraduates whose families earn $10,000 a year or more.

title: Nindl Takes Pro Final In Giant Slalom Skiing
description: MOUNT SNOW, Vt., Jan. 22 Experience paid off today as Hugo Nindl, a former member of the Austrian National Team, defeated Scott Pyles of Marble, Colo., in the final of a profes sional giant slalom event.

title: The Talk of Rome
description: ROME, Jan. 22  When this ancient city must dig, it's not like blasting a hole into the rock of Manhattan.

title: BURTON RECORDS UPSET AT FORUM
description: Two New York Golden Gloves champions made off with the major honors last night in the first fight card of the year at Felt Forum.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: WALTZES OF LOVE SUNG AT MUSEUM
description: It is not precisely true that Brahms is the Gorky of music. Jocular moments do come to mind, even in the symphonies. But in a word association test, one would not automatically give his name in response to joy.

title: Lion Sleeps Seeks Sixth Victory in Row in Royal Palm at Hialeah Today
description: Lion Sleeps, who has been opening eyes with his perform ances over six furlongs this winter, will be asked to go an extra furlong today in quest of his sixth straight victory.

title: Arabs Charge Israel Bars a Withdrawal
description: CAIRO, Jan. 22The leaders of four Arab countries declared tonight that Israel was trying with United States support to perpetuate the occupation of Arab areas seized in 1967 by turning the temporary cease fire into a permanent one.

title: Pacification Program Is Given a New Name
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 22 (UPI)  Ellsworth Bunker, United States Am bassador to South Vietnam, says that the pacification program in South Vietnam has been so successful that it was being given another name.

title: MURPHY SUPPORTS $15,000 POLICE PAY
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy said yesterday that he thought New York patrol men should be paid at least $15,000 a year.

title: NewIssue Prices Move Up in Week In Active Trading
description: Prices of new stock issues those of companies selling their stock to the public for the first time  climbed again this week week in moderately active trading.

title: United Jersey Banks Plans Princeton Bank Acquisition
description: United Jersey Banks, a Hackensackbased holding com pany, is to add the $88mi1 lion First National Bank of Princeton to its fivebank sys tem, it was announced yester day.

title: STREET SEMINARY ENDS A SEMESTER
description: Trinity Parish celebrated the completion of the first semester by its experimental seminary called the Seminary of the Streets at a special service yesterday morning in the church at the head of Wall Street.

title: Tickets and Cocktails Cost More as Airlines Tighten Their Belts
description: In midDecember, Michael Odierno of Mahopac, N. Y., made reservations to fly to Miami Feb. 13 with his wife and 18yearold daughter. He was told their fare would be $377. Last week, Eastern Airlines called and said he owed $971 more.

title: Tomorrow's Pro Bowl Ends the Football Season; Tune In Again on July 30
Baseball Signings
description: AMERICAN LEAGUE

title: NIXON TO REPORT STATE OF WORLD
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22  President Nixon announced tonight that he would summa rize the Administration's view of foreign affairs in his second annual State of the World mes sage in the near future.

title: New Blast Rocks Pnompenh
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sat urday, Jan. 23 (Reuters)  A terrorist bomb rocked central Pnompenh today blowing up a police immigration post just a few yards from the city's main street. At least 10 persons were wounded in the blast, the sec ond in the city in 14 hours. that the small raiding party was backed up by enemy soldiers firing rockets and mortar shells from farther away.

title: U.C.L.A. FIVE WINS FROM LOYOLA, 8762
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 22 (AP) The University of California, Los Angeles, overcame first half jitters tonight and ran its undefeated streak to 14 with an 8762 victory over Loyola of Chicago in the first game of a doubleheader at Chicago Sta dium.

title: Harry Guggenheim Dead; Newsday Founder Was 80
description: SANDS POINT, L. I., Jan. 22  Harry F. Guggenheim, the financier, philanthropist, horse man and publisher, died here early today at his home, Fa laise. His age was 80. He had been in failing health for more than two years.

title: Nearly Half of U.S. Aid to State Goes to Welfare and Medicaid
description: ALBANY, Jan. 22  The largest share of the 11 cents New York State gets back for every dollar its taxpayers send to Washington is spent on wel fare programs, an official of the Bureau of the Budget said to day. Next in order are educa tion and transportation.

title: YIELDS ON BONDS ARE PUSHED DOWN
description: The bond market yesterday afternoon ended the week with a burst of strength that gave in terest rates another big shove downward.

title: Singapore Meeting Ends With New Heath Success
description: SINGAPORE, Jan. 22Heads of Government of the 31 na tions participating in the Com monwealth conference reached agreement today on a declara tion that for a time threatened to break up the Common wealth. The declaration, in stead of binding members to bar assistance to any nation practicing racial discrimination, as had been demanded by many African members, was turned instead into a condem nation of discrimination.

title: Trudeau Visits Jakarta
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Jan. 22 (Canadian Press)Prime Min ister Pierre Elliott Trudeau of Canada was given a 19gun salute on his arrival here to night for a threeday state visit.

title: Shop Talk
description: Handsome clothes, hand some store. The clothes, not inexpensive, but wellpriced, are from Paris. The store, all mirrors, chrome and steel, is at 755 Madison Avenue (between 65th and 66th Streets). It's the second Saint Germain shop in the city; the other is at 231 East 53d Street. The new shop, which op ened last month, was quiet at 5 o'clock on a recent afternoon. Past the brickcolored, dou blebreasted sude man's midi coat hanging on the wall (Lord Edward of Paris, $200), down a few steps stood Ron ald McCusker, 27 years old, the shop's comanager, in a gray pinstriped suit (Artex of Paris, $185).

title: Sonics Win in Overtime
description: SEATTLE, Jan. 22 (UPI)The Seattle Supersonics tied Cincin nati with a pair of field goals with five seconds left in regu lation play tonight and then went on to top the Royals, 132131, in overtime.

title: $1BILLION DEFICIT FEARED BY MAYOR
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 Mayor Lindsay told a Congres sional hearing today that New York City's budget gap in the fiscal year starting July 1 might approach $1billion. According to Lindsay aides, it was the first time that the Mayor had put a dollar estimate on the gap between anticipated expenses and revenues for the city's pro posed expense budget. Mr. Lindsay is required to submit the budget to the City Council and the Board of Estimate by April 15.

title: Rogers Assures Cooper on Troop Curb
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22  Secretary of State William P. Rogers met with Senator John Sherman Cooper today in an effort to assure him that the Administration was abiding by Congressional restrictions on American involvement in Cam bodia.

title: O'Neill New Democratic Whip; Albert Set Back on Rules Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22  Thomas P. O'Neill Jr. of Mas sachusetts was named today as majority whip of the House, the No. 3 spot on the Demo cratic leadership team.

title: EDNA MURTHA
description: Edna Murtha, commissary manager at the Women's House of Detention in Manhattan, died on Wednesday at the Col lege Nursing Home, Flushing, Queens. She was 60 years old and had been on leave of ab sence for illness since last March.

title: TURNOVER SURGES AS DOW RISES 6.57
description: Surging volume set a record of 21.68 million shares yester day on the New York Stock Exchange as Wall Street's dy namic bull market scored fur ther gains.

title: LONDON STOCKS UP ON LOW TURNOVER
description: Trading on the London stock exchange was depressed yes terday. There were two main reasons: too many prospective buyers appeared to be indif ferent and the postal strike kept many orders from coming through, which helped to keep volume very low.

title: Antiques: Show Reflects Elegant Tone
description: Top quality, high fashion antiques are shown in all their glory at the 17th Win ter Antiques Show, now at the 7th Regiment Armory at Park Avenue and 66th Street.

title: Burton Is Bowler of Year
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 22 (UPI) Nelson Burton Jr. was named on 100 of 104 ballots, including 61 firstplace votes, to be named 1970 bowler of the year today by the Bowling Writers' Association.

title: PANEL TO DEFEND BERRIGAN FRIENDS
description: More than 50 prominent clergymen, labor officials and writers announced their sup port yesterday for Dr. William Stringfellow and Anthony Towne of Rhode Island, who are accused of having harbored the Rev. Daniel J. Berrigan last August.

title: JUDGES CALL OFF WORLD CUP RACE
description: BAD GASTEIN, Austria, Jan. 22 (AP) Lack of snow led today to cancellation of the men's World Cup downhill ski race scheduled on Mount Grau kogel near here tomorrow.

title: Wichita Names Coleman
description: WICHITA, Kan., Jan. 22 (AP)Cecil Coleman of Fres no State College was named athletic director of Wichita State University today.

title: Hawks Hand Bucks 117110 Loss and Snap Their 10Game Winning Streak
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 22 (UPI) The Atlanta Hawksbehind the clutch shooting of Pete Maravich ended the 10game winning streak of the Milwau kee Bucks by handing them a 117110 defeat tonight in a Na tional Basketball Association game.

title: MOZART'S OPERA, TITO, IS STAGED
description: It has been generally agreed that Mozart's La Clemenza di Tito abounds in beautiful music but that it is so dead the atrically that it is not worth staging. As a consequence, Thursday night's production by the Julliard American Opera Center was the first in this city, although it has been given a few concert performances in the past.

title: SAUL SUGGESTS RATE DISCOUNTS
description: Ralph S. Saul, president of the American Stock Exchange, injected himself yesterday into the controversy over institu tional access to the major se curities markets with a sugges tion that commissionrate dis counts be granted to institu tional investors.

title: HAYWOOD'S LAWYER TELLS OF NINE BIDS
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 22 (AP) Al Ross, lawyer for Spencer Haywood, said today that nine National Basketball Association teams had bid for Haywood's services before Seattle signed him and provoked an N.B.A. court suit over his eligibility.

title: Santa Fe Line Net Off;
description: Net income of Santa Fe In dustries fell in 1970 to $40, 216,000, or $1.59 a share, from $60,760,000, or $2.43 a share, in 1969, the holding company, which controls the Atchison To peka & Santa Fe Railway re ported yesterday.

title: ANTONIO BAROLINI, ITALIAN NOVELIST
description: ROME, Jan. 22 (AP)Antonio Barolini, the Italian journalist and novelist, died yesterday of a heart attack. He was 61 years old.

title: Wages and PricesIII
description: The confrontation between fear of Inflation and fear of unemployment ought to be resolved before it fires up racial conflict and youth revolt to destroy our society.

title: Wages and PricesII
description: The hiking of prices by the steel industry will undoubtedly increase pressure on the Administration to adopt some form of an incomes pol icy for controlling inflation. The Com mittee for Economic Development has lent its not inconsiderable weight to this proposal, while others have sug gested a general freeze on wages or the adoption of socalled wageprice guidelines.

title: Seminar on Annual Meetings Is Held Here
description: What could have turned into a bitter confrontation yesterday between a senior official of one of the na tion's largest corporations and a professional stock holder wound up with smiles and good feeling on both sides.

title: Capital Tribute
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 (UPI) Senator Russell's body was borne back today to his native Georgia aboard Air Force One, President Nixon's personal jet.

title: Jacob M. Simon, a Builder Here, Dies
description: Jacob (Jac) M. Simon, founder and former president of Simon Brothers, builders here, which erected many of fice and residential buildings, died Thursday in Palm Beach, Fla., where he lived. His age was 81.

title: Back to the Driving Dream
description: In his State of the Union Message, President Nixon has swung away from the strident divisiveness that marked the Administration's approach to the 1970 cam paign and returned to the role he originally marked out for himself of unifier, reformer and uplifter of American institutions.

title: Agent Who Quit F.B.I. Scores Bureau Investigations, Discipline and Leadership
description: A former agent of the Fed eral Bureau of Investigation once selected for one of the bureau's more prestigious posi tionshas criticized the way the F.B.I. selects its leaders, disciplines its men and makes its investigations.

title: OffDuty Patrolman Is Slain In Downtown Brooklyn Bar
description: An offduty patrolman was shot and killed last night as he was making a telephone call in a bar in downtown Brooklyn.

title: From a U.S. Helicopter Base: Support for Cambodia
description: AT A U. S. HELICOPTER BASE, near Cambodia, Jan. 22  South Vietnamese officers and American airborne co ordinators, flying routinely from this base on a jungled plain in Vietnam, symbolize the direct nature of United States combat support in Cambodia.

title: Death Toll in Enemy Raid On Pnompenh Is Put at 39
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Jan. 22At least 39 persons were reported killed and 170 wounded today in a predawn raid by guerrillas on Pnompenh's airport and nearby installations. As small fires still burned among wrecked planes and helicopters and devastat ed ammunition dumps, Capt. Chhang Song, a Cambodian information officer, said pre liminary casualty reports list ed as killed 13 soldiers and 26 civilians, including wives and children of soldiers. At least 20 soldiers and 150 civil ians, many of them women and children, were wounded, he said.

title: Charles Muldaur Is Dead at 66; Former Advertising Executive
description: MARTHA'S VINEYARD, Mass., Jan. 22Charles E. A. Muldaur, a former New York and Philadelphia advertising executive, died here on Wednesday. He was 66 years old.

title: BELGRADE LIKELY TO DEVALUE DINAR
description: BELGRADE, Jan. 22The Yugoslav Government, which has already frozen prices and wages in its battle against in flation, is expected to devalue its currency by 20 to 30 per cent tomorrow, according to usually reliable sources here.

title: 8 G.I.'s Killed in Copters
description: SAIGON, Jan. 22 (AP)Viet cong gunners shot down a United States observation heli copter today and then downed a larger helicopter going to the aid of the first one, killing eight Americans and wounding three, the United States com mand said.

title: ARMY CLEARS G.I.'S IN MYLAI KILLING
description: FORT McPHERSON, Ga., Jan. 22The Army cleared today the last four enlisted men ac cused of participating in the alleged massacre at Mylai 4, leaving only a few officers still charged in the killings.

title: Denmark to Admit Dutschke
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Jan. 22  Rudl Dutschke, the West German radical student who has been ordered to leave Britain as a security threat, has been given a sixmonth permit to live and work in Denmark, the Ministry of Justice said today. Mr. Dutschke, who was not allowed to continue his studies at Cambridge University, will join Aarhus University as an assistant tutor while com pleting his doctoral dissertation.

title: Here We Have Chants, Like GoodBy, Anatoly
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 22 (UPI) Anatoly Tarasov, coach of the Soviet Union's world ohampionship hockey team, after dismissing two players for drinking and violation of training rules, set the stage today for a major shakeup of the team.

title: CITY TENANTS GET EVICTION RIGHTS
description: The New York City Housing Authority announced new pro cedures yesterday to protect the rights of tenants facing eviction in the authority's 172 public housing projects.

title: Sales of Small Appliances Rise
description: WASHINGTONDon't be a Herman Schmidt, read the button worn by the young peace demonstrator here last summer.

title: U.S. Yacht Finishes Third In Dragon Class Title Sail
description: HOBART, Tasmania, Jan. 22 (AP)  Americans finished third and ninth in the first race of the world champion ship for Dragon Class yachts today. Axel Holm of Denmark in Maj. Britt sailed the winner.

title: Works of Art From 40 Tiny Islands
description: The Cuna Indians (there are about 20,000 of them, inhabiting about 40 of the 350 tiny San Bias Islands be tween the Panama Canal and Colombia) have been a bit slow in abandoning their customs upon contact with the marvels of our century. The New York dealer George Staempfli, who has reached a conspicuously successful working arrangement with the jet ages is a Cuna fan and is holding an exhibition of their art at his gallery, 47 East 77th Street.

title: Arbitrator Tells City to Improve Conditions in Sanitation Garage
description: The city was ordered yester day to begin replacing lights, showers and heating units at its Sanitation Department ga rage at Canal and West Streets within five days or move the men working there to another location.

title: Two Win Children'sBook Prizes
description: An author and an illus trator of children's books have been announced as the winners of the John New berry Medal and the Ran dolph J. Caldecott Medal awarded to the most distin guished children's books in 1970 by the children's serv ice division of the American Library Association. They are Betsy Byars, author of Summer of the Swans, pub lished by Viking Press, and Gail E. Haley, illustrator of A StoryA Story, pub lished by Atheneum.

title: 16 TANKER SEAMEN LOST OFF SARDINIA
description: CAGLIARI, Sardinia, Jan. 22 (AP)  Sixteen seamen were missing and believed dead to night after two explosions and fire aboard an American owned oil tanker, the Universe Patriot.

title: Foreign Policy: Congress More Active
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22  Senator J. W. Fulbright, sum ming up the work of the For eign Relations Committee dur ing the past Congress, observed that the oncecozy relationship with the Administration on for eign policy had been replaced by a more questioning attitude among the legislators.

title: ORIN R. SUMMERVILLE
description: SACHETS HARBOR, N. Y., Jan. 22Orin R. Summerville, board chairman of the Brown ville Paper Company, Brown ville, N. Y., and a leader in the pulp and paper industry for many years, died on Sunday in a Watertown hospital. He was 75 years old.

title: Seals, Last in West, Score Over Maple Leafs, 5 to 2
description: OAKLAND, Jan. 22 (UPI) The California Golden Seals, in last place in the National Hockey League's West Division, slowed down Toronto's drive on third place in the East Division tonight when they de feated the Maple Leafs, 52.

title: Pennzoil and Irish Concern To Pool Fertilizer Patents
description: Pennzoil United, Inc., an nounced yesterday that it would pool its patents and technology for a new series of highyield fertilizers with those of Goulding Fertilizers, Ltd., of Ireland.

title: MRS. BARRON COLLIER
description: Mrs. Juliet C. Collier, the widow of Barron G. Collier, ad vertising executive and land developer, died yesterday at her home, 920 Fifth Avenue. She was 86 years old.

title: Dr. John Woodruff Dies at 72; ExColgate Geology Professor
description: LEESBURG, Fla., Jan. 22 Dr. John G. Woodruff, who had been professor of geology at Colgate University for 37 years at his retirement in 1966, died on Tuesday in Leesburg Gen eral Hospital. He was 72 years old.

title: FUND FOR CANCER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 President Nixon announced to night that he would ask Con gress for an extra $100million for an intensive effort to con quer cancer as one part of a broad program to make the United States the healthiest na tion in the world.

title: Tulane Adds Laird
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 22 (AP)Bill Laird, offensive backfield coach at New Mexico State, was named to the coach ing staff at Tulane today. He will handle the receivers for the Green Wave's new head coach, Bennie Ellender.

title: Doomed Lithuanian Asks for Clemency
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 22Vitautas Simokaitis, the Lithuanian under a death sentence for at tempting to hijack a plane to Sweden, has appealed for mercy to the Lithuanian legis lature's ruling body, official sources said today.

title: ASHER HOLDS LEAD IN NEVADA BOWLING
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Jan. 22 (UPI)Barry Asher of Costa Mesa, Calif., clung to his lead today as the semifinal phase began in the $77,777 Showboat invitation bowling tournament.

title: Environment Aide Named
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 (AP) President Nixon named Thom as E. Carroll today to be chief of planning and management for the new Environmental Pro tection Agency. Mr. Carroll is a former broadcasting and magazine executive. He is 42 years old.

title: Report Asks Dismissal Of U. of Wash. Coach
description: SEATTLE, Jan. 22 (AP) The University of Washing ton's Human Rights Commis sion, which investigated charges of racism in the foot ball program, made public a report today recommending the dismissal of the head coach, Jim Owens, and ath letic director, Joe Kearney.

title: Executive Changes
description: Lear Siegler, Inc., in Santa Monica, Calif., an nounced yesterday the election of Robert L. Pur cell as chairman and Robert T. Campion as president. They fill the vacancy created by the death Jan. 15 of John G. Brooks, chairman and president. The diversi fied manufacturer also named K. Robert Hahn, 49 years old, formerly senior vice president, as executive vice president, director and corporate secretary.

title: BONES OF ANIMALS CLUE TO CULTURES
description: Using a new laboratory color test that would more naturally be applied in mineralogy than archeology, a team of Columbia University scientists reported yesterday they could take an animal bone thousands of years old and tell if the animal it came from was wild or do mestic.

title: Braves Down Rockets
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 22 (UPI) Don May scored 29 points to night, including a pair of key jump shots in the fourth period, as the Buffalo Braves posted a 10194 triumph over the San Diego Rockets.

title: F.T.C. ISSUES ORDER ON ROCKWELL CORP.
description: The Federal Trade Commis sion issued yesterday a pro posed order for the North American Rockwell Corporation to sell Textile Machine Works, which it acquired in 1968, be cause the acquisition illegally restrained competition in the market for knitting machines and other textile machinery.

title: Devonshire Granted Stay in Bankruptcy
description: The Federal District Court here has granted the First Devonshire Corporation a stay in its bankruptcy proceedings pending a final determination of the suspended member firm's petition for review.

title: Gen. Francisco Melo, 67; Fought Reds in Brazil in '64
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan. 22 Lieut. Gen. Francisco de Assis Melo died yesterday of a thrombosis in the Central Aero nautical Hospital. He was 67 years old.

title: Art: Themes of Violence
description: We hear rumors of art turning its face in the direc tion of social crisis, but there is actually very little art these days that can be taken seriouslyvery little that takes itself seriouslyas an authentic reflection of the agonizing issues that have overtaken society. Observing the few feeble and preten tious attempts at an art of social consciousness that have lately come forward, I am reminded of one of the art jokes of the nineteen fifties. When artists were rumored to be contemplating a return to nature, the question often asked was Is nature willing to return to art? One wonders if the socialprotest quotient in art is any more amenable to a quick seduction.

title: Truman Sits Up in Bed; Condition Called Good
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Jan 22 (UPI)Former President Harry S. Truman sat up in his hospital bed today, ate a peanut butter sandwich and sipped buttermilk while watching television. Doctors said he was feeling better and that his condition con tinues to be good.

title: HABER SAYS CITY LIMITED PARITY
description: Herbert L. Haber, Director of Labor Relations for the city, testified yesterday that he had agreed to a paritypay adjust ment for patrolmen if certain conditions were met.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended Jan. 19.

title: Chief U.S. Witness Against Policemen Is Held in Paterson
description: NEWARK, Jan. 22  The main prosecution witness at the trial here of eight Paterson, N. J., policemen charged with brutality and vandalism during that city's 1968 racial disor ders was arrested in Paterson yesterday on a gambling charge.

title: DEMOCRATS DRAFT CONVENTION PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22  Democratic party reformers adopted a plan today to appor tion delegates to the 1972 Democratic National Conven tion under a formula giving equal weight to state popula tion and past party regularity.

title: Proxmire Disputed by Pentagon On Military Aid Total for 1970
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22  The Defense Department said today that United States mili tary assistance in the 1970 fis cal year totaled $2.9billion.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Betsy Roth, for 63 years a baseball stitcher with the National League, cried bitterly yesterday when she learned that the Hall of Fame electors were unable to choose a candidate for enshrinement next summer. For what, I ask you, are my eyes dropping out of my head, do I have a callus on my thumbit feels like stone? she asked. These electors, they're such big deals they can't even give us one little immortal? It's too much to ask? What's another plaque on the wall to them?

title: If You've Never Seen a Soybean Before
description: At any given time, Denis Barber can claim possession of something like 75,000 bushels of soybeanswhich is an awful lot of soybeans to own, especially for someone who's never seen a soybean.

title: KNICKS TO BATTLE CELTICS TONIGHT
description: With a squad that may be in the healthiest collective shape it has achieved in sev eral months, the Knicks embark tonight upon an important and grueling nineday stretch dur ing which they will play seven National Basketball Association games.

title: Books of The Times
description: The Black Aesthetic of the title can be defined succinctly. It isn't white; it isn't esthetic. Although the emphasis on these two themes varies with the different con tributors, they are repeated with a con sistency that never allows the reader to forget them. Anything to do with the white man's artistic evaluations, judgments or sense of beauty is invalid. This notion is sometimes softened in the writings of the older generation: Eliot, Stein, Joyce, Proust, Hemingway, and Anderson, Gorky, Barbusse, Nexo and Jack London, no less than the folklore of the Negro himself, should form the heritage of the Negro writer, Richard Wright says in his essay, Blueprint for Negro Writing. But this statement is immediately countered by Hoyt W. Fuller's remarks in his article, The New Black Literature: The revolu tion in black literature in America  is deliberately moving outside the sphere of traditional western forms, limitations and presumptions. And the bulk of the con tributors, if pressed, would side with Mr. Fuller. To judge by this collection, there is nothing less relevant to black artists today than white criticism, white achievement, white advice.

title: The Screen
description: I guess it all began the day Daddy opened his new munitions plant, Licia, the beautiful daughter of an Italian industrialist, tells the psychiatrist the day after she's been arrested in a raid on a whorehouse.

title: Rowing Foundation Pays Tribute to the OneTime Young Giants Out of the Northwest
description: They were usually de scribed as young giants out of the Northwest and they came from such hamlets in the state of Washington as Puyallup, Montesano and Anacortes. They were the University of Washington's varsity crew of 1936 that went on to win the Olympic championship in Germany.

title: ELLINGTON'S SPIRIT MARKS JAZZ SESSION
description: Although Duke Ellington was not corporeally present yester day at the weekly noontime jazz session at Downbeat, Lex ington Avenue at 42d Street, the room was filled with the Ellington spirit.

title: Blazers Halt Pistons
description: DETROIT, Jan. 22 (UPI) Solid scoring by Geoff Petrie, Rick Adelman and Gary Gregor offset the 36point effort of Detroit's Dave Bing tonight and enabled the Portland Trail Blazers to snap a fivegame Pistons' winning streak with a 123112 victory.

title: Music: A Personal Way
description: By now the characteristics of Daniel Barenboim as a conductor are in steady focus, and his concert with the New York Philharmonic on Thursday evening was another illustration of the very personal way he ap proaches music.

title: Neruda Confirmed as Envoy
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Jan. 22 (AP)Pablo Neruda has been confirmed by the Senate to be the new Chilean Ambassador to France. The poet, a member of the Chilean Communist party, was named to the post by President Salvador Allende Gossens in December.

title: 2 of 3 Suspensions in Waldorf Case Lifted
description: Two of the three men sus pended for putting a welfare family into the WaldorfAstoria Hotel Tuseday night were rein stated yesterday by a Human Resources Administration in quiry board. The third was sus pended for 30 days.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Cornell Triumphs, 9365, Over Bucknell on Late Rally
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Jan. 22A secondhalf burst led by Kenny Wiens and Rick Amato gave the Cornell five a 9365 victory over Bucknell tonight.

title: RISE OF 1520% SEEN FOR HOUSING STARTS
description: An increase in 1971's na tional housing starts of 15 to 20 per cent was predicted yes terday by Dr. Roy O. Wenzlick of the Roy Wenzlick Research Company of St. Louis.

title: Aussies Roll Up 493 Runs Against English in Cricket
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Jan. 22 (Reuters)  Rodney Marsh's 92 not out enabled Australia to reach 493 runs for nine wickets declared against Eng land today on the second day of the fifth cricket test. Marsh went to the wicket after Aus tralia had slumped from 260 for one overnight to 324 for five.

title: Man In the News
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 Roy Lawrence Ash, says former associate, ought to have a little man with a steno pad constantly in tow, to collect the steady stream of proverbs that issue softly from his mouth. These ashes are not corny old sayings, but pithy, selfcoined principles, such as: Organization is policy. To decentralize op erations, central ize information.

title: Mine Rescue Is Modernized
description: GARY, W. Va.At U. S. Steel Mine No. 14 near here, the primitive underground technology of coal mining is getting its first exposure to the razzle dazzle world of space age technology.

title: U. S. Planning Regional Waste Unit Here
description: The Federal Government is drawing plans for a solidwaste disposal authority  covering at least parts of New York, New Jersey and Connecticut  to handle garbage in the metropolitan area.

title: New York University Five Turns Back Alumni, 8583
description: New York University's var sity basketball team beat an alumni team 8583, last night at Alumni Gym in the Bronx. Eighteen Violet alumni, guided by Howard Cann, N.Y.U.'s former coach, participated in the 24th varsityalumni game.

title: Ohio Edison's Net Off in 4th Quarter And for All of '70
description: The Ohio Edison Company reported yesterday lower net income for the fourth quarter and full year despite higher revenues in both 1970 periods. The preliminary annual report placed fourthquarter revenues at $71,453,814 against $67, 833,951 a year ago.

title: Colorado Hires Claiborne
description: BOULDER, Colo., Jan. 22 (AP)  Jerry Claiborne, Virginia Tech's head football coach for 10 years, was hired by the University of Colorado today as assistant head coach and, defensive coordinator.

title: Littler Cards 63, Barber and Harney 64's for Tie at 129 in Phoenix Open
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Jan. 22 The touring golf pros had a day of low scoring they will probably remember for many seasons. A tussle ensued for the 36hole lead in the $125,000 Phoenix Open Tournament be cause Gene Littler shot an 8underpar 63 while Miller Barber and Paul Harney tallied 64's over the level Arizona Country Club course and tied at 129.

title: Irwin Confers in Tunis
description: TUNIS, Jan. 22 (UPI)Under Secretary of State John N. Ir win 2d conferred today with Premier Hedi Mouir.

title: Humanities Council Given $8.2Million By Ford Foundation
description: The Ford Foundation an nounced yesterday that it had granted $8.2million to help sustain the quality of scholar ly research in the humanities in the United States.

title: 2 U.S. Oil Concerns In Manila Bombed; Employe Is Killed
description: MANILA, Jan. 22The head quarters of two American oil companies were bombed and damaged extensively at about the same time tonight. A Filipino employe was killed and three others were Injured in the blasts.

title: DEMOCRATS BACK VOTE ON RENT RISE
description: Twenty  seven Manhattan Democratic leadersincluding Borough President Percy E. Sutton and five Assemblymen announced their support yes terday for a drive to invalidate a city law permitting rent in creases in rentcontrolled build ings.

title: Downtown Scene: Destructive Threat
description: It was only two years ago that New York's Finch Col lege was turned for a mo ment into an ensanguined arena of staged violence as several artists scratched, beat, and punched one an other until their clothes were left in shreds and their flesh running with blood. At the same time, two other artists, a boy and a girl, performed a ritualistic dance during which they scissored off the head of a chicken and al lowed it to flop itself to death in a pool of its own blood.

title: TIMES SQ. UPLIFT URGED BY LINDSAY
description: Mayor Lindsay called yester day for the revitalization of Times Square and said the city would study the possibility of designating the area as a spe cial district with zoning priv ileges.

title: 76ers Sink Suns, 117116
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Jan. 22 (AP) Archie Clark stole an in bounds pass and set up Bailey Howell for a layup with 16 sec onds remaining tonight to give the Philadelphia 76ers a 117116 victory over the Phoenix Suns.

title: Aide to Mayor Denies Conflict Between Law Practice and Job
description: Edward A. Morrison, the Mayor's representative on the Board of Estimate and his liai son with the City Council, said yesterday that his private law practice did not constitute a conflict of interest.

title: SPAIN OUTLINES PLAN OF GROWTH
description: MADRID, Jan. 22The Gov ernment announced tonight some bold targets for Spain's economic growth over the next two years, and some relatively cautious steps for achieving them.

title: Great Society's Programs Would Face a Dismantling
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22President Nixon's proposal to divert about onethird of the Federal domestic grant pro grams into broad categories of revenue sharing would dismantle some of the major Great Society programs en acted by Democratic admin istrations.

title: T.W.A.Sun Line Deal Off
description: Trans World Airlines and shareholders of the Sun Line have terminated discussions concerning a contemplated ac quisition of the cruiseship line by the airline, it was announced yesterday. The two companies said they could not pursue the merger arrangements because of conditions imposed by the Civil Aeronautics Board.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 President Nixon had every right tonight to call his new domestic program a revolution. Except that old New Dealers might call it a counterrevolu tion. Although many of his proposals are not new, though many will be disfigured or de layed by Congress and while hardly any will satisfy the many claimants on Fed eral money and power, taken to gether, they rep resent a radical effort to re verse the 40year flow of bureaucratic power toward Washington. Their purpose is to improve the delivery of governmental services, to re vitalize state and local govern ment and the authority of Governors and Mayors and to relieve the White House and Congress of much of their cost ly and dispiriting administrative burdens.

title: Weather Favors Renaults as Rally Starts in Europe
description: MONTE CARLO, Monaco, Jan. 22 (UPI)The French Al pineRenault team received the first break as the 40th Monte Carlo auto rally opened today with 250 crews converging here from 10 cities over Europe and Africa.

title: McGrady and Evans Renew Rivalry in 600Yard Run at Philadelphia Tonight
description: PHIALDELPHIA, Jan. 22Is Martin McGrady ready to rule another season as track and field's chairman of the boards? How much higher can Jan John son reach as a pole vaulter? What new surprises will Po land's tenacious and talented distance runner, Henryk Szordy kowski, spring on his latest American tour?

title: Show With Touch of Its Own
description: The temptation is to touch, squeeze, cuddle, ruffle, snug gle, tickle and stroke at the Furs and Feathers show opening today at the Museum of Contemporary Crafts. But it's hands off on most of the exhibits.

title: ETHIOPIAN PLANE HIJACKED TO LIBYA
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 22 (AP)An Ethiopian airliner was hijacked today to Benghazi, Libya. It made refueling stops in Kartoum, the Sudanese capi tal, and in Cairo. There were 23 persons aboard.

title: Tear Gas Is Used In Rout of Youths At U. of Arizona
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Jan. 22 (UPI)  Scores of police used tear gas and clubs tonight to rout a large crowd of young persons from the University of Arizona campus in the second consecutive night of disturb ances.

title: The Princess in Washington
description: WASHINGTON  For the last two years Princess Moune AnneMarie Sou vanna Phouma, whose father, Prince Souvanna Phouma, is Premier of Laos, has been plain Mrs. Perry Stie glitz, the wife of a United States Information Agency officer. But the privileges of royalty lingered on.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES SCORE ADVANCES
description: After a period of heavy prof it taking, soybean futures prices turned around and closed at about the highs for the day on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday. Wheat, corn and oats also advanced as well as soy bean oil and meal.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: DETROIT, Jan. 22 (AP)  A Northwest Orient Airlines jet carrying 54 passengers and a crew of 6 was hijacked to Havana today after leaving Mil waukee and stopping here for refueling. The plane which had been on route from Minneapolis to Washington, landed in Miami after a brief stop in Havana.

title: RYUN TAKES MILE IN TRACK RETURN
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 22 (UPI)Jim Ryun began his track comeback tonight after a 19month layoff by taking the mile in 4 minutes 4.4 seconds. The former Kansas star ran away from a mediocre field and finished nearly six seconds ahead of Duncan MacDonald of Stanford.

title: Colonels Reportedly Get Gilmore in A.B.A. Draft
description: GREENSBORO, N. C., Jan. 22The American Basket ball Association conducted its secret draft of college players today, and player agents, enjoying the talent war between the National Basketball Association and the A.B.A., were mentioning large sums of money.

title: Lakers Engulf Warriors
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 22 (AP) The Los Angeles Lakers, with a strong firsthalf attack, routed San Francisco, 130110, tonight, snapping a fourgame Warrior winning streak.

title: No Offensive Expected
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 22Highranking military sources expressed doubt today that the devastating attack on Pnompenh's airport fore shadowed any immediate up surge in the Indochina war.

title: EXMUSEUM TRUSTEE FINED IN ART THEFT
description: A former trustee and vice president of the Denver Art Museum received a suspended twoyear prison sentence and $40,0000 in fines yesterday on charges that he had trans ported stolen works of art from Colorado to New York.

title: Mrs. King and Miss Casals Gain Milwaukee Semifinals
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 22 (UPI) The top four seeded players in the $12,500 Virginia Slims professional tennis tournament scored victories today to ad vance to the semifinals.

title: Mrs. Meir Disappointed
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 22Premier Golda Meir expressed disap pointment today, asserting that she felt that the indirect peace talks had not gotten off the ground.

title: Ballet: Two Premieres
description: The two new works bravely presented by New York City Ballet at the New York State Theater on Thursday evening proved mitigated disasters. The mitigation was on behalf of the youth of the perpe trators. The disaster was the miscalculation of the com pany's management. We all know that youth must have its flingbut some flings are frankly ridiculous.

title: 2 Cities Expected to Be Named For School Voucher System
description: The Office of Economic Op portunity is expected within the next few days to take the first concrete steps toward the establishment of experi mental educational voucher systems in at least two local ities, one in California and one in Indiana.

title: LUCIA SUNG HERE BY GAIL ROBINSON
description: Gail Robinson's appearance in the title role of Donizetti's Lucia di Lammermoor at the Metropolitan Opera Thursday night was, in a sense, her first in that part with the company.

title: Alexander's Set to Offer $15Million in Debentures
description: Alexander's, Inc., a New York retail chain, said yesterday that it had filed a registration with the Securities and Exchange Commission for a proposed public offering of $15million of convertible subordinated de bentures due in 1996.

title: Wages and PricesI
description: DETROITMany proposals to com bat inflation have an Alice in Wonder land flavor. While avowedly aimed at price increases, they direct their fire at wage increases.

title: Bullets Crush Celtics
description: BOSTON, Jan. 22 (AP)Earl Monroe led Baltimore to a 21 point halftime lead tonight and the Bullets went on to a 136 117 victory over the Boston Celtics in a National Basket ball Association game.

title: Speech Gets Restrained Approval From Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 President Nixon's State of the Union Message was greeted with restrained approval by Congress tonight, with Repub licans praising the President's goals and Democrats pledging cautious cooperation.

title: The Rockefeller Budget
