title: Rescuing the Central Market
description: In a precedentshattering report, a blueribbon com mittee of the New York Stock Exchange has endorsed two proposals that could preserve the Exchange as the nation's central market for securities. The first would open membership to financial institutions; a decision on this matter has become urgent with the applications for membership of subsidiaries of the Dreyfus Corpora tion and Investors Diversified Services, two of the nation's largest mutualfund organizations. The second change would wipe out fixed commission rates and allow free competition to determine the rates on trades at some amount to be determined.

title: Big Board Unit's Report Stirs Wall Street Dispute
description: Controversy began bubbling beneath Wall Street's normally placid surface yesterday in re sponse to the endorsement of institutional membership on the New York Stock Exchange by a highlevel exchange commit tee.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 26 (Reuters)  Israel's reply to Egypt's proposals for the Middle East will be delivered tomorrow to Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, the United Nation intermediary, Josef Tekoah, the Israeli delegate, said today.

title: Smoking to Be Banned On Staten Island Ferry
description: Smoking will no longer be permitted on the Staten Is land ferry, Charles G. Leed ham, the city's Commissioner of Marine and Aviation, an nounced yesterday.

title: Villanova Triumphs, 7252
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Jan. 26Villanova University pulled away in the final seven minutes to turn back Seton Hall Univer sity tonight, 7252. The Wild cats have a 155 wonlost mark, Seton Hall has won five and dropped nine.

title: Shanker Would Use Lawyers' Licensing Method
description: Albert Shanker, president of the United Federation of Teach ers, called yesterday for state teacher and supervisory exam inations similar to those given in medicine and law, instead of those now administered by the controversial Board of Ex aminers.

title: Former Nun Paroled
description: ALDERSON, W. Va., Jan. 27 (AP)Marjorie Melville, a for mer nun who along with the Revs. Philip and Daniel Berri gan and six others was con victed in 1968 of destroying draft records in Catonsville, Md., was released on parole from a women's penitentiary here today.

title: STENNIS SAYS U.S. MAY HAVE TO EASE CURB IN CAMBODIA
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 Senator John C. Stennis, chair man of the Senate Armed Serv ices Committee, said today, after a briefing by Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird, that it might become necessary to re lax the present Congressional restrictions on military opera tions in Cambodia.

title: 3 Large Banks on Coast Cutting Rates for Loans
description: Three West Coast banking giants announced yesterday acrosstheboard reductions in the rates charged on con sumer loans, the second cut of half a percentage point since Thanksgiving. The Bank of America, the nation's largest, kicked off the round of cuts and was followed within a few hours by the Wells Fargo Bank and the CrockerCitizens National Bank.

title: Boat Show: Warm Port on Cold Day
description: Four classes of stock cruising yachts used in distance compe tition have been approved for standard measurements under the International Offshore Rule, officials disclosed last night at the New York Yacht Club.

title: ABBA ABRAMS, 69, RELIGIOUS LEADER
description: SURFSIDE, Fla., Jan. 27 Rabbi Abba Abrams, formerly president of the Bronx Council of Rabbis and spiritual leader of the Jacob H. Schiff Jewish Center of the Bronx, died here at his home today. He was 69 years old.

title: Private Jet Carrying Five Is Lost in Lake Champlain
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., Jan. 27 (UPI)A private jet aircraft carrying five passengers crashed into Lake Champlain tonight, the state police reported.

title: Market Place: Pollution Curbs And PE Rations
description: Wall Street has been look ing in vain for a way to make money in pollution control stocks over the long term. At last, a sensible ap proach may be in sight.

title: Bouillabaisse for 20
description: Most of the recipes at the Culinary Institute of America are for mass cooking and call for longsimmered sauce bases. Here is one for a bouil labaisse, Marseillesstyle, for 20 people.

title: OWNERSHIP SHIFT AT SUFFOLK DOWNS
description: BOSTON, Mass., Jan. 27A New Yorkbased conglomerate with assets of $1billion has agreed in principle to take over Suffolk Downs from Realty Equities, Inc., a spokes man for the financially troubled race track said today.

title: Fairleigh 6347 Victor
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Jan. 27 Lee Shulman made 12 of 13 freethrow attempts tonight as Fairleigh Dickinson defeated American International, 6347. The victory was the third straight for the Knights and lifted their wonlost record to 65. American International is 48.

title: Croteau Paces Seals
description: OAKLAND, Jan. 21 (UPI) Gary Croteau, a left wing, scored three goals tonight, the first time in his career, and assisted on another goal to lead the California Golden Seals to a 62 triumph over the Minne sota North Stars.

title: Rangers Deadlock Bruins, 22, on Ratelle's Late Goal Before 17,250 Here
description: Exhausting the 17,250 fre netic fans at Madison Square Garden, who were ready to roar at the least excuse, the Rangers and the Boston Bruins clawed their way to a 22 tie last night in a rugged game with playoff overtones.

title: Diamond Ball's 400 Glitter in a Good Cause
description: Despite the economy, the thermometer and the state visit of Prince Juan Carlos of Spain to Washington (a din ner dance in his honor kept Washingtonians at home and drew some New Yorkers), no one was very surprised when the traditional 400 guests ap peared in the Grand Ballroom of the Plaza Hotel last night for the 12th annual Diamond Ball.

title: Gomulka Still in Hospital
description: WARSAW, Jan. 27 (Reuters) Wladyslaw Gomulka, former Polish Communist party leader, who was admitted to a hospital with a circulatory ailment last month, is suffering increased pain and his eyesight is further affected, a medical bulletin said tonight.

title: ERNEST THOMPSON, IN BLACK CRUSADES
description: ORANGE, N.J., Jan. 27 Ernest (Big Train) Thompson, first black organizer on the Jersey staff of the United Elec trical Workers, died today of a heart attack at his home, 397 Olcott Street. He was 63 years old.

title: Alabama Electrocutions Barred Because Chair Has Been Moved
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Jan. 27 Alabama's Court of Criminal Appeals has ruled that, because the state moved its electric chair from one prison to an other, a man convicted of murder cannot be put to death.

title: Chiefs Gets Saints' Otis
description: KANSAS CITY, Jan. 27 (UPI) The Kansas City Chiefs ac quired a running back, Jim Otis, from the New Orleans Saints today in exchange for their seventhround pick in to morrow's college draft.

title: Philip Morris Gains By CLARE M. RECKERT
description: Philip Morris, Inc., realized a 32.8 per cent increase in 1970 earnings on a revenue gain of 32.1 per cent, both establishing records, Joseph F. Cullman 3d, chairman of the diversified, multinational tobacco company, reported yesterday.

title: Violin Recital Given By Keiko Furiyoshi Shows Virtuosity
description: Carnegie HallJeunesses Mu sicales, Inc., an organization that presents young foreign artists by arrangement with the Jeunesses Musicales of other countries, offered a recital by Keiko Furiyoshi, Japanese vio linist, in Carnegie Recital Hall on Tuesday night. She has been in this country for the last four years studying with Josef Gin gold at Indiana University, be sides teaching at the Univer sity of Wisconsin in Racine.

title: NIAGARA QUINTET HALTS ARMY, 6050
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Jan, 27 (UPI)  Niagara outscored Army, 197, in the final eight minutes tonight as it battled its way to a 6050 victory over, the cadets.

title: Truman Wants to Go Home
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Jan. 27 (AP)Former President Harry S. Truman remained hospi talized today, but against his wishes. His physician, Dr. Wallace Graham, said that Mr. Truman was in good condition and he is regaining his strength after a stay at Re search Medical Center since last Thursday for diverticulitis. He also said that Mr. Truman had expressed an earnest de sire to go home to Indepen dence, Mo.

title: Princeton Sextet Triumphs
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Jan. 27 Jim Tittemore scored three goals tonight, two of them un assisted, to lead Princeton Uni versity's hockey team to a 41 victory over the St. Nicholas Hockey Club. Roger Kyle added the fourth Princeton goal. Jim Gately scored in the final pe riod to avert a shutout for St. Nicholas.

title: House Inquiry Is Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (UPI) Representative Henry B. Gon zalez, Democrat of Texas, said today he had asked the chair man of the House Banking and Currency Committee to look into the malodorous scandal involving banks and public of ficials in Texas.

title: Tuesday Night Fights
description: New York (Sunnyside Garden) George ?? Foster, 135 pounds, ??, knocked out Lloyd Mar shall, 135, Newark, 8 rounds,

title: Manson and 3 Face Penalty Jury Today For Seven Murders
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 27 Charles M. Manson and three members of his hippie family begin their fight tomorrow to avoid death in the gas chamber.

title: City Ballet's Hornefolks Dancing as Well as Ever
description: With visitors around, it is always dangerously easy to forget the family. In dance terms, New York City Ballet is New York's family. Like the welfare rolls, it is always with us, and in moments of dance stress it is occasion ally difficult to pay it proper attention.

title: INJUNCTION ENDS A POLICE STRIKE
description: MILWAUKEE, Jan. 27Mil waukee policemen returned to work today after their fourday strike was broken by a court order.

title: Detroit Paper Raises Price
description: DETROIT, Jan. 27 (UPI) The newsstand price of The Detroit Free Press is being raised from 10 to 15 cents as of Feb. 1. The price of The Sunday Free Press will remain at 30 cents a copy, home de livered or at retail stands, the newspaper said.

title: RABBIS FAVOR AID FOR ALL SCHOOLS
description: The New York Board of Rab bis yesterday abandoned its longstanding opposition to state aid for parochial schools.

title: 11 State Counties Cut Off In Snow and 70MileWind
description: An intense winter storm gripped much of the nation in cold and snow yesterday, isolating 7,000 square miles of northwestern New York State. Driven by winds up to 70 miles an hour, a footdeep snowfall drifted into eight foot banks, closing all roads in 11 counties.

title: ARIZONA FACES HALT IN U.S. WELFARE AID
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (AP) The Department of Health, Education and Welfare an nounced today that it would cut off $36.8million in welfare aid to Arizona on April 1 un less the state complied with Federal public assistance regu lations.

title: Jersey City Bartender Held As Head of Numbers Game
description: JERSEY CITY, Jan. 27With the arrest today of a 31year old bartender, the police said they had broken up a $2mil lionayear policy operation.

title: ST. VINCENT'S SUED BY ADVISORY UNIT
description: Members of an official ad visory committee sued St. Vin cent's Hospital yesterday, charging that the hospital was deliberately withholding infor mation they needed to perform their duties.

title: Erie Sheriff's Helicopter Is Found by F.B.I. in Florida
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 27 (UPI) The Federal Bureau of Investi gation told Sheriff Michael A. Amico of Erie County today that it had found his depart ment's stolen helicopter and had arrested a man about to fly, it in Florida.

title: Squalor Is a Way of Life At a Welfare Hotel Here
description: Fires, muggings, beatings, robberies and narcotics viola tions often bring the police to the Broadway Central Hotel four or five times a day.

title: Dance: Bejart and His Ballet of the 20th Century
description: This writer first saw the work of Maurice Bjart and his Ballet of the 20th Cen tury in 1961. The program included his version of Stra vinsky's Le Sacre du Prin temps, which was one of three ballets given their first performance locally by the company at the Brooklyn Academy of Music on Tues day night.

title: Decision Reserved on Flood Appeal
description: A threejudge panel in the United States Second Circuit Court of Appeals reserved de cision yesterday on the appeal of Curt Flood in his suit to overthrow baseball's reserve clause.

title: 5 Die in Kentucky Fire
description: FALMOUTH, Ky., Jan. 27 (AP)Fire believed started by an overheated stove swept through a home four miles from here today, killing five young sters. The victims were Lois Haddix, 15 years old; her brothers and sisters David, 14, Karen, 7, and Patty, 5, and Calvert Combs, 16.

title: Who Shall Choose the Bishops?
description: TUBINGEN, GermanyIs a church credible when it preaches peace, jus tice, freedom and democracy to the world, but finds itself incapable of realizing these ideals within its own walls?

title: Spanish Prince Has Lunch With Fulbright Committee
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 Prince Juan Carlos de Borbn of Spain told members of the Senate Foreign Relations Com mittee today that Spain was making progress economically and politically.

title: Special State Session to Redraw Congressional Lines Is Expected
description: ALBANY, Jan. 27  Legis lative sources disclosed today that the state's Congressional districts could not be reap portioned during the current session of the Legislature and that a special session on re apportionment was a certainty.

title: K. ELMO LOWE, LED REPERTORY GROUP
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 27 (AP) K. Elmo Lowe, former director of the Cleveland Play House, died of a stroke yesterday in Abington House of University Hospitals. He was 71 years old.

title: New Soviet Envoy in Cuba
description: MIAMI, Jan. 27 (AP)The new Soviet ambassador to Cuba, Nikita P. Tolubeyev, has presented his credentials to President Osvaldo Dortics, the Havana radio reported today.

title: Chess: Fischer Will Play Taimanov In the First of Eliminations
description: In the first set of elimina tion marches to determine the world championship chal lenger, Grandmaster Bobby Fischer of Los Angeles will play Grandmaster Mark Tai manov of the Soviet Union. Though Taimanov is sure to play with spirit, nobody seriously thinks he will score an upset.

title: AGNEW ASKS BACKING ON REVENUE SHARING
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 27 (AP) Vice President Agnew, carrying out a Nixon Administration pledge to take its revenueshar ing proposal to the people, told a gathering of county officials today that they must make Con gress believe the program is good for the people.

title: KRETCHMER ACCUSES CON ED OF STALLING
description: Jerome Kretchmer, the city's Environmental Protection Ad ministrator, charged yesterday that Consolidated Edison had failed to repair Big Allis, its millionkilowatt electric power generator in Ravenswood, Queens, because it wanted to convince the public of the need for nuclear power plants.

title: 2 Ships, Crippled in Crash, Reach the Port of Galveston
description: GALVESTON, Tex., Jan. 27 (UPI)Two crippled Venezue lan ships that crashed together in the Gulf of Mexico limped slowly into the Galveston har bor this afternoon.

title: Profit Rise at Socal
description: Net income of the Standard Oil Company of California inched ahead in 1970, while profits of the Standard Oil Oil Company (Indiana) dipped slightly.

title: N.Y.U. Bows, 8065
description: EASTON, Pa., Jan. 27Tracy Tripucka became the first Lafay ette College basketball player ever to score 1,000 career points in less than two sea sons tonight as he led the Leop ards to an 8065 victory over New York University at the Alumni Memorial Gym.

title: Wellington, Heizer in Deal
description: Wellington Computer Sys tems, Inc. announced yesterday that an agreement in principal has been reached with Heizer Corporation, a Chicago invest ment house, under which Heizer is to make a major in vestment in Wellington and its subsidiary, Telemax Corp

title: 2 Youths Charged With Firing On Patrolmen in Central Park
description: Two teenagers were arrested last night and charged with firing at two policemen in Cen tral Park Monday afternoon.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27Reflections upon washing the dishes:

title: People of Saigon Pause For Ancient Tet Rituals
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 27The Lunar New Year began today and found the people of Vietnam trying to hold to ancient symbols and customs while coping with their wartorn daily life.

title: Sabres Tie Kings, 33
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Jan. 27 (UPI)Gil Perreault, a rookie, scored his 21st goal of the sea son on a power play with 6 minutes 42 seconds remaining tonight to give the Buffalo Sabres a 33 tie with the Los Angeles Kings.

title: UNION FILES SUIT IN WALDORF CASE
description: Victor Gotbaum, the city employe union chief who was credited by Mayor Lindsay as having been a major factor in his reelection, charged yester day that the Mayor was deal ing in slogans and orders rather than plans to solve a housing crisis that had forced the plac ing of relief clients in hotels.

title: Skepticism in Johannesburg Dispatch of The Times, London
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Jan. 27There is some skepticism here about the plebi scite offer, critics seeing it as a means of protracting the pro ceedings.

title: Moratorium on Funds' Entry Onto Exchanges Sought by Lasker
description: Bernard J. Lasker, chairman of the board of governors of the New York Stock Exchange, will attempt to obtain a mora torium on any more institu tional membership on any of the nation's stock exchanges, pending a resolution of the in stitutional issue by the Big Board.

title: MISS ATLAS DANCES FLOATING JOURNEY
description: Some pieces of music such as Ives's The Unanswered Ques tion cry out for the chore ographer's touch. Journey is a logical and lovely result of Joyce Trisler's encounter with this evocative score. Tuesday evening the Alvin Ailey Ameri can Dance Theater offered the work for the first time during its current ANTA season.

title: Nyerere Won't Comment
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, Jan. 27 (Agence FrancePresse)  President Nyerere would, not comment on the Ugandan situa tion on his arrival from India. He drove immediately to State House, where Mr. Obote is staying.

title: Mortally Wounded, A Guard in Queens Kills His Assailant
description: A 77yearold Queens guard, although fatally wounded by two gunmen, managed to kill one of his asailants, a former patrolman here, during a hold up in a Bayside savings and loan association, the police said.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Culebrans Hamper Navy
description: CULEBRA, P. R., Jan, 27 (AP)Six Culebran residents brought a halt to United States Navy target practice today by walking into the beach target area with a yellow flag saying Culebra for the residents. A Navy spokesman said a vessel had fired about six shots be fore it was learned the civil ians were on the firing range. Residents of the island have been trying to stop the Navy from using part of the island's beach area for target practice.

title: Amin, Uganda's New Leader, Charges Tanzania Plans an Attack
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Jan. 27 (AP)The head of Uganda's new military government de clared today that neighboring Tanzania was preparing an at tack on the country and he placed his army on the alert. Israelisupplied jets swept over Kampala on patrols.

title: Bridge: Opponent's Reaction Gives Clue To Expert Faced With Guess
description: An expert can find many reasons for reaching a deci sion when faced with a guess ing situation that might seem to be a 5050 proposition.

title: News of Skiing
description: ELLENVILLE, N. Y., Jan. 27Joe Tso, a Chinese ski area owner, is introducing a hotellift ticket package plan this weekend with mixed emotions.

title: F100 Lost in Cambodia
description: SAIGON, Jan. 27 (AP)A United States Air Force super sonic fighterbomber crashed in southern Cambodia today, ap parently while on a mission near Route 4, Pnompenh's link to the sea. The United States command said the pilot had been killed.

title: CANADIEN RALLY DOWNS BLUES, 42
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 27 (UPI) Serge Savard and Phil Roberto scored within 35 seconds in the third period tonight to give the Montreal Canadiens a 42 National Hockey League vic tory over the St. Louis Blues.

title: Mall Project in Albany Is Aided by a $127Million State Loan
description: ALBANY, Jan. 27The Leg islature today approved $127.1 million in loans for the huge South Mall project after some members registered opposition ranging from outrage to mock ery over its annual budget in creases.

title: Chile's Peasants Get Aid in Seizing Farms
description: TEMUCO, Chile, Jan. 25 Organized peasants under rad scat political leadership have seized hundreds of private farms in recent weeks and are getting financial aid from Chile's leftwing Government.

title: Brazil Takes Over Construction Group In Bridge Scandal
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan. 27 The Brazilian Government has moved to take over part of the construction of an eightmile bridge over Rio de Janeiro har bor in a move to halt a scandal that threatened the Govern ment's reputation for economic accomplishment.

title: GOVERNOR TO ASK PROFITSTAX RISE TO 9% FROM 7%
description: ALBANY, Jan. 27Governor Rockefeller will seek a major increase in the businessprofits tax as part of a tax package that will probably exceed $900 million, legislative sources said tonight.

title: Naming of Principal Not on List Upheld
description: The appointment of a black teacher as acting principal of a Brooklyn intermediate school was upheld yesterday by State Supreme Court Justice Frank J. Pino.

title: Manhattan
description: At 7 P.M., the time sched uled for Community Planning Board 11's public hearing on the city's proposed capital budget, there was a strenu ous volley ball game under way in the gymnasium of East Harlem's Junior High School 117, and across the hall thumping rock music filled the auditorium where the budget was to be dis cussed.

title: Community Planning Boards: Louder Voice for People
description: As decentralization has evolved over the last few years from an abstract idea to a movement, and now to a mood that has filtered into the thinking of block work ers and mayors and the Pres ident, neighborhood groups like some of New York City's 62 community planning boards have felt new life.

title: Yale Six Tops Army, 54
description: NEW ??, Jan. 27Yale's hockey team, which had not won ?? its last 10 games, snapped ?? streak tonight by defeating Army, 54, in over time. Greg Luck scored the winning goal, his second of the contest.

title: NATHAN DRAMA PRIZE WON BY JOHN SIMON
description: John Simon, the 45yearold drama and film critic, has won the $4,500 George Jean Nathan Award for drama criticism dur ing the 196970 season. The award is the theater's richest prize.

title: Merger News
description: A Federal District Court in Cleveland granted yesterday a temporary restraining order postponing the merger of the White Motor Corporation into White Consolidated Industries, Inc. The restraining order pre vents the merger of the two companies, which was set for tomorrow, from being consummated until after the court has ruled on a Justice De partment request for a temporary injunction that would bar the merger until the Government's antitrust case can be heard on its merits.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 27 (UPI) Walt Wesley left the bench in the second quarter and scored 23 points tonight to lead the Cleveland Cavaliers to a 118104 victory over the Portland Trail Blazers.

title: JUNIORS TO ENROLL AT CITY COLLEGE
description: ALBANY, Jan. 27The State Board of Regents formally ap proved a specialadmissions program today under which City College admits high school students with exceptional abil ity upon completion of their junior year.

title: Italians First and Second In World Bobsled Trials
description: CERVINIA, Italy, Jan. 27 (AP)  The Italians continued to dominate the fourman trials to day in the world bobsled cham pionships, the first without an accident at this Alpine ski resort.

title: Taxi Commission
description: The City Council will try again today to muster suf ficient courage to approve a commission to regulate New York's taxicabs. It is doubtful that any Council member has any real reserve about the desirability of a new agency to establish some standards of public service and responsibility for this chaotic industry. But the intensity of union pressure against any form of com mission makes it questionable even now that the Council will be able to muster a majorityand even more ques tionable that any agency it authorizes will have the requisite power.

title: U.S. Protests Attack On Two in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 27  The United States Embassy pro tested today against the second assault in the last three days on American newsmen in what appeared to be a campaign to discourage meetings between correspondents and Russian dissidents.

title: Bethlehem Steel Reduces Dividend as Profit Drops
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corpo ration, the nation's second largest steel producer, an nounced a cut in its quarterly dividend yesterday, to 30 cents a share from 45 cents, payable March 10 to stockholders of record Feb. 9. The new nuar terly rate is the lowest in about 18 years.

title: Jets Send Turner to Broncos for Howfield in Deal for Kicking Specialists
description: In a move to minimize run backs on kickoffs, the New York Jets traded their record holding fieldgoal specialist, Jim Turner, to the Denver Broncos yesterday for Bobby Howfield, a 34yearold place kicker who was a soccer player in England before entering pro football three years ago.

title: Aide at Indiana University Is Selected as President
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., Jan. 127 (AP)Dr. John W. Ryan, 41 years old, was named president of Indiana University yester day, a day after Dr. Joseph L. Sutton resigned from the post.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Advertising:
description: Since its president was formerly marketing chief of Volkswagen, and since the head of its ad agency was formerly at Doyle Dane Bernbach, which has the Volks account, don't be surprised if the campaign for Subaru includes an ad headed, The Subaru is not a Japanese Beetle.

title: CORE Scheduled To Sign TV Pact For Fight Today
description: The Congress of Racial Equality is scheduled to sign a contract today to show the Muhammad AliJoe Frazier heavyweight championship fight on closedcircuit television at the 369th Regiment Armory at Fifth Avenue and 142d Street in Harlem.

title: Colombian Crash Kills 11
description: MEDELLIN, Colombia, Jan. 27 (UPI)Eleven persons were killed in the crash of a small plane here today.

title: HIGH COURT REDUCES SCHEDULE OF CASES
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27The Supreme Court reduced today its argument schedule for the remaining weeks of this court term, making it the lightest winterspring schedule in many years.

title: Cambodians Open Drive On Foe Near Pnompenh
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Jan. 27  The Cambodian high com mand announced the start of large drive today to clear out enemy concentrations west and northwest of Pnompenh.

title: Pas de Nom ($83) and Daves Sister ($64) Score in Jasmine Stakes
description: MIAMI, Jan. 27  A funny thing happened to the favorites on the way to the finish line in both divisions of the $20,000 added Jasmine Stakes at Hia leah today. They got outrun and the results were slightly staggering.

title: Shoes for Shorts
description: PARIS, Jan. 27  Roger Vivier, the shoe, man, has de voted himself to the problem of what t' put on your feet when you're wearing shorts. What indeed? Platform shoes, modified wedgies and, of course, boots.

title: O.A.S.,220, Rebuffs U.S.; To Hear Ecuador Charge
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27The Organization of American States, overriding Washington's objections, voted tonight to convene its foreign ministers to consider Ecuador's charges against the United States in their dispute over fishing rights.

title: Jury Insists on Drug Data
description: FRANKFORT, Ky., Jan. 27 (UPI)The Franklin County grand jury said today that a newspaper reporter who had refused to testify about drug abuse would not have been required to reveal his sources of information. The jury vowed to continue its efforts to obtain testimony from Paul Branzburg, a reporter for The Louisville CourierJournal who had been granted 30 days to file an appeal with the Su preme Court.

title: An Era Lives in Photos at Evans Show
description: For how many of us, I wonder, has our imagination of what the United States looked like and felt like in the nineteenthirties been de termined not by a novel or a play or a poem or a painting or even our own memories, but by the work of a single photographer, Walker Evans? With an infinitely greater artistry than the Hollywood movies of the period  and for some of us, these movies are Mr. Evans's only near rival in this respecthis pho tographs embody the moral and esthetic texture of the Depression era with an un rivaled pictorial precision.

title: MRS. R. J. BIRDWELL
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., Jan. 27Mrs. Lela M. Birdwell, wid ow of R. J. Birdwell, a Method ist evangelist and Texas oil explorer, and mother of Russell Birdwell, a public relations executive, died Monday at the age of 88.

title: Insiders' Stockholdings
description: The New York and American Stock Exchanges yesterday issued their latest reports on changes in stock ownership by major stockholders, directors and officers of listed companies. The list include the following:

title: Givenchy: Elegance, and More
description: PARIS, Jan. 27Le Grand Huberteven Ms friends call Hubert de Givenchy that and not just because he's tall has loosened up considerably. The designer's elegance is re nowned. But elegance these days tends to be a bit quaint. By mixing it up with contem porary fashion themesthat includes shorts, natchhe ac complished quite a lot in his spring and summer collec tion. He made the old cou ture look relevant.

title: Queens
description: When Community Planning Board 4, covering the Corona and Elmhurst sections got around to discussing a city proposal for a new express way in Queens, one of its members raised the question of the board's responsibility.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: PRICE RISE SLOWS AS ECONOMY GAINS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 The Government issued today two moderately encouraging reports on the economy as the Secretary of the Treasury struck a new theme on policy that a rapid expansion of the economy this year might, para doxically, help more in check ing inflation than a slow ex pansion would.

title: Westinghouse Net Off
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation reported yesterday lower earnings in the fourth quarter and in all of 1970 de spite record sales for the year.

title: PRICES IN LONDON LOWER AT CLOSE
description: Prices on the London stock market drifted lower in ex tremely quiet trading yesterday.

title: Lacey to Be Sworn Monday
description: NEWARK, Jan. 27 (AP) United States Attorney Fred erick B. Lacey Jr. will be sworn in Monday as a United States District Court judge, it was an nounced today. Chief United States District Court Judge Anthony T. Augelli said the ceremony would take place in the courtroom of Judge Reynier J. Wortendyke. A successor to Mr. Lacey has yet to be chosen.

title: PLOT JURY HEARS 3 GIVEN IMMUNITY
description: HARRISBURG (Pa., Jan. 27 Three witnesses testified today before the Federal grand jury that has indicted. six persons in an alleged plot to bomb Washington heating tunnels and kidnap Henry A. Kissinger, the Presidential adviser.

title: SCRIBNER SELECTS WILLIAMS AS AIDE
description: Chancellor Harvey B. Scrib ner has nominated Frederick H. Williams for the post of execu tive director of the city school system. The $38,000  a  year post is equivalent to that of deputy superintendent.

title: WITNESS INDICTED IN U.M.W. INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (UPI) A Federal grand jury inves tigating the activities of the United Mine Workers of Amer ica has returned its first in dictment. It charges that a band leader lied about his $1,600 salary for playing at the union's 1968 convention in Denver.

title: CARMEN IS SUNG BY RUZA BALDANI
description: The plot is socially relevant, and concerns a contemporary problem: sex. The hero, a coun try boy with the standard ap petites, is induced by the hero ine, a disadvantaged but liber ated factory worker, to desert the army and join her at a freaky commune in the moun tains. That trip doesn't work out very well, so he stabs her in an excess of jealousy. The music is good, too.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27Governor Rockefeller of New York has been the most ardent and articulate advocate of Federal revenuesharing with state and local governments. So it is not reassuring to learn that the Governor's cherished South Mall building project in Albany is going to cost an addi tional $85 million because of planning errors by his own state administration.

title: Man in the News
description: Maj. Gen. Idi Amin, Ugan da's new head of state, was the Ugandan army's heavy weight boxing champion for nearly 10 years.

title: Emanuel R. Freedman, 60, Dies; Editor on The Times Since 1948
description: Emanuel R. Freedman, an assistant managing editor of The New York Times and for 16 years its foreign news editor, died yesterday at New York Hospital. He was 60 years old and lived at 1000 Park Ave nue.

title: Advertising:
description: We're going to get you one way or another, said Richard R. Uhl, creative chief of S.S.C.&B., speaking of the saturation TV cam paign that's just been started in behalf of Lysol Brand Spray Disinfectant.

title: Buckley Views Revenue Sharing As Stopgap, Not Permanent Cure
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 Senator James L. Buckley said today that he regarded Presi dent Nixon's revenuesharing proposals as an emergency solution, rather than a perma nent one, to the fiscal prob lems of state and local gov ernments.

title: Boulez Outlines Orchestra Plans
description: In announcing his first sea son as music director of the New York Philarmonic, Pierre Boulez said he thought he would follow the lead of the art museums. Museums, he noted, always have master pieces on display, but they also arrange special exhibi tions devoted to a big paint er, an important period, spe cial phases of art, research and experimentation.

title: Garages Here Face Strike on Saturday; State Intervening
description: A state mediator will meet with union and management negotiators today in an effort to avert a strike that could shut down 650 public garages in Manhattan and the Bronx after midnight Saturday.

title: Sports of The Times
description: A year ago, even as the Knicks wheeled and darted in glorious flight toward their certain championship, basket ball fans glanced sidelong at Lew Alcindor hatching out in Milwaukee. The 7foot2inch rookie made mistakes and took punishment, but he led a lastplace team to the play offs. The Knicks had better win it now, people thought, because when Alcindor gets a little more experience and little more weight.

title: Security for Apollo 14 Tightened As Precaution Against Sabotage
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Jan. 27Security proceedings were being tightened today as a pre caution against possible sabo tage or other violent interrup tions of the countdown for the Apollo 14 mission to the moon.

title: S.E.C. Inquiry Into Insurance Stock Is Felt in Texas Government
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 27  A Securities and Exchange Com mission investigation into what it called a multimilliondollar case of stock fraud and pos sible influence peddling has caused a near crisis in the Texas state government.

title: Firms' Level of Failures to Deliver Securities Rises With Trading
description: The soaring volume of stock trading in recent weeks is prompting fears of a new pa perwork crisis on Wall Street.

title: EARLE HOLSAPPLE
description: Earle T. Holsapple, a retired stockbroker who founded the firm bearing his name, died yesterday at his home, 200 East 66th Street, after a short ill ness. He was 84 years old.

title: Harrelson Signs With Mets, Then Prepares to Take Swing at TV Tonight
description: Having taken care of his first hit of 1971 baseball business yesterday, Bud Har relson makes his debut in another business tonight  show business.

title: DEFENDERS LEAD IN SENIOR PAIRS
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 27   Ken Shelley, the defending United States Champion, and Jo Jo Starbuck moved into the lead tonight after the compulsory routine of the senior pairs event as the 1971 national figure skating championships ended its first day of competition at the Dahn Memorial Rink.

title: A RUNAWAY YOUTH DIES IN MIAMI JAIL
description: MIAMI, Jan. 27 (UPI)Cloyce Bradley Cook, the runaway son of a Piedmont, S. C., preacher, was barely 17 years old, blond, polite and adrift with only a few dollars in this city of ex pensive hotels and palmstudded beaches.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: ROME, Jan. 27 (AP)Pope Paul VI today denounced the public execution of foes of President Skou Tour of Guinea as a blind and wicked vendetta in a collective explosion of hate and cruelty.

title: Bronx
description: They talked about traffic lights on the Grand Con course, about the crowds at Yankee Stadium, about day care for children and sub ways for commuters, about topsoil and trees.

title: Desulphurization Unit Set
description: Texaco, Inc., announced yes terday the award of a contract to the Badger Company, Inc., to construct a 90,000barrela day desulphurization facility at the company's PointeaPierre refinery in Trinidad. The new facility, which industry sources said would cost some $80mil lion, is designed to manufac ture desulphurized fuel oils to meet lowsulphur requirements for fuel oil on the East Coast of the United States.

title: AMEX PRICES CUT BY PROFIT TAKING
description: Profit taking ended the American Stock Exchange's streak of 12 consecutive ad vances yesterday as the list declined in slower trading.

title: Executive Changes
description: Victor A. Bonomo, who has been president of the PepsiCola Company since last year, was ap pointed yesterday chief executive officer. Mr. Bon omo was also elected to the board and as vice presi dentU.S. beverage operations of Pepsico, Inc., the parent company.

title: Screen:
description: CURSE OF THE VAMPIRES, directed by Gerardo De Leon; screenplay by Ben Feleo and Pierre L. Salas; di rector of photography, Mike Acclon; music by Tito Arevalo; released by Marvin Films. At neighborhood thea ters. Running time: 90 minutes. (The Motion Picture Association of Amer ica's Production Code and Rating Ad ministration classifies this film: GP all ages admitted, parental guidance suggested.)

title: HARRY P. MARTIN, 80, UNION CARBIDE AIDE
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., Jan. 27 Harry P. Martin of 131 Over brook Avenue, who retired in 1962 as a vice president of the Union Carbide Corporation, died yesterday in Hackensack Hospi tal. He was 80 years old.

title: Fashion Note From Britain
description: LONDON, Jan. 27 (Reuters)Tail'r and Cutter, the most influential men's wear weekly in Britain, tonight gave Prince Charles a royal drubbing for the way he dresses.

title: War Recedes for Rites For Pnompenh Monk
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Jan. 27Concerns of war and growing terrorism re ceded a bit here today for the final rites accorded a king of the monks.

title: ALLYEAR SCHOOLS PUSHED IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, Jan. 27A bill permitting school districts to stagger their vacation sched ules and keep schoolhouses open yearround was intro duced today in both houses of the Legislature.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 15% Profit Gain Reported for 1970 For Middle South
description: Middle South Utilities, Inc., and subsidiaries reported yes terday a gain of 15.8 per cent in 1970 net income on a rise of 9.2 per cent in total operat ing revenues.

title: WILLIAM L. KICKHAEFER
description: William L. Kickhaefer, who retired as a sales executive of Standard & Poor's Corporation in 1963, died Tuesday in St. Vincent's Hospital. He was 73 years old and lived at 39 Fifth Avenue.

title: Manhattan on Top, 9054
description: Brian Mahoney scored 26 points last night to lead Man hattan to a 9054 victory over St. Francis before 400 fans at the 69th Regiment Armory court.

title: PENNSY TRUSTEES REPORT BIG LOSS
description: The Trustees of the Penn Central Transportation Com pany reported yesterday that the railroad operated at A loss of ?? November and a loss of $290,068,156 dur ing the first 11 months of 1970. The fullyear results are ex pected to be issued in two or three weeks.

title: Ehrlichman Rebuts Mills on RevenueSharing Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 President Nixon's chief domes tic adviser today rebutted charges made yesterday by Representative Wilbur D. Mills, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, that President Nixon's plans to give states and cities billions in un restricted Federal funds would require higher taxes and short change urban areas.

title: Cambodians Get Boats
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Jan. 27 (UPI)The United States command announced today that it had turned over to the Cam bodian navy eight river patrol boats under the military aid program.

title: David Altman, a Manufacturer Of SteamBath Equipment, Dies
description: David Altman, president of Thermasol, Ltd., 101 Park Ave nue, manufacturer of residen tial and commercial steam bathing equipment, died Wednesday of a stroke in Doc tors Hospital. He was 59 years old and lived at 1512 White Plains Road, the Bronx.

title: Attempt at a Unified Opposition Within P. B. A. Seems to Founder
description: An attempt to form a unified group within the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association to op pose Edward J. Kiernan, the acting president, in next June's union election appeared to founder yesterday.

title: Document Attributed to Ship Workers Charges Massacre in Riots in Poland
description: LONDON, Jan. 27A docu ment attributed to shipyard workers in the Polish port of Gdynia during the riots there last month accuses Maj. Gen. Mieczyslaw Moczar, then an alternate member of the Politburo, of using brutality to suppress them.

title: Mayor of Washington Seeks Income Tax for Commuters
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (AP)  Mayor Walter E. Washing ton proposed today an income tax on Maryland and Virginia commuters who work in Wash ington.

title: Blast Damages Bank
description: An explosive device blew an 18inch hole in a plate glass window in the front of the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company branch at 123 Waver ly Place, on the corner of Ave nue of the Americas, at 1 A.M. today. The police said the ex plosion may have been caused by a collection of firecrackers.

title: Brooklyn
description: The only commotion ac companying the leadership changes of Brooklyn's Com munity Planning Board 13 came when Dr. Irving Herzen berg, the outgoing chairman, pushed his chair back from the head of the long table and changed seats with David Rogers, a lawyer.

title: LITTLE ORCHESTRA IN MIXED EVENING
description: It was chambermusic time for the Little Orchestra Society at Tully Hall on Tuesday night, and Thomas Schennan devised a program that, characteristi cally for him and his organiza tion, contained works one sel dom hears.

title: ANOTHER EXECUTION IN GUINEA REPORTED
description: DAKAR, Senegal, Jan 27 (AP)The Guinean radio today reported the execution of a fifth person convicted of involve ment in the invasion of the West African country in No vember

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BAMAKO, Mali, Jan. 27 (Agence FrancePresse)Trav elers arriving here today from Conakry reported that four persons were hanged in the Guinean captial Monday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: CAPTAIN BEEFHEART PLAYS AT UNGANO'S
description: Captain Beefheart & the Magic Band, a Los Angeles group, is playing through to night at Ungano's, 210 West 70th Street.

title: J. EDGAR HOOVER SUED BY EXAGENT
description: A former agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation filed Federal suit yesterday against the agency and its director, J. Edgar Hoover, contending that he had been the victim of a capricious and vindictive act of personal retribution.

title: U.S. Aide Says City Code Will Not End Pollution
description: A Federal airpollution con trol official testified here yes terday that even with full en forcement of the new air code proposed by the Lindsay ad ministration the city would not be able to achieve levels of sulphur dioxide low enough to protect the public health.

title: Yale Awards Computer Chair
description: NEW HAVEN, Jan. 27Alan J. Perlis, scholar and researcher in programing languages and systems, will join Yale Univer sity's department of computer science as the first Eugene Higgins Professor of Computer Science. His appointment, an nounced today by Kingman Brewster Jr., president of Yale, is effective July 1.

title: Stars Halt Rockets
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Jan. 27 (UPI)Glen Combs scored 38 points and guided Utah's fast break in the second half tonight in leading the Stars to their second straight victory, a 111 105 triumph over the Denver Rockets.

title: Eurodollar Borrowings Drop
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (Reuters)  Eurodollar bor rowings by United States banks from their foreign branches dropped $38million in the week ended Jan. 20, the Federal Reserve reported today.

title: Wiebe Gets Planning Post
description: ALBANY, Jan. 27Governor Rockefeller announced the ap pointment today of Richard A. Wiebe of Guilderland to the $40,075ayear post of director of the State Office of Planning Coordination.

title: Transmission by Satellite Marks 50Year Gain in Radio Religion
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 Fifty years ago this month two radio technicians, one a Jew and the other a Roman Catho lic, stood among members of the Calvary Episcopal Church choir in Pittsburgh to see that the first religious broadcast on a commercially licensed station, KDKA, went smoothly.

title: POLLUTION BRINGS TWO INDICTMENTS
description: Two textile dye companies were indicted on Federal water pollution charges here yesterday as a special grand jury neared the end of its investigations of alleged industrial polluters in the area.

title: INTEREST COSTS ON BONDS SLUMP
description: Federally backed taxexempt housing bonds were sold yes terday at an Interest cost be low 5 per cent for the first time since 1968.

title: Fireman Killed in Explosion In a Suburb of Philadelphia
description: CONSHOHOCKEN, Pa., Jan. 27 (AP)One perosn was killed tonight and many people were hurt in a series of fiery ex plosions that ripped.through the suburban Philadelphia commu nity of West Conshohocken.

title: LINDSAY AND CASO DISCUSS PROBLEMS
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Jan. 27 Mayor Lindsay came here to day and for an hour discussed with Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso such problems of mutual interest as water and air pollution, revenue sharing and welfare.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE ASSIGNMENT. By Martin Myers. 346 pages. Harper & Row, $7.95.

title: Fordham 87to79 Victor;
description: AMHERST, Mass., Jan. 27 Fordham's oncebeaten basket ball team gained its 13th vic tory tonight by using speed and a fullcourt press to defeat Massachusetts, 8779.

title: Muskie Talks and Hopes on FiveDay Campaign Trip
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 27 Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine completed the first major trip of his unannounced Presi dential campaign today, a five day trip to California in which he accomplished most of the limited tasks he set for himself.

title: United Air Lines, Inc., Cancels Order for 8 DC1O Jet Aircraft
description: United Air Lines, Inc., which today is expected to report it suffered about a $42million net loss during 1970, announced yesterday it was cancelling orders for eight of 30 McDon nell Douglas DC 10 jet aircraft and was going to defer for 20 months the taking delivery of four Boeing 747 jetliners.

title: VOTE SUGGESTED BY SOUTH AFRICA
description: THE HAGUE, Jan. 27 (Reu ters)South Africa said today that she was willing to hold a plebiscite in the territory of SouthWest Africa to let the people decide if they want to remain under South African administration or would prefer United Nations supervision.

title: Kaiser Aluminum Reduces Its Distributor Discounts
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Jan. 27 (UPI)Kaiser Aluminum & Chemical Corporation today re duced its distributor discounts on a wide variety of large volume sheet and plate prod ucts effective April 1.

title: Liberal Investing Set In Yugoslavia
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Jan. 27After debates lasting roughly one year, Yugoslavia has taken a first step toward liberalizing her 1967 law on joint ventures with foreign in vestors. That legislation opened the door for cooperation be tween socialists and capitalists here. Amendments, which still need formal parliamentary ap proval, roll out the red carpet.

title: Major Builder Signs a Pact for Public Housing
description: Samuel J. Lefrak, president of one of the country's largest building concerns, signed a con tract yesterday to construct his organization's first low income public housing in the city.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Harry J. Schultz, 91, Dies; Headed News Agency Here
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Jan. 27 Harry J. Schultz, who for many years operated the Schultz News Agency, in New York, died yesterday at his home. He was 91 years old.

title: INCREASES VOTED IN STATE U. TUITION
description: State University tuition fees were raised $150 to $500 a year yesterday, with the in creases to go into effect in September.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Squires Beat Floridians
description: HAMPTON, Va., Jan. 27 (UPI) Charlie Scott's 34 points led the Virginia Squires to a 126 117 victory over the Floridians tonight. That widened the Squires' lead in the A.B.A. Eastern Division to 5 games.

title: Apps Paces Penguin Victory
description: PITTSBURGH, Jan. 27 (UPI) Syl Apps Jr., playing his first game for Pittsburgh since he was acquired from the Rangers in a trade, scored one goal and assisted on another tonight to give the Penguins a 31 victory over the Toronto Maple Leafs in a National Hockey League game.

title: Duet Delight: Janet Baker Joins FischerDieskau
description: Dietrich FischerDieskau and Daniel Barenboim already have collaborated in two Carnegie Hall concerts this season. On Tuesday evening a third member was added to the little cast. Janet Baker, the British mezzosoprano, joined the baritone in a pro gram of vocal duets. They previously have sung  and recorded  much the same program in London, with the addition of several Purcell duets, regrettably absent from the New York program.

title: Lefkowitz Wins Return Of $11,000 From Play
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz has ob tained the return of $11,000 that allegedly was improp erly expended in a Broad way musical.

title: Waiting for Godot With. Peter O'Toole Visits Nottingham
description: NOTTINGHAM, England, Jan. 27Ireland has the faculty of bringing its bigtime prodigals home to roost. Peter O'Toole is following a pattern laid down by Dion Boucicault and Orson Welles in periodically disap pearing from the international scene to return to the Dublin stage.

title: DR. RALPH DEFALCO, RUTGERS ZOOLOGIST
description: BRIDGEWATER, N. J., Jan, 27 (AP)Dr. Ralph J. DeFalco, professor of zoology at Rutgers University and the director of the Rutgers Serological Mu seum, died at his home here Monday. He was 64 years old.

title: Holy Cross Tops Dartmouth
description: HANOVER, N. H., Jan. 27 (AP)  Holy Cross used its height advantage to gain an 81 75 basketball victory over Dartmouth tonight despite a recordbreaking 44point per formance by the Indians' Paul Erland.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Laotian Base Overrun
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Jan. 27 (UPI)Enemy forces overran a Government base near North Vietnam's Ho Chi Minh supply trail and seized an outpost on the strategic Boloven Plateau in southern Laos, military sources reported today.

title: West German Discount Rate Defended
description: The head of the West Ger man central bank yesterday defended the bank's decision to hold the discount rate at 6 per cent as a means to counter act inflation.

title: Patriots Get First Crack To Draft Plunkett Today
description: At their annual twoday draft meeting beginning today, pro football's 26 teams will select the 442 college players deemed most capable of competing in the National Football League. About 170 of those drafted will succeed in winning jobs next season.

title: Students Get Rabies Shots
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Jan. 27 (UPI)Six Ohio State Univer sity students are undergoing rabies shots after coming in contact with a rabid cow at the university's veterinary med icine clinic. Dr. H. Spencer Turner of the student health service said that the students had not been bitten but were exposed to the disease from saliva from the cow's mouth.

title: Italian NeoFascism, Almost Reputable, Has Growing Impact
description: ROME, Jan. 27From Milan to Messina squads of young rightwing extremists  the latest model of NeoFascism are bursting onto the Italian scene the way the ultraleftist urban guerrillas did about three years ago.

title: Harassment of Syrian Jews Charged by 2 Who Say They Fled
description: PARIS, Jan. 27A young man and woman who said that they had escaped from Syria some months ago reported here today that the 5,000 Jews of Damascus were being forced to remain in a ghetto under daily threats and harassment by the Syrian authorities.

title: School Where Chefs Are Made
description: NEW HAVEN This year marks the 25th anniversary of what must be the most prestigious and distinguished cooking school for profes sional chefs in America. The school, in fact, calls itself the only private, nonprofit, posthigh school educational institution in the United States, in. which a student can train to become an expert chef. It is, of course, the Culinary Institute of America, now situated on eight and onehalf acres with Yale's divinity school on one side and the forestry school on the other.

title: 22 Sit In at A. ?? P.'s Offices to Seek Help for Blacks
description: Twentytwo ministers, de manding that the A.&P. Food Store chain reverse its flow of dollars out of the black com munity, invaded the com pany's executive offices at 420 Lexington Avenue yesterday and vowed to stay there until the president met with them.

title: Savage Vendetta in Guinea
description: The African scene is with evergreater frequency being scarred by arbitrary arrests and harsh sentences, includ ing death, for alleged subversion and treason. South Africa's white rulers have entered the picture again with the arrest under the monstrous Terrorism Act of the Anglican Dean of Johannesburg, a relentless critic of the policy of racial apartheid.

title: Yale Fencers Beat Fordham
description: NEW HAVEN, Jan. 27Les Fagen of Brooklyn, the Yale captain, and Ev Wetchler of New York won three bouts apiece today in leading the Elis' fencing team to a 225 victory over Fordham. The victory lift ed Yale's wonlost record to 32. Fordham has yet to win in five matches.

title: Nader Criticizes Hester for Role As a Director of Union Carbide
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27Dr. James M. Hester, president of, New York University and a member of the board of direc tors of the Union Carbide Cor poration, has been accused by Ralph Nader of seriously com promising if not disgracing the university by silent com plicity or knowing participa tion in company air pollution control policies.

title: Report From Venus
description: Man's exploration of the solar system has been enor mously advanced by the success of Venera 7. For the first time, a manmade device has landed on another planet and radioed information from its surface back to earth.

title: ExPresident Arbenz of Guatemala Dies
description: MEXICO CITY, Jan. 27 (Reu ters)Col. Jacobo Arbenz Guz man, former President of Gua temala, once known as the Red Colonel who was overthrown by a United Statesbacked in vasion of his Central American country in 1954, was found dead in his bathtub today. He was 57 years old. Mexican au thorities said the cause of death was drowning.

title: Training for What?
description: Confusion, overlap and ineffectuality are the predomi nant findings of the Economic Development, Council its assessment of the manpower training programs on which $100 million or more of public money is being spent annually in this city. Of all the report's gloomy aspects, none is more depressing than the sketchiness of the overall information available on how many people have been trained and what has come of their training in steady jobs or increased earning capacity.

title: News of Dogs
description: Breed standards are changed because of a desire to con form to modern fashions, or because of an attempt to improve the breed in sound ness, health or beauty, or just because of the general restlessness and boredom that afflict many in Amer ica today, according to Mrs. Hayes Blake Hoyt of Washing ton, Depot, Conn., a world authority on poodles. She finds fault with most, of the reasons in the current issue of The Poodle Showcase, of which she is associate editor.

title: ALCINDOR GETS 53 IN 132129 VICTORY
description: BOSTON, Jan. 27 (UPI)Lew Alcindor scored 53 points to lead the Milwaukee Bucks to a 132129 victory tonight over the Boston Celtics in the final minute of a National Basketball Association game.

title: The Talk of Savannah
description: SAVANNAH, Ga.  When James Oglethorpe founded this lovely river city 238 years ago, he said down only three basic rules for its three dozen citizens: No one could sell or enlarge his 50 acre grant from the King, no one could have any rum, and no one could own a slave.

title: Mortgage Commitments Auctioned by Fanny May
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (UPI)  The Federal National Mort gage Association yesterday auctioned commitments to pur chase $35.5million worth of F.H.A. and V.A. mortgages at the new 7.5 percent face value interest rate.

title: JOHN SHGSTAK, 57, EXNORWALK MAYOR
description: NORWALK, Conn., Jan. 27 Former Mayor John Shostak died today in Stamford Hospital after a sudden illness. He was 57 years old.

title: 100 Boise Motor Homes Are Ordered by Hertz
description: The Hertz Corporation an nounced yesterday that it had ordered 100 motor homes for its entry into the recreational vehicle field.

title: NANTES STRIKERS SEEK TO CATCH UP
description: NANTES, France, Jan. 27 All we want is to catch up, said Leon Brun, a 50yearold stamper at the Batignolles Metallurgical Plant, reaching chunky arm toward the red wine.

title: David Niven and 'The Statue':Amateau Directs Gags About Nobel Laureate 'Curse of the Vampires' Also Begins Run
description: "The Statue" is about Alex Bolt (David Niven), a Nobel Peace Prize winner, Rhonda Bolt (Virna Lisi), his wife, and an 18-foot statue of Bolt, commissioned for the United States Embassy in London and sculptured by the laureate's wife. The point of the movie is not that Miss Lisi is a dreadful artist, although, from the evidence on display in the film, I doubt that she could obtain a commission to decorate a post office in the Soviet provinces.The point of the film is that the statue is nude. Although the physique looks like some failing art student's copy of Michelangelo's David, we are told that it bears a perfect likeness to thin old David Niven, except for the genitals. This, however, we have to take on blind faith since "The Statue" is, after all, a movie that depends on prudery. Like a stereotype spinster, it averts its eyes every time the camera approaches the statue's mid-section.The film has something of a storyNiven's search for the man who posed for the genitalia and who was, he assumes, his wife's lover. Mostly, however, it is just a collection of disagreeable, mainly antihomosexual, antifemininist gags designed to offend not only the members of the Gay Activists Alliance and Women's Lib, but also anyone who cherishes the memory of wit.Although everything about the film is rotten, it is of some historical interest as a desperate attempt to update the kind of prissy sex comedy that used to amuse Broadway matinee audiences with endless complications about "it."There is not much point in going into the dialogue, but you'll get the idea from the line spoken by a little girl who is shown gazing in wonderment at the copy of Michelangelo's work in the Piazza della Signoria in Florence. "Golly," she says, "if that's David, I'd like to see Goliath!""The Statue" may have the distinction of being the first adolescent comedy about penis envy. Paradoxically, it is rated R, which will keep out most of the 12-year-olds who might be expected to find it good for a smirk. It opened yesterday at the Astor and Loew's Orpheum Theaters.

title: Survivor of Rabies, 7, Leaves Ohio Hospital
description: LIMA, Ohio, Jan. 27 (UPI) Matthew Winkler, 7 years old, who doctors say may be the first person to have sur vived rabies, was released from the hospital on his birthday today, free of all symptoms of the disease.

title: NEW ISRAELI NOTE GIVEN TO JARRING
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Jan. 27  Israel submitted a new written policy statement today for transmission to the United Arab Republic in the indirect ArabIsraeli peace talks.

title: GERM WAR CENTER ASSIGNED NEW ROLE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (UPI) President Nixon announced today that the biological war fare facilities at Pine Bluff, Ark., would be converted into a national center for research into the effects of chemicals on man.

title: U.S WILL APPEAL WIRETAP RULING
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27  The Justice Department an nounced today that it would ask the United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit to review a Detroit judge's rul ing that the Attorney General does not have the right to or der wiretapping against radical groups without a court order.

title: Knicks Defeat Hawks, 116108, With Reed Playing in Second Half
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 27  Those who look for logic in basketball were given no encouragement whatever tonight as the New York Knicks defeated the At lanta Hawks, 116108.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Nixon Men Reported Planning to Abolish Appalachian Economic Aid Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27The Nixon Administration will at tempt to abolish all funds for the Appalachian Regional Com mission, the fiveyearold Federalstate economic recovery agency designed to aid the largest impoverished area of the country, Congressional sources said today. Appalachian Congressmen pledge a fight to save it.

title: STOCK RISE HALTS IN PROFIT TAKING
AN APOLLO SCIENTIST IS HONORED BY NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27 (Reu ters)President Nixon today named George E. Mueller, a leading scientist in the Apollo moon exploration program, as a recipient of the National Medal of Science.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27The Manhattan Project made the atomic bomb a reality in less than five years, and the space agency planted human foot steps on the moon in less than 10. Now scientists may be asked to devote a like effort to the conquest of cancer. That was implicit in the President's State of the Union Message, in which he said last week: The same kind of concentrated ef fort that split the atom and took man to the moon should be turned toward conquering this dread disease.

title: Staten Island
description: For a little while it ap peared that Community Board 3 of Staten Island had got itself into a procedural culdesac from which it could escape only by adjourn ing and going home.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: The other evening, I en countered resistance when I asked my daughter Mary if she would tug a few hairs from the tail of her pony.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: ENGINEERS checking operations at Union Carbide Corporation's subsidiary, a chemicals and plastics complex, Antwerp, Belgium. Company's sales in 1970 set a record, but preliminary income was 14 per cent below that of 1969.
description: Birny Mason Jr., chairman of the Union Carbide Corporation, reported yesterday that indi cated net income for the fourth, quarter of 1970 was $37,800,000, or 63 cents a share, down from $41,400,000, or 69 cents a share, in the 1969 period.

title: StormStranded Drivers Wait Along the Thruway
description: Scores of families, long distance truck drivers and motorists of every variety have spent the last two nights curled up in corners of the rest areas along 260 miles of the blizzardswept Gov. Thomas E. Dewey Thruway.

title: NETS ARE BEATEN BY PACERS, 116100
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 27 Rick Barry's 26 points led all scorers tonight, but that was not enough to prevent the New York Nets from dropping a 116100 decision to the Indiana Pacers in an American Basket ball Association game.

title: A Split in the Right Wing
description: When William Buckley and the Na tional Review crowd injected evangeli cal antiCommunism into rightwing circles, the conservatives found them selves split into two broad camps: the libertarians who were very anarchistic on domestic issues and military isola tionists in foreign policy; and the Russell Kirk and William Buckley tra ditionalists who saw the existence of atheistic Communism as a threat to the religious and cultural inheritance of the Western world. Many libertari ans went their own way, but others embraced the new fusionism which sought to draw a bridge between ad vocates of individual freedom on the one hand, and those who wanted to rid the world of Communists at any cost on the other.

title: Brewers Get Angels' Voss
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Jan 27 (AP) Bill Voss, an outfielder, was traded today to the Milwaukee Brewers for Gene Brabender, righthanded pitcher, in a straight player swap with the California Angels.

title: Jacksonville Triumphs
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Jan. 27 (UPI)  powerful Jacksonville University registered 13 con secutive points midway through, the first half tonight and then went on to rout Florida State, 8365.

title: Colombo Plans to Visit Washington on Feb. 18
description: ROME, Jan. 27 Premier Emilio Colombo will visit Washington as a guest of President Nixon Feb. 18 and 19, officials said today.

title: Alternative U.S. Budget Asked by Urban Coalition
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 27  The National Urban Coalition proposed today a limited Fed eral revenuesharing plan and a national health program de signed to replace the present welfare and Medicaid systems.

title: Britain to Denationalize The Cook Travel Agency
description: LONDON, Jan. 27The Gov ernment confirmed today that it intended to sell Thomas Cook & Son, Ltd., one of the most famous names in inter national travel, to private en terprise.

title: Uganda's Forces Bigger
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Jan. 27 (Agence FrancePress)  Ugan da's armed forces are larger and better equipped than those of Tanzania.

title: Cassese Offer to Join Hearings On Parity Is Recalled at Trial
description: Arvid Anderson, chairman of the Office of Collective Bar gaining, testified in State Su preme Court yesterday that John J. Cassese, former presi dent of the Patrolmen's Be nevolent Association, told him in June, 1969, that the patrol men intended to participate in the police sergeants' payparity factfinding case.

title: Rising Costs Cancel 1971 Flower Show; '72 Revival Is Goal
description: The New York International Flower Show will not be staged here this year because of losses suffered in the last three years. Efforts are being made to cut costs to revive the show for next year.

title: For Madagascar, A Pragmatic Line
description: TANANARIVE, Madagas car The Malagasy republic took a decisive step in 1970 when it signed its first eco nomic and financial agree ments with whiteruled South Africa.

title: CHARLES A. SHEA, 68, OF MILTON BRADLEY
description: Charles A. Shea, vice presi dent and director of Milton Bradley Company, died yes terday in Springfied, Mass., after a brief illness. He was 68 years old and lived in Long meadow, Mass.

title: Industrialization Of the Ivory Coast
description: ABIDJAN, Ivory Coast One of the problems of anal ysts trying to assess economic performance of this prosper ing West African country last year was to find substitutes for the terms stupendous and fabulous, liberally used in past years.

title: APOLL0 14 IS GIVEN ITS FINAL TOUCHES
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Jan. 28The Apollo 14 countdown, described by a space agency of ficial as the cleanest ever, proceeded smoothly today with launching technicians putting the finishing touches on the $305million moonship.

title: Rebellion Draining Chad
description: FORTLAMY, ChadThe unpromising economy of this landlocked African republic will probably continue to be sapped this year by the rebel lion of nomadic tribesmen against the Government.

title: Al Jacks to Coach Williams
description: WILLIAMSTOWN Mass., Jan. 28 (UPI)Al Jacks, former Penn State quarterback who coached Clarion (Pa.) State the last eight seasons, was appoint ed head football coach at Wil liams College today.

title: AN UPWARD TREND RESUMED ON AMEX
description: The American Stock Ex change yesterday resumed its recent upward move after a one day lapse as the list rose in fairly active trading.

title: Kenyan's Idea Meets Need
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Ten years ago, few Africans in Kenya possessed more than one suit of clothes and to get them cleaned meant staying at home for a few days.

title: PHILLIPS REPORTS 8% PROFIT DECLINE
description: Earnings of the Phillips Petro leum Company last year de clined 8 per cent to $117.1 million or $1.58 a share from 1$127.8million or $1.73 a share in 1969, despite record reve nues of $2,304,500,000 which gained 3 per cent from $2,227, 300,000.

title: For Trade Bloc: Problems and Successes
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Prob lems are inevitable when sovereign states cooperate on joint undertakings and the East African Community is no exception, President Julius K. Nyerere of Tanzania said last November. But these prob lems do get solved, he in sisted.

title: Fiscal Lifeline Needed
description: There is unpleasant news for practically everybody in the statetax increases Governor Rockefeller plans to ask the Legislature to enact this year. Even without the projected increases, New Yorkers have been carrying the heaviest combined load of state and local taxes in the nationa total of $576 per capita, more than double the figure of a decade ago.

title: MANSON EJECTED FROM COURTROOM
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 28 (AP)  The penalty phase of the Sharon Tate murder trial began today with Charles M. Manson shouting at the judge and be ing ejected from the courtroom for punching his lawyer.

title: Guinea Now Using Riches
description: CONAKRY, GuineaThis country is at last beginning to drum up the foreign capi ?? it needs to exploit its ?? mineral deposits that could make it West Africa's most prosperous nation.

title: Open Door Trade Helps Togo Thrive
description: LOME, Togo  In these inflationary times, an Ameri can, or almost any foreigner, strolling through the mar kets of this West African city might briefly wonder whether his eyesight or arithmetic was failing.

title: PanAm Expands Flights
description: SAN JUAN, P. R. (UPI) American Airlines, which takes over Trans Caribbean airlines March 2, said today it would start a 14flightsaday sched ule between the United States and the Caribbean on that date involving flights between San Juan and the Virgin Islands to New York, Newark, Washing ton. Aruba and Port au Prince.

title: News of Skiing
description: When gusty wind begins ripping through southern Ver mont, Hans Thorner, the col orful ski area operator of Magic Mountain, quickly as certains from which direction it is blowing. If it is coming from the west, he ignores it.

title: Advertising:
description: The men who sell the product of the Miller Brew ing Company (beer) who have been wondering what direction they'd be taking with a new owner (Phillip Morris) and new ad agency (McCannErickson) found out yesterday.

title: STOCKS DECLINE ON LONDON BOARD
description: The London stock market drifted lower yesterday, main ly because potential buyers were said to be worried about Britain's industrial situation, and apathetic.

title: Freezing Cold Cuts Voltage in State
description: Numbing cold continued to assault much of the East yes terday, provoking power short ages and mishaps and more than the usual number of sighs for spring.

title: Malawi Tightens Her Ties With South Africa
description: BLANTYRE, MalawiDe spite pressure from the rest of black Africa, Dr. H. Ka muzu Banda, the controver sial President of Malawi, consolidated his policy of neighborliness with white ruled South Africa during 1970.

title: Bomb Scare and Fumes Harass Soviet Dancers at Carnegie Hall
description: The openingnight perform ance of the Siberian Dancers and Singers of Omsk of the So viet Union was interrupted briefly at Carnegie Hall last night by a telephoned bomb threat and the scattering of 10 bottles of ammonia through out the orchestra section and balcony.

title: A Discussion
description: As African countries push on with development, their prob lems are getting more com plex. Some, such as integration of urban and rural economies, are fa miliar in the developed countries. But all are new to Africans, especi ally an increasingly critical African phenomenon  the educated un employed who are jobless despite a shortage of trained manpower.

title: RISE IN RETAIL SALES OF 8% IS PREDICTED,
description: Retail sales this year will rise by about 8 per cent, Albert T. Sommers, vice president and economist of the Conference Board, predicted yesterday.

title: EUGENE P. SCHANZ
description: Eugene P. Schanz, who re tired in 1958 as an executive in the custom department of Brooks Brothers here, died last Friday at Daytona Beach, Fla. He was 77 years old and lived at Ormond Beach, Fla.

title: Wood Field and Stream
description: Nonresident hunting li censes are reflecting the pricewage increases of the past decade and sportsmen are beginning to feel the pinch.

title: State Party Chiefs Urged Javits To Accept Buckley in the G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28 Senator Jacob K. Javits dis closed today that the New York State Republican organi zation had requested in writ ing that Senator James L. Buck ley be admitted into the con ference of Republican Senators last week.

title: Sentence Completed
description: ALDERSON, W. Va., Jan. 28 (AP)Marjorie Melville, a for mer Maryknoll nun who along with eight other persons was convicted of destroying draft records in Catonsville, Md., in 1968, was released from cus tody here yesterday.

description: CERVINIA, Italy, Jan. 28 (AP)  More spills, one of them injuring a member of British royalty, forced can cellation of trials today for the world fourman bobsled championships. And the Unit ed States found itself re duced to a single sled.

She was placed on probation for three years but was ordered to spend the first three months in jail.

title: DELURY GIVES CITY DEADLINE ON REPAIRS
description: The head of the Uniformed Sanitationmen's Association, John J. DeLury, staged a rein spection yesterday of the de partment's garage at Canal and West Streets and gave the city five more workdays to com plete its repair and rehabilita tion.

title: Declining Exports Hurting Senegal
description: DAKAR, SenegalUnhap pily for the 4 million Sene galese, their main cash crop peanutshas again fallen below expectations and, con sequently, this West African country will gain little from the current rise in peanut prices.

title: Southern Pacific Net Off;
description: Two of the nation's most diversified railroads, the South ern Pacific and the Union Pa cific, reported yesterday lower earnings for the final quarter and full year of 1970.

title: G.M. Lists Quarterly Loss At Record $135Million
description: DETROIT, Jan. 28  The General Motors Corporation to day reported a $135million loss in its fourth quarter, the largest for such a period in G.M.'s history.

title: A Coup Leaves Questions
description: KAMPALA, Uganda  One of Africa's most fertile coun tries, Uganda is unlikely to suffer any setback to her productive agricultural econ omy as a result of the mili tary coup that overthrew the Government of President Mil ton Obote earlier this week,

title: Pacer Makes Comeback After Cancer Operation
description: YONKERS, Jan. 28In 1962, a 2yearold pacing horse named Gaviland won 13 races and was the fourth best standardbred in number of victories in the nation. The horse's career seemed promising.

title: SHELLEY PAIR KEEPS FIGURE SKATE TITLE
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 28With only one flaw in their program, Ken Shelley and Jo Jo Star buck of Downey, Calif., suc cessfully defended their senior pairs title in the United States figureskating championships tonight at War Memorial Auditorium.

title: Post Routs Kings Point
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Jan. 28 Jim Webber scored 31 points as C. W. Post rolled to a 9672 basketball victory over Kings Point tonight.

title: Julia Richman Principal Ousted With Unsatisfactory Rating
description: The principal of troubled Julia Richman High School in Manhattan has been removed by Dr. Harvey B. Scribner, Chan cellor of the city schools, on the basis of an unsatisfac tory rating, a spokesman for the Board of Education said last night.

title: Autos All Over Morocco
description: CASABLANCA, Morocco In this country's major cities and on the 13,000 miles of paved highways connecting them, modern filling stations are everywhere, contrasting with ancient Arab architec ture nearby and some robed Berbers on burros pausing at the traffic lights.

title: China Gets Table Tennis Bid
description: TOKYO, Jan. 28 (Reuters) China reportedly has been of ficially invited to compete in the 31st world table tennis championships in Japan in March. The newspaper Asahi Shimbun reported that the in vitation was extended in Peking yesterday by Koji Goto, presi dent of the Japan. Table Tennis Association. The Chinese have not yet replied.

title: Rubber and Iron Ore Ease Liberia's Debt
description: MONROVIA, Liberia  Buoyed by record production of iron ore and rubber, her two main products, Liberia is hoping that rising revenues will begin to ease the burden of heavy debt payments.

title: A Discussion
description: YAOUNDE, Cameroon  In filling public health needs, most African countries must still depend on foreign universities to train their medi cal students.

title: Index of Commodity Prices Climbs to 108.1 From 107.3
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials rose to 108.1 Tuesday from 107.3 last week.

title: New Setup Is Urged At Juvenile Centers
